text: Ceasar side salad was awesome. Bleu "Blues Burger" was very mediocre. Dry and overdone.   All-female string band was tons of fun.

I love coming here to watch a concert. It is so intimate. The staff is ways friendly and fast to get you're drinks to you. I Always have had a great time here. The food is what you should expect but you are here to see a concert.

Zero Stars, do not go! After 1.5 hours wait our food arrived. The breakfast burrito was very under cooked, served on a cold skillet, and was promptly sent back to the "kitchen". Other breakfast items were also served cold when they should have been at least warm. English muffins were tough like a hockey puck. The staff from the manager on down is clueless and unapologetic. First time in my life I have had to walk out of restaurant. Didn't even wait for the bill, wasn't about to pay for any of that shit.
I'm not a party person, kinda a homebody actually. But I enjoyed this place a lot. The music was loud and fun, the atmosphere was great and the waiters were prompt. Not a bad experience in my book.
Never ever ever have breakfast here. I was a party of one and had to wait 20 min to be seated. I walked in and half the tables were empty. Epic fail.

I keep trying to give them a chance and they continue to disappoint.    This is geared towards the music/concert goer.  If you're not planning on standing down on the main floor, you might as well forget about any kind of sound quality.  We generally try to stand around up top as it's too crowded down on the main floor.  This time we even purchased VIP seating...you're sitting right next to the sound boards so you'd think the quality would be the best there....wrong!  We could hear the opening bands fine, but when it came to the main event, we couldn't understand a word.  And sadly, we knew most of their songs.  This has happened this year on 3 separate occasions.  Even while the bands talk in between songs, you couldn't understand a word.  And the cost of drinks is ridiculous.  Starting off at $2.50 for a bottle of water. $8.75 for a PBR.....REALLY?    I will say that every staff member we talked with was super friendly and helpful and the place was relatively clean and security was plentiful.    And why don't they open up the upstairs seating.  We saw Yellowcard there a year or so ago and sat upstairs, and it was awesome.  But alas, the upstairs is always closed off.  We spoke with other concert goers at each event, and they had the same comments on the "lack of clean sound" when you are off the main floor.  Pretty sad since it would be a great venue with a little care or tweaking.  Come on HOB management....get in the game!

As a local I've been to the house of blues many times over the years but this particular night had me wondering if I'll ever go back again. About two months ago my friends band was playing in the restaurant area. I go to see the band and meet up with a group of friends. My friends had got there before me and already had dinner and a few rounds of drinks. I get there and meet my friends and say let's sit closer to the stage so we can see the band better and was told you can't sit right in front as that is a designated restaurant area. We were told to either sit where we were (in the back) or watch the band from the bar area (which is even further back from where we were sitting). Now I'm not sure who made up these 'rules' but it wasn't even that busy and there were plenty of tables in the restaurant for people to dine at. We waited for half a set to see if the front got busier and it didn't so we took it upon ourselves to just go ahead and sit up close in front. Well that action must have really upset management because we were not waited on for the rest of the night despite already eating and drinking up to that point. It seemed that the wait staff was told not to help our table and I found that quite petty and unprofessional. Even without getting waited on we still continued to buy drinks but we had to go to the bar instead. Why would you have bands play here if you're going to stick the people that came to see them in the back? Not impressed by any means.
Overpriced drinks and food, but the best place to go for shows.  If it wasn't for the concerts, I would have no desire to come back.

Way overpriced for what you get. Went in here at 6:00 pm before a Friday Cavs game and there was no one dining... at all. The bar was full, but even by the time we paid and left only two more groups had sat down to eat. This must be why they need to charge $15 for a simple po' boy.   Our server was very nice and the food was okay. The shrimp po' boy was tasty but the french dip was flavorless. Even the dipping sauce was plain. You can do much better in the area for the same price so I suggest you dine elsewhere.

Wow.  I was at Mandalay Bay during the week of the SEMA Auto Trade show,  and stopped in for a quick dinner at HOB LV at Mandalay Bay.    May I say, the jambalaya with shrimp was one of the best dishes I have ever had, just spicy enough and loaded with protein.  You can taste the freshness and quality.    My server, Christy, cute with a tattoo sleeve, was attentive and professional.    There was a band playing during dinner on a Wednesday, and they were perfect, not too fast, not too slow.   Feel good music, feel good vibes, and the manager was cordial and genuine when I told him about my experience.    I will definitely be back every time I come to Mandalay Bay and I would recommend this place to my family and my friends.

Seen aq great rock concert here in late january.  I was here on the boss's coin and was told to take in some show/concerts.  Seen  "Mr  bad to the bone "  on a fri night george T was great.  Bar made good drinks GA tickets got up right to the front and swiched people maken runs to the bar.  I will go back when i am there in sept.

I went to this house of blues garbage last night and the dam place is so freaking loud. I did not enjoy it one bit all the bands sucked big time and the restrooms were dirty with piss stains all over the toilets and floors.

We sampled several items on the menu.  The pork sliders were great, the mushroom  burger was great --- and cooked to a perfect medium rare as ordered.  The fries were also quite good with a perfect crunch.  We did not really like the mashed potatoes because the potatoes tasted old.  The biggest disappointment was the buttermilk fried chicken.  Though it was fried to perfection and crispy, it had no flavor--completely devoid of flavor.  If celebrity chef Aaron Sanchez really did create their menu/recipes, he forgot to taste the one he provided for the fried chicken, as no salt was included in this recipe.  Unless the staff forgot it....

The city of Cleveland is very lucky to have this wonderful world class establishment in the heart of downtown, and as a part of our E. 4th Street "Food District."   This Thanksgiving (in conjunction with Live Nation Cleveland), these great, charitable people sacrificed part of their Holiday--to open up their beautiful doors, and their loving hearts, at 11am to 2pm--to feed anyone and everyone who entered.  A Traditional Thanksgiving All-You-Could-Eat Buffet was served: Roast Turkey, Stuffing, Gravy, Cranberries, Sweet Potatoes, Green Beans, Dinner Rolls and Butter, Pumpkin Pie and Whipped Cream, Coffee, Sodas, and Water.  Additionally, during the feast, various local artists volunteered their time, and showcased their musical talents.
Lindsey was great.  We started with three people and our table grew to nine. She didn't mind and  handled it without issue.

Came here twice because we were staying at the Mandalay Bay... the first time was for breakfast, service was terrible... second time was for dinner a few days later. Service was still terrible, AND myself and another person in my group got food poisoning!!!  I'm guessing it was from their tater tot nacho appetizer because it was the only thing we both ate all weekend

After being on the strip for the day, I wanted something comfortable and laid back for my last nights stay at the Mandalay Bay. I wanted a few drinks and to listen to some live music. The hostess just glared at us going in. She made no attempt to make eye contact. She was more concerned with texting on her cell phone. The restaurant wasn't that busy but looked fun as it was a full band with karaoke.  I asked for a table for a party of two and she just pointed and said seat yourself anywhere. We sat for about 30 minutes as waiters kept walking by. We yelled trying to get their attention. Finally, after yelling and clapping my hands at the waiter at another table who had walked past me 4 times in the 30 minutes he said he would take our order. He made sure we knew he was working past his scheduled time. I even commented that I would sit another table so I could get someone to wait on me. I watched this poor waiter serve half the restaurant while the rest of the wait staff had their own small areas that they seem to service well. After watching this for about 30 minutes, watching the manager not take care of his employees and redeploy them to take back the floor, I approached him and told him what was going on. It was obvious that he wasn't going to jump in and take his front end back.  He set a very bad example chatting on his cell phone several times while on the floor. Anyway, after two drinks I had enough. I was really disappointed and will probably never return. Hopefully the general manager will look at the development of his team and provide some coaching to his wait staff and host at the door. There is no excuse for this type of service at a 5 star hotel.

This place has the best suace to go with their chicken and waffles.  It's a honey siracha that has some kick to it, but not to bad.  That's the only reason I keep coming back.   My wife likes their pancakes that are huge as well as the pulled pork sandwich
Terrible service. Our family had to wait 45+ minutes after getting seated to get our food.

Ugghh like 5 different lines with no signs saying which one to go in, had to show my ticket to four different people after passing security.  Took them a solid 5 minutes to pay down the girl in front of me.  Just awful experience getting into a concert venue.  Show still isn't ready to play more than half hour after start time.
I hate that I let my friends convince me to eat at this place on the Strip.  Spent approx. $60 for 2 dinners and 2 beers.  The quality was just mediocre too.  Grrr...never again!

The decor was too dark and too grim, not a fan. However the mac and cheese side tasted alright. I order bbq ribs as an entree. It was well done and tender but the sauce left something to be desired. The sweet potato fries were tasty! For the high price, I would *not* bother.

Having only eaten at the Downtown Disney HOB.  This one was far beyond that one.  The food was great, our seats were great, the band in the dining room was fun.  Had a great time.  Will definitely return.

I can't remember the last time I waiting so long for a meal. I don't blame the waitress cause I'm sure she could only do so much but we waited well over an hour for our food while 2 different sets of customers that arrived after us were served before us. After getting frustrated we left $30 on the table for the 4 beers we had during that time and the manager actually had the nerve to get mad at us for not wanting to wait for our food. Needless to say we will not be returning this place.

Best food and not that expensive. Wait staff super friendly and helpful. Make a point to come to this one for breakfast every time in Vegas. Drinks are awesome. And the best part. Wife likes it here so we don't have to argue about where to eat.

I used to be a big fan of the House of Blues and saw a few shows a month there. I have not been back since last September. My favorite band in the world, Roger Clyne & the Peacemakers plays there every Labor Day weekend each year. Each year for the last 5 we have reserved a VIP table for the show. Each year it was an awesome experience. You could get a bottle or bar tab. It was a set price, no fuss no muss and the service was always incredible. That was until last year and their new VIP Host Natalie. It was such a bad experience unfortunately we will not be attending this year. It breaks my heart to miss the show but I will not give them a dime as long as she is in charge. We booked a $750 package which gave us a table for 4 with a few bottles or a cash value bar package and supposedly access to the Foundation Room afterwards. So first of all there was a ton of confusion when we got to the venue. She had no idea what was going on. It was a ridiculous display of ineptitude. Honestly if she was a manager in one of my stores I would not hesitate to fire her. Not only does she not know what's going on but she's arguing with and yelling at security and the staff in front of patrons. By the time we finally got to our table there was a lot of confusion about this so called "bar tab". We were assured by her we had a certain amount we could order from the bar. So we went on with our night and our waitress was fantastic and the show was amazing as always. Skip to the end of the night and the chaos and misery ensues. We were careful to make sure we did not exceed our allotted amount of food and drink throughout the night yet we are presented with a bill for over $200! I have been a Vegas local for over a decade and am well versed in how table service is supposed to work. This was not it. She sat there and argued with us and each time she "did the math" she came up with a different number. Eventually she decided to discount the bill, but all she took off was the gratuity for our waitress. Not wanting her to get screwed because her boss was an idiot we payed the extra money for her and gave her some extra in cash directly. By far the worst experience I've ever had at HOB or any venue in Vegas for that matter. We have missed lot's of good shows this year and will not get to see Roger Clyne in Vegas until she is gone. This show sees a lot of the same people year over year and I have urged all of my friends locally and out of state to not order any table service at the HOB until she is gone. Please bring back the guy and girl that used to do it because Natalie is an idiot and scamming loyal customers.

I went here last night for some dinner with my family. I ordered the build your own burger and got the 7 ounce angus burger with some French fries. This dinner was the worst dinner I have ever had. They took 40 minutes to get our food out and the restaurant wasn't busy at all. The amount of time it took them to get the food out was ridiculous considering of the quality of the food. My burger tasted like the angus burgers you can buy at Sams Club that are microwaveable and my fries were plain, soggy and some parts of them weren't even cooked and tasted like I was just biting into a potato. They actually seemed like the exact same fries that they had at my school lunches in high school... Also their water had that chlorine taste to it. I totally regret eating there, it's not worth your money. I suggest going to any other restaurant in Mandalay Bay other than this one.

I was seriously impressed by my visit here considering it's other chain restaurant competitors- i.e., Hard Rock Cafe, Planet Hollywood, etc. There was a live band while we dined- they weren't great, but good enough for entertaining background music that wasn't too loud, distracting, or offensive.   Most of us had burgers, quesadillas, or similar fare. We were all happy with the food- it wasn't fantastic, but good enough to make me feel like I got a decent bang for my buck. The downside was the service- our server was very busy and didn't pay a lot of attention to us.   The upside of the place was definitely the atmosphere. The ambiance differs from most Vegas restaurants and even the inside of the place looks just as cool as the outside. For a chain, it seemed like there were a lot of regulars at the bar top, which tends to be a good sign for me at least. Overall, a good experience and a fun atmosphere.

My husband and I have been here a few times. We usually sit at the bar as we did on this visit for lunch. The bartender D'Andre was cordial and took our order. Even though the crowd was light. D'Andre was very busy filling server drink orders as well as taking care of guests at the bar. My husband and I shared a BBQ bacon  burger. It was delicious!  D'Andre knew we were splitting the burger and salad so sent out 2 plates. We didn't tell him. He just listened to our order and acted accordingly. To sum up. Food came out fast. Service was excellent. Food was above expectations. Atmosphere fun. Decor creative

Not a bad joint at all. 4 of us ate dinner for just under $100. It is located in a prime spot, just off the casino floor, between the Delano and Mandalay Hotels, and just outside of the Michael Jackson "One" show. Another plus was, you can request a table and leave. The staff will text you when your table is ready. Very smart as it gives you time to gamble; I LOST. LOL.   My wife and daughters ordered flat bread pizza which was comparable to a flat bread pizza at BJs. I order a turkey burger which was full of flavor and surprisingly juicy. I also order a 16oz can of Oscar Blues Pale Ale.  Having the can was perfect because I was able to take it with me when I left.   The highlight of the dinner was the live music. Tony (unknown last) was the artist's name.  He was great. He had a personality that made you laugh, he included the crowd in the music and (most importantly of all) he sounded great. He knew the lyrics, his guitar play was dialed, and he was passionate about his performance.  We may return tonight to see who's playing.

I am never coming to a concert here ever again! I thought I was going through TSA at the airport upon entrance, except worse! First off, security would not let in my boyfriend because they said he was too intoxicated, he was far from and did not believe any of our testimonies when we said he wasn't. The security officers were incredibly rude to all of us after this incident, completely uncalled for. The rest of our party decide to go into the concert and this was when the fun began. If I didn't know any better I thought I was in a police state like 1984. A security officer was to check everyone before entering, and I mean THOROUGHLY. We could not bring in our cigarettes, gum or chapstick! I mean seriously, chapstick? I was forced to throw all of those items away. She searched every hole and crevasse of my purse and jacket like I was about to go kamikaze on the HOB. Finally, in the venue drinks were outrageously priced, bartenders were rude just the cherry on top to make the night a little worse than it was. Never again...

We were pleasantly surprised! We went for some happy hour drinks/food to tide us over before the main meal later that evening and left content. I don't remember if they even had drink specials but I do remember a Corona... pretty good stuff! I recommend one (or 10).   Took forever to get someone to our table, though. That, and some moron was at the table next to us YELLING at his cell phone for 15 minutes. Seriously? Entertaining for a minute, but straight up annoying when you realize it's not quite loud enough to eavesdrop on!  We got the seared-tuna tostadas and the basil/mozzarella flatbread. Both were pretty good. Don't expect much in the way of those tostadas though, as there are 3 that come per order and their "tostada" is actually a tortilla chip. Pretty tasty, but come on... I guess nobody would order it if they said it was "seared tuna on a tortilla chip". The flat bread was fairly big though, and better than expected.  Nothing fancy, but it hit the spot. Plus, the guy singing cover tunes was pretty good.

Man came here a couple years back while I was vacationing  in Vegas with some friends and it was BAD ASS! We came to see this 80's band called The Spazmatics and it was off the chain. Drinks weren't to bad and they were strong. I know my friend ordered a round of shots for everyone and the dude hooked us up with huge shots. It was a fun night of dancing drinking and then ya know Vegas is 24/7 so that only makes it better. I definately recommend you to go here especiall if you can catch the Spazmatics there. GO!!! PEACE!

I love the House of Blues.. My first concert was Fergie. I've been to several concerts there. My son was in a concert there too, The Cleveland Boy Choir. It's always been a pleasant experience.  I forward to coming there again.
Really tasty chicken wings. The corn bread with bits of peppers was not bad. Overall good food and quick service. Recommend.

There should be a way to rate the restaurant and the venue separately, but I don't see one, so I'll combine them.   The concert venue: I thought the acoustics were pretty solid. I've seen a few shows and I was impressed. Drinks are insane and watered down - as expected. For one show I reserved a seat upstairs, but that was really uncomfortable and I wouldn't recommend it.   The restaurant: I used to go here often with work friends and I absolutely love the decoration - awesome artwork everywhere - really well done. The service ranges from horrible (as in, did our waitress leave?) to great. The food is pretty consistent, and though I've had some great dishes (the fried chicken is awesome), some are dry or bland. All are overpriced. Desserts are good for sharing.

My family and I came twice during the week we were staying at the Mandalay bay hotel. The first time we sat over 10 minutes without anyone coming over, then my mom had to go up to the bar to get someone over. Finally 5 minutes later someone came Over and took our order then we never saw him again. Two nights later we decided to try it again because the food was good and we waited at our table for a server for over 5 minutes and our table was 1 out of 5 in the whole restaurant. We had terrible service and was charged for a meal we didn't even order/get, then we were told there was nothing they could do about it after charging our card (by another server because ours was too busy). Finally a manager fixed it and dropped off bill. We never saw our server after our food was dropped off. I've been a server for 6 years and am very understanding but this was awful, a manager wasn't even sent over to apologize or anything. Long story, short.. Great food, terrible service.

yup, it's a fiver =)  I enjoy the service and the food is good, too...after a long day bringing tourists to Vegas on vacation, I'm due for some down time my self. I enjoy some live music, a plate of baby back ribs, some sweet potato fries and a Stella...life's good.  The staff is friendly and fast, from the waiters to the bartenders, and my food is always done just like I like it.  It's a fiver...yup!!!

Came here for a bite to eat after we found that RM Seafood was closed due to an event . We sat in the bar area and ordered several appetizers and a few beers which were very good. The waiter was great and really took care of business with us and all the tables around us. Good job.  Good Food and ambiance. The next day the breakfast was not nearly as good but I may try again if given the chance.
Love love love this place. Free live music tonight. Great cocktails, service & atmosphere.  Really good food especially the Cajun options. See Molly or Colleen at the bar.

Ate there today.  Horrible experience! Service was totally absent. I gave a waiter the empty coffee carafe and he never came back.  The only thing I found good to eat was the cold shrimp and the omelet.  Most of the promised menu was absent.  No  sliders or shrimp & grits.  No chicken wings.  The meat they called prime rib was over cooked, dry and tasteless.  The entertainment was a movie for the first hour and the a few women singing - I expected a choir.

The House of Blues is DEFINITELY a great night time spot! I love that it is in the Heart of Downtown Cleveland, where the nightlife is extremely exciting and happening. I went to see the Who's Bad Michael Jackson Tribute Band. They were excellent! The energy was great, and the diverse compilation of people and songs brought everyone together. I loved The House of Blues.  It was clean, and sophisticated.  Will definitely come back again!

Attended the World Famous Gospel Brunch for the second time this year! Amazing job done by Pat with her amazing voice and all the staff. Good was great as always. Look forward to returning and sharing this experience with another group of friends!

Just saw Bayside at the House of Blues, and I have to say, this place never lets me down! The drinks are a bit pricey, but not over the top. The kids are too "scenester-ish" but not enough to handle. The concerts are always amazing. I like this venue because this is the first and last time I will ever say this, but I enjoy the segregation. The young kids have their floor space, while us older folk (I'm only 22, but I feel like a granny when I see twelve year olds with more tattoos than my trucker grandpa) can hang by the three bar areas and enjoy a much better view. I also enjoy the fact that on those rare occasions that I can't see the stage, I can just look up at the various tv screens and watch from there for a while. The sound is always perfect, and there is a pretty cool vibe. The only concert I was bummed about was Ashlee Simpson a while back, but not because of anything wrong with the HOB...because it was Ashlee Simpson.

Should have paid attention to the reviews on Open Table about the lousy service, but wanted to go somewhere that my son could get something to his liking, which he did. My food was pretty good too, until I pulled an undercooked piece of chicken out of my mouth from the Jambalaya. Long story short, they took my entree off the bill. The service was terrible. There are a dozen other restaurants on this fun block of fourth street...opt for one of them for dinner.
Pizza was bland.  Cost of beer inexpensive.  Service was marginal.

The rotund man who claimed to be a manager needs a serious attitude adjustment. Very rude security and bartenders in the venue. If you want to pay to be treated like garbage while having a mediocre music experience in the armpit of Cleveland, then you definitely want to visit the House of Blues.
This place was way too crowded, there's no in and out, performers were okay, a lil disappointed but it was worth what I paid!

BEST SERVICE with KURT!!! Just flew in and I was tired and hungry but his service made my dinner perfect with my friends. Wow I felt like I was at a 5 star restaurant because of Kurt. Everything he recommended was great.  Voodoo shrimp Fish tacos Bread pudding was perfect.

I regularly enjoy going to Mandalay and catching a show at HOB. My recent experience with Adriana for VIP services made the night even better. It was a good deal, she took care of everything and the wait staff and food was on point, even in the midst of the show. Good view of the stage and easy to get around, I will definitely come back.

OK. This is a karaoke review. This is just  for the HOB Rock Star  "karaoke" night. Monday nights.  If you are a karaoke addict AND you happen to be in Vegas in the *quieter* part of the week (Monday), you gotta try this one! It's "karaoke" in the sense that you have a monitor that scrolls the lyrics for you to sing. But your accompaniment is *not* a CD soundtrack, it's a live punk rock band! (a guitar player, bass player, and a drummer-- and they're pretty good too).   You stand on the 4 foot stage or the 8 foot stage (depending on if you're in the upstairs or downstairs room that night) with real spot lights, smoke and fog machines, and guys who really know what they're doing running the giant House of Blues sound panel to make you sound better than you ever thought possible.   There's been a lively crowd despite the late hours each time I've gone.  Down side is a limited song selection and they can't do key changes up or down from the standard version of any song, but you should be able to find one or two songs in your range, then you can go ascend the stage and be a rock star singing on the very same spot where some pampered *millionaire* rock star sang the night before (or even the hour before) in the House of Blues!  It's definitely a different experience doing "Copacabana" with a punk rock drummer...but it works just fine! (in fact a little more spirited than usual) The night I did that I got a roomfull of real-estate conventioneers bouncing around the place in a conga line. Stuck around for a while to listen to the others. Everyone was sounding pretty good that night. Despite their intimidating punk appearance the band is really good at vocally backing singers who hit a patch of song that they have trouble carrying.

I ordered the breakfast combo (eggs & hash browns). If you want toast it's an additional $3.00, kind of a rip off.    Eggs came out over-super easy, I ordered over-medium.   Hash browns were burnt on the outside, and tasted like mash potatoes on the inside! Yuck!  My sons egg and pancakes were great, until we found a 1-1/2" black hair on his strawberry.  Neither one of us have black hair.    I came here last year, it's gone down hill in quality and up in price.   Pro: The manager and waitress were very nice and apologetic. They comp'd the meal.   It wasn't her fault, and yes I still left here a nice tip lol!
I spent sunday morning in church, er sort of.  We saw Sunday Gospel and had brunch too.  man I forgot how much I loved this town.  I wanted to something different and I wasn't disappointed.
Nice place and pleasant music.  Low standard food and service.  I do not recommend tacos at all.

The hotel/casino needs to mark the directions to H.O.B.s better. I saw one whole sign from west valet to the venue, and my titanium hip was starting to hurt. Once I found the place, the staff was friendly and helpful. I'm looking forward to some great tunes without a mosh pit. I am NOT a strip eater, so I can't review the grub. I do feel like I'm in New Orleans walking and looking around. It's just about Showtime, sooooooo see ya Black Magic Women and men.

We stopped into House of Blues for breakfast thinking what could possibly be simpler than steak and eggs or other simple breakfast fare?   Obviously, quite a lot could be simpler, the first red flag heralding the catastrophe to come was the complete lack of anyone at the ma√Ætre d' kiosk for five minutes. The food was greasy, overcooked, and completely disappointing for the price. The service was amateurish and ghastly at very best. It's probably a better gig if your enjoying a show with a couple of drinks in you.

Meatloaf special was good and so was the Juicy Lucy. Soup and sandwich combo was overpriced. Tiny half of a grilled cheese and cup of soup for 11 bucks. Alexandria was our waitress and was very pleasant.  One small tip for her. NEVER clear dishes until everyone is finished eating. Then don't drop a check until all plates are clear.

We now drive 2+ hours for concerts we want to see because the fees and prices are so outrageous. $140 for social d tickets... $35 for Pittsburgh.... $100 for Rob Zombie.... $40 for Toledo. We pay $140 For a our Riot Fest weekend!!! Yes most is the horrid Ticketmaster but greedy HOB now has VIP sections and price grades. Bring back the HOB before live nation where they cared about fans seeing shows rather than $$$. HOB please care a little more about the fans and go back to an awesome place To see a show! Clevelanders deserve more!

Really nice/cool ambiance. That's about all I've got for nice things to say.  Made to wait outside for 10 mins despite restaurant being 3/4 empty.  Asked if there's a vegetarian burger and was told there IS a turkey burger (that's not actually a complaint, it's just funny... sorry turkeys, I guess you're no longer an animal.).  Waitress spilled some kind of ranch sauce ALL over the floor, my feet, my purse. Janitor comes and takes care of the floor first (?!) - then waitress tosses me some wet naps and leaves me to clean up this sh*t all over my stuff.  Barely apologizes, and doesn't take anything off the bill or anything (we just paid the whole thing and didn't argue, but you would think that's the LEAST they could do... Frigging mayo/ranch in the fabric of my shoes which are probably going to stink and be ruined now).

Went there for a quick bite and had the buffalo chicken wings and pulled pork sliders.  The chicken wigs tasted old, dry and chewy. The sliders were dry and didn't taste great.  The waiter was nice but the food is terribly bad, even the coleslaw was awful!  Will not get back!

We came in for happy hour and sat at the bar. Nikki was our bartender she was amazing!!  She made us great cocktails and really went out of her way to make sure we enjoyed our date night. We really appreciated her!! Thanks Nikki. :)

My Wife and I had lunch here for the first time in September.  The service was friendly and prompt.  I've also been to the HOB in Orlando but, never ate there.  The food was amazing.  I got the Juicy Lucy.  One of the famous Chefs own recipes.  It was the best burger I've ever had.  Simply awesome.  I've told everyone about it.  It's a MUST try.  My Wife really enjoyed her chicken sandwich.  I love the ambiance, and wall art.  Top notch.  When I go back, I will be having a Juicy Lucy and checking out Santana if he's still playing there.

Saw Kid Cudi & Asher Roth and they put on a great performance! The service here was another story. First off, we wanted to get table service, so after being jumped from one employee to another, we finally got into a table that had a really good overview of the stage. You'd think for the price of the table you would get equally good service. Nope. The wait staff was either understaffed, or too into the concert to keep the drinks coming. The worst part was the restroom staff. I literally never ever have been hit up for a tip before, anywhere. Until HOB, that is. After grabbing a mint i was walking over to the next available mirror/sink and the guy literally grabbed my arm (thinking I was leaving) wanting a tip. After having to actually tell him to not grab my arm, i went about washing me hands. Dropped a five in the jar and left. If he was the only one there I would not have tipped anything. After letting the staff know about the pushy attendant, they seemed to brush it off and literally did nothing. I will never go to another concert at HOB in Vegas. Great venue, awful staff.

Just the same as the HOB in your city.  I don't know how I got talked into going there for lunch this past Saturday, though there's absolutely nothing to complain about. The food is what you expect. And what you've had. Very corporate, very precisely portioned. I used to make fun of American tourists eating at McDonald's in Europe. Now I think I've lost that privilege. (For the record, I went to McD's because I like being served beer out of those wax paper cups. With a straw of course)  All in all, Vegas is home to many restaurants you don't have in your hometown. Try one of those instead.

I haven't attended many concerts in the last few years but my experience at House of Blues was fantastic. Parking, restrooms, food - even bowling in case you got there way to early - was nearby and easy so that I could relax and let NeedtoBreathe sweep my soul away. Everything came with a price tag, but at the end of the night it was soooo worth it.

On June 12, 2013,  We totally enjoyed our dinner spent for our last evening in Las Vegas.  The food there was exceptional and tasty.  Our waiter, Anthony Collata provided exceptional. He was terrific in checking with us throughout the meal.  Anthony was personable and knowledgeable in informing us in what was recommend.  He made our last dinner there very special and memorable.  If we return to this restaurant, we would definitely request for him to serve us.    The catfish there was the best we have ever tried.    Henry and Jenny From Hawaii

I like HOB and visited the one in New Orleans before I knew there was one in Vegas.  I like this place.  It is a nice break from the Vegas sun and noise of the casinos.  This one is in Mandalay Bay, and we make the trek down to this end to eat at HOB, not because of Mandalay Bay.  The catfish nuggets and sweet potato fries are yum yum yum.  Get 'em, you'll like 'em.  We've had just about everything on the menu, even the fried chicken - very good.  You get a discount for the store and your next meal, so save your receipt!
Overpriced applebees! very slow service took over 45 minutes to receive appetizer. They were out of plates to serve our meal which was burnt chicken over penne pasta for $17
Love the place....Love the Southern flair  - the food, the decor the vibe. Nice place for a gumbo or a jambalaya or several round of beer before sweating it all out at the nearby Rumjungle.

I came in for breakfast on a Friday morning. The super fuel omelet was good. The hash browns I could not eat, they tasted like cheap margarine. They serve Peets tea. They don't include any cream or honey with their tea. The service was ok at best. The waitress forgot to get my toast and do I reminded her, they brought the toast but no jam with it and  charged me for the side of toast.  One of the servers had so much facial hair with a big moustache and long full chunk of a beard that I was worried his hair will fly into my food. The atmosphere is lively with a theatrical tv playing the world cup and some people were cheering. The layout and theme of this place is very unique and charming.

This review is for the Foundation room bar. Views are to die for - best on the strip. Go on a Monday night when it's free. Expect to pay $10 a drink minimum. Two out of 10 of us threw up immediately after drinking rum & cokes. No other explanation other than we were roofied. Buyer beware

AVOID THIS PLACE!! I went here for lunch with my family on a Thursday when the place barely had anyone in the restaurant. We sat down at 1:30 and we only got about half our food 50 min later!!! We also got a broken glass with one of the drinks. After complaining to the manager just before getting our food she didn't seem to care that much and just said "I'll look into getting your food out" and later said she would apply a discount. At this point I'm wondering why I should even pay when there were at most 10 tables of people in the place and  most only had 2 people at them. Then when the bill came the manager only took 25% off the bill and then had some comp tickets to a show that was later in the week when my family and I were not even going to be in town and they were also for a band that I don't even like and would never enjoy!! Towards the end I didn't see the manager anywhere in sight even when the bill came. I've never seen such poor service. I own my own business and know many restaurant owners. And we would have ended up firing some people if any business I associate with conducted themselves this way. I warn all people hungry and looking for a decent meal.

Oh man. Don't even know where to start. I used to come here all the time since I work in Mandalay Bay. I waiting 40 min for a quesadilla. They have people running around like chickens without heads. No one knows what the other is doing.  The person must have came back to me at least 4 times to tell me my food will be right out. When I got the food the portion was so much tinier than the last time I got it. When I bit into it, it was absolutely disgusting. Granted I ate it because I just wasted my break waiting for it but I will never be going back to eat there again.

Just saw Billy Idol perform here. Fantastic show. Venue is great and gives an awesome intimate feeling. Hands down my favorite music venue on the strip. The staff are friendly and helpful. Bar stuff are great and security handled situations like pros! Was particularly impressed with how a female security member handled a particular circumstance near me. I think she was English or Australian. Great team and great venue. Wunderbar all round!

Great ambiance, cold beer, good entertainment, but the food was horrible. We ordered a bacon wrapped meatloaf, the meatloaf was the consistency of the pigskin on a football. It just tasted wrong in your mouth. And we had a shrimp and grits. The grits was like a fried cake of cornbread, but without any flavor. Again, the consistency was horrible, & I am from Louisiana. Very very disappointed with the food but to sit and have a beer, its great ambiance!

I had the bacon cheese burger and it was amazing! So was the jalapeno corn bread (not spicy). It has a fun vibe, good food.  I'm giving it three stars because my girlfriend ordered the flat bread, and it was bland, dry and overall like eating cardboard with vegi toppings.  Why she would order such a dish anyway is beyond me, but it was a poor item to have on a menu.  I reccommend going to this place, the prices are reasonable 10-20 for entrees (plus a few more expensive items).

I certainly hope I was here on a really off day for our waiter.  We stopped in during happy hour and ordered two appetizers to share and a couple of beers.  Our beer bottles came, a glass was requested, and I ordered a water.  We waited and waited and waited.  Finally, the food came.  However, no small plates to accompany the food or the beer glass.  Another waiter realized, on his own accord,  that we needed plates and water, so he went to get them.  In the meantime, our original waiter came by and asked if we needed another round of beers to which I replied, "No.  However, I'd still like a water and we need plates."  While that waiter said, "oh yeah!"  and went to go dilly-dally, the second waiter came by with waters and plates.  By this time, I wanted a second beer.  But, our waiter was nowhere to be found.  Eventually, I saw him and by this time I figured it would be best to get the check.  He came back with the check, I gave him cash and our change was returned.  However, it was the incorrect change.  So, I explained to the waiter that his tip will be off because he returned the incorrect change.  He then explained to me that he doesn't have change on him so he rounds up or down to the nearest dollar and gives bills back.  I then explained to him that he rounded in his favor not his customers' favor and therefore his tip will be off because the change was off.  A light bulb went off in his head and he finally understood.  With that he said, "You know, I did that the other day. A guy gave me a fifty and I thought he paid me $30, and I ended up shorting him twenty bucks!"  So, yeah, I can only hope the waiter was having a really off day.  But, after hearing him say that, I wonder.  Two stars because the happy hour specials are decent, the food was tasty, and I enjoyed the decor.

Really disappointed during my last trip to HOB (and I mean it will be my LAST trip).  Went on a Saturday night around 6:30 pm.  I know that that is early for Las Vegas standards, but there was no one else there.  Then they seat us in the back by the restrooms!  The menu was on the placemat.  The food was average.  This place has really gone downhill.

Amazing happy hour. Great time there.  + dollar beers. + half off appitzers + good country singer while we were there, old school + waiters were attentive but not annoying  - kind of hokey - really loud, but what do you expect - the breakfast was good, but not great  definatly worth a happy hour trip for sure!

The Crossroads at House of Blues is one of the better casual dining experiences on the Mandalay Property.  The overall experience rates as average to slightly better than average when compared to similar options in Vegas, but the good kind of average where you won't find yourself too disappointed by the experience...only wishing that it was a little better.  It's not "on" the Strip, but with fair prices and decent sized portions, it's not a bad place to grab a meal/snack and some drinks.  I have eaten at the House of Blues (Crossroads not the Foundation Room) twice, most recently in late 2010.  It's one of those places where the food is ok for the price and you don't have to worry about much going wrong - nothing excellent but nothing bad.  This is just my opinion, but as far as Resort on-property food options go, the House of Blues is a decent casual-affordable destination: not in the top tier but certainly not at the bottom.  I think the place is understaffed or lacks proper management, but if you can avoid going when the crowds are in, you will improve your experience exponentially.    Items I have tried include: quesadilla, jambalaya, ribs, burger, kid's pizza, and assorted appetizers and sides.  Overall, the food is average: not great but not bad.  The burgers had nice toppings (could have been put together better) and good flavor.  The ribs were a bit interesting: I appreciated the Cajun attempt but some in my group didn't like it.  Aside from this minor or major taste distraction, the ribs were also a bit dry.  The jambalaya was bland and the pieces of meat ranged from good to rubbery.  The restaurant appears to suffer from a little lack of effort or quality control.  Despite these less than flattering comments, the basic menu items aren't bad and can easily be improved with a little BBQ sauce or hot sauce.    Most people will visit because of the House of Blues "thing" but you'll also see your share of Mandalay guests who've never even heard of the franchise.  If you're coming with kids or seniors, I suggest you come during lunch or have an early dinner because it does get crowded during the weekends and during events.  I think it's too loud and dark for kids and most seniors, but the restaurant isn't exactly aiming for that demographic.  Both of my visits were during non-peak hours (less than 15 diners in the restaurant) and I found the service to be efficient.  Our server came by and got everything we needed, but it wasn't what you would call "friendly" service...YMMV.   There are a lot of casual dining options, and despite not being perfect, the House of Blues does offer Mandalay guests a nice alternative to fine dining and fast food.  The experience ranges from "hip night spot" to "dead during the day" so plan your visit according to your expectations.  There are places with worse service and worse food, so for the category that it's competing in (casual resort property dining) - I think the House of Blues is ok as long as you stick with the basics like burgers and sandwiches.  It's a solid 3 stars when compared to others in the category, but can easily be improved upon with better management and improvements to the recipes/cooking.
Jambalaya tasted like it was reheated from last week...not the same HOB experience I have had around the country.

I guess when you get this big you don't have to care anymore. I was treated like total shit from the entire staff. I was nothing but polite however, the staff went out of their way to treat me like garbage. They assume they will always be busy but they'll end like every other venue, too big for their own good.. It's just a matter of time. House of Blues will get a true lesson of what the blues truly mean. Mark my word.

Staff was great. They went above and beyond. Originally booked the foundation room for my wedding reception but upon review of my needs and guestlist the wedding coordinator closed the House of Blues restaurant for us to meet our needs. Food was great. Setting was awesome. Loved everything about this venue!

The Voo Doo shrimp are great. My husband had the juicy lucy hamburger. He thought it was pretty good. I had the fish of the day which was red snapper. I had it blackened and it was ok. Price was average for Vegas meal. Although the meal was not a "WoW" dinner, I would visit again for the gospel brunch.

Flew in for Mastodon and Gojira and I've gotta say this place is a BEAUT Vaulted ceilings , one spectacular chandelier  centered above the main floor Love this place  Only gripe I had and actually was NOT expecting was the 14 dollar tallboys  A 2 dollar can of Pabst ..14 bucks  C'mon now  As stated previously , in many reviews I'm sure , pregame before you show  Tho I have to say , thee bartender did make an outrageously good AMF , probably the best I've ever had  Quality over quantity ..this rule does not apply to Pabst lol   Oh, by the way  The show was KILLER Soundguy was perfect

I can't sing enough praises for Denise and the staff at the HOB Company Store! I called from Austin, TX, looking for certain paintings by "Glitter Girl" that are difficult to find. The two young women who helped me went out of their way by sending pics of the paintings that were available and answering all my questions. I was able to purchase two large paintings over the phone and have them shipped to Texas. Honestly, it was an exceptional experience, and so nice to know people care about a customer's satisfaction. Will definitely stop by the HOB next time I am in Las Vegas! Kudos again and again to Denise and her fellow HOB members!!! I am happy, Deborah Grimsley

We ended our Saturday night here after dancing the night away at J-Pop Lounge just down the way. The had a live act which plays every Saturday night called Boogie Nights and it was fun.   Only downside was having to deal with the second hand smoke of the idiots near the entrance seeing as it was nearly impossible avoiding their fumes. Some people have no respect for others.

This review is in reference to the venue and not the restaurant.  My wife and I recently attended the Anthrax show on January 22nd 2012.  The tickets were $29 50 each plus a $10.00 convenience from Ticketmaster for this general admission show.    This was my first HOB show but I do know they have some seating and tables which we were hoping to arrive in time to get one since our old bones just can't withstand the brutality of the pit like we did in the old days.  Anyway, come to find out all of the surrounding tables were reserved only.  $200.00 for the table that included a bottle of Sky Vodka and only (4) metal heads per table.  Really...$200 table at a Anthrax show?  Ok, fine if you think that is worth it.    Now here comes the main reason for my review.  The upper seating deck was available but closed off.  We were told that it would open soon when the floor got packed.  After the first act finished sure enough it opened up but there was a charge.  What???  $10.00 more per person to sit in the upper deck seating.  Come on HOB!  We already paid to be in the venue and hardly anybody went upstairs.  As if you weren't making enough money on the bar you had to stick it to me one more time.  My complaint is if your going to charge extra for seating then do it in the advertisement for the show.  I'll pay for it.  Don't call it general admission then charge extra to sit down in the venue.  In the end I guess I should be grateful I wasn't charged $5.00 for leaning on the wall.
I love this restaurant. My $30 steak was awesome it was much better than any other fancy and expensive restaurant. I will always have there stake every time I go to mandalay bay

The entertainment and atmosphere fun, however, if you want to talk to others at the table when the live band is playing...forget it you can't hear each other. I had the steak salad very good! Wait staff was nice and looked happy to be there!! Recommend.

The food here is fantastic!  We stopped after the Michael Jackson One show and had the jalapeno corn bread, a chicken quesadilla and the lobster mac&cheese.  All these dishes were fantastic!  We were pleasantly surprised.  Highly recommend!
Cheesy artwork. Very corporate feel. Super expensive drinks. Meh customer service. But all the money that House of Blues has allows them to put on nice sounding shows.

I was just there to see Billy Idol on March 23rd, 2016; it was my first visit to the House of Blues. It's a smallish, more intimate venue which means there is not a bad seat in the house. All of the staff were very nice and friendly. The restrooms were clean, which I always appreciate. I will definitely be back, they know how to put on a show! :)

Big dissappointment!    I went here with a large group of people, and our service was horrible. I really think the waiter didn't try becuase he knew he was already getting his 18% gratuity.  I had to ask for a water refill three times. wtf? (they were not busy either) The entree was horrible, and had so much peppercorn on the plate that's the only thing I could taste.  In fact, no-one in my party finished their plates, nor did they want to take the food home.  They need to step it up, bigtime.

I emailed the Manager Director the next day as LeAnn requested, and he ( Michael Heid) responded and said he would call me the next afternoon.   Have never heard anything more from them.   Apparently, fixing this restaurant and having satisfied customers is not on their list of priorities.. Wish I had read the yelp reviews before we spent the money on the bland, over cooked, overpriced food.   I did notice that most of the positive and very lengthy in-depth reviews are from locals??? hmmm.  I compared them to the other reviews.. Even the out of town 4/5 star reviews are not as indepth and lengthy...Makes me wonder if these locals have been asked to, or if they have been given incentives to leave this high feedback...

SANTANA gets FIVE STARS!!!! And the inside concert area is like all other House of Blues. We really LOVED the concert with SANTANA.   Reason for 3 star is it is hard to rate here for the concert a five star yet the minimal food menu they offer gets a ONE STAR. One star for offering bland food.  We were not thrilled with the menu and opted to get the lobster sandwich with fries for $20+ each. IT IS BIG BREAD with a dab of their BLAND lobster salad. Literally no flavor and merely all bread. WORST offering of food at a high price I have ever experienced!! Serve the best quality options or don't bother.   It hurt to even show 3 stars on this review because if I am rating the FOOD, IT IS ONE STAR! Concert with SANTANA, 5 stars!!   Someone deeply needs to rework the menu quality. Pathetic and how can you possibly feel proud of it???? Ugh. McDonalds style is what we got at 8x the price.

I just hosted a birthday party at the House of Blues and I WILL NEVER GO BACK.  Our server never smiled once and had such an attitude from the moment we got there even though we were a well behaved table of 6 AND a 19% gratuity was included in our bill.  When we ordered our appetizer, it was at first delivered to the table next to us. Then all night, servers walked around with plates of food seemingly guessing as to which table it belonged. We were interrupted several times with question of "who had the cajun whatever" and it was never anyone at our table.  The spinach dip was such a small portion it hardly filled the bottom of the bowl and the chips lacked salt and the salsa was seriously out of a jar from Save-a-lot. The corn bread was good - but the only vegetarian option were those listed above and a side of mashed potatoes which again lacked salt. The Fish and Chips were totally greasy and disgusting. My drink, when it finally arrived, was $11 which wasn't listed any where on the drink menu.  This place completely sucked and is overpriced.

sorry I was disappointed. First of all  Kirk Franklin is not there in person. It was 6 singers on stage singing his songs. I did enjoy the singing. I think $50.00 was too pricy. The buffet was more of a catered event, not what you see in most Las Vegas buffets. The alcoholic drinks start at $6.00. We had dishes stacked on our table at least 15 min. No I will not go again.
Service was a disaster, food was average and took forever to come out in a half full restaurant. We had 5 different servers.  Probably won't go back unless for just drinks and music.

RITA!  That is all she wrote!  Just kidding...  I felt compelled to share kudos and love for Rita today.  We spent a great evening at the HOB in Vegas with a large group of folks and Rita was our server.  She took care of us with love, humor, professionalism, and grace!  The food has always been great... in fact I was not all that hungry that night BUT Rita just blew me away with how well she treated each and every person... answering questions, running to get every little thing we needed and even dealing with breaking up the check for each couple.  She rocks!!!!  I just love great customer service and you certainly get that at the HOB in Vegas!  The gal in the gift shop rocked too!
Thank you Leah for the wonderful service! Very personable and super sweet! Nothing goes better with southern food, the the hospitality! Great food recommendations Leah, your a great waitress.

We were totally surprised by the quality of food; all four of our entrees were (too) big and quite delicious. Our bill was $110 for four entrees and four cocktails; totally reasonable for Vegas.   The service was slow; friendly, but slow... which was weird because the restaurant wasn't very  busy; I'd say 25% capacity when we were there, but it took quite a while to get drinks or water refills.

Went here for breakfast not expecting much but was pleasantly surprised. Pancakes were fluffy and tasty, hash browns light and perfectly cooked, eggs fresh and just right. Well, the coffee was weak but at least no bad tastes. Staying at Mandalay 3 days and we'll be back

House of Blues is one of my favorite places in Las Vegas.  Excellent food and service and watching Rock Star Karaoke during dinner was fun.  The manager stopped by our table a few times to make sure all was good.  In all, very attentive service.  I ordered the sirloin and to my surprise, it came out cooked exactly how I wanted it!  The food was very tasty and served hot (always a plus).  The bar is well run and the bartenders know how to mix a drink correctly.  If you are in Las Vegas and are a bourbon lover like me, House of Blues stocks my favorite spirit...Woodford Reserve (Official bourbon of the Kentucky Derby).  I highly recommend it.  Most establishments do not stock this top shelf bourbon.  Had a great experience here (again) and it is always a regular stop when I am in town.

Chains don't normally do it for me, but this one if kind of fun, if you can forget it is a chain.  Music is always good, and it's a good place to grab a  drink and a snack... as long as you are in the mood for fried carbohydrates!

I worked with Gina to make a group reservation for 19 for my birthday dinner. We started planning a little over 1 1/2 months prior to our trip. This may be why we were able to get the most fabulous private room. It felt like we were dining in a castle with a long dinner table that accommodated all of us. When we walked into this room....we knew it was going to be an awesome experience. Our servers Jackie and John were phenomenal. They interacted wonderfully with our group and we didn't want for anything. I arranged to have appetizers started when we arrived and people raved about them...especially the Voodoo Shrimp (also had basal pesto flatbread, spinach dip and cornbread). Particularly popular dinner items were jambalaya, bacon wrapped meatloaf, shrimp and grits and salads.  Thank you, Gina, Jackie, John and Chefs for making our time together as a family absolutely perfect!!

All too often, we talk about Las Vegas eateries as having great food but terrible service.    Katie, at The House of Blues, gave Vegas dining a breath of fresh air.  She was the perfect level of attentive and courteous without being overbearing or obnoxious.  The experience today will make us return patrons again.  Thank you!

I just want to say. I recently went to the joint at Hard Rock for a concert and was blown away. I was with my friend a month ago for Santana at House of Blues and was highly disappointed. He paid for a table and our waitress was Lauren, she was blonde, but but very grumpy. It was a small venue and she didn't seem to be busy but we seemed a neusciance to her.  We talked to her but she said her manager Griselda, or something was busy. We just wanted to buy another bottle but wasn't possible. At the Joint we were treated as customers. Very refreshing. I will go back. I hope Santana chooses wise and makes his residency much more professional, clean and welcoming.

Was first in line for the Dec 20th show, Lupe Fiasco. My boyfriend and I got there about two hours early. The workers came up to us about an hour before the show with a $30 voucher for the house of blues restaurant and told us that we could go eat and they would see us at the show. We walked over to house of blues, had a great meal. All we had to pay for was the tip! Also if you spend $40 at the restaurant you get to skip the line completely.. so we added a few more things to our meal and skipped the line! Great service! Great show! Great people! Just wish I didn't live 4 hours away!

My wife and I have been at this establishment a number of times.   We usually order the chicken wings as an appetizer, along with the catfish fingers and sweet potato  fries.   The pizza isn't worth the time or the money.  The spinach dip with fries would be better if they ditched the potato chips and instead use pita chips.   Usually the service is fast, but last night we had to wait quite a while.   Burgers are good and the drink prices are reasonable.  All in all a good place to enjoy live music.

I'm not changing my review, but in fairness, after reading my post a manager from the restaurant contacted me to apologize for the food and gave me a full refund, which is pretty great. She offered me a free dinner at The House of Blues here in LA. Haven't had a chance to take her up on it, but if I do I'll report back.

Went to HOB to see Santana last weekend which was a great show in a small but awesome venue.I ordered the French Dip at the restaurant,it was bland but the service was freindly and prompt.My review is largely based on the music venue.

Went to a concert at Cleveland's House of Blues last night.  Few seats and they go fast so be prepared to stand all night. The real problem is the sound engineer. The mix was so incredibly bad that it was impossible to enjoy the music. I could hardly pick out anything in the mid-range mush, and each time the drummer hit the kick, or the keyboard or bass guitar hit some low note, which was very, very often, the whole house would shake, boom and resonate with that one overly boosted bass and sub-bass frequency.  Highs were cutting through, as they always do, but anything in the mid-range was lost in the mush. This over-amplification of the bass betrays a great or complete ignorance of psychoacoustics, and it caused physical discomfort and pain in my ears so that, when the bassist, keyboardist, and kick drum started pounding in unison, the noise was torture.  When this House of Blues fails and closes its doors, I will not be surprised. Purveyors of music who know nothing of acoustics? I think not.
Came for lunch on a Wednesday food was amazing so was the service! Not only was the food great the presentation was really nice. Had the fish sandwich  would really recommend!
Shrimp PoBoy sandwich was LARGE in portion size but TINY in TASTE.  Tasteless with DISAPPOINTMENT!!!!!  I will not order that again.

Went to go see King Diamond and had a blast. Security was nice, the staff was attentive and it was just big enough for the concert! I wished we could smoke cigarettes downstairs but it's not really a big deal. The only warning I can give is a 24 oz. can of pabst blue ribbon is 12 DOLLARS! Ridiculous and unacceptable for a beer that costs $1.50 anywhere else.

I like thid place.  I have seen it several times and never stopped in. I was excited when I was invited to a Halloween party here. I had a great time. The line at the bar moved farely quickly.  The staff was professional and friendly.  I should have come here sooner. The dj (Bow Wow Wow) was friendly and approachable.  On theother side was a cover band playing ,so it was fun to float between dance floors.   I definitely want to go back again. Great venue.

Went to a show last Wednesday.  I think the sound quality was pretty good.  I could hear well from where I was standing.  I agree that a lot of people will end up staring at someone's back.  I am 5'7" and had my vision blocked for about half the show.  Luckily I don't really care what I'm looking at, I'm there for the music.  Drinks were expensive, which should be expected, because it's a concert venue.  Not a problem.  However, 4 dollar coat check?  Annoying.  Leave your coat in your car if you can stand the arctic chill for a few minutes, or at a nearby bar and just come back for it.  I would come back here for another show but would sit in the balcony so I know I have a good view.
A totally fun and friendly atmosphere! Our waitress, Tracey made whole the visit! She was so personable and offered the best recommendations.
Perfect greasy place to cure a hangover and that's about it.

Saw Metric here last night and I was really impressed.  The acoustics are fantastic and every seat has a good view.  It's a small and intimate venue--smaller than even the Pearl.   I wish that more bands would play here instead of the crappy Boulevard Pool (I seriously hate that place as a venue).  Also, they have a decent selection of ENORMOUS canned beers.  OMG, I am so hungover....

Who the FUCK do these people think they are. There is NOTHING less rock and roll than this airport security checkpoint. Not one thing on earth. TSA takes notes from this place. More metal detector wands than a fucking presidential campaign rally.   Why don't you guys just strip search everyone, now THAT would be rock and roll. Embrace your inner fucking J. Edgar Hoover, you've got enough security cameras, at least make porn.  A good friend played there once and wanted to SPARE us from the other RAPING, namely, the beer prices. So he invited me and some friends back stage. SORRY THAT'S TOO ROCK AND ROLL - douchebag minimum wage security fuck standing at the backstage door says nuh uh. You ain't in the band. My friend in the band couldn't believe his ears. He was like, "dude, I'M in the band."   House of Rules. Not blues. Not rock and roll. You should be enshrined in the Hall of Fame down the street next to the guys who blew up Beatles records in Shea Stadium as the Biggest Assholes in the history of popular music.   Fuck. You.
Came in off of a morning hunger but left so satisfied after a decent meal and great service from the bartender August who provided great service not overbearing but attentive, thanks August!!

Review for Concert area only. Was here to see a great local band Moksha on Saturday. As a concert venue this place is OK. I have been to a few shows here in the past, this was my first since yelping. Ultimately there isn't anything in my book to say that's really great about the place, or that is really bad about it. Hence in the middle with 3 stars.   The venue it a bit intimate with its setup, that you can be up close. Its not really big, so crowd is together for it. Sound and lighting are both good. Drink Prices are usually average strip prices, $13 for a tall boy of Guinness extra stout isn't to bad in my book.   Ultimately if you like a band that is playing here, go see them. The venue is not going to add much to the show, but won't detract from it either.

Cool ambience in this place for being inside a casino. The food was pretty decent as well as the service. We went for some late night grub after a night out on the town which totally hit the spot. The place could be a bit cleaner though.
Best breakfast ever!! You must come here for the pancakes!   I had banana pancakes with stawberries on top. Everything was fresh and amazing!

This is my first time in vegas and I am pleased. I have eaten here for the past 2 breakfasts and I am so grateful with my full and happy tummy. Yesterday I was not to hungry so I got side of biscuits and gravy. THE BEST EVER I had no butter and just ate them straight, delicious. My family had chicken and waffles, fruit plate and more. The chicken and waffles did not disappoint! The chicken was fried to perfection and not too greasy. They were boneless and easy to eat with the golden brown waffles. It came with bourbon syrup, dark with a touch of booze and also hot maple syrup, yum!  Today we got the chicken waffles again-because they were so good, the steak and eggs, the white chocolate banana French toast, the rock and roll breakfast and the buttermilk pancakes. I got the banana French toast. It was delicious!! A mix of bread pudding, French toast, and banana bread, it's something totally new, innovative and tongue pleasing! However I did not even get a hint of white chocolate. Not sure if it cooked off or what because it wasn't on top nor in. But everyone else was ecstatic about their meals, the service, and the prices!   Our waiters name was Christian and he took great care of us. Constant service, filling waters, fresh coffee, asking us if we needed anything, and the food came out quick. Christian was nice and not grumpy considering it was 8 in the morning on Easter Sunday. Relatively cheap for good quality Vegas food. Great start to the day, thanks.

We LOVED House of Blues but it could have been because we were eating nothing but straight junk up to the point we arrived here.  The Gumbo side soup was delish   I had the Shrimp PoBoy. I felt like it lacked spice but it was tasty. Another thing is I like my pickles pickled and the resteraunt only has pickled cucumbers which is a pickle at its earliest stage.  My boyfriend had the ribs with the macaroni and cheese. Ribs were tender and mac n cheese was to die for with bread crumbs on top that give it a cruch. My cousin ordered a New York steak that was perfectly cooked medium well and the potatoes she got were creamy.   The prices are not too bad either.

AUSTIN WALKING CANE I LOVE YOU. Anyway, just passing through Cleveland, had dinner then came here for drinks and music. We sat in the backroom and it was empty but Austin was playing and his voice kept us around. We didn't get any food but the service was super, very attentive and drinks were generous for their servings. Happy place full of good, good peoples. Don't be deterred by sitting in the less rowdy backroom. I'm sure the front room is ok though.

I had never been to a House of Blues. We drove up to Cleveland from Pittsburgh to see Brandi Carlile. Whenever she tours in Pittsburgh she plays local venues that tend to be great places to see a show. As soon as I walked into the HOB I had my doubts. It was like a Planet Hollywood threw up all over the place.  I had major doubts about the set up of this venue. It is like a shoe box. There is a pit in front of the stage and then more standing room in the back by the bars (yes BARS, 2 of them to be exact, more on that later). The second tier dipped in a weird way so if you were standing in the back you felt like you were in a dungeon or basement. The acoustics were awful. They piped everything through speakers so instead of hearing actual music you hear the speaker recreation of music unless you are "lucky" enough to get a spot in the pit.    I hate standing room only venues because there is always some idiot who thinks s/he and their group of 8 giants can squeeze in front of you.  By the mid point of the show (which was awesome, Brandi Carlile is amazing regardless of the crappy venue) most of the audience was totally trashed (2 bars one small venue) there were three women behind me who were so wasted they were having trouble standing up. There was a group of three in front of me that had one girl who started wildly flailing her fists about when she decided to tell her boyfriend random stories and she ended up hitting not just me but also a middle aged woman standing next to me. I have never had so much beer spilled on my person by total strangers with no regard to the fact that they were spilling their drinks everywhere. During the very last song of the set an honest to god brawl broke out up near the front between some of the patrons. Cleveland, you seem like a nice city but your residents are sloppy drunks. Honestly, HOB should set some kind of drink limit because everyone there who had been drinking was sloppy. I hated this venue and will never come back. Acoustics were awful, it was so commercial it was sickening, the crowd was generally awful. I didn't partake in the food or drink so I can't comment on that but as a venue for concerts I recommend NEVER going there unless it is to see someone you absolutely love.

Worst place we visited our whole trip. Except for our waitress Aune.. she was BY FAR one of the BEST waitresses we had the whole trip. The food was almost unedible. We had the corned beef hash.. which tasted like it was a microwave meal. I ate the toast and that was about it. My husband had the 2 egg breakfast, the portion was small and was cold by the time we got it. The bloody mary was awful.. Our over $50 tab for 3 meals and one drink seemed ridiculous. Won't be back!!
Love this Gospel brunch. Great food but even more wonderful is the music. Huge smile. Sitting by folks from Chi Town and Canada. Feel the love. Good champ too.

Went to see Strange Days, the tribute band for The Doors that have Robby Krieger as the lead guitar. !! Band was awesome. We sat in the balcony and had a great seat. The drinks are very expensive so take that into account before you get there as you can't bring any drinks in from the casino. I did smell mother nature half way thru the show which was appropriate for the mood that night. Had a great time !!
Caught the Dj Shadow show the sat before halloween, he killed it. Great venue. Cheap eats, not so cheap drinks. Go with the tall can and smuggle in a flask.

House of blues is a very intimate concert space. Your vision will be blocked for for at least a part of the show but you also might get close enough to have the artist sweat on you. Which is really, really close.  I've been to a few concerts here. It's always super crowded but the sound quality is great. The food is overpriced but I expect that if I go downtown. I would say the only con is there is always, always, always someone smoking pot. I've been to metal, alternative rock, country and orchestra events here and someone always lights up. I know it's expected at concerts but the orchestra event threw me. You would think in such a small space they would be able to locate and remove the individuals. I normally don't care but HOB's is very small and I don't want to be coughing on smoke through my shows because someone's smoking cheap weed.

Wow.  Either Arron Sanchez needs to do better, or the house of blues needs to stop associating themselves with a head food network chef.  This was a horrible experience.  The only positive aspect of my time here was....well actually, everything sucked.  We (my fiance and I) ordered the wild mushroom flat bread pizza for an appetizer.  1.  the mushrooms were canned and horrible. 2. The marinara was canned and not home made, and 3. the parm cheese that was on top of it, was definitely from a Craft canned Giant Eagle Purchase.    Awful.  Next.  We ordered a Juicy Lucy burger that was supposed to be a 1/2 lb.  but was nothing more then a 1/4 lb.  Not only was there no cheese in the middle of the burger (the very definition of a juicy lucy) it was over cooked and mediocre.... at best.    We will never go back here, and waste another 55$ on the worst food I have ever eaten.  If I'm going back to 4th street, I would rather go to Saigon and order the House Special Vermicelli.  Please, DO NOT GO HERE! (house of blues)

The House of Blues is the worst live music venue in Las Vegas. I don't even know where to start. First I guess is the design. A venue should always have a clear line of sight to the stage. In this place, there are HUGE pillars that surround the main floor, so if you're on the other side, you're screwed. They also EXTREMELY oversell the place. When a concert is sold out, it's packed as tight as can be...yeah, you may think every general admission concert is like that right? Wrong. You have to take stairs down to actually get in the venue, and when it's full, there's people standing up the stairs. When the Joint at the Hard Rock has a sold out show, there's still plenty of room to get reasonably close to the stage, and still have room to breathe. I've never sat in the balcony, so I can't comment on that. But bottom line, if it's not sold out, ok, if it is, just stay home and don't bother. The Joint at the Hard Rock Hotel usually gets much better acts anyways.

During our stay at Mandalay Bay this past week, my Wife and I went to House of Blues for an early dinner before our flight home. The restaurant wasn't too busy and we were seated right away.  My wife is a Bloody Mary fan and ordered the 'Morning After' which comes with a mini Hamburger and souvenir glass. My wife loved it (and she's quite a Bloody Mary critic). We both ordered the NY strip steak which was perfectly prepared and tasted great. Everyone was very friendly and attentive, The manager even stopped by to apologize for the appetizer taking a while to come out, which I honestly didn't think they took too long at all, but  they took them off the bill nonetheless.   We'll definitely be back when we return.

We went to House of Blues for the Gospel Brunch, which happens on Sunday mornings and we were really happy to find so close to our hotel. After getting our tickets, we went to our table, which was at the end of a long table that was filled with gentle older ladies. When we set our bags at the table, the nice ladies said to us sternly, "This is our table. We came with a group." After showing them our tickets and that the seat numbers indicated that we sat there, the dear old women declared, "No, our friends are going to sit there." I asked to see their tickets, saw that they were not our seats, and explained to the pleasant old folks that their seats were different from ours, and they scowled at us and snapped, "There's more people in our group and they're our friends and they're sitting there. We have the whole table." By this time, a group of people heading to the buffet were gathering around to witness and smirk at the elderly ladies' bitter senility, but my girlfriend and I were getting kind of sick of it. That was when a server, Kristy (sp? she had red and blonde hair), came and tried to help us. Seeing that these rusty old dinosaurs refused to listen to reason, she offered us other seats, actually VIP seats, and gave us free cocktails ($10 each). Kristy the server took what was going to be a big disappointment from the decrepit, walking bags of bones at our table to a really enjoyable show with our own private seats at a much better location. Thanks Kristy for saving us from the crypt!

Fun tourist destination. Not the best food in the world, but still pretty good. You don't go here for a great dinner you go here for fun.  Service was excellent, very friendly, very accommodating for a gluten-free diet.

Went on a unplanned trip to Vegas, doing some business and decided to have lunch at House of Blues. Our waiter Kitty, was off the charts: made recommendations on food and drinks, knew the menu cover to cover. He was really solid, provided info on Vegas and about House of Blues.  The good was complete five star occasion, we had an appetizer which was the shrimp and chicken for lunch. The food was awesome: well prepared, solid portions, and really good price.
