The service was five stars, we had a waiter and even the manager dropped over to say hello. If you have time the House of Blues is always a treat and must eat.

About 13 months ago I was excited to go across the country for my second Maryland Deathfest in Baltimore, MD. The line up was already stacked and it seemed like it could not get any better with bands like Impaled Nazarene, Inquisition, Doom, Cathedral, Cianide, Repugnant, and Goatsnake. I have to admit Goatsnake was a huge reason I decide to go again. Due to some issues they were unable to make the fest and I was bummed. Then the fest organizers announced that they would have a replacement band within a couple days. To every ones amazement they added Ghost.   This made perfect sense seeing that the Death/Thrash Metal band Repugnant was preforming as well. A little side note, Ghost is Repugnant. If you doubt this, check out the Swedish Indie Rock band Subvision, also the same vocalist. With Repugnant playing during Sunday afternoon, it was only right for Ghost to close out MDF 9. They took the stage early Monday morning right after midnight absolutely killed it.   Fast forward 13 months they added a Las Vegas date to their second U.S. tour since May last year.   Traffic on the way to Mandalay Bay was crazy. After downing a few beers and some green in the parking garage we literally got their just in time for the show which started at 6:30 PM. The place was already packed and 24oz cans of beer were $12. Ghost's performance was amazing. They definitely put on a show with the whole band dressed in black cloaks and good ole Papa Emeritus in his satanic pope outfit. The set was only about 35 mins but they covered most songs from their debut album. It was pretty clear that everyone come out for the Ghost. The other two bands didn't receive the same reaction from the audience and were quite boring in my opinion.   I hope they return with a headlining tour because 35 mins was just not enough. In Maryland they played everything to their name including a chilling cover of the Beatles's Here Comes the Sun.   Oh yeah, the sound was on point, good job HoB.

Harrison DEFINITELY added to the ambiance. We laughed and traded stories. He DEFINITELY keeps this place clean! Ariel was our bartender and we were not disappointed with our drinks! Great fun on a sunday afternoon. Hit Harrison up and say leanna and tony sent you!

We were in a hurry so we tried out the grab-and-go continental breakfast. It was so slow! There was virtually no guests but we waited 15 minutes for muffins fruit and coffee. They were not prepared for grab and go.

Just got home not to long ago from hanging out with some friends. We went to the House of Blues to see a concert for the "wonder Girls". They were pretty cool. My friend is more into them, but had me watch a couple of videos on youtube. In the videos the costumes were very colorful and different, yet I like it. We were up front right in front of the stage. This was my first time being there. I was about 15 to 20 minutes late since the concert started right at 6pm. The opening act was the "2AM" group. They were a bunch of young handsome men performing on stage, but I was too busy looking for my friend and her friend that she brought with her. We had a blast standing right in front of the stage to where we could reach out if the performers reached out. As I finally find my friend, the guy band was just finishing up. She said she was upset because I had my camera and didn't take any pics of the guys.. I was tooooo busy looking for her. Then we waited for a short period for the "Wonder Girls" to come out. At that time, I had to ask the security guard if it was ok to go down the stairs in front of him to be with my friend. He was kind enough to let me go. I took his pic later but it was tooo blurry!!! Then the "Wonder Girls" finally came out and gave a good performance. Most of the pics that I took, were a little blurry but it was ok. I even took video clips of the girls as well. Thanks to my friend, I had a good time hanging out.

Went to HOB to celebrate a friend's birthday party and I won't be back again. The waitress was friendly and helpful but her service was super slow.  The place wasn't crowded either. There was a 2 man band playing that was terrible. We had a party of 7 so we couldn't hear each other talk. I ordered the cornbread and when it came out it was lukewarm. The server who brought out the cornbread dropped the maple butter on the table then took his time wiping the mess up and bringing a new one.   I ordered the blackened shrimp salad it came out with 5 small shrimp and salad greens that looked like they were tossed together by a child. The dressing that came with the salad was oil. I was so glad I ordered the salad on the side. I asked for the balsamic vinaigrette which was ok. It definitely was not worth the price of $15.   It took forever for the waitress to check us out.  She never came back to check on the table. Terrible service. Not impressed and won't be back!

This place has HORRIBLENESS customer service. They jam all the food customers into the bar area with one server when they've got a dozen open tables with servers.  Horrible planning for a post concert restaurant.  The live music is great Hire on servers for post concert chow; handle your business!

This review is for the entertainment only.  Friday night karaoke was outstanding.   You sing on stage with a live band.  There are definitely some regulars here - the mid 50's guy with the semi-Billy Idol haircut who sang an Idol song (quite well) and a few others.  5 stars to the biker looking dude who sang "Welcome to the Jungle" and put Axl Rose to shame.  5 stars as well to the guy who got on stage wearing cowboy boots and big black cowboy hat.  I was expecting some straight-up honky tonk country until he invited everyone to give  him the middle finger, announced it was his birthday and then rocked Motley Crue's "Shout at the Devil".  There were some people that absolutely had no business being on stage, but that's how it is every night at karaoke night, no matter where you are.
Just came here for an event. Met president Bill Clinton here and had a photo taken with him, so I can't rate this place lower than 5 :)

My girlfriend invited me out last night to House of Blues at MGM.  She had free tickets to try out their new menu. I have never gone and have always wanted to so I told her to count me in!  We were greater by a friendly staff and escorted to our table. It was a little cramped for me but nothing I couldn't manage.   Our server was really fun, his name was Jason. We ordered the house salad, Cobb salad, chicken wings, and two mixed drinks served in a mason jar that we even got to keep.   The food was presented very beautifully with a great appearance. The house salad was sort of bland and boring. The Cobb salad was amazing. I loved how they placed all the items individually on the plate so you could remove the items you didn't want like the bleu cheese. It was really appetizing and delicious. The chicken wings were great! Not to spicy but had just enough of a little kick. The problem with the chicken wings was the size. They served them whole and were not cut up individually into a breast, wing, and thigh. It was totally messy! My hand were covered in sauce and I felt like a carnivore trying to rip the meat off the bones.   The atmosphere was great! A live jazzy band was playing and people were dancing. We had a great time.  I would definitely come back in the future.

I went here for breakfast this morning and was pretty disappointed with the service and the food. We had to request silverware and napkins, cream for our coffee twice, and syrup even though we ordered waffles and French toast. The food lacked flavor. Although family friendly and convenient to our stay at Mandalay Bay, we would not recommend HOB

If you want the House of Blues you enjoyed in 2010 or earlier, spare yourself the trip. The restaurant has a new chef who decided the menu should lose the new orleans flare for a more modern American fare (think high dollar Dennys). Totally unimaginative now.
Ashely R. Was the best server! We had such a good time. Soul cluckin good was the best dish, amazing!!!

The House of Blues, has always been my most favorite place to watch a live concert. I've seen everyone from Incubus, Trapt, Finger 11, Seether, Modest Mouse, Erykah Badu, The Black Crowes, Crossfade, etc..  And has always been more affordable, because it really isn't a huge Venue.  and they have 3 bars attacking you from 3 sides.  Left, Right, And Behind!!  No! They don't have one on the stage. I think 3's enough!!  Other venues just charge too damned much.  Corporate Assholes!!!!  Yes Ticket Master, I mean Ticket Price Hoarders!!!!!  Hehehe!!

Although small, the House of Blues music venue was nice. The smallness made it more intimate. It also had this rustic feel and I like how it was underground. It reminded me of a place I frequented when I was a lot younger and partied. I don't remember where. The bartender was friendly and the service overall was good. It made for a good atmosphere for a small concert. I hope to go back and check out another concert in the near future.

Worst experience ever. Took over 45 mins to get our food it wasn't even that busy in this restaurant. Then our food gets to our table the ribs were cold my pulled pork sliders were cold. The others we were with were not impressed with the taste or service or lack there of.   Then asked for check that took another 30 min before we received.

Clarification: This revue is of the House of Blues Restaurant.  Service was very good. James made sure we were always in good condition. Our food took 30 minutes to get to us...It was pretty good. A little on the pricey end for what they serve in my opinion. Highly recommend you give the waffle cut fries with melted gorgonzola cheese. I had the clam chowder in a sour dough bread bowl. Nothing to call home about, but still good. Portions are big so make sure you have somewhere to store your leftovers and you wont feel so bad about the tab.

This is evidence that key to happiness most of the time are low expectations.  As much as I was against someone choosing this for lunch, it actually turned out to be the best place we ate the whole 3 days in Vegas.    So, do give it the right chance and enjoy both the food, service and atmosphere!    Highlights - quesadilla's, flatbreads and ahi tuna anything.  Overall, a great experience!

Came for appetizers and drinks during happy hour...took 30 mins to get drinks and our queso dip and another hour to get the rest of our appetizers. ..prices were absurd for a happy hour and service was poor...food was average at best.

Saw a show there on Friday. It was a great performance even after part of the ceiling fell down next to me.   However,  FYI be careful when using a debit card. The bartenders ran my card three times for preauthorization holds. So after the correct amount was paid to House of Blues the holds remain until my bank releases the money. I was told by Alex in customer service that this is a standard procedure at House of Blues Cleveland and that most bars and restaurants do this. Actually,  I go to bars and restaurants often and rarely see duplicate holds of varying amounts. If it were an industry wide procedure I wouldn't have called, right?

it seems that lately if you want to see a band of the up and coming nature, the house of blues is the venue that they will play at in cleveland.  especially lately.  for example, while flipping through stations aggravated the other day, i caught the "concert watch".  every show they mentioned said "house of blues' as the location.  really?  wtf.  why is everyone getting booked at the house of blues?    it's not a horrible venue.  it's got eclectic decor like the rest of the chain. but i have to say:  any venue, no matter what the place, chain or otherwise, shouldn't get every.single.show.   it's just not right. it's like the mcdonald's of concert venues.  the shows there aren't bad experiences.  the sound is generally well balanced and the space itself is a good venue.  i'm just a bit upset they seem to be monopolizing the scene.  that and their drinks are astronomically priced.    house of blues, i get the vibe you're bullying all the other cleveland venues.  stop it.  play nice.  or we'll have to separate you.  though i'm still going to the shows, so who am i to say.  i can't give half stars, but i'd say this is a solid 3 1/2 stars. only cuz i'm scared they're bullying the other cleveland venues.

This place is conveniently located in the Mandalay Bay where I'm staying.  I received a $100 voucher to use anywhere in Las Vegas and this was the perfect place.  I ordered the New York strip steak with mashed potatoes and my boyfriend ordered the Soul Cluckin Good entree that came with 2 pieces of fried chicken, mac n cheese and potatoes.  For starters we ordered garlic fries and the chicken and sausage gumbo.  Ashley Peterson was our server.  The food was just okay.  The potatoes were very bland and the steak lacked seasoning as well.  I was very disappointed.  My boyfriends chicken was good and his mac n cheese was just okay.  The garlic fries were good and the gumbo was awful...don't order that!  For the amount of money spent we were a little disappointed.  Our waitress and the manager were great though.  I would probably come here again but wouldn't be on the top of the list. I give the restaurant 3 stars for the staff and atmosphere.

We came here on a MyVegas comp. We ordered the chicken quesadilla, wings, and pulled pork sandwich.  The chicken quesadilla was lackluster and lacked any significance in both flavor and originality. It was basically cheddar and white breast chicken sandwiched between two warm tortillas. I did not see or taste any peppers, pablano chiles or onions as it was mentioned in the menu. Even the salsa could not save this app.  We chose Kansas City BBQ sauce for the wings, as it allowed only one choice of sauce for 8 wings. Again, the sauce was completely unremarkable, it was slathered in sauce yet it was neither sweet nor tangy, like a true KC sauce.  But boy was the sauce thick, it was deceiving because the actual wings was quite small and very little meat.  The pulled pork also was suppose to be KC BBQ style but again it was just a whole lot of tomato-based sauce and nothing else. The meat was, you guessed it, unremarkable.   This is definitely a chain to avoid, even at peak lunch time, the place was dead.
One name for ya...BOB the barkeep the coolest dude ever!!!  One food  for ya....catfish nuggets&sweet potato fries  One drink  for ya.... Electric lemonade   This place is Ace
I love the atmosphere and music that was playing. I love the steak and maui tacos, don't forget to put some siracha on it. DELICIOUS!!!
This place has incredible food and live music. I love their truffle fries and the chicken wings. Service is excellent. Try this place if you're looking for a nice atmosphere with amazing food.
Chicken and waffles are phenomenal! ! Fast and very prompt service by Courtney.  The Sriracha honey sauce is great....
This is the first stop for me every time I'm in Vegas.  My friends and I are always treated like royalty!  The staff and management are amazing!

Some observations based on a recent Steel Panther Show, which my buddy and I see every year during our annual summer Vegas trip:  At most venues, doors open about an hour before the scheduled start of the show.  I don't know about other acts, but they always do doors for Panther only 30 minutes before the scheduled start of the show, so doors aren't until 11:00 p.m., for Panther.  There is no reason to get there before 11:00 and no reason to line up.  We usually chill and get drinks at the casino bar across from the HOB and stroll right in when the line is gone.  Panther tends to go on a little late anyway.   Panther's set was an the short side (about an hour) this time.  I'm not sure what's up with that.

This is my second concert at a HOB, and judging from the last place, the setup looks almost exactly the same.  Hmmm, maybe that's how it's supposed to be.  In any case, I had a blast because: - concert was only half full. Not crowded. - got reserved seats at the balcony, or upstairs, whatever you want to call it.  If you like standing in the pit, then get General Admission tickets. - I had the first seat, on the first row.  What does that mean? It means I was 4 feet away from 15 feet height speakers!  My ears survived!  And I could dance in the space and hold on to the railings. - my first stay at Delano was a big plus! Highly recommend booking a room at Delano or Mandalay Bay...  you won't need to drive if you happen to get wasted. - smaller, intimate setting.  Place probably holds about 1500, as opposed to 10k or 20k crowd frenzies.  Drinks - a bit on the pricey side.
Great food, good atmosphere, good service.  We had both lunch and dinner there, and were served dinner by Jason, a fine young man who provided us with great service and a big smile!

This is positively the worst venue anyone could ever experience.  The security is ridiculously over the top. They make their presence extremely known--and for no reason whatsoever.  They don't even allow dancing if you have seats in the balcony. In fact, standing up will get you harassed.  As a paying customer being constantly interrupted from the music/performance completely ruins the experience.   To make matters worse,  the sound system is horrible.  The sound cut out at least a dozen times in the less than 2 hours that the performance lasted. What a joke of a venue.  See the performance somewhere else. It's just not worth the annoyance and frustration.

Watched Dita Von Tease at House of Blues. May 17th 2012 : The show started 20 minutes late, since it is standing room only tickets at $45-55 a pop and we had to arrive at least 30 minutes early so it is not very pleasant. A total of 50 minutes standing time and some audiences were sitting on the dirty floor... Once the show started it was disappointing and not worth the wait at all. What a waste of life and time this was! I didn't know a fat woman twirling nipple tassels is entertainment!? The MC told us the more we drank the better the show becomes and prettier the women too. I understand HOB started the show late so they can sell more drinks, but it is not fair to the audiences. Only thing nice about that place is the chandelier, I had the chance to stare at it for 50 minutes.
well tracy is amazing! very personable and gives great advice. she went out of her way to help us. shell be why we come back :]  food is great as well. love the holiday decorations!
The inside is fun and inviting. The food was equivalent to Applebee's. I got a champagne cocktail and the champagne was flat. Better places to go.

Came Friday night and had a great time at Michael franti concert. The venue, employees and atmosphere were great! Came back Saturday morning for breakfast and was very disappointed. Food service was slow and order eventually came incorrect. Food itself was one star, Denny's quality food...blech! Summary- come for music atmosphere and drinks but don't eat the food.

Lisa D.. not sure why you would say that the company has disgruntled ex-employees. If it were my company I wouldn't want the world knowing how employees aren't getting along. Before you log onto yelp for one time & write your ONE review, just realize you are doing the same thing... so in other words I could say it's quite sad how yelp is now a place for business workers to go on here & write a five star review just to say how another person's REAL review was not correct.  I've have had food here more than enough BUT it's not consistent. However, when it's good, it's good. So for that two starts will suffice.

The chicken and waffles are good.   Mostly for the honey Sriracha sauce.  The pancakes are huge.  Really one person can only eat one pancake, which is not a bad thing.  Service was decent.  Have had the Cobb salad and pork sandwich on other visits and felt they were of good quality.

It has been 10 years since I attend HOB Gospel Brunch and I took my friend who had never attended and we were both blown away. Now there are some glitches but first the outstanding points:  1. The food - it is yummy Southern home cooking - from the waffles to the made-to-order omelet station to prime rib to huge already peeled shrimp. The coffee is good as well as the mimosas.  The bread pudding was to die for - and there were plenty of salads, sides and I really loved the Mac and Cheese.  2. The music - it is unbelievable - the energy, the love, the power. It inspires me and I didn't want it to end. The show is interactive and you just want to get up and dance.  3. The atmosphere - you can carry on a conversation and still enjoy the music. You do sit family style and meet some very nice people. Com'n it is like going to church - you really don't need your own table.  Now the glitches: 1. Seating - originally I was seated at a table designed for 2 which had 2 additional chairs added to make it seating for 4. Once the drinks were brought, I knew I would be eating off my lap. I did look around and saw some empty seating (this was 1:30 so everyone had been admitted) and they did move me. However, seating for 2 is seating for 2 - at $40 a person, who wants to eat holding their plate or off their lap.  2.Service - now this is not the servers' fault - everyone was moving - more help is needed. I had to have my friend go to the bar to get our refills and the plates stacked up at our table of 8. Again, I am not faulting the staff - HOB - you need to add a few more - even part-time.  3. The Wait - be prepared to wait with long lines. I loved the waffles but it was truly the longest wait I ever had for waffles.   I would still go back - I did give it 4 stars - but be prepared for long lines and see about sitting on the main floor instead of the second level.

This place is amazing..the atmosphere is great, people are fun! My only complaint is they close WAY TOO EARLY! Come on..this is Vegas. I hope they expand their hours. 3AM is good.... Thank goodness Ri Ra was open super late to accomodate us. :)  However, they have the best bread pudding I've ever had..

Great place to see a concert.  Good views from most anywhere.  The one thing that keeps me from giving them a fourth star...the drinks prices are insane.  Listen, I have seen a lot of concerts at various venues and I understand they want people to drink, but $8 for a little plastic cup of alcohol that    is barely big enough to hold all the excessive ice they cram into the cup, which leaves little room for the actual drink.  Come on guys, we like to have some drinks with our rock n' roll, not go broke.

This is so far from my favorite music venue.  As far as big acts go, it is kind of nice to see them here instead of somewhere like The Q, but it's still pretty impersonal and way too expensive. I always get super disappointed when my favorite artists come to town and end up here, whether they book here initially or the show gets moved from somewhere cool like Beachland and I'm forced to go to HoB since I already bought tickets. Blegh.

Can't go wrong with this place. Came here a few months ago and tried the Turkey Burger & oh my God 5 stars!! Tried the breakfast today and once again 5 Stars!!! Our waitress Ruth was very helpful and really went out of her way to make our experience wonderful. Will definitely stop here every time we're in Vegas.

Went to House of Blues for happy hour. They had great  small plate specials.  Popcorn shrimp was amazing,  as were  the street tacos and sliders. Our server, Jenny, was very personable, efficient and had a wonderful sense of humor. She really made our visit a memorable experience.

Great venue for a wedding reception. Food was above average (several stations that included salmon & asparagus, pulled pork, jambalaya), staff was kind & almost too efficient (taking our drinks away too soon), sound system was a tad loud for my taste.   Knocked down a star because of the horrible sewer gas smell upon entering the Euclid Ave lobby. Surely they could fix that?!

How do you mess up a grilled cheese? I don't know but this place did. It smelled like fish! The fries were mediocre, but at least they smelled like fries. Plan to go elsewhere to eat after you see a show here.

Sunday gospel brunch....skip it.  It's $50 for a buffet brunch (with "southern food") and a 45 minute gospel show. The food is just ok - plentiful, but lacking in flavor and, well, soul. Most of what I sampled (including egg dishes, fried chicken, roasted pork and salad) was blah. The two standout dishes were cheese grits and - would you believe it? - a rice krispy treat, and I can make both of those at home! The price includes all-you-can-drink mimosas and bloody marys, but they're watered down.  As for the entertainment, that's the real reason I wanted to go here - I love gospel music. The performers are talented, but the acoustics in House of  Blues are TERRIBLE! We had to move from our table on the lower level to the balcony, just to be able to understand half of what they were singing. The music is way too loud and the singers are shouting, and yet you still can't hear them. The balcony was marginally better, but even then the quality just wasn't there. I hope they can make some adjustments so future guests can actually hear the singers.
We went 2 times!  Great place - Eggs Benny was great! Our waitress was super sweet her name was Aunu. ( I believe- the Blue hair girl).  Super fun!  We will go back!

We atended the Gospel brunch last Sunday. The food and service was very good, but the entertainment was disappointing.  Instead of a gospel choir, there were five women and one man.  A lot of time was spent on a birthday/anniversary segment that lasted far too long. We were disappointed.

We were staying at the Mandalay bay and looking for a grwt place to wat breakfast, someone recommend the hojse of blues. We went with no expectation and i enedes up to be amazing!! Great service, super nice, great atmosphere. The food was great. Tons of food for a little price. Great place for kids too!!!

Best southern food on the strip. Check their live music schedule so you can plan ahead, and make reservations. It's a total blast, and the hospitality is impeccable. Try the jambalaya and the chicken breast from the gluten free menu! Yum.

Make sure you're not in a hurry! Good sound with very good musicians. Good prices but they lose it with poor, did I say poor, service.  I'd give no stars if I could. Ordered from the bar menu, 20 minutes for a beer, 50 minutes for the food! Really! They've been in operation for how long??? Server blamed it on the kitchen-threw them under the bus...

Food Review Only  I thought this place was just ok. We did not eat anything the whole day so by 5 o'clock we just wanted to eat something. That and $5 happy hour sounded good.  We shared their happy hour appitizers and I ordered a pulled pork sandwich. Their appitizers tasted like appitizers you could find at Applebees, good but not spectacular. Their pulled pork sandwich was ok. The meat tasted good, but their sauce was too sweet for me. I like my sauce spicy.  Next time I come here I would rather go to a show.  Zipzap Zubidy Bop!

FOOD REVIEW ONLY  Breakfast at HOB is good, depending on what you order.  My friend was very disappointed with her biscuits and gravy, which for some reason had ham incorporated into the gravy.  I had a typical bacon, eggs and hash brown meal and it was fine.  Service was good and the coffee was excellent.
Love the HOB.... but Gina & the Eastern Black? Thanks, but NO THANKS Gina. Horrible opener for Steel Panther! NOT WORTHY.

Best venue for concerts. No bad seat in the house. I always love to come here. Even with big name acts, prices are excellent especially with such close proximity. Always a better venue than the big overpriced arenas.

I have to review this place, because they gave us such great service they deserve a good review. We came here for the game on Sunday. It was happy hour and all beers were $1, appetizers half off, and DonQ rum drinks  (which turns out to be really good) were $3. You can't beat that! My girlfriend and I consumed two pounds of wings without any help from our husbands. yikes! Yes, they were good. We initially had ordered 1 plate of wings and a spinach dip appetizer. The spinach dip was so bad. No one even took a second bite. Even though it would have only been $5 gone to waste we had to send it back because we were at a tiny little cocktail table and it was taking up too much space. I have to say, I have never seen a restaurant so cool about a patron sending something back. It was almost embarrassing how apologetic and attentive they were from that moment forward. They asked us what we wanted to replace is with. That's when the 2nd plate of wings came in. : / Three people came to check on us several times throughout the rest of our time there. Everyone was so nice. My drinks had the perfect ratio of rum and diet. Our bill came out to $34. Ridiculous!

Really great service. I had the classic bleu salad and it was delicious. Very simple and some what on the small side but that's what I wanted. I'll also note that I didn't finish it so if you're looking for something small but filling in Vegas get it. The bacon was very tasty. I was worried I wouldn't enjoy it coming from Canada ( high standards on bacon LOL I KID ) My friend really loved her buffalo chicken salad but the portion size was a little on the large side for her. The waiter made sure to fill my water up every time it was almost gone leaving me now thirsty. I give this place five stars!

We came here to watch Santana and my husband I absolutely loved every minute of his show. We were in the standing area and stood for two hours and didn't realize it because he knows how to entertain.   The ambiance and energy in the building is what it should be like at every event.  The folks who worked there were all cool starting from the ticket booth, security, bartenders and servers.  Great all around experience and would go to another concert here anytime.

Came here for dinner on a Friday night before we saw Steel Panther in their venue space.  It's not a place that I would have chose, but this was a group situation.  We had a side room for our group of 12+ and the service was okay, not great.  Being in any side room, it's hard to flag down your waiter or waitress if you need something.  My main complaint is that I ordered the Yummy Chicken and it wasn't yummy.  :-(  It was really spicy and that wasn't in the menu description.  I probably should have ordered a burger or sandwich, but I wanted an entree for dinner.  i would have sent it back if I wasn't with a big group.  I just didn't want to make a big deal of it, so my man shared some of his food with me which was just okay.  I'm sad to see that it's Chef Aaron Sanchez running this restaurant because I like him on TV.  STEEL PANTHER:  Fun overall, but we didn't like the opening band that night at all.  The opener took way too long and I didn't know that Steel Panther's actual show would be so looooong.  Our group of friends at the show (maybe 10 of us?), only 4 of us made it to the end of the show.  I know, we're getting old (in our 30s)... but the show was kind of dragged out.  The venue was good, but the drinks were expensive.  I don't think I would want to see another show here.  Vegas Trip 10/20-23/11

I want to talk about what went well at the house of Blues instead of focusing on the bad.   The host got us a seat at the bar because we where short on time (Micheal Jackson One tickets). Eventually Jason was our bartender. I say eventually because he had to come from the other side of the bar when he noticed us failing epicly to get the attention of Jillian, the bartender working right in front of us avoiding eye contact at all cost. Jason was attentive and friendly. Everything Jillian was not. My wife tried to get her attention 5 times with no response. I assumed it was loud and my wife doesn't have a commanding voice. So I tried twice before she just walked away. My voice is very commanding.  She didn't speak to us until we where almost complete with our meal. I think the reason was because her name was on the ticket and she thought she was getting a tip... Haha not this guy. I tipped Jason in cash.   The dinner ended with Jason talking to the manager to provide me with a 25% military discount on my meal. Overall a great experience. Jillian should probably find a different occupation if being friendly is not something she likes to do.   The show is starting, Jason is awesome, Jillian is not. House of blues is awesome and so is the food.
I've contacted Sasha/business rep per her reply to my review. I've recd no response. At this point there's no point to discuss anything further.

Fun bar, unique 'Dusk til Dawn' decor & different atmosphere.  Twice for HH recently & I've been here a decade ago to see Kayne perform.  One entrance is the restaurant/bar & other is the concert area.  Love that they have KJ Chardonnay on HH & a nice selection. The couple next to us had three menu items & only liked the Popcorn Shrimp.  I'm not really a fan of popcorn shrimp so I ordered the SW Quesadillas... horrible!  They were full of mushy veggies.  It was also tiny so if I EVER order them again, it will be w/ cheese only.  Hopefully, they change a few food items on the HH menu cause nothing really seems appetizing to me on it.  Both bartenders we had were great, both times.

I was in LV for my sisters wedding and decided to check this place out by myself and had a blast to say the least lol. People seem to be so much nicer when youre out of town on vacation. Will definitely be coming back.

Gross gross gross food. GROSS FOOD. Awesome venue though. The menu is small and it sucks, and the service is terrible - but the venue is small and a bar wraps all the way around so people have easy access to drinks and there's no long lines. Go for the concert, and eat at the Burger Bar in Mandalay Shops (towards Luxor).

This is a really cute placeit's something different.   I had the watermelon spritzer, very sweet, but good if you like watermelon. They refill it for you too  voodoo shrimp - i usually never eat shrimp, but our waitress recommend this so i had to try it. It was really good, jumbo size shrimp smothered with tasty seasoning over corn bread that melts in your mouth!  gumbo - its thick and gooey it was decent. Tasted way better with hot sauce :)  baby back ribs -  literally fell off the bone... it was delish! it also came with cold slaw, beans, and corn. mmMMm the corn was good up until i dropped it :( But my sweet server saw the whole entire incident and fired up a new one for me right away!  Lastly, we had the field of greens... the portion was smaller than the ribs, but that's okay. every bite was yum :)

Wonderfully small, intimate venue, but beware of the loge seats. If you can get a table on the floor or are willing to stand for a show, you will love this space. The sound is great, the vibe and energy are great.  The seats in the 200s, however, are ALL at least slightly obstructed view because of the railing. In particular, if the only seats you can get are in section 200 or 208, then skip the show. I'm not kidding -- just don't waste your money on section 200 or 208.

The food here is decent...maybe a bit mediocre. I like the variety on the menu but the execution was not quite as good. The ambience is nice, but of course you're sitting at the House of Blues!   I tried the lobster mac n' cheese and it was good. The lobster was quite flavorless and could have been crab for all I knew, but the mac n' cheese was darn yummy and I could have eaten it all by myself. Except I also split it with my coworker along with a cajun jambalaya...which was quite disappointing. And a little dry and not spicy.  I would come back for a show, but never for food.
Love the atmosphere! Food was great but a little slow.  A little pricey, but what isn't on the strip?  Would definitely go again.

Went to see Raekwan, ghostface kills and Mob Deep.  The night was pop'n. I had such a great time I'm not even sure if I made it to their performance.    The drinks were not the best tasting but was strong.  If you have a chance to eat before you get in I'd advise to do so.  The pizza was not that great even when I was a little buzzed.

I came here for Happy Hour. The specials were nothing to write home about and the service was slow. We got nachos to share which were very plain jane. I don't even think we finished 1/4 of the plate. Very limited choices behind the bar - even if you're willing to step away from the HH menu. A means to an end but not worth searching out. Great for tourists though.
I have come to this place every time I have come to Vegas and have not yet been disappointed it's always a great turn out.

text.text: The food is very good, and I have been to many shows here. The venue is very nice. Priced fairly although that is sometimes out of the control of HOB. Visit, you will not regret it
Excellent Jambalaya and the chicken is awesome too. Don't forget to check out the entertainment.
Don't complain about having to pay 9$ for a tall boy they will cut you off.  Worst venue I've ever been to.

One of our first drinking stops the Sunday we got into Vegas . . . I was still under the weather, but damn it, it was my vacation, and it was a rock joint, so a whiskey drink it was - bartender makes a fine Manhattan.  Word to the (un)wise - alcohol consumption doesn't really affect your cold one bit.  Just alternate Airborne and Emergen-C and you'll be fine.  My cold cleared up the next day because I attacked it with electrolytes and booze.  And blues.  My one regret is that we missed the Prince show later that night, but we had many miles to go before we slept . . .

Our waiter was great. Our food cane out in a timely manor. Our food was great. But it was all a bit too salty. There was 4 of us with appetizers, meals, and drinks. Just a bit too much salt on most everything. Food was very comfort like and heavy. Because we showed our receipt, we got into the show with our tickets easier than waiting in line. :)

Went to see the Rocky Horror Picture Show. Could not understand what the actors on stage were saying. Sound was distorted. When the movie was playing. Sound was also distorted. Picture quality was poor too. We sat in the balcony. It was hot, and no air circulation! Outside temperatures were in the 50s. Venue was less than half full. So no excuse for the venue to be hot. Mandalay Bay is to cheap to air condition, or replace the worn out carpets. Many walked out of the show before the half way point. Drink prices were outrages! Soda $5.00 for small cup, $11.00 to $14.00 for a beer, and mixed drinks $18.00! Awful rip-off venue. Last time we go here!

There is no denying the atmosphere was pretty cool. The food was not so great. We had the breakfast menu, which had a really good selection but the meals left something to be desired. In my expert opinion ( and by expert I mean I eat food), here are the things that could be improved; Hash browns; very generous portion but cold and kinda mushy. Less potato and more crisp would be good. Chicken and waffles; waffles were great, chicken strips were REALLY bad. Under seasoned and horribly tough. My daughter ate them, I thought they were inedible. Breakfast burger; OK. Kinda blah. Could have been seasoned better. Egg white burrito; Pretty tasty, better than expected actually. Creole Bloody Mary; Surprisingly not great, just salty, not much flavor. Easily corrected with more lime. Service was decent.

Food was just ok, was with 3 other people.  On the burgers; buns not fresh, need more flavor.  Fries were blah, although friends said the sweet potato fries were good.  Service was mediocre, and the place was dirty, and this was a regular Thursday night, so it not slammed with people at all.

New menu launched yesterday.  Unimpressive. Don't waste your evening at HOB when there are countless other establishments on this hustling walking street in downtown Cleveland.  Fish tacos - well let's just say that they are a far cry from an authentic mahi mahi taco you would get in Southern California or Baja.  The first thing we heard while being seated at 8:40pm - was a server walking by the hostess saying - "you know we are closing in 20 minutes" -- hmmm, not a very good first impression.    The place was empty.  TVs are bolted to almost every wall but they only scroll advertisements - why have TVs if you cannot tune to a sports game or CNN or ??  - who wants to watch the same three or four scrolling ads?

Just some average food. Let's be honest if you are eating here its because you just want something quick or casual. Nothing bad, just average. The waitress we had though was good. Quick, helpful, and did a fantastic job.

We wandered in for lunch one afternoon and we pleased with the fast service and the tasty sandwiches served with a cute little variety of specialty sauces for your fries and/or your sandwich.  Fries served in a cup a little novel and it does prevent you from the sea of fries so many places serve.  The cool thing was they want to keep you coming back in so if you show your receipt you can get a two for one breakfast the next day.  Listen, this is one of the better deals around as we all know the slots machines don't have it.  At any rate, we did go back for breakfast, which was also tasty and then they told us that we would get 10 percent off in the gift shop with our receipt.  They are the king of deals at this place and it seems to be working for them as the place was packed in the morning with people who had eaten there yesterday.  Nice strategy, House of Blues.  I, of course, would like to come back sometime and see a show here.    I'll try this place again.

The House of Blues has a venue with seating for approximately 2000.  The sound quality was fantastic and the space was still small enough to feel intimate.  Drink service was on point and servers were very friendly. Carlos Santana and his band were all exceptional. Mr. Santana was front and center for the entire concert filling the room with his one of a kind legendary guitar skills. Lady Drummer was simply amazing. The two male vocals added more beauty to the concert with their amazing vocals. There are not enough words to describe how fantastic this concert was.  Thank you for a great night!! The average age of the audience was over forty and Not a single person remained seated.  Entire audience brought to their feet dancing. What an unforgettable night and concert.  Kudos to Carlos Santana and his amazing band!!

Gospel Brunch  I have been to the Gospel Brunch in Vegas at the House of Blues 5 or 6 times.  The shows are always outstanding but this one on Dec 31st was the best.  The spirit in the room was amazing.  The food was good but could have been hotter. I will still go again.  We even bought one of the CDs at the end.

My, now wife and I, had our wedding at house of blues last night. If anyone is on the fence and ever thinking "hmmm...maybe we should have our wedding at the house of blues?"...DO IT! Wow, first of all, from the start you're treated like royalty. We were fortunate enough to have the wonderful, calm and amazing Jen R. help us through the entire planning process. She's so cool and collected, and honestly makes you feel reassured from the first day on through the wedding. Also, she assembles a team of absolute rock stars! Mel, Terri coordinate the wedding operations and manage the wedding craziness - oh - and don't think there won't be, because there will. Let me tell you, these three ladies absolutely nail it like true professionals. Never once do you feel like they don't have a clue what they were doing. Lastly, should you have your wedding here, I can assure you that your guests will all Tell you that this is the best wedding ever. It's unique, fun and high energy. Absolutely awesome.

This was my first time to the HOB in Las Vegas and is based on the venue only (not food).  The venue is very different from the L.A. location.   I have to share that this was an excellent customer experience.  I say this because every staff member from the gift shop, those directing the crowd to the box office were friendly with the right attitudes and helpful in every way.    Regardless of where you are seated, you get a decent view and concert experience.  I was seated in the balcony on the far right side close to the wall.  Clever and conveniently, both sides of the "basement" concert area are flanked by cocktail bars.  I didn't have to walk all the way downstairs to order my drinks. I was just a few feet away.       Husband and I came here to listen to the smooth sounds of Santana (which by the way had phenomenal bass, guitar and drum performances). I had a customer service issue with Ticketmaster while being on hold forever.  It was so easy to call HOB and actually reach a human being rather than being subjected to another annoying automated call with prompts leading you to nowhere.  I was connected right away to Howard at the ticketing office.  I want to give special thanks to him for restoring my faith that there are still professionals who believe in making the customer experience a positive one.  I'm so appreciative of his understanding and quick resolution to the problem without added drama.   I would definitely come back here for future events and recommend checking this venue out if you want to see any concert.   I'm a fan of House of Blues!!!!

I was there last week for a huge trade show, and our software company threw a big bash there, and took over the entire place.  There were some really great appetizers, many tray passed, and the atmosphere was a lot of fun.  Service seemed pretty good considering the crowd.

Went got the Gospel Brunch - worth checking out. All you can eat brunch with emphasis on Southern specialties, i.e. Chicken & Waffles! The food is worth the cost of admission alone. Music & entertainment were good. Only low point as the mimosas, seemed weak & warm. Still worth checking out!

Yup, The House Of Blues has it going on with all the show varieties. Parking is plentiful, but as you know its at your own expense even if you come to a show. I was truly impressed as to how clean and put together it all looked. To bad they don't validate the parking ticket to at least half the cost that would have sure made all the difference in my experience. The staff from the box-office to the Bartenders where good people and fast. Today I get to watch George Clinton in all his glory.   The opening act for GC was amazing tonight she was fantastic and had incredible vocal cords. The only thing that was a huge disappointment was that it took about 30min for the set up between acts.

Welp....... Came last week and sat at the bar ( was here for work so I came alone)     waited 20+ minutes to be given a menu even tho the two male bartenders acknowledged that I was there.....   They were Not friendly at all... Ordered a salad and a water and my visit was over an hour!!!!!!  Food was amazing but experience was not...    Now,  I'm back again with my fiance,  we waited 15 minutes for the water we ordered.... And now have been waiting 37 for our food... Not happy, again...

I visited for breakfast and Angel was our server. Atmosphere was easy and relaxing. Angel was spot on with everything - very professional and friendly. I ordered chicken and waffles. Presentation was excellent and enhanced my desire to eat. Waffles were very light and had good taste without syrup. Chicken breading was perfect! Not greasy at all, clung to chicken very well and was moist & tender. Portions run large. The food was excellent, but Angel made it a great experience.

This place is unbelievable.   Great food and great atmosphere. Every meal we had was cooked perfectly.  Great wait staff...very attentive and accomodating.  Pablo is the man...el hefe.  Had a Bloody  Verde BLT cocktail with a tomatillo garlic base with a pepper vodka.  Great drink with my eggs benedict.

This a review of the Sunday gospel brunch only. Save your $42. The food was atrocious, especially the breakfast dishes. Eggs were cold, bacon was greasy and bagels were stale. But most disappointing was the music. The gospel singers were off key during much of the numbers and were mediocre at best, plus the acoustics were terrible.

Definitely did not disappoint I'm from California thought it was going to be a little different since the original one is in my hometown but come to surprise it was good place good music good entertainment and a lot of beautiful ladies
I always enjoy eating at this place. You always get a good value for your money. So far each staff member is professional and welcoming.
Very Vegasy, very loungy place. Food is reasonably good, prices are reasonable for Vegas, entertainment varies :) Cool atmosphere, very relaxing and chill place. Recommend.

Took my mother to Gospel Brunch today. We had chicken & waffles, omelets, biscuits & gravy, salad, bacon, macaroni & cheese, ribs and bread pudding for dessert.  Everything was lukewarm or ice cold, including a brand new tray of chicken for the chicken & waffles. He just put it down and I went straight to my table after grabbing some and it was cold!   Biscuits & gravy, Mac n cheese, bacon & ribs were lukewarm as well. Salad was seasoned well but not fresh.  The bread pudding was warm but the sauce for it was pretty much empty.   The omelet station was the winner (it was hot). You grab the ingredients and place them in a little cup & give it to the omelet guys. They were an awesome team (cleaning the station while the other adds the eggs to the pan) and had my omelet made in no time.  The gospel itself was fantastic! Their voices were beautiful & the lead (Patti) was very energetic and wonderful at keeping the crowds attention.  I give a 1 star for the overall quality of food, it was far too cold. I feel like the health department should stop by, my mother and I  did not feel safe eating the food and were worried we might get sick later (neither of us did). That's just not a feeling one should have after eating. The banquet department at the hotel might be able to give you some tips on how to keep food warm and refreshing the salad as it runs low instead of making a big plate of it and letting it sit & get soggy would help. Things running out (like the bread pudding sauce) is not acceptable. These are all things that should be taken care of, not something for people to put in reviews.  The coffee was lukewarm, we even noticed other tables sending coffee back. Making the coffee at time of show instead of 30 minutes or 1 hour prior to show time would fix this.  I give five stars for the gospel. Wonderful, uplifting and fun.  Stay away from Table Fourteen, there's a fan right above it, which turns already lukewarm food to ice cold in minutes. The tables could be spaced a little more apart. From table 14 & the table to its right it was too close, I had an inner seat and when I went to get more food I disturbed the guest next to me to get out (she had to stop eating and get up so I could pass).  I have no complaints about the bussers, there was always someone clearing the tables and no plates were stacked on our table at any one time.  I would not return until the reviews are better and quality of food is fixed.

Nobody in my crew was impressed by this place, in fact one quote was "the salad was the best thing I ate"  I ordered the Jambalaya, and the list of other items included the pork ribs, lobster mac and cheese and french dip.  The 325 pound man who ordered the ribs disliked them so much he passed them around to the table and went to another restaurant for his meal after we were done, he also said the beans were the worst thing he has ever eaten in a restaurant, and he is by no means a complainer.  My jambalaya portion was frankly insulting for the 18.99 I paid for it and not that great.  I have never ordered Jambalaya and not had some to take home, but I literally could have finished the portion in 3 minutes had I been really hungry, and it was no where near as good most other Jambalayas I have eaten.  When the manager came over to ask how everything was, big mistake, the honesty flew, he then tried to say that the menu was created by world renown chef Aaron Sanchez like that was going to magically make my portion bigger and the food taste better, I've met Aaron and if that Jambalaya is really how it should have tasted then I flat out dont think hes that great of a chef, but I doubt thats the case.  in the end our server did take the ribs off the ticket and our server was awesome and so was the band that was on stage.  We should have come in for some drinks and music and gone elsewhere to eat.  I wont be going back for food unless its free.

This review is for the concert venue only. I bought VIP seating at a table for Joe Walsh and it was well worth it. We had an attentive server who took great care of us all evening. We didn't have to show up early, and there was no jockeying for a view of the stage. The tables are elevated enough to see above the General admission crowd. Highly recommend the VIP experience. Worth the price. Picked up the tickets and laminates at will call without a hitch. After party access to The Foundation room was easy although there were WAY too many people in that space to enjoy the venue. The 'security' at that venue was pretty aggressive for no reason and they were less than helpful. View of the strip was nice though. I'll stick to the HOB venue itself and skip the Foundation Room in the future.

An all in one experience.  It's the House of Blues.  The House of Blues is best known for being a concert hall, but you can get a bite to eat or down a few cold ones all the same.  I've seen Boogie Nights (a bitchin' 70's cover band) here and it was a blast.  The floor is spacious and can accomodate hundreds.  Opposite the stage is a bar and a couple of levels for people to hand out and watch if they don't want to be in the middle of the crowd.  However, some of the watching space, especially right in the middle in front of the bar, is for VIP seating.  Drinks are typical Vegas pricing.  You are inside the Mandalay Bay after all.  On a separate occasion I grabbed lunch at the restaurant.  It's in a portion totally apart from the concert hall.  Mix of booth and table seating.  I got a burger and beer.  Quality of food and service is good, but nothing extraordinary.  Set me back around 15 bucks, so you're not breaking the bank by any means.  It's also family friendly place.

By far one of my favorite Venus in town. The box office is right at the entrance. There are 3 bars on the main floor and 2 bars on the second floor on opposing sides. The acoustics here are good. I like them more than at The Joint. The sound is always spot on. I've yet to go to a show here with bad sound. I enjoy the view from the top as much as being on the floor and it's not as loud lol.  There's a decent size floor area. I like how intimate it feels.  Their drink prices are why they get the 4. They aren't that affordable especially if you're trying to drink spirits. They'll typically have tall boys that make you ask yourself what you're thinking spending so much for beer in a can but it's that or stand there drink free the entire night and no one wants that.  The workers, like security, are always chill and pretty laid back but straight forward; never a bother unless you deserve it. Kind of sux if you're a smoker b/c u have to go upstairs towards the entrance for the smoke pit; good for non smokers though.

This was my first time dining at the House of Blues in Las Vegas. I have to say I was very disappointed with the buffalo wings. They were not hot (spicy) at all, they were very mild at best. I'm also not a fan of huge gigantic wings, and boy were these wings big. When visiting the House of Blues my advice would be to stay away from the buffalo wings.

I loved this spot!  The acoustics are amazing!!!!!  If I come back to Vegas I will have to try to catch a show there again!!   If your at the house of Blues be prepared for a weak drink.  They use jiggers and the cups they had were to big for only 1 oz of booze.   Lesson learned, my second drink was a double and it was perfect.  I'm a bartender so when I  saw the jigger I already knew it wasn't going to be good.  Either get smaller cups or make all your drinks a double.

Went with a friend before cavs game.  Dead on a Wednesday night.  Food was fine, gumbo appetizer so-so.  Flatbread pizza was quite good. Service very fine although it wasn't busy at all.  Most entrees are $20+

The House of Blues is fantastic!! We have been here several times, the different venues are incredible, the food is outstanding and the staff is exceptional. The events are all across the board, one night might be Blues, another night might be Rock, then another night a "Rat Pack" tribute. There is always something to make that dinner or night out exceptional. We have since joined the "Foundation Room" and live over an hour from the HOB.  Thank you , House of Blues.....for a great place to share our time.  Check out "The Corn Bread" WOW!!!

Went to see Lindsey Stirling. The ticket wasn't clear enough that the seat was on the 3rd floor and it's almost impossible to have a direct sight toward the stage, instead you give up and watch the screen. Luckily we were able to secure the front row but still, there was a big pillar in between.  The concert was fun, but the venue - not so much.

OMG, avoid this place unless you like being frisked and wanded like at the airport. This is a concert venue not the friggen UN. I wont be back not for the frisk down not for the free tickets, and not! for the $16 dollar beers. Oh lest we forget the obnoxious blue laser lights that hit you in the eyes in this standing room only venue where the headlining cover band has an opening act  which in this case for the Fan Halen band was terrible. So I stood for one hour trying to find a non blinding corner or spot to hang out waiting for very late musicians to take the stage. I cant blame the bands, its probably the club trying to get people to buy super inflated drinks and yes suck more cash out of people before the show ends. Sorry I don't subscribe to the goping broke blind and deaf business model while you greedy club owners get to drive home in Ferraris Maserati's and Bentleys at my or other peoples expense. I call it like I see it.

Oh biscuits and gravy - thou art a comfort food for my belly and soul.  After too many nights up in a row until your nerves are shooting acetacholin randomly and and are as frayed as the bottom of your favorite jeans - thy creamy goodness smoothes over the jagged edges and coates the belly that by now is a cess pool of 3 olive martinis and grand marnier.

Stayed at TheHotel in prep for the Ice Cube concert at HOB LV.  The ticket and markee said the doors open @ 11:59.  So make sure you check out the lobby early.  The line started before 11pm.  If you get there early you may be able to get early entry with there with thier early entry special , but check that out.  The line got very long early, it started to wrap around the casino.  I suggest get a drink or two then stand in line.  Then they heard you past security into this type of holding pen deal, in front of the doors.  They let people enter in groups of 30-50, then would wait 5 minutes and let more in... i guess this was to help crowd control.  But i was just waiting for people to rush the door, which didnt happen luckily.  We had general tix, so we grabbed some watered down drinks from 1 of the 3 bars and headed to a spot on the floor in front of the stage.  WTH is this?! Ok the floor was super sticky.  Like somebody had a honey & beer fest and forgot to clean up.  The floor was so sticky, your shoes stuck as you walked, and dont stand in one place too long, you just might stick.  The lights, and sounds were great.  The show .. pure Ice Cube! I can't comment on the food, or anything else.. but its a good venue that could use some cleaning and better crowd management.  HOB on Sunset is better.

We went to the Sunday Gospel Brunch and it was a lot of fun. The show is very good and the music was fantastic. The singers were top notch and put on an enjoyable show. The food was flavorful and good but not hot enough. The jambalaya and mac and cheese were the best. I do like that they had buffalo sauce for the chicken and waffles which was very tasty. Service was eh. We asked for a coke that we never received and they would bring by small water pitchers that filled 2 glasses and then come back with another 20 minutes later so water was not always refilled. I also thought $10 for a bloody mary with the price of the ticket was a little much. Tables are also very close. Take one table out and then it would have been fantastic. I know they loose money that way but it would have been a lot more comfortable.   Fun event for a Sunday morning. Worth seeing once and for the price, you get a meal and a show so price is good. Just needs a little work with keeping the food hotter and a few more servers.

Came for breakfast, the place is really interesting.  I had a miss communication with the server and he didn't understand and gave me the wrong thing. .. but once i told them they were very nice and cater to me.. super nice and good food.

We had tickets for a Lynyrd Skynyrd concert which was cancelled at the last minute and I scrambled to find a viable entertainment option.  When I spied the "Kings of Chaos" (billed as the Ultimate Rock Super Group), I was "all-in."   When we arrived to partake in pre-show adult beverages, we ran smack dab into what appeared to be a full TSA screening of guests.  There was plenty of uniformed security with metal detection wands to ensure nobody got shanked at the show.  Cool.  Just make it snappy and don't hold me up too long.                Inside, there's a good sized main bar on the lower level, which does the trick.  Expect to pay a fair amount for your cocktails.  If you want apps, there isn't much to get excited about.  One of the offerings was a Caesar Salad, which I found odd and galactically uninviting.  Just bring a couple of portable snacks with you, providing they pass through the security shake-down.    We had seats in section 206, which is located on the second floor.  Most of the seats had a nice view, and once the band started playing there's was a fair amount of unregulated seat hopping by guests.  The venue itself is large enough to pack some people into, but small enough to feel somewhat intimate, depending upon your seating assignment.    There was cocktail waitress service on the second floor, but they did a poor job (and seemed disinterested).  I ended up making a few runs downstairs to the main bar to pick up my drinks.  I was excited to find they serve several varieties of Tall Boys (which makes for fewer trips to the bar, nest pas?)    The lead in band, which warmed up the crowd was a local Las Vegas band, "Franky Perez and The Truth."  If you're from Las Vegas, you'll probably know Franky.  He's one bad ass entertainer.  He really grabs your attention and puts on a show.  His band was actually better than the main event "Super Group."  I liked the HOB venue, and would easily consider going back for a show there.  My takeaway was seeing Franky Perez play and planning to see him play the next time I roll into town.

AVOID. This venue was not designed for the shows that HOB is presenting. First, you go through a weird security line and scanning in the middle of the casino. Next, you walk down a bunch (two floors) of stairs to get into HOB. After that, you walk into what is basically a bar/restaurant with a dance floor. There are multiple staircases, and I hate to think about what would happen if a fire broke out. I didn't see any mobility impaired options. Important- don't EVER get GA tickets. Go VIP(ay), or not at all. HOB ropes off every single place to sit, many which are in awkward places for this setup (example- directly across from the long bar, which messes up walking traffic by limiting the space). At the front, there is even a dedicated "upgrade to VIP" standing desk (in place of a hostess desk). I would think that this setup would affect the "maximum capacity" limit, since so many GA people are jammed into less than 1/2 of the venue, but I guess the numbers (people per square foot) end up looking the same. But, it seems unsafe. Last night, the Dan Band show was supposed to start at 7:30, but the opening act didn't even begin until around 8:30. Long wait. The stage was also too small for the Dan Band to do a lot of their act. Basically, there was no room for cool props at HOB, so there weren't any. Sad. In the future, I'll just skip House of Blues, because there are better venues that also offer $14 beers in Vegas and free seats with a ticket.

When I first walked by this place I felt it looked inviting so the next night I went there around 8pm after seeing a show and secured a table with a great view of the live performer. I was thoroughly impressed with the atmosphere and the drinks/food, I had two margaritas and jambalaya. It's not a place for the budget conscious as this meal did cost me $50 for just myself but the atmosphere made up for much of that.   I've never been to a restaurant with a fun live performer like that not to mention such great food. If you are in the area, I highly recommend this place, I don't think you'll be disappointed.

Quite possibly the only place I see bigger bands that i like because they don't typical play anywhere else!...but its still an awesome place and i been coming for years. They have $15 beer that i will not be buying,lol but upstairs is a few nice places with great happy hours, so pre-booze. One of these days ill have the pleasure of sitting in the upper deck for a classy show-until then, I'll hang in the front line on the gate for my fav bands!!!
Amazing breakfast!!! Got 4 orders of bread pudding french toast... super thick and delicious! Ordered eggs and chicken sausage which was really good!!

Solid.   When you come to the House of Blues, you are usually coming here for some name act. I popped in here last last night with some friends for the Steel Panther show.  Although the show itself was a bit cheesy, it was a fun place to hang out with friends. The bartenders didn't treat me like an idiot when I asked for ice water.  Service is good. Enough bartenders for a full crowd.  The stage and venue is quite small, but it's perfect! I can imagine seeing a big-name act (bigger than Steel Panther) and really enjoying the intimate vibe.  Plenty of televisions so if you are talking to your friends or cozying up to a neighbor, you can still see what's going on in the stage area.  Steel Panther was pretty cool, since locals get in free. Holler.  I'll write up another review when I come here for a real show, but for now....A-OK.

Great and excellent food, and awesome service. Tyler was a great waiter, patients with our kids, and he even knows the time of the food. When he says it going to be a minute, its going to be a minute...I timed him. Live show was great, and all and all it was a great early birthday for our Grandfather. Strongly recommend eating here.

Been hear a few times over the past couple of years.  Be prepared unless you are receiving some sort of VIP treatment,  to wait in line for a bit before you roll in into joint.  The layers of employees you contact until you make entry are friendly enough.  If you can make it in early and can build a brief rapport with the bartenders you will be better off as things get busier the less they seem to care. Your going to pay for a buzz..help it along prior to making entry.    Some of the bouncers take comfort in their positions only and have no idea about combining their girth with customer service.  On a street corner or in any other setting...a large dude that does not smile after salutations or small talk is a dick. Trust me... I know what being a large and sometimes FAT man is all about. You are not protecting the president..RELAX.  As for the venue, the closer you can get to stage, the better.  And if on the north and south sides of stage, the closer the better.  Looking forward to expounding on my HOB knowledge in the future and looking forward to more good times.

Very Impressed! Gospel music and brunch are my two favorite things already but the service was outstanding and the performance was remarkable! The price was well worth the experience, and I look forward to returning monthly. Also would like to give a special thanks to my friend Angel for inviting me out, and Jason for his above and beyond hospitality.

So I came here with a friend to see Billy Idol. Did not try any of the food, drink, or even relieve myself while there. Did not pass go or collect 200 - went straight to the floor area right near the stage and pretty much had an awesome view of the stage for the whole show. Was told by the box office employee earlier that a line usually starts about an hour before doors open. Sure enough there were already 20 people in line when we showed up. Billy Idol had already done a few weeks of shows in residency so all the bugs were worked out and the show itself was flawless other than a faulty mic. Place can hold a few thousand and after all the added Dickheadmaster (or whoever) fees it's just a little under hundred. Other seating costs more. You do the number crunch. Place was packed and he played all his hits. For souvenir collectors - Steve Stevens just stands there after the encore throwing out hundreds of his personalized guitar picks. Thought that was pretty cool. So for the concert experience I had that night at the House Of Blues - I give this place a five as far as an up close and personal place to see a show. In the Mandalay Bay. Come early. Worth every penny.

The Gospel Brunch was excellent. Despite mixed reviews on other sites, we found the food to be excellent, the talent amazing and the energy uplifting. Not sure how it goes down in other city's house of blues gospel brunches but the 15+ Vegas performers were spot on. We'll worth attending.
The food is actually quite terrible.. service isn't bad.. sub par beer menu..completely overpriced. But hey who doesn't like a salty $15 fish Sammy!!! So if your coming for the food... don't!!!
Wish there was some seating :/. 4" heals for 3 hours gets a little tough.  Otherwise, fun spot :)

Love the trendy decor! The best wings combo I have ever had. They serve buffalo wings over a nest of coleslaw. It is so good. After you finish your wings, the slaw has soaked up flavors from the wings and it is out of this world amazing!

Food wasn't bad. The service was. While our waiter was great and knowledgeable, we had to wait over an hour for our food. Added to that is the fact that we had to wait to be seated. This is reasonable, but they ask for your cell phone number so they can text you when your table is ready. They texted us, and then we stood and waited another 10 minutes before they sat us. All around this experience was a bust. We won't be coming back.
The food was good. The BBQ pizza appetizer was great, as was the macaroni and cheese. The citrus chicken was good, nothing special. The service was very, very slow.
Had breakfast here on a Tuesday morning. Yummy, quick, great service, reasonable price.  Definitely will go back.  Ham & cheese omelet was great.

***I have been to a few House of Blues locations and this was probably the weakest of the bunch; pretty run-of-the-mill food***  Please note that this review is for the food only.  I've been to three House Of Blues--the original one in Chicago (which had a very nice interior, and the food tasted better too; maybe the atmosphere helped), the one in Anaheim (super busy, okay food), and this one at the Mandalay Bay in Las Vegas.  I felt this Las Vegas location was the weakest of the three.  It was around five-ish, and we had late dinner plans.  We decided to come here to hold us over.  It was pretty dead.  For food, I went with the Buffalo chicken sandwich, which was pretty run-of-the-mill.  It was served with pretty boring and depressing looking french fries.  It was your typical chain experience.

In the land of feed trough restaurants of mass produced mounds of food dieing in a steam table. This place stands out, here you can set down order your food the way you want it. Adds or subtracts.   Great drinks large portions friendly staff. My Favorite place in Vagas for Breakfast.

I came to the House of Blues for the first time to watch AFI/Saosin many years ago. However, since Yelp didn't exist or was big then. Also, I never had experiences in other venues, so I couldn't really judge.  One thing I like about this place that the atmosphere isn't cramped or disgusting looking. Maybe it was also because being emo and scene wasn't that big during my high school years, but the venue wasn't full of high school teens who think the world revolves around them. I also like that there's a big enough back area to chill in unlike some smaller venues where you're just packed in one floor.  All in all, I think House of Blues is one of the better venues out there.

It was my first time enjoying a show at the House of Blues.  It's located in Mandalay Bay Casino and very easy to find.  Attached to the venue is a restaurant which has live music acts as well!   To get to the main level, you take stairs down to where the bar, seating and general admission floor is.   There is also a second level with seating that looked comfy!  It's a smaller venue but I think that's what I love most about it.  There really isn't a bad seat in the house.  The sound acoustics were great to really get a feel for the show.  Fabulous!  I can't wait to come back for another show in this fantastic venue! Enjoy!

Good food, somewhat slow service. The music was pretty good. Went several times and Woody's Rampage from Louisiana was our favorite! Excellent guitar. We had several menu items, mahi-mahi sandwich, fried chicken, bread pudding, vegetable dish with side of Mac n cheese. The cornbread is really good, mushroom soup and bratwurst.

This is for the concert hall only.  We've been here for three concerts and last night for the B-52's was the worst.  The venue itself is nice as are the acoustics.  My concern is how tightly people are packed in the SRO section in front of the stage.  The management needs to do a better job spreading people out as there are other places to stand.  It would be almost impossible to safely and rapidly exit in an emergency.
Lisa was fantastic. Street tacos were amaze-balls. Margherita flatbread was to die for.
Great show last nite with Panama! Great crowd and atmosphere!  Loved the music and performance they put on.  Would love to see them at this venue again.
Wife and I where there on a Friday nite for a concert at 10, we got there about 8 and the food / service was slow.

I went to this location about a month ago on a first date. The girl that I was with wanted to go somewhere with live music, so while we were at Mandalay Bay, I quickly yelped this location.   The music was pretty good, the singer was singing mostly country songs. I am not a fan of country music, every song sounds the same and its always about failed relationships. Anyways, my date loved the music there, and I loved many interesting things about country music from her. So, it was educational, but I still hate country music.   I ordered their pasta with bolognese sauce, and she got their thai shrimp salad. The food was below par for the quality and prices. The pasta was tasteless and had a bitter flavor in the meat sauce and the salad barely had any dressing in it and the shrimp was bit chewy. We were not happy with the food, but the atmosphere and music seemed to be the main attraction. Also, the prices are pretty reasonable, so if you are at their bar for drinks and live music than this place is pretty good.

stopped here by chance for breakfast- kinda wanted to avoid the buffets...  anyway- the breakfast food was actually very delicious ! the menu is a little small and a little questionable at first cause it looks like everything is al a  carte but it all comes with essentials like toast and whatnot.  i ordered the 3 egg omelette - you get a choice of 3 fillings - and it comes with toast of choice and AMAZING hash browns. i also got a coffee - for a total of $15 for my bill. not bad if you ask my cheap ass.  Our waitress Ashley was great and funny and always alert. Id come back for sure :)

This is where the night's DYL activities officially began.  I'm saying officially because you know we all started pickling our livers within an hour of getting off the plane.  Broken up into three seperate sections, you can either catch show in the main concert hall, a smaller more intimate performance in a cafe type setting, or grab a bite and drink in the restaurant bar.  Our only option for this night was the restaurant/bar.  Nothing really to write home about as far as the bar aspect of this place.  They have a medium sized bar at the very back of the restaurant.  With not a whole lot of bar area seating we squeezed ourselves into a couple booths as close to the bar as possible.  I think they were kind of miffed that we weren't there to have dinner, although we did order some bites to eat while drinking.  If they had any clue what they had sitting in their establishment they would have made a killing on drinks that night.  But they didn't so we had a few drinks, waited for the stragglers to join us, then headed to the next DYL stop of the night.

My wife and I frequent this place mainly cause its UBER fun! Let's start with the concerts. Decently priced entertainment in Vegas is hard to come by. Here I rock out with the wife in a totally cool concert hall and I still got enough for the booze. The last act I caught here was Satriani and dude was I blown away! Ok now the food is the usual fair but not the generic casino food you always see. Wings are hot served with slaw and bleu cheese. Pepperoni Pizza's are crisp. Smokehouse Burger with Bacon is my usual choice cause with the burgers they load the fries. They also put together a pretty good rib platter. Ceaser salad with Salmon was nicely put together. Gumbo was flavorful and filled with sausage and shredded chicken. So if your down for the type of food that goes great with loud live music and I say this cause there is always some band or act playing on the main stage then your in for a treat. The Bread Pudding is what the wife likes. Servers here are simply the most down to earth people you'll ever meet. Amongst the chaos of live music she was able to keep our order totally straight with a smile to die for. Party of six. I don't  mention names in my reviews but if you get the sweetest red hair lady you will agree. Since you read this far here the secret tip, the happy hour is the best time cause its half off all the appetizers. Other times this place can tend to be a bit pricey with the added entertainment taxes that Las Vegas charges when Live music is playing. If you go to  http://restaurant.com your able to get a discount voucher that you can use to counter this extra expense. My last note on the House is Check out the Steel Panther act.
