I had a good buzz and stumbled in to the concert. It was the funnest time I ever had at a rock concert. It was Hilarious!!! Then after the concert there's an DJ Spinning out After the restaurant closes. This place is way too much fun.

Gospel brunch - 2 for 1 tickets and still not a good value for the money.   Chior was as expected but food and service were terrible.  No spoons in place setting.  Coffee pitchers on tables went cold quick.  Seating too crammed in hard to get thru the fat people.   Seat number written on table not waterproof bled ink onto wife's sleeve.  Wooden folding chairs uncomfortable. Asked for tea and was brought one cup of hot water and no refill.  Shrimp should be peeled for 55$.  Understaffed for table servers. Mainly just mediocre quality and selection for buffet food.  Dessert bar was  cheap danish and cookies.  Pre entertainment time was too loud to talk.  Too dark to see selections at buffet.  Especially bad at omelet bar.
Delicious eats for breakfast, lunch, and dinner.  Great drinks, excellent service.  I enjoyed the live music as well.  This was my favorite place to eat in the entire Mandalay Bay Resort.

This was one of the best night out we have had in a long time.  Before you go writing off The House of Blues as a "touristy" thing or a "chain" like Hard Rock Cafes take a look at their offerings and come in and see for yourself that they are far from average.  On Tuesday which happened to be Valentine's Day we did dinner along with a concert at The House of Blues. It was so much fun.  Far starters we made reservations in advance because we knew it would be crowded - we arrived and were seated right away. Frank, our waiter was really personable and he did not rush us into ordering.  In fact, he was great at helping us choose drinks and a great selection of appetizers to enjoy before the concert.  I tried the Strawberry Bubbly a very festive drink for the evening It was made with Stoli Vodka, strawberry, fresh lemon, La Marca Prosecco.  I am so glad I tried it!  It was fresh and delicious... I made myself stop at one because it went down as easy as Koolaid! My sister had a Patron on the rocks and my daughter had a root beer. For snacks we ordered the Mardi Gras Fries to share. These fries are AWESOME!!!  Crawfish and smoked Gouda cheese sauce with red peppers and Cotija cheese over crispy fries - This Louisiana girl was in heaven!  The cream sauce is really nice not too spicy and not too heavy either.  I will go back for these again before the end of the month as they are only available through February,  Other goodies we snaked on included the Calamari, a pretzel, regular fries and coleslaw.  I loved the calamari.  I did not get the spicy sauces it normally comes with instead I opted for plain or a little ketchup on it. The Pretzel Rhyan chose was huge and had a really great flavor all on its own.  It came with two sauces.  One a cheese and the other a honey mustard. The honey mustard was my favorite. Really nice mild flavor and not overpowering. My sister loved the coleslaw.  She said it was one of the best ones she has had in ages,. Very tangy but not not too vinegary. She said she will definitely want that again next time!  We all really loved the meal.  Frank really took great care of us.  We cannot wait to go back again.

The food was ok, the service slow, and the prices outrageous.  The atmosphere is rock and blues, and it fits.  But $14 for a tiny hamburger and fries is too much.  The beers were cheaper because it was happy hour.   They had some unknown musicians playing and they were not too bad.

I keep trying to like this place. Really. And I do appreciate the gorgeous artwork on the ceiling and in the upper eaves. And the cool light shows that the stage is set up for. But when it comes to acoustics, service, and general comfort, this location fails.   What should be a small, intimate concert experience always devolves into a sweaty, shoving free-for-all, with some 6'6'' dude standing right in front of me and a 10 minute wait at the bar for a $13 drink. The no re-entry policy kind of makes me feel an animal being herded into a corral during set breaks.  I saw Umphree's McGee here last night, and have seen Moby, Metric, Ghostland Observatory, Karl Denson, and Wilco in the past. The Karl Denson and Wilco shows worked here, because there was very limited attendance, making them quiet, intimate events.   For a truly intimate venue, I like the E-String. But for a bigger crowd, the Hard Rock Cafe on the Strip would be a better choice.

I waited about 9 months to attend the Carlos Santana show last Saturday night at HOB Vegas. I attended the greatest "show I have ever seen in a bar". Music was great and the HOB staff that I saw really did an incredible job taking care of all the guests. Our bartender "Victor"? I think his name?..great guy, polite, fast, you got a positive vibe when the staff seems to enjoy their work. I look forward to attending other shows there..  I will be back! Thanks HOB Vegas!

First things first: Jennifer is the supervisor and she is ahhhhh-mazing! While we were waiting in line for the restaurant and gear shop to open, she was more than willing to answer any questions about the Pass the Line process and HOB in general. She's an absolute delight! And Gretchen at the bar is also wonderful. She's very attentive, personal, and witty. I've never been to a HOB before, but if I go to another, it will be hard for them to compare!

House of blues in Vegas is much like the other ones in the country, They are generally nice venues. This one in Vegas has two major negatives. The first is the horrible view from general admission and the second and Worst one is absolutely insane beer prices, $13- for a can of beer? This is a blatant rip off and really shows where the priorities are. Without customers you cannot sell your over priced drinks. Put the customer first and not your profits. Once that happens then you will have both. You really feel like a sucker when you realized you just spent $40- for three beers. I guess in Vegas, House of blues is looking for a quick buck just like everyone else and not repeat customers.

We stopped here on a weekday afternoon because it didn't look too busy and we wanted a place that had burgers. First off, we either had a brand new waiter or this guy was checked out because he was AWFUL. He would tell us the wrong pricing for the catch of the day, he didn't know any of the beers on tap off the top of his head, and he mixed up everybody's bill at the end! They really need to step up there service here. I understand if you are new, and you can't remember all the different beers on tap, but you have to solve the problem by saying you will find out the answer. This waiter would just keep bringing the hostess to our table so that she could tell us about the  beers on tap or what was on the menu. Or another time when all he could tell us about a cheese on a burger was that it was yellow. Yup, a yellow cheese. Plus I saw this waiter sitting and hanging out with friends at another table while we were ordering food! Simply unacceptable.   But anyways, we started off with a giant pretzel for the appetizer and it was quite good! Huge pretzel that is easy to share with everyone. I ended up getting the Juicy Lucy (~$14) which is a beef burger topped with bacon, provolone, jalapenos, and chipotle mayo. It was very good! The food was actually pretty tasty. Just terrible service, which caused me to rate it a 3/5.   Pros: - large menu that has more than just southern food - tasty burgers  - seasonal menu for Oktoberfest (get the giant pretzel!)  Cons: - terrible service (or at least terrible waiter)   Why I gave it a 3.... Mainly because of how bad our waiter was. Besides that, the food was pretty good. We all enjoyed our meals. I just wish our waiter would have tried to know what was on the menu and I wish he didn't hang out at another table during the middle of the busy lunch service.

Been here about 100 times in the last 5 years.  Service is usually pretty good. The prices are just outrageous, but if you expect that, you'll plan appropriately. The sound system is great and the lay out if cool. NO FIGHTING, and I am okay with that.

So, let me start off by telling y'all that I have had a great experience here, a full year ago.  This trip was the total opposite.  On both occasions that my friends and I came for lunch, the service was horrible.  The first time was sitting in the bar area, which I've learned from working in restaurants that the service is generally much faster and better in the bar.  This was not the case.  Group of four and two meals came out, then twenty minutes later, the other two.  The bartender was cool about it, and told me to come back tomorrow, he would comp a beer when I returned.  Nice right.....  Yeah, don't trust a part time bartender...  Never happened, and I didn't feel the need to argue over a beer, just let it go.   Don't get me wrong the food is really AMAZEBALLS!  Just the service took this place completely off of my list for next years conference, and judging by the reviews I'm guessing that I'm not the only one. I can get amazing food from many places in Las Vegas.    So during the second "redemption" visit, the waitress, you could tell was new.  Which was fine, and frankly I felt she did ok, but again the service was very slow, and the food took way too long to hit the table.  We sat for about 45 minutes. P.S. I promise, our group did not complain or act rude.  We were just enjoying the last day together with each other. Also, if you look at most of my other reviews I'm probably a little too kind when it comes to ratings.  By the end of the meal, the "Supervisor" came over to ask how things were.  I filled him in on the slow service, and how I understood running a restaurant is hard work.  Also, told him about the promised beer, and the food lag time.  All he did was give a couple of excuses and talk about this Awesome night club that was connected to the House of Blues.  If the Douche really knew about the business he would have seen four empty drinks and tried to salvage the service, instead of talking about a Bombtastic night club.  He also stated that we would be receiving some tickets for the night club from our waitress, which never came.    Two promises that the House of Blues committed too, and two failures.  Sorry that we had this experience.  I'm sure they are probably off our list for next year, which is really sad for me.  The food was really good, and the atmosphere is exactly my thing.   Single tear just ran down my cheek.  Cheers!

After eating not impressive breakfast at the Luxor's Cafe we went looking for something different. My husband had eggs benedict just as he had at the other restaurant but it was so much better and about $5 cheaper I had the grits and egg breakfast and it was delicious needed a little salt and pepper but that is to taste anyways. The Grits were the heavier hominy grits I chose sausage on the side because I don't eat meat.  They were gigantic! My breakfast yesterday at Luxor was $19 and sub par, the shrimp and eggs were $11.  We will be back later this week for gater bites!!
Went for lunch. Delicious, not rushed but not slow, affordable, and would totally go back.
Awful, awful food, terrible, terrible service I will never come back here.  They get one star cuz the drink was decent.  I highly recommend you do not dine here

Delicious food, prompt service, great atmosphere. Our server Jennifer was the highlight of the experience, she's fantastic. She recommended the Voodoo Shrimp as the best thing on the menu, and after trying it we 100% believe her- I'll literally be thinking about that dish weeks from now.

You should know you can do bottle service and get a table for a show, but decide that before you buy your first round. One vodka cran = $13. Bottle of Skyy vodka and a table is $200+tax and they go up from there. In fact, you should PREGAME in the casino or in your room if nothing else. $13 is crazy to me, for a vodka cran. I pay half that in GA (different worlds).. and it's especially wacky since right outside the venue in Mandalay Bay you sit at a machine and start getting your drinks free.  PREGAME.  Despite that, the staff is super nice. Natalie behind the bar is excellent, and the girl who handles the bottle service is also very sweet.  I haven't been to any House of Blues in quite a while, and this was definitely my first time at this one. The venue is pretty awesome.  It feels like a short distance from the stage to the back of the room, and the "pit" area is lower than the surrounding bar area, so it feels like most spots give you a pretty good view. Fairly easy access to the bars even when it was as packed as it was gonna get all night, although I'm sure it's not always easy. And if you care, the curtain on stage was suuuper cute. It was a patchwork quilt that I just wanted to curl up in.  There's a second floor/balcony seating, but they didn't seem to be allowing many people up there while we were there.  The stairs were blocked off at the main entrance, and we were not sure why, or who was already up there, but you could see a crowd.   This particular show - The Neighbourhood and Kitten - was All Ages.. which was weird to me. So there were a ton of teens, including the ones standing in front of us whom at first I was hoping would leave to go to the bar (before I realized they were probably underage). There are plusses, though, to sharing a concert with so many under-21s: Less people at the bar, and I can see over the whole crowd!
Loved, loved the hamburger and fries.  My kids had the mac and cheese and I had to try it and loved it.  I will definitely be back.
The food is ok, the prices are high, the ambiance is kind of cool. There isnt anything awful about this place but there also isnt anything rad about it. It is a safe bet for a decent meal in Vegas.
Excellent customer service. Also was surprised at the quality of the food and drink.  Enjoyed watching Stephen Marley et al here. Would definitely return to the venue.

Excellent service. My kid fell asleep at the table, even after the server brought a Shirley temple with an abundance of extra cherries to try and keep him awake. By no fault of her own, it didn't work, she even had them turn down the air cause he was whining about it being cold (needy, I know!) and I still missed out on the live music. C'est la vie when you try and stretch a 6 year old pool tuckered out kiddo past 8p. Anyway...food was pretty good. We got the Cajun chicken pasta with the add of shrimp and the shrimp were over cooked (should slide out of the tail, but these needed to be peeled) and omg the amount of oil left in the bottom of the dish had me running up and down the strip in 100 degree heat the next day to try and work it off. It was tasty but way too much oil, pooling in the bottom it should not.

FOOD REVIEW ONLY  I thought I had food poisoning after eating here. My stomach hurt for hours. It's DISGUSTING. As I was eating I remember thinking "this is friggin GROSS" but I was so hungry I ate the majority of my meal. We ended up going here because we were staying in the hotel and someone told us they had good food. WRONG.

Ben here multiple  time to eat and have fun . When possible  ask for D'Andre  the server he will take care of you..  As far as the food it pretty  good the meatloaf  is good fried chicken  is good   Did mentioned  they have live music also.

First show I have seen at House of Blues in Vegas, this was back in January for Amon Amarth and Enslaved....first off the place is at Mandalay Bay which is at the end of  the strip which sucks to travel too, the venue is very small which is unacceptable given this is a huge hotel/casino, seriously you will have no room to move, when I did it just caused fights.  It is sort of setup like an EDM club, you have tables right in the middle of the venue and all the rest of us have to stand around either near the two bars on either side of the venue or behind the aforementioned "tables" , totally sucks ass...drinks are way too much, service sucks, the only redeeming value for this place is the sound is good, well in a small room the sound should be good !!  Outside where they sell merch and band signings is essentially just an open area right by all the casino shit....The Joint @ Hard Rock is far superior to this venue, do not go to a show at House of Blues it is all style and no substance...!

Went here with my family on January 25th to see Who's Bad a Michael Jackson tribute band. We ate dinner here first - the food was AMAZING!! But.... The show was set to start at 11pm according to the website which was already very late but we figured it is a Saturday, no big deal. However, the show did not begin until 11:30! Not to mention the weather was horrible that night so we really did not want to be driving home at 2am! The show was great though, so that made up for it but to me a show that is already set to start at 11pm has no reason to start late, especially at almost midnight! The least they could have did was announce that it would not start on time.

I used to love the Hard Rock Venue but they have rebuilt it in a weird way so now this is my favorite place for standing room only tickets.  They have a wrap around bar so its not all the way in the back of the room up a ton of stairs and they serve food which is very good, not greasy bar food.  Cool vibe and no matter where you stand, there is a decent view of the stage and they have video all over the place as well.

I don't know what happened. We were here a while back for a concert and we raved about how good the food was so when I saw an email for free tickets to that night's show with food purchase, I thought, why not?  The food was nothing like it was the last time we were there. The jerk wings were insanely good the last time and these were not. I'm a wing person and I didn't want to finish them because they were old and drowned in sauce, probably to cover up the old. The burgers we got were just ok so I have nothing good or bad to say about those. Service was a little slow to start but we found out she was new, so I'm not gonna knock any points for service. I just wish the food was just as good as the last time. Maybe this place will get another chance but it'll be some time.

Came here to see "The Dan Band". First time here and did not know they had a venue down stairs. I did not see an elevator so if you cant handle stairs this may not be for you. Love the d√©cor. Its got a feel of old time stuff with an upgrade. Its kinda small but, have 3 areas with bars. Before we went in the security wands you and they check the purses and anything that is in pockets. I had a bottle of water in my purse and I had to throw it away.  When we got inside we did just order bottle water (wasn't in the mood to drink) and that cost was $11.00. They do serve food such as street tacos. pizza etc. It smelled good but, did not try anything we ate before coming.  It was very crowded we were on the stage floor waiting for the show to start and it got so packed like we were sardines and yes you did get bumped with people squeezing thru. But the show was really good. Dan was good with his two older back up guys and he kept the audience entertained.

This was a great venue to view a live concert, especially since they still have reserved seating, something that has all but disappeared from smaller music venues.  I like the property, I like the staff, the acoustics were great and it was a pleasant experience.  I do have a caveat for those attending shows there however- particularly people who buy their tickets online at Live Nation or Ticketmaster with the intent of printing their tickets at home.  If you print your tickets online and are offered the "Pass the Line" option, don't buy it.  It's not necessary.  At the House of Blues home page, it clearly states that all a person has to do is present a receipt from the restaurant or gift shop in order to automatically receive priority entrance into the music hall.  This is true at all HOB locations in the USA, per their website.  Furthermore if like me you purchase assigned seating tickets, there really is no need for priority entrance.  Those who have General Admission/Standing Room Only tickets will have a priority, as they can get into the music hall faster and secure a better place to watch the show.  Since I did not visit the HOB website to purchase my ticket to a recent show at the Las Vegas HOB, I was not aware of this option until after the fact.  I went to Tickemaster/LiveNation and bought the ticket there. During the check out process, an icon for "Pass the Line" popped up with an offer.  Buy a Pass the Line voucher in advance online, and receive not just the priority entrance, but also $20 on the voucher good towards purchase in the restaurant or gift shop.  I took it because I already knew I would be eating dinner at HOB before the show.  The voucher did not provide anything at a discount or for free, and in fact it is restrictive because it has to be used the night of the performance.  It really isn't anything more than HOB finding a way to receive payment for a meal or gift shop purchase well in advance.  Good marketing, but not good value for the consumer.  I bit anyway- that was a mistake.  After the ticket and the $20 voucher were paid for, I received an email link to print my ticket.  Upon printing I discovered that the printout includes a coupon for $10 off a restaurant meal purchase(s) of $25 or more.  The verbiage does not state it is not for the date of the ticketed performance, or excludes that performance, nor does it state that it cannot be combined with any other offer.  It is blatantly an attempt to get concert goers to eat at the restaurant, period.  So I took my receipt for the prepaid voucher to the box office and was issued the voucher.  I also had the $10 off offer on the printout with me.  When I presented the voucher worth $20 in conjunction with the printed meal discount offer, I was told they could not be used together, that the discount was for a future date as in incentive for people to return to dine.   I disagreed and said there was no verbiage to that effect.  I spoke to the manager, and explained that not only was the verbiage not present, but also the $20 voucher I tendered as payment was not a freebie or a comp, I paid the $20 in advance.  In other words, I was not getting anything for free by using it.  The manager attempted to tell me that was the fee to get past the line and onto the VIP line, at which point I pointed out that there was nothing special, as I could have merely dined and obtained a receipt, and presented the receipt with my ticket as proof of dining.  The manager abruptly relented and stated he would honor both because he "wants me to have a good time at the concert."  I don 't necessarily believe that was his true motive, but it works for me.    The moral of the story is that if you are  planning on dining at HOB prior to the show, just pay for your dinner when you get there.
Wow-one of the best breakfast opportunities in Vegas. Great heart healthy options too. Terrific service by Katie. We be back this week!
St patty's day here was awesome! Live bands all day long, great food and fun atmosphere!

I'm only reviewing the breakfast here. When we stay at Mandalay Bay we eat here every morning, Sun, Mon, Tues. Those are the days we are there. Not going to say what month. They have a deal if your staying in Mandalay Bay and you bring your receipt from the first days breakfast you get like half off every day afters breakfast. How can I beat that. Also on those days they are not that busy.   The breakfast has always been good. I love eggs, they have great eggs. I love bacon, they have great bacon. I love sausage, they have great sausage. I especially love biscuits and gravy and well I would have to say their biscuits and gravy are pretty darn good. The waiters are excellent too.

We got a 2-1 Breakfast Coupon for the House of Blues and it was well worth it. The food , coffee and service was excellent. It came to about $25 with a tip for both of us. Not a bad deal for an upscale hotel.

Located inside Mandalay Bay, House of Blues is a beautiful venue with gorgeous architecture, unique artwork and design.   I was there to see Pvris. The sound quality was good and overly experience was decent.   I wasn't impressed with one of the security guards that was hitting on my friend and the lack of seating for those of us with disabilities and chronic illness.   Drinks also cost a lot at the bar.

3 of us have now been sitting on the Patio at HOB for 25 minutes and have yet to be waited on. Happy hour prices are good but if u can't get service it's not worth it. Save ur time and go across the street & enjoy a $2 pint plus better service.

Great food and fantastic musicWent in for breakfast enjoyed the meal so much that we returned for dinner and to our surprise we got to listen to a great guitarist while enjoying our dinner of fried chicken.

Can I just say I love themed restaurants, bars, stores etc. basically I love Vegas right hahha. I love the vibe and decor of this place. The fact that they have live music just makes this a must when visiting Las Vegas or even if you're a resident. The food is is great!! Essentially after drinking -_-

We visit the House of Blues for Homegrown Thursdays when local bands take the stage and you get to eat and have a show.   Our friends, Left Standing, were playing last night (7/7/11) and we decided to eat at the show and show some support.   We arrived, waited for seats even though there were open tables right in front of the stage. When we were being seated, we politely asked if it would be possible to sit closer to the stage, as those tables were open. We were told there was no server for that section. I'm sorry, but a section consisting of 2 tables in a place like the HOB?!?!? I don't think so.  We took the table we were offered, in the back of the room, off to the side and basically on the gaming floor.   Before we even ordered our drinks, there was another couple at the the table where there "isn't a server". Oh, and they got their food before we did!  Our server was great, let me get that out there. He was busy, and forgot out water, but he was good. He had good personality and corrected anything we needed. I ordered two sides, the veggies and mashed potatoes. The veggies were good, but in my opinion, not warm enough.   The potatoes came out at the same time as Chris' meal and they were COLD. After a few bites the server came to check on us, when I mentioned the potatoes were cold, he immediately took them and brought me new ones. We didn't have to wait for refills, and he continued to check on us all night.   I am not one to keep quiet, though. I asked to speak to the floor manager and question the policy regarding the seating. I explained the situation, very calmly, and made it very clear that I was in NO WAY complaining about the service.  As a result, we were offered better seating that was open, and they comp'd us some drinks and desserts.    The section we moved to had a different server, and he was on top of it. He had a great personality and checked on us frequently.   The menu, unfortunately, got much smaller than we remembered. When we first started coming to the HOB I remember it had a "real" menu - the plastic covered kind with multiple pages. Now they're down to a 1 page oversized piece of paper with food on one side and drinks on the other. If you are with a picky eater, don't bother. Or, if you won't want to pay out the ass for your meal, you're in the wrong place.   The more we go here, the more we are disappointed in the establishment. We've had good service, in fact, past servers even came up to us and checked in.   With this seating fiasco and the limited menu, the only times we will ever return is for Left Standing or another friend-band playing  - and we'll likely skip the food and drinks and just stand for the show.

I've been to the House Of Blues metal venue before. It's very tight and narrow, therefore, for sold out shows you're very elbow to elbow with other fellow metal heads. When you're in this much of tight quarters everyone ends up talking to each other and joining in on random conversations, something that doesn't happen in antisocial Vancouver. It was just nice to do some pre show socializing. They place may be narrow but it's very logically constructed that no matter where you are you'll get a good view.
Love the HOB! We saw a great band here, and it was amazing. Again, the wings will never let you down... so great! The prices weren't too outlandish considering the great atmosphere and live music.

Their gumbo soup is really good. There's lots of flavor.   However, their jambalaya - not so much. The rice was mushy, and it tasted very tomato-y but without much flavor.. The portion was very large though. It's definitely big enough for two.  The cornbread was very good. It came out in a cute little skillet. It's an appetizer that you'd definitely want to share. It does have jalape√±os in it. The maple butter that it came with was delish.  The lobster mac & cheese was super creamy. It had lots of big chunks of lobster.

My son dragged me into the House of Blues for lunch inside the Mandalay Bay. In the beginning, I was leary. But from the start, our waitress was right on spot. Very attentive and friendly. I ordered the 1/2 slab of ribs with vegetables and sweet potato fries and added the House of Blues salad on the side for just $4.00 more. When the salad arrived at the table, it was enormous. Could have easily been a meal itself. I shared some with the family, and they loved it so much, they all ordered one for themselves as well. The sweet potato fries were the best I've tasted. Mixed vegetables were green beans, snap peas, and asparagus sauteed. The ribs were St Louis style and just right. Happily surprised and will now make sure I visit the Vegas House of Blues for lunch on my next trip.

GREAT breakfast! Minus the eggshell on one day and the champagne aluminum the other day. Those are minor imperfections compared to the bartenders, waiters and gift shop staff. Everyone was super nice, hostesses can use a little pep when greeting but once you are inside, you totally forget they were even a part of seating you.

Good god - it's not that we sat down for brunch with HIGH expectations... But the huge servings of terrible food didn't make up for the fact that it was still terrible food.  Service was terrible to boot.
Food is good here, the place looks good too. I like the live performance here, they play blues all night long! However, the price is kinda expensive :(

Oh god (sorry, I'm athiest), make it stop.   I'm not sure who is going to this, but they must all be religious. That's the only reason I can see for all these great reviews of this place. YIKES.  The food was, like most have said, just okay. It wasn't anywhere near special and the price was over the top to have a sad buffet. The food was just warm. It wasn't hot, the bacon wasn't crispy, the mac 'n cheese lacked any sort of distinct flavor, the drinks were watered down. I'm so disappointed.  BUT, I could have dealt with that, I went really for the music. I was raised in a Southern Baptist household (the forced religion thing led me to stop believing in anything, hence atheist) so the music, while yes, religious, is something that I have deeply fond memories of. The jubilation, the reverence, it all moves me. Or did, until I got here.   What the heck? The songs weren't traditionally gospel. They were made up, I think. The woman singing talked more than she sang, and when she did sing her voice was scratchy and lacked something. The only song I recognized was Amazing Grace and that lasted far longer than it should have. I just wasn't impressed and I think my background in gospel singing is well established. I was hoping for something less showy, more reverent and got this really whacked out stage show that didn't have much to do with any gospel I've ever heard and it was just sad. I went hoping to be moved and instead left early. And, they seemed like they wanted to convert people. I understand that it's a 'gospel' show, but I came to hear singing, not preaching. It was almost offensive, I expected them to start passing the plate at any time. Did I mention I was SO disappointed? I was so disappointed.  There are a lot better places to spend your money on music than here. This seemed like a put on circus act. I was so disappointed. AND, it was expensive! Boo!

Let's try and act serious for writing a review for the House of Blues. seriously I'm not kidding and stop talking to me like a jerk from Spinal Tap and Columbus Day. Rock and roll in cleveland, now what the )))  I am not fond of the entertainment  area. Area looks similar to the game Plinko from the television gameshow, 'The Price is Right'. I watch kids line down Euclid in October for Marilyn Manson or $katepunk, tee shirts and shorts that security must frisk every last Alice Cooper before the gym class. I have visions of firing squads lighting up into all of these bastards. Do not have interest for what is inside yet I have visited inside. I saw Ghostface Killah from Wu Tang and he autographed my ticket. That was actually amazing. Okay actually I have been to HoB few times, not terrible. I am waiting for karate  continental drift the neon bowling lanes and the lights and pyrotechnkks, and sound of the House of Blues, the Greenhouse Tavern Weezer songs and pig heads for become one barf.

Food and service were really good. I had the bbq bacon burger. Best burger I've had out in a while. I'd give 5 stars but I think it was a bit pricey. $14 for the cheapest burger seems a bit much to me.

The restaurant portion is meh. Can't say I'm fan of much of anything there. Meh drinks and beer list. Meh food. Meh service. Meh ambiance.   What does redeem the restaurant area is the Rockstar Karaoke (currently on Friday nights at 10:00pm). Live band karaoke is the best. The host is so-so, but it moves along quickly and lots of folks get a chance to sing. And the band is pretty good.  So in sum, skip the food, but come for some karaoke.

Walked into this restaurant and got sat and had a great experience from the moment my boyfriend and I sat down. Marissa saw that we weren't greeted by our server yet and got us waters right away. Later my boyfriend accidentally spilled some water and Marissa was on top of it to wipe it down for us and didn't even make us feel bad about him spilling it. The best part about all this is she wasn't even our server during our meal. Thanks for the awesome food and service, we will definitely be back!

Mediocre this time around.  I had the bacon avocado eggs Benedict with a side of chorizo.  Bacon was a bit tough, avocado over ripe, and the chorizo was bland with some grit.  My wife had twisted up with a side pancake and she liked it all.  Service from Jason the waiter was very good; he had a great attitude.

Absolutely THE WORST service I have ever had. Well, actually none!  I ended up leaving. There were only about 10 customers in the whole restaurant other than the bar for happy hour. All the staff was walking around like they had nothing to do!  Management needs to do an overhaul as I see other posts about crappy service and crappy food!

Went to house of Blues for my daughters birthday dinner. The waitress forgot to put in our order. No big deal, we waited longer. Then when it came out messed up 3 of the 5 entrees. Mine wasn't a big deal, I asked for a bed of lettuce instead of a bun. I took it off. They put the wrong sauce on my boyfriends chicken wings,  no big deal, he ate them. But my daughter asked for a salad minus the blue cheese as she hates blue cheese. By the time the waitress came back to check on us everyone was done. We had snacked and gave my daughter some of our food and by this time were ready to go. I told her about the mistake and asked for them to give her the correct salad she ordered, but "to go" and with dressing on the side, so that she could eat it later. The waitress smiled and said "no problem" and I tipped her 35% on a $140.00 bill. When we got home we found that they just threw the salad we returned into a "to-go" box as it was, a soggy old salad, with the blue cheese and all.  I am a very cool person, admire and have much respect for people working in the food industry. We were understanding when the waitress made several mistakes, but this crosses the line. All I was asking for was what I ordered and payed for. Such a shame and embarrassment for a restaurant on E 4th area in the city I am proud to call my home.

Came here for a Bastille concert, the venue is what you expect to hold 500 or so ppl. There's a seats upstairs and tables through the place. Place is clean and they had a nice bar to buy some drinks. The concert was great but that's a different story. Overall, a nice concert venue. It can get a little crowded but that's expected.

My mother always insists that we eat here when she is in town. I'm always hesitant to go, and then end up licking my plate as if I hadn't seen fried chicken before. They have these catfish things that they fry and give you little shoestring sweet potato fries with them. So yummy! I order the fried chicken because I'm of the mind that if you eat at a southern inspired place, you eat the native things. It is always surprisingly good. Would I order a Cesar salad here? No, but the things that they specialize in are gooooooood!!

Food: excellent - had the fried shrimp and catbites (in the bar during happy hour), chicken wings and fries in the restaurant. Service: consistently excellent - Jessica and Grecia were both outstanding Ambiance: very upbeat. Clean. The bathrooms were well kept  even during the busy times.

Worst service i've had in a long time. The service probably would have been better at DIcks.   We never even got served water. i had to go to the bar across the casino to get a glass of water. Why do you have so many people on staff if they cant even serve a restaurant that is half empty ?

Had dinner here with two friends after teaching a workshop all day.  Ashley R. made the evening marvelously relaxing and fun.  Her service was outstanding, personable, professional, efficient and caring.   The food was great for all three of us and the atmosphere for MNF was great.

Just left The Dan Band show at house of blues.  Unfortunately we didn't get to see the show, we went at ticket time and gave up after 1 and 1/2;hours.  Overcrowded with big vip all u can drink section empty.  They are getting $24 for 2 cans of PBR.  Can you say gouging?

Pro: Free Blues night Saturday.  Con: $19 for halibut pasta special.  The plate was decent enough but not outstanding, rum and coke for $6 was a better deal.  If it weren't on the Strip, this would be a pretty chill place to hang, grab a drink with a buddy and some decent grub.  I liked the act on stage, had a lot of heart and wicked shreds (8 string bass!).  Somebody mentioned that the speakers are too loud, I did find this to be an issue, but not so much to make it un-enjoyable.

I have been to a fair share of HOB venues in my teen years, and I have to say that the one in Las Vegas really lives up to reputation for the city that never sleeps! The artwork and design of the venue is amazing, they really went all out for this location. It is slightly smaller than the others I've been to, but that makes for a better show experience- plus, they have a second level for those who were lucky enough to get seat tickets! Haha.  You can tell I'm not of a Pit Girl, but it doesn't get over-crowded at this venue. Unlike the other HOB locations I've been to, the LV location is smart about their capacity limits. I was in the pit the whole time and never felt suffocated or violated (without my discression-h ey it was a  Marilyn  Manson concert, OK? I've been into the guy since I was a pre-teen!) Anyway, crowd control was amazing, the show was amazing, and the bar was- eh.   The bar. I paid $14 for a sprite. It was supposed to be a midori sour cocktail, but it just tasted like sprite, and for a person who DOESN'T drink very often didn't even affect me whatsoever. Weak drinks. Pre-game in your hotel room before hand. Your little sister can probably mix better drinks!  I would definitely see another show here, it's so convenient, comfortable and relatively on schedule. The only thing I HATED? This was the only venue I've EVER been to that did not allow a closed bottle of water- and I have a hydration issue!!!

Saw umphrey's McGee there last weekend. It's your standard house of blues which is a good thing. Not a bad seat in the place. Staff was professional and bar service was efficient. I love these venues and will always support them whenever I can
Who doesn't like HOB? It can be crowded if you don't go early enough, but for the shows that I want to get up front I end of doing the "front of the line" dinner deal at the HOB restaurant.

4 stars based solely on the venue set up.  I really liked the balcony seats - we were in row A and could easily see the stage without having to stand on the floor all night long.  The decor is quite interesting too..when you're looking for something to entertain you because the 2nd opening band is rubbish. What I did not like was how freaking cold it was in there! I was wearing jeans, a t-shirt, and a jacket and I shivered throughout the entire show.  I actually bought a long sleeved t-shirt from the merch table because I couldn't handle being that cold any longer!...Maybe that was their evil plan?? The drinks were super expensive but I think we can all expect that from any venue.

5 Stars??!! For the Vegas HOB??!!  Really?  Yeah.... here's why.....   My wife and I stay in Vegas way too much. We love Mandalay Bay.   Invariably, I check out who's playing the HOB downstairs, plunk down the money (generally a great deal) and go see a band of which I have a passing interest.  I've been blown away by some bands (Porcupine Tree) and pleasantly surprised by others (Joe Satriani, Styx, Flogging Molly) Some have been a drunkin mess. (I'm looking at you, Joe Rogan)  All have been entertaining.

AVOID AT ALL COSTS!  This venue sucks for live shows. Here is a break down on how a $20 costs about $100 every time 2-$20 tix + fees                                         = $54 Parking                                                      = $10 Double Vodka Cranberry and 1 tall PBR  = $22 Tip                                                             =$   5                                                                 ________                                                                      $91 NOTE: thats just with one round of drinks SIDENOTE: The sound and view suck THE BREAKDOWN: SUPPORT LOCAL MUSIC VENUES AND NOT CORPORATE AMERICA.  Go to Brothers Lounge, Beachland, Grog Shop, Etc etc but save yourself from this crap.

We came here for Happy Hour with half price appetizers and drink specials. There was a guy playing acoustic guitar who was pretty good in my opinion. One of the girls who worked there said it was there pretty much every weekday performing during Happy Hour. It was a nice addition to the experience.   We had:  -margarita pizza (just OK- I've had better)  -spinach dip (good but served with a sort of potato chip like thing that I didn't care for)  -chicken wings on a bed of coleslaw (I guess the wings were small but flavorful and the coleslaw was average is what was reported to me since I do not eat meat)  -Voodoo Shrimp (excellent--served with cornbread and it was yummy!)   For 3 of us and we each got a drink special it was less than $50 so for Vegas it was pretty reasonable and we left full!

First of all we have had meals here several times. We like the place. Service - always prompt - I particularly enjoyed the convenience of on line reservations. Wait staff always polite and prompt.  Food - GOOD, not great chain fare. I remember the fired chicken as being larger when we had dinner here about two years ago. My wife had some sort of blackened fish - adequate. Drinks - the usual overpriced glass of wine. It's the Strip  Ambiance - eclectic Seventies reflecting Sixties look with stuff on the walls, pictures of musicians and the odd autographed axe. Cute., Sort of a Soft Rcok Cafe. I'm partial to darker lighting - I am not disappointed at HOB  Value - actually, for an on-the-strip place the price is not bad considering we were full when we left and the food was good.  Good place. We'll go there again.

You have to go when there is an artist performing for dinner. But don't expect to have a conversation with your meal. But it's okay because the music that they play here is awesome. :] Even though it's not a well known band, they choose their musicians well. Also, if you have MyVegas, be sure to use your points and get free foooood :] they allow more then one voucher at a time, so it's a great break after a rough night of gambling.

I paid for TPain tickets and I had to endure and hour and 30 minutes of whack a** bands... I definitely would not have purchased the tickets if I woulda known that the opening acts would be almost the whole show. Will not do this again.

Street Tacos. Not exactly from a taco bus, it had cheese on it which I should of had omitted just to keep with authenticity but sometimes I just want to try food they way it's on the menu. I ate all 3 of them and had a bite of the blue cheese burger if there is one. Otherwise I guess I forgot what that was. Thumbs up from this little eatin' machine.

Honestly I can say I have only given one star to anything else on Yelp but I have to give one star to this gospel brunch due to the fact the seating is absolutely horrific.  To pay as much as I did for two people to be seated in a can of sardines is just disturbing.  I understand that this is all about Christian fellowship but I don't want to smell my neighbors arm pits while I'm trying to listen to music.  The food wasn't all that either.  I understand the House of Blues is trying to make as much money as they can and packing them in like cattle is one way of doing it.  Just not classy or professional though.  Just a very disappointing experience.

The HOB is a great place to eat before the show, service was fast, the food surprised me with the flavor, very well presented great flavor. My first time, would definitely return to try out the menu in the future.

After going to the house of blues in las Vegas a few months prior and enjoying it we figured this would be a safe bet , we requested a table outside and were seated immediately ,our waiter Christopher was absolutely great ,he knew the menu very well and took the extra time to answer our questions and was friendly and went out of his way to give us great service .We ordered a burger and a prime rib sandwich which was very good .After our meal we went inside and had a beer at the bar and had a nice conversation with the 2 female bartenders who were great too .Kudos again to Christopher and the house of blues !!!

While walking through the Mandalay bay we stumbled across the house of blues so we thought we would give it a try , we ordered a few drinks and appetizers ,the food was very good but we were disappointed that our order took almost 40 minutes to arrive .Our waitress was very apologetic and she even sent the manager over and he too was very apologetic, yet he offered nothing to make up for the extremely long wait .Other than that it was a nice experience in a very nice atmosphere !

This review is ONLY for Kirk Franklin Sunday Brunch  Check for groupon deal- I used mines during my dine experience ($50 for 2 ppl) and it was great! though I would pay full price for it!   Let me be clear, Kirk Franklin himself is NOT there but he does make appearances here and there to all of his locations... If you are coming to see him, good luck! but, if you want a soulful experience with GREAT food and entertainment, please go here!  Getting in the place: Because we had purchased out tickets in advance (THANK GOD) the line for us was shorter. Once the doors opened we were in there pretty fast. We were given a little tid bit on what was offered, where we could find it and released to do our thang (get our food). lol  The food: AMAZING. Fresh Fruit, carved turkey, ham, baked chicken, friend chicken, made to order omelette, fresh waffles, biscuits etc Any type of eater will find something to their liking.  The performers: AMAZING... interactive with the audience and I really felt that I was at church. The song choice was on point and everyone on stage had a great voice.  I can't wait to return!!!
The food is ok and they charged us an entry fee did eating there. We sat by the bar and they charged that I felt that was too much. We didn't receive great service yet were charged extra.

Other than the decor this restaurant is very average. Burgers, sandwiches, and salads. I had the Rueben with sweet potato fries. I could have gone to any other place and spent half as much and had just as good food. If you come here you many just want to opt for a drink and save your money to get food somewhere better.

Happen to come here for Santana.   The venue seems to be small for the rock concert and has a weird layout.  Friends of ours bought the tickets so I can't complain but the arrangement of the club seems to be too vertical to be useful.  From the top level you can only see the top of the performers heads and though the sounds is good given where we were sitting we might as well put on a CD in the comfort of our own home.  The entrance doesn't seem to be well positioned and the security arrangements start right at the entrance to the restaurant rather then away from it as I would expect so everyone who haven't been here before would go and ask the hostess on whether or not Santana was playing here.  Overall I think that this venue needs a little bit of rearranging but it is pretty functional with bars and everything.
Every time I have been there, the atmosphere is great the service is consistent and friendly, and the food is amazing! I have yet to go there and get bad food or shitty service.

I've been to this venue several times so it kind of shocks me that I have yet to review it... but then I remember that every experience there has been mediocre.  The bands themselves have been fine or better, don't get me wrong.  It's the venue itself that just makes it miserable.  It's pretty cramped and the pillars make it pretty obnoxious to see anything if you are slightly off to one side or another at all.  Drinks are expensive, but that shouldn't shock anyone since it's on the Strip.  The sound is really what makes me disdain this place.  It's just so... awful.  You pay decent money for a ticket to go here because it's House of Blues plus it's Vegas plus it's usually a rather known band.  And for what?  Sub-par, barely-better-than-the-local-bar sound?  Tiny little TVs so you can (barely) see what's happening on-stage?  Pushy bathroom attendants?  All of this combined really makes me hate going here.  Ever.  Even when it's one of my favorite bands that I have seen several times in other venues.  They sound jarbled and muddy.  I don't know if it's your sound system or your sound crew, but seriously - fix it.
Not only great for concerts, but breakfast is the bomb. Fast service great food. Can't wait to come back.

We stopped in here on our last day for breakfast.   All House of Blues locations are usually eclectic in decor and that's great. It was just so dark in there!  I knew I wanted french toast. But I saw other things on the menu that I wanted, so without blowing my budget, I had to come up with a plan. I got the 3 egg omelet with andouille sausage, onion and bacon. YUM. It was chock full of ingredients and they weren't just hidden between the folds of the eggs, they were bursting from the seams. It was so delicious and filling AND I had a side of french toast from the kids' menu!   Our server was a bit scattered. He was nice, though. My cousin didn't like his response, though when she asked what they had to drink. Sometimes you just want to know if a restaurant has coke or pepsi products. He asked her what she'd like to drink and her question was "what do you have?" He pointed at the bar -- and that was his answer. Obviously there's a bar, but what else is there? Anyway, I had coffee-- and it was good, too.
Not a bad place for a beer, but the food is pretty average. Not terrible, but nothing special. I had their shrimp in a gumbo sauce on a jalape√±o cornbread. It was ok.

I hadn't been to this venue since 2009. It's a great place for concerts. Large enough to have great sound and crow vibes: small enough to feel like you're really part of the show.  I saw Billy Idol's residency show and chose to upgrade to VIP seating. I was not disappointed. The food is amazing. The service is stellar.  I don't frequent concerts, but from now on, when I do, it will be at a HoB!

sometimes when a certain city comes to mind you automatically know whether or not you think its worth visiting. well, i guess im going to be the first to tell you that cleveland is actually an awesome place to party. maybe it had to do with the fact that i was only stopping through for warped tour, but the fact of the matter is, i met the most amazing  people here... which is why im going to start off by reviewing HOB cleveland. we rolled into town around 2am and parked in front of the caves stadium. later than night we hit up HOB for a couple drinks and dinner. we sat next to this older couple who were cool as fuck because they bought us rounds of jager and didnt mind that we were being total drunks. our waitress started doing shots with us and at that point i knew where to take this party. we moved to the bar and chilled with all of the bartenders. about 40 shots later they were closing up and i asked her ..."what is there to do in cleveland?"  ...it was a million dollar question because this girl took us out to every club and every bar in cleveland. id say this was one of the most memorable spots we hit on tour!!! oh..yeah... the food isnt bad... its like a hard rock cafe...  so four stars for the awesome friendly service, the drinks and the vibe

the only times i have been here were for the shows during punk rock bowling. and every time i had a blast. i think the best show i saw here was me first and the gimme gimmes... the sound is always on point and the crowd seemed really chill... but then again how would i know, i was chillin vip with the bands.. hahaha.. suckers!!!!

Had dinner here with family last night & I was very impressed! The food is delicious, our server was amazing.. It was very busy but our server was wonderful! Live music was really nice also. I had the steak salad w balsamic vinegerette for my dressing choice, it came with grilled asparagus, potatoes, and it was to die for! In my salad it had some cornbread croutons, mouthwatering!! They have good drink prices I highly recommend the Watermelon Slammer it was my fav!! You will not regret coming here!

This is where i get my ribs in vegas, plus their pulled pork sdwh is very good too if you want to be civil and not tear off rib bones that might mess up the clubbing gear.  The sauce is good, of course i ask for more on the side, they actually warm it up, and boy does it make a difference.  drench it.  don't forget that rosemary, I just wandered in one time, and i've been going back whenever im in town.  However, the ribs seem a lil small, i can prob kill 2 racks. but its vegas, and i didn't expect good ribs here.

I ordered the traditional eggs Benedict.  The Canadian bacon was rubbery.  The English muffin was difficult to cut through. The eggs were almost cooked all the way through, providing very little yolk.  The hollandaise sauce was not hollandaise sauce.  The hash-browns were soggy, watery and bland.  The dish reminded me of sub par cafeteria food.  On a lighter note I did enjoy the cheddar biscuits.  The service was outstanding.  For $25 you are probably better off going to the buffet or the cafe.

Great place, but it is a pretty small venue. The Walk the Moon concert was 16+ but there was no security walking around making sure that kids weren't using drugs (which they were) or that no one was dehydrating, etc... Also, it was HOT in there! I know that it's a concert, but it was musty in there. I'd definitely think twice before seeing a show here again.

Came in around 6:20 maybe (darn, just missed happy hour!) and asked the hostess for her opinion: we had a show to catch at 7:30, would we have enough time to eat here or should we go somewhere else? She said we'd be fine and that it usually takes 45 minutes so we got seated.  We asked our waitress about the Yelp deal that gives you a free appetizer with order of an entree and she said she'd have to check with her manager first because they might only accept printed coupons. C'mon hon, it's a deal that you get from checking in on Yelp with your mobile phone, if you expect people to print this out then I'm going to yell at you. So when she comes back she ends up saying that she thinks it's okay but another waiter is taking over our table so when we pay, we can just bring up the deal to him. I ordered the chicken quesadilla appetizer and BF got one of the sandwiches (I think chicken) with sweet potato fries upgrade. Then we waited and waited and waited. Our waiter had already refilled our water glasses twice and then as we continued to wait, I think he just started to avoid our table altogether. At maybe 7:10 I finally just stopped him and asked how much longer our food would be and he said he would check. He came back with our food and I asked for the check and had to ask about the Yelp deal all over again.  BF's order did not have sweet potato fries, no way did we have time to exchange it though. As irritated as I was, when we began to eat it was kind of like "okay, well this is pretty yummy.." That's pretty much the only thing saving them in this review because I'm still so irritated by the communication between workers and the service overall. Yes they were friendly but geez. The hostess knew we were in a rush but never bothered to let our servers know? And when you switch out servers you should be updating the server replacing you about anything regarding the table, don't tell the customer to re-explain something to the new server. I understand our situation was a little different because we were in a rush to begin with but if we were going to wait that long just to receive the food, I would've appreciated being told at the door that I should consider eating somewhere faster.   Most dishes are overpriced but the Yelp deal did make it worth eating there so thanks Yelp! Rather unpleasant experience but the food was not to blame

WU-TANG!!!! Hell yes!! The place was smoky and gross and close and sweaty just like a venue should be! Plus you can slip it without tickets if you grease it nice and pretty, or, in my case, have your bodyguard do it. So close to the stage everyone could smell method man's blunt.

At Mandalay Bay, breakfast options are buffet, Seabreeze Cafe, or HOB.  I am not a fan of MB Buffet and service at Seabreeze tends to be incredibly slow even when it is not busy   During my 3 night stay, I ate at HOB each morning.    No fuss standard weekday Breakfast special Two Eggs, Hash, Bacon, Toast is perfectly portioned, fresh, and excellent value for strip standards.  Coffee is good.  Skip the overpriced OJ.      No wait.  Quick Service.    Occasionally you can also find 2 for 1 coupons in Las Vegas Advisor and MyVegas.

The food was yummy, but the gospel portion wasn't what I expected.  I thought we were going to be able to see some major choir action, but it turned out to be a small family singing group who's lead vocal kept looking at his watch to see how much more singing he needed to do. I think they sang a total of 5-6 songs (or, that's what it felt like). As Kayla B. mentions, the set was really short (about 30 minutes). I wish I had seen Kayla's review before I went.  In any case, I wanted to echo her thoughts.

This is my go-to music venue. Best staff, audio, stage, atmosphere and overall set up! Their is a great restaurant attached as well that serves amazing southern creole/cajun food, they may have the best Jambalaya ever.  I have been to the HOB cleveland at least 40 times now and its never disappointing. Cheap Valet off of 4th street and pass the line is a great way to start.  My wife and I love the HOB so much we decided to get married in the Cambridge room (to the left of the box office). The wedding package was amazingly cheaper than I thought, less than 4 grand with food/venue for 50ppl. Rachel Rosen was phenomenal with setting everything up too! HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!

Venue Review!  I love, love, LOVED this place! It's inside the Mandalay Bay . My bf and I were staying at NY, NY and walked from there to HOB. But don't be like us, take the tram from Excalibur, it'll save you some walking/exercise. ;)  We were there to see Brandon Flowers. Going in was quick and easy. The staff was helpful in getting us to our seats. As soon as we got seated we went to the bar and the bartender was REALLLLLY nice! I asked her to suggest a drink for me (something fruity and peach-y but still kinda strong. ;) ) She mixed something up for me then told me that if I didn't like it then she would give me something else, no charge. Luckily, I LOVED it. ;)  Brandon Flowers put on a great show (OF COURSE ;) ) my only complaint that from where we were sitting, it was really difficult to see him when he was in the center or on the right of the stage. We could only clearly see him when he was on the left. =/  Leaving the show was also not really pleasant. There was only ONE exit!! o_O It took us a good 10 minutes just to get back out to the casino again. =/   Overall though, I really enjoyed myself. :)

I can't believe I've been to Vegas so many times and never hit the Gospel brunch.  This is such a fun way to kick off a Sunday in Sin City. The singers know their gospel and they get everyone in the venue on their feet, clapping and singing.  The brunch was the best we've had In Vegas and at $50 head it's a steal considering the show is basically a freebie.  Bloody Mary bar?  Check. Chicken and waffles?  Check.  Best Mac n cheese in the world? Check.  You gotta check this out
Nice atmosphere. Food and service was OK. Martini was excellent. Prices reasonable.  I would return again if in the area.

While here in Vegas at the Mandalay we have come to HOB three times. Just warm, friendly, and reasonably priced. Today for brunch we had a waiter named Adam and he is hands-down one of the best waiters I have ever had. Just a great guy -warm, informative, welcoming. Don't hesitate, just go and ask for this Adam!

House of blues is house of blues!!! There's no changing that, EVER! Awesome concerts & events here.  Almost exactly the same as the ones in California. It is inside of the casino itself, but it's a pretty large yet intimate showroom, comparing to t-mobile arena (which is cool but an arena) HOB makes any show more intimate which leaves room for audience participation.  The other side of this they have a restaurant which also has a small stage and they host  a lot smaller concerts here.

There are so many things wrong with the House of Blues I'm not sure were to start. First ticket prices are out of control, I understand that it's a smaller venue and bands need to charge more but it still seems like there are a ton of service fees. Drinks are are the same price as Browns games (equally a disappointment) and they REALLY NEED TO GET RID OF THE BATHROOM ATTENDANTS! There is nothing I hate more than having to give/tip someone a buck or two to use soap and a paper towel! C'mon man give me a break! It really sucks that I'll be going back there because this is the only medium size venue in Cleveland for bands to play. If the Agora or the Odeon were still around this joint would have some competition and it might not be so bad. One good thing is the place is clean.

If you ever get a chance to see one of your favorite bands at the House of Blues,  DO IT. The venue is the perfect size to see an intimate show from general admission or the paid seats. The energy in the place is awesome and infectious. The only knock I had was the somewhat small bathrooms and the ridiculously overpriced drinks. These weren't enough to take off a full star, so my true rating would probably be a 4.5 stars.
The day after partying, 14 dehydrated drunks waited 20 minutes to get water. The cup of gumble was horrible but the burger was good. Probably not going back their for awhile.

We stayed at the Luxor and stumbled upon The House of Blues while browsing around the walk way thats connected to Mandalay Bay.  It's a great lunch spot, its dimly lit with very nice decor.  The staff is laid back but really professional and attentive.  I had a cajun chicken sandwich and fries, it was reallllyyyyyyyyyy yummy.  Be sure to go there for lunch, you'll be happy you did.

I saw Tom Waits perform here.  (I love that sentence.)  THE UP-SIDE:  I saw Tom Waits perform here in a rare concert appearance.  He came on around 1 AM.  It was magic.  THE DOWN-SIDE:  How can there ever be a down-side if Tom Waits performed here.  THE SUM-IT-UP:  I saw Tom Waits perform here, and it was good.
Icona Pop on Sunday!!  Fun Fun Sunday!   .... "I love it"

Had dinner at house of blues.  Service was decent and pretty quick.  Food looked good but was very bland. Recommend you carry salt, pepper, and what eve spice you like on your pocket.  But to be fair, I'm from Louisiana and most food outside my state is bland, no flavor.  Of course it's very loud, but not bad overall.

This is a venue revue:  After seeing some shows in the new massive Joint at the Hard Rock - coming back to the cozy House of Blues was a refreshing change.  The venue is a really nice size in which to see bands - not too big.  The sound ranged from horrid - with the bass and kick drum so loud in the mix you literally feel like you're being given sonic CPR  - to great, all in a single evening.  We went for a rock and roll show, and although it took some time to get the guitars up in the mix where they belonged, once they did the sound was awesome - better in the back near the bar than on the floor I have to admit.  I'm docking one point for the OUTRAGEOUSLY high priced drinks!  $26.00 for a bourbon & coke and a Stella?!? EEESH!  Get your drink on somewhere else before the show if you must.

I was in Vegas recently for my birthday and we decided to have a snack to break us away from gambling for a bit. The main draw was the happy hour specials for appetizers at $6 a pop.   Upon walking in, I immediately enjoyed the interior. There was a lot of interesting things to look upon, including a gargantuan fake tree. Also, a musician started playing acoustically, which was unexpected and made the experience more fun.   When the food arrived, we were very pleasantly surprised with the portions because we weren't expecting so much for the money we were paying. We enjoyed the spinach dip with kettle chips and the shrimp with cornbread. The cornbread was SO good and the sauce they put on the plate was a big hit with all three of us. Definitely my favorite. The wings were just average. We ended up not even finishing all of the apps, with the exception of the shrimp dish. Not bad for 18 bucks betwixt 3 people!

We hit this place right after it opened. Quiet and dark, with a really cool outside vibe while inside, with a giant tree. The service was good, and they give you huge carafes of drinks. The basic burger is just a build it yourself, but it's handmade. And it's a doozy. It's like dad used to make on the grill. It's huge. The chicken strips are hand breaded and delicious. The Mahi tacos came out cold, and the after mentioning it to the manager who came out to apologize, they took it off the bill. Overall pretty good experience.

Great facility! Never had the food here. Only come for concerts. It's located within the Mandalay Bay on the casino floor. Very easy to find once you find the center casino floor. Really cool memorabilia throughout. Anyway, came to see an icon play last night: CARLOS SANTANA. Phenomenal show in a phenomenal, intimate, and cozy venue. There's a restaurant with a stage, a music hall (where concerts are held), and a store. The music hall has food options and a few bars

I've been here now for more than a few concerts (Matisyahu, Girl Talk, K'naan + Wale) and have no complaints.  I hate large venues and I love that I can sit in the balcony, easily grab a drink and enjoy the concert without having to push and shove my way through a mosh pit or spend three hours straining my neck and my calves to see the performers on  stage (I'm 5' 3" so this is a big deal!)  Also, I live right on Euclid so it's great to be able to just walk over and grab tickets for shows and avoid evil Ticketmaster and their insane service charges.

Not fancy, but cool as hell. Kinda like the blue bayou at disneyland in atmosphere (trying to create an outdoor, southern atmosphere inside) but with actual solid interpretations of southern classics.   Service is spotty but, hell, you're in a casino and the chef isn't a celebrity.   Biscuits and gravy rock the party, but, predictably, you can only eat about one, since they are so rich. Still, yum yum.   Also, beans, rice and jambalaya kicked my ass. In a good way. Spicy, tons of protein, rice not cooked too much and hot sauce. Buh-bye hangover.   Best part? If you eat here for breakfast your receipt has a 2-1 offer for breakfast the next morning (Read: grub on biscuits and gravy for free. WORD!)  This is a great stop if you're in the Mandalay/Luxa/Ex area. :)

What A Wonderful place to eat at, Happy Hour Was Awesome Food, Great Prices, And The Best Staff!!!!!!!!!!!! #MyBlueHairedSoleSister #MzC, You Sit In Her Section, She Will Take Great Care Of You, Awesome Personality, Great Recommendations, Knows Her Restaurant, And The Best It Has To Offer!***** And Awesome Staff Is Usally Ran By Awesome Mangers #MeganRocks..... THANK FOR TODAY!!!!!

We went to the HOB for a Volbeat concert that absolutely rocked! The atmosphere, layout and decor was perfect. I really like the placement and size of the bars, the floor and the stage. My only serious complaints are the amount and strictness of security and the $$$. Beers were $13, that just ridiculous. Mixed drinks were tiny and no alcohol for $10. It was a rip off. Two drinks cost more than the tickets to the show. The security guards were everywhere a little too oppressive for a rather tame crowd. We had a great time so I'll give this place a 3 but I'm not in a hurry to go back.
we all felt sick after eating here.  service was friendly but slow.  gross gross gross

I've seen many performances here... VNV Nation (har har), Spiritualized (heroin, anyone?), Stella (sloppy wet pizza), Peter Murphy (muahaha), Black Rebel Motorcycle Club (they rock out - too bad their c....oops, never mind) ... just to name a few.  Sound is great here. It's not too large of a space and almost feels intimate. Especially if you're lucky enough to snag a bar stool.  I'm giving 3 stars because of the ticket fee raping and because you get a frickin' tall boy PBR for $4 BUT a diet coke in a dixie cup for $3. Can I have some KY with that next time, please?   Also, the bathrooms are really nice but I hate feeling like I have to tip a bathroom attendant. I always do because I'm guilted into it (thank you Catholic school) and because I'm not a cheapskate. But seriously...  the bathroom attendants are the reason that the girl standing next to me last night smelled like Debbie Gibson's Electric Youth. My nose wanted that $1 that I left in the tip basket back for that one.

We had breakfast here all 5 days we were in Vegas. There are 3 reasons why I can't give this establishment 5 stars.  First, more than 2/3 of the restaurant tables were open when our group of 6 tried to get a table and were told it would be a 45 minute wait. 45 minutes?!?! How was that even possible?? The place wasn't even busy. We wound up smooshing together at a bar top table so we didn't have to wait so long. Second, the waitresses were soooooooooo SLOW! We had really great service the first day when we had 2 male bartenders that absolutely killed it in customer service but then the rest of the days we went here, it would take forever to order a drink or food or get our bill. There were 2 days when we just left cash because it would have taken ages to get our bill and run our card. Third, the pricing. Although the portions are larger, the pricing was still a bit steep for the quality of food.  I would absolutely go here again if I was staying at the hotel but wouldn't go out of my way to go eat here.
Ask for Angel for breakfast. Good service and character. Gave us comp entries to a nightclub and coffee in to-go cups when we left.

So far this has been one of the best places to eat at the Mandalay Bay resort.   I went there the first night here to have a drink and appetizer while waiting for my husband who was attending a conference. I sat at the bar and had wonderful service. Got wings with BBQ sauce served on coleslaw which were awesome and a full meal for me. Met up with my husband and returned for him to eat dinner. He got lobster Mac and cheese which was very good and rich. I had triple chocolate cheesecake which was great. There was a fight in the bar - added entertainment ;-) - which was handled by staff and security appropriately well.  I went back for breakfast this morning and had the super fuel omelet and fruit. Excellent. Service was good. Server was busy but friendly and attentive. Great coffee - Peet's !

Santana was awesome. It's a small venue which makes it feel personal. It was poppin'. The next day we went to the gospel brunch. The food was terrific. The music was soulful & uplifting. My kinda place. It was the most fun I've had in Vegas. I'm looking forward to enjoying more music at this venue this time around in Vegas.

I've been here twice:  1) Dinner...don't remember what I got (the food was average, and forgettable, apparently).  I remember thinking, "how can THIS, cost THAT much?"  Tasty cocktails, way overpriced (I guess that's because it's in Vegas...).  2) "Salsa dancing" night.  The quotations mean they promote it as being salsa dancing, but really it just turned into a ghetto reggaeton dance club.  NOT what I wanted, and we had to pay the cover charge to get in...very disappointing.
The food was great and reasonably priced.  The wait staff was great.  I only wish they stayed open a bit later so I could get food after 11pm when I'm staying at Mandalay Bay!

Waited 25 minutes for food from the Happy Hour menu and it was marginal at beat.   Told by a server the kitchen was slammed but the main restaurant opened 15 minutes after we ordered.  2 thumbs down for service.

I've been to the House of Blues for a few concerts now, and there are plenty of other venues that offer a better sound quality, especially in Las Vegas.  If you have the opportunity to see a band at another venue, I highly recommend it. The sound quality is awful, so there will be a very low chance you'll understand anything coming out of the singers mouth. It ends up being just a muffle that fades into the rest of the band.

Pretty terrible for breakfast although we had a good burger there the night before. The hostess sat us in a corner because our waiter had a "section."  I'll cut to the chase... the coffee was warm, my eggs were cold and came without sausage. When they arrived they were cold. My wife ordered a three egg omelet that was delivered cold. If there were three eggs in it they were robin's eggs because the omelette looked tiny. I didn't eat anything after the sausages were delivered the second time because (paranoid me, having worked in kitchens I don't trust them when you send food back. An old Japanese soldier, I admit, but I don't do it) the place skeeved me out.  Don't have breakfast there.

The food is ok, I would compare it to an Applebee's or Chiles ect. However I am sitting here right now being totally ignored by our server. I am not one to write reviews, I just don't ever do it. But I am irritated enough that here I am. This our second time here during our stay and the service has been horrible both times, and no they are not overly packed. (If your wondering "why would you go back" its simply because it is the most convenient location to our room, and we have kids) SUPER SUCKY SERVICE. BUMMER.

The main reason to come here is the cornbread, which is simply the best you'll find anywhere. Outside of that, the fare is very average. My baby back ribs were too stringy and didn't have enough meat on them andThe cook tried to compensate by over saucing them with a tangy sticky non spicy sauce.  The beans were good but the gumbo was utter crap! The service was nothing special either. Only come here if you're desperate for cornbread.

Nice location in Mandalay Bay. Good menu selections with high quality food. The happy hour prices are a wonderful value for very good items. We were very happy with the service as well and plan to return when we go back to Vegas.

We ate at the House of Blues Restaurant on 9/12 and we had the NY Strip steak and Lobster Mac and Cheese.  The steak was good and served with carmelized onions, garlic real mashed potatoes and the vegetables were fresh green beans, water chestnuts and tomatoes.  We ate in the restaurant so we could skip the line because we had General Admission seats for the Mr. Speed and The Wanted concert.  At intermission I went outside to have a cigarette and when I came back in I expected to be wanded etc. checked for items not allowed. We have been here numerous times for concerts and I've never experienced a Security Guard who took my cigarettes out of my small purse, inspected my cigs. and he was rude.  This really upset me and my guy.  We may not return.
Went here for lunch  My friend had the burger & loved it  My salmon was ok nothing special.  The cookie was amazing.  Service was good

Second concert I've seen here.  Both times I had a great time.  Quickly friendly bartenders tend to you quickly.  All seats are really good to see the stage.  I had VIP tickets which allowed me on the top floor with a private bartender so I had an even better time than most I imagine. :)  I'd see another show here for sure!
Management from HOB did finally reach out. Faith in people restored.
I love this venue, but lately cosmo has more shows. So until they get indie bands to play here, I'll be at cosma. Plus cosmo has free concerts at book and stage.

AWESOME feel to the place. Came for breakfast. Creamer in the coffee was bad but the staff happily fixed it. Eggs were cooked perfectly and the children's portion of pancakes could feed an orphanage. Bloody Mary was decent and the music of course rocked.

House of Blues is part of the chain started by Dan Ackroyd. The big draw is the live music. Ambience at this location is nice - They have a nice tree right in the middle of the restaurant which makes it different. Tables are spaced out so you're not on top of one-another, but a negative is they play the music SO LOUD. At dinner, when you want to speak to people. Acoustics are slightly disadvantaged in here, I'm afraid...and that makes it difficult to hear your dining companions.
