Our server showed up right away to take our drink and appetizer orders, but it took ages for her to come back. Someone ordered Tequila and she said the "bottle was locked up". Strange. Only one appetizer came out, and the next one came out 30 minutes later. Not acceptable, but the restaurant did comp it. It was the cheese artichoke dip which came out luke-warm. Not worth it, even if it was comped. The person refilling fountain drinks was very prompt however.   The menu. It's all soul food, and seemed very chain restaurant'y. I just had a feeling anything that looked interesting was going to be mediocre, so I had a hard time finding anything I wanted to eat here...so I ordered the fried chicken. It was decent, and not greasy...if unimaginative. Came with mash potatoes and slaw. Potatoes were heavy, slaw was good though. Others in my group ordered burgers or salads. Everyone said it was "OK".  Prices are reasonable for the food, but the food ain't that wonderful. Workmanlike is what I would say. Still, if you like live music and are on a budget, you could go worse. Needs a revamp IMO.

Gospel Brunch in Sin City is so edifying! Growing up in the South, the excellent music and vocals from the Desert Angels (http://www.desertangels.com/) brought back soulful and sweet memories of my upbringing. I was impressed that other Las Vegas locals were also in attendance. Glad there are people open to praising the Good Lawd above while feasting on a Southern-style buffet at the House of God... I mean, House of Blues.

Even with the many entertainment & dining options that Vegas has to offer - I always make sure to stop by HOB either for a great meal or a show (sometimes both).  There's a great variety of menu options - and very reasonably priced.  HOB has many nationwide acts - and periodic residency with Carlos Santana.  I felt the acoustics of the venue were great - and I like the layout - including the standing room area, bars on the side, and additional seating upstairs in the balcony area.  Very cool joint with great characteristics - and great food.  Definitely worth checking out when in Vegas.

We came here for dinner. I had the chicken street taco and sweet waffle potatoes. They were both very delicious. It was also reasonably priced.  Live music starts at 8pm. The only reason that I gave a 4 star was because our server had someone she was training and there were a few awkward moments (I felt she was a little bit rude) with the trainee.  If it wasn't for that, I would have given a 5 star rating.
Didn't like this place on a Sunday night. Really expensive beers and the music wasn't good blues. Seemed more of rock music. Plus there were a lot of weird paintings.
Best breakfast of our trip, thanks to the honest input of our server. After we ate, she took us on a tour of the performance area and VIP spots.

This is just for the food. I wish I could have seen a band here, but was in town for business and just didn't have time. I flew in from KC late Monday night (for my time zone) and missed dinner with my coworkers, so I decided to head out on my own. I was staying at Mandalay Bay, so I didn't have far to go to House of Blues. It's right in that complex.  I asked to sit at the bar. That's usually what I do if i am eating alone. You get seated right away, your server is never far away and the service is usually superb. I was not disappointed.  I asked the bartender for a light, savory gin drink. I can't remember what he called it, but it hit the spot. Then I asked what was good on the menu. Initially he said, "Everything". I said BS to that. Then he asked what I wanted - I said something light, it's late for me. So, he recommended the shrimp tacos.  The food came out pretty quickly. The shrimp tacos were really good. Lots of shrimp, nicely seasoned with a little kick. I asked for hot sauce, but all they had was Tabasco. That surprised me. Didn't this chain start in New Orleans? However, they had some sauce that really highlighted the flavor, so kudos.  I was out in less than an hour. Nice dinner. I'd go back - next time for a concert, hopefully.

More like House of SNOOZE! Get it?! (you get it).   I think Neko Case said it best when she was on stage here: "I like the Beachland about 8000 times fucking more." (Yes, this is an actual quote, and yes Neko Case is this amazing (no duh)).   The HoB is the Applebee's of music venues (they even have kitschy garbage on the walls!) . So if you're into chain restaurants, you'll probably be into the HoB (a chain music venue); which, in all fairness, is FINE - we're all different people who like different things (though, I'm secretly worried about you).    During concerts, the HoB prices its drinks as if it were a sporting event, so get ready to pony up big time.   Also, for those of you who are not aware, House of Blues is owned by Live Nation, which itself has recently merged with TicketMaster (barf). With that in mind, it should come to no surprise that it engages in the deceptive practice of tacking "Service Fees" onto all of its ticket sales. Think you can avoid these fees by purchasing the tickets directly at the venue, instead of online or over the phone? Nope! They apply regardless of the method of purchase.   Under these circumstances, you would think that HoB could simply and honestly include their "fee" amount into the face-value of the ticket; but that would require HoB to not be the absolute worst, which it most definitely is.

I have never been treated like some livestock at the stockyards. The place was over packed, people standing on stairways and blocking emergency exits. God forbid one of the people smoking pot start a fire there would be multiple casualties. Not what time the concert was supposed to start but I'm sure it was late. I will no be back, and only hope other people are concerned about safety and think before you put your loved ones in danger.

We had the pulled pork sliders. They were very tasty and hit the spot. The margarita was ok. Nothing memorable, just a margarita. We ate in the bar to skip the wait. Service was good with some interesting (aka annoying) people watching. We would've gone back after our concert that night but food was shut down already.

I had dinner here Friday May 19th.  I ordered mahi mahi tacos that were either overcooked or past their prime as they were really tough.  To make things worse, the fish was covered with pepper which I think clashes with the natural flavor of the meat.  Beers were Vegas priced but cold.  The beer selection could be broader but, that's why you bring an ice chest to Vegas.  The service was good.

Yeah, so I saw the Scorpions here. So what? You judgin' me? HERE I AM...ROCK YOU LIKE A HURRICANE!!!  Speaking of hurricanes, I'm not exactly sure what the blue frozen thing I got from the bar was, but it was pretty good. I had about two or three or seven of them. Great venue for a show, but by the time I was done with the blue drinks, you could have put me outside by the dumpster and I would have had a blast.   Dinner, though fuzzy in my memory, was a sweet little rack of baby back ribs, mashed potatoes, greens, and a piece of cornbread the size of my face.  The dining room is, like, really big and confusing; make note of where you're sitting before you head off to the can.  Ok, so the Scorpions were having an off night, but I didn't care. Long as the HoB bartenders keep the liquids flowing, you'll have fun. Make sure your credit rating is solid before you tuck in for a long night.

Prices are high at this location but I guess what can you expect for Vegas. My family and I came on a Monday evening right before the 7;00 Cirque Du Soleil show. There was hardly wait, they just needed time to get our table together.   The food was ok. I went to the Orlando location and I felt the food was slightly better. I ordered the lobster mac and cheese and it was ok. It was a little bland and I had a crunch of lobster shell, eww...and no it wasn't the panko topping. My brother ordered the ribs. The meat was tender but he complained of the lack of meat but other than that he enjoyed his dish. My dad ordered their 25 minute to cook buttermilk chicken (and they really do give you warning about how long it takes to cook). I had some and it was also just ok, not sure what all the wait was about. My sister got the pull pork sandwich and I was feeling greedy that night so I tried some of her dish as well. It was really tasty and I will definitely be trying this next time. Overall the food was ok and would be interested in trying out other dishes in the future. Sidenote...the sweet tea was so addictive, watch out!

After a not so happy hour at La Strada, we went here instead because my friend said they got great food and a happy hour menu to look at. The hostess was attentive and listened. The wait staff was much better and Boy was it the best decision made. We had about ten minutes before it was over. They had $2 Blue Moons and 1/2 off appetizers. We ordered the catfish, chicken quesadillas, artichoke dip, and BBQ pizza. It was ten minutes before 7 so we ordered 4 beers altogether. That is what I call happy hour. Great food and drinks! The food was kinda like Southern Cajun food, the catfish and sauce was kinda spicy and the quesadillas had a kick to them. The pizza and dip was okay, I wasn't too much of a fan.   We sat out in the patio so we were able to enjoy the scene and people watched. I would definitely come back here again.

3 reasons to go:  Happy hour till 7pm, $1 beers, $3 'cocktails' (as long as they're made of rum and rum only, bizarrely). Half price appetizers.   The food is excellent. Maybe we got lucky but the burger was excellent, as were the buffalo wings and the spinach dip. I didn't find it that overpriced for the quality (and quantity).   Hot waiters.
Good food, fun atmosphere and great staff! Sweet Potato fries were excellent as was the french dip.

As a music venue, the House of Blues makes up for the spectacular crapfest that the Joint at the Hard Rock is and I'm so glad it's made its way to Vegas.  I've seen countless acts here over the years.  The HOB is always quite good at booking more popular bands and then, every once in a while, they'll book someone I never thought would play Vegas and I just flip my wig.  Most of the time, the ticket prices are very reasonable ($20 - $30, including all fees) and they allow artists to sell their own tickets which is a lot more pleasant than dealing with big ticket sellers.  Drinks are pricey, but not as much so as other venues.  The sound is consistently good.  The levels in the general admission area make it possible to have a good view from just about anywhere.    I'm always checking the HOB site to see what shows are coming up.  It's a delight to see artists in this space.

My review is for the restaurant only.  Seeing all the fancy high priced restaurant in the Mandalay Bay, the House of Blues is a nice option.  Having said that, I've only been once.  The service was slow and the food was just ok.  I was hoping for more but with newer restaurants popping up in the casino or the shopping mall, I really don't find myself coming back here.

So, we went here before a show.  Got seated fairly quickly, and then were ignored for almost half an hour.  Then we finally ordered, and sat there for another forty five minutes.  During which time the server only spoke to us once.  She blamed the kitchen for the delay, but she still only talked to us twice in the hour and fifteen minutes we were sitting there.  Then she finally came back after we told her we were going to have to leave, and she informed us our ticket had been lost.   I wondered why she hadn't checked on it in the forty five minutes since we'd ordered, but whatever.   She said she'd get a manager over to us.  The manager said she'd get our food out in fifteen minutes or just give us our check.  Our check for two sodas and some cornbread.  I was fully expecting them to comp us the sodas or something, but nope.  Easily, from top to bottom, the absolute worst service I've ever had in a restaurant.

The House of Blues is an excellent venue for live music and performances. I recently visited it for Pole Show LA by Leigh Ann Reilly, talented pole dancer and owner of Bespun in Hollywood, CA. The show was fun, sexy, and hilarious. The show itself was a combination of Cirque de Soleil and burlesque shows. Professional pole dancers from all over the world including Russia, France, and U.K. joined American dancers to perform at House of Blues.   The venue has three sections: general admission, bar, and balcony seating. General admission (cheapest seats) was an open area where you stand and can get up close and personal with the performers. Bar seating was on the ground floor level with the bar with parties of 4 around individual tables. Balcony seating is the most comfortable and comparable to regular show seats at a vegas show and thus the most expensive. The seating selections are all very different so depending on what kind of mood you are in for the night, choose accordingly.  House of Blues is located in Mandalay Bay and super easy to find once you enter the casino. You won't miss the big House of Blues signs. I highly recommend this venue for a show or just some drinks to start your night. You can hop right over to the Shoppes to do some shopping, LIGHT to dance the night away or The Foundation Room for a breathtaking view of the Las Vegas Strip!

Man, their drinks are thee best! We had a few rounds. Our waitress hooked us up! Our salads were delicious but the wings were just alright. Still had a good time and the bonus was our photo bomber smiled in our selfie. Didn't notice him in the background until later! Lol

Great wait staff! Food was delicious and was served promptly. We had the fried chicken And loved it. Full stage set in the restaurant creates fun live music. Started at the bar for drinks and a big "mahalo" for the Hawaii bar staff! Nice to have Hawaii friends in different places. Will be back. Take the family!
Great venue for concerts. If you ever get the chance to see a band you like at this venue, I suggest going!  Been here 3-4 times and never left upset!

We just saw Carlos Santana . Tracy was our waitress and was the nicest , most responsive and coolest ever . She even talked with us after the show , after her she was done . Ridiculously enthusiastic about music and super sweet .

Came here for breakfast and were pleasantly surprised while staying at Mandalay Bay. Tucked in the back of the Casino floor, this location was clean, well lit (during the day) and featured friendly and very attentive staff. Definite recommend
Lobster Mac and cheese and cluck in good chicken - one of the best meals at Mandalay!!!

House of Blues is the worst venue. We lined up for a concert at 10:30am the day of the show and got completely screwed over. The House of Blues resteraunt let people that ate there in before of us and they waited an hour!!!! To add to that, they promised us that they weren't doing that for this show. It was 35 degrees outside and we waited the entire day. Highly disappointed with this venue.

We wanted something quick and easy so we stopped in. The atmosphere is cool. Food was ok. We got the artichoke/spinach dip which was pretty good. Served with chips. I ordered a half caesar salad, i ordered regular grilled chicken and think they did blackened so i didnt loved it but it was ok. The regualr order is HUGE. My date ordered a chicken wrap and said it was pretty tasty. So it was good but nothing that blew us away.

Probably one of  my favorite and most frequented venues in vegas. I've seen some great bands and had some awesome times here. Tickets are about average , usually depends on what band you are seeing. The GA level is pretty large with lots of room for fellow concert goers. The bar staff is a friendly bunch. The Sound system is amazing here, always makes for a great show. The lighting is always on point and makes a great display. Security is pretty cool , however they get distracted when the pit goes off and some folks lose their cool. All in all though it's a great venue to see your favorite artist.

What can I say? The House of Blues Gospel Brunch is a great family oriented wonderful experience to be had by all!!  If you are a fan of HOB's famous Mac N' Cheese get it here! If you are craving a home cooked made to order omelet with fresh ingredients get it here!!! Plump juicy link sausages, savory bacon, southern biscuits with sausage gravy!! YUMMM!!   If you are interested in having lunch...juicy tender prime rib, spicy flavorful Chicken Jambalaya and one of the BEST Caesar's salads I have had in Vegas! The salad was crisp and the cheese was plentiful! Not like some of the limp soggy salads I have had in the past.   Now on to the show... energetic, uplifting and entertaining! The female singer could sing her way onto any singing competition and blow them all away! The band The Gastons (I believe that is correct) had some smooth dance moves! Very fun and leaves you feeling with a light heart.  The only reason they did not rate five stars is because on Mother's Day the wait staff seemed a little overwhelmed and we did not get a coffee pitcher refill and the mimosa's were very slow in coming. Other than that a great overall experience!!

I have been to the House of Blues on 3 occasions, and I have never been dissapointed. Last weekend I went to the nightclub to see the 80's cover band "Spazmatics" for a friend's bachelorette party...The bands schtick is that they dress like nerds from the 80's, and they put on an amazing show, it was awesome! The band was great, I was dancing the whole time, the place has a really good atmosphere. We called and were put on the VIP list (the only way to go) so we had to buy a bottle of alcohol and we got a place to chill if we got tired. I liked the crowd, they weren't pretentious, and not too trendy. I would highly recommend this place if you want a cool place to dance, drink, hangout. It's a good mix of people, young, older, I danced with all kinds of people. Love it!

This review is for the restaurant and was posted before they split HOB into music venue and restaurant on Yelp.    Happy Hour Daily 2-5pm  I came in for Happy Hour before going to see Billy Idol.  I love that they have happy hour every day, even on nights they have concerts.  Happy hour is 2-5 but on the night I was there they extended it until 7.  I am not sure how often that happens.  Maybe because it was show night?  I started with a Mango Mai Tai and then had a Pineapple Mojito.  Both drinks were very similar.  I am not sure they weren't the same drink.  They were good though and did the trick so no complaints from me.  I ordered the Cajun Popcorn Shrimp and Pretzel off the HH menu.  Both were OK.  Typical bar food that did the trick.  This wouldn't be my first choice for HH in Mandalay Bay but its great if you are on a budget or pregaming before a show.    In addition to their regular HH menu they have day specific HH specials.  Monday 1/2 off specialty margaritas, Tuesday $6 craft beer, Wednesday $5 bourbon and Thursday $5 Stoli.

Seriously good food! Can't wait to go back! We had TWO orders of their Jerk Chicken Wings and one of the Voodoo Shrimp. So good! Can't wait to go back! Great place to watch a football game too! Big Screen! Loved the decor also. Great place to hang out and/or take a date. Wonderful service!

I came here on a Sunday night before heading back home and was sorely disappointed. I had the babyback ribs which were somewhat tasty but fell below standards that even Applebees upholds. The fries were bland and the iced tea was at a point where not even a cup of sugar could salvage it. The service was so so and I found it obnoxious that they come and take your picture and then try to sell it to you while you're eating. I ate on the side without the music so it was very empty. It seemed like people were having a good time on the other side..but I'm sure it has everything to do with the music and nothing to do with the food.

I ambled over to Mandalay Bay yesterday and tried the House of Blues. I was pleasantly surprised.  The service was excellent and the food was very tasty. I had breakfast and found it filling, hot, and quick.  My only problem with the experience, and I have to say, it's just me, but it was dark and hard to see. All in all, a good choice.

It was nicely air conditioned.  The only downfall is lack of seating.  Most of the venues are standing only.  Not too great when you are standing for hours.  I probably would have stayed through the whole concert if I wasn't already standing during the opening act.

So I took a birthday trip to Vegas this week.   On the last night, we had dinner at here. And in all, it was ok.   Service: our server almost got all of the orders wrong, I ordered a New York strip steak, she almost brought me buffalo strips. That's not even on the menu, I said medium rare, she almost brought well done. I don't get how hard it is to hear me when there's no music playing at that moment and I'm looking right at you. She was wondering around on a not busy night, I had to get up and find her for the check.   Food: steak was great, mashed potatoes were creamy and tasted amazing, steamed veggies needed a lil salt but good either way.   Music: during dinner we caught a show called loop, one guy, playing all instruments, drums, guitar, using a keyboard with record and play back. The show was great, he played some great songs. From journey, to Bon Jovi, Stevie Ray Vaughan. It was really cool.  Other than the server, I liked it.

The place is amazing, location amazing, service is amazing....Jen kicked butt, but the food was pathetic!   Save your money on quality...I had ribs, Hulk Hogan couldn't  break them apart, my wife had a Shrimp Po Boy...dry as the desert around us in Vegas...no sauce and bread is bad....nothing like N'orleans.    Daughter had had a buffalo chicken salad and it was good.   Don't expect much for the price, hit the McDonalds drive through.

The atmosphere was nice, the art is cool, and well... I'll be honest, there were lots of cute servers.  :)  The air was chilly, though, everyone in my group was uncomfortable.  We came in for lunch around noon on a Thursday.  Our drinks came quickly and our orders were taken in good time, the appetizer came in good time but then the entrees took almost an hour to come out.  They said it was the ribs that held everything else up but that didn't make a lot of sense to us; aren't ribs pre-cooked?  The ribs themselves were not a bad deal for a full rack at $24 but were very disappointing.  They were very fatty, they were like half fat and half meat.  I like ribs a lot but I don't like eating mouthfuls of fat.  The meat wasn't very tender, either.  We did really like the jalapeno cornbread which everyone agreed was "weird... but good".  So anyway, after all that wait for the entrees, by the time we ate and paid our checks, suffice it to say we were all very late getting back to work.  I definitely cannot recommend this restaurant for lunch.

We were originally seated in Sec. 200 Row E, which is a side view of the stage and the sight lines were very poor. My girlfriend is 5'1 and could not see 80% of the stage. I could see maybe 50%.   When we asked an usher if we could possible move he simply suggested sitting elsewhere once the show started but we'd have to move if anyone owns those seat tickets.   I also spoke with the box office manager but was informed the show was sold out and all he could do was get us to general admission standing room only section.   We ended up staying in our assigned seats for the first 15 minutes and then moved to some empty seats in Sec. 204 handicap row. These were great seats and showed me that as long as your in the middle sections (204, 300, 400) you'll have a good view of the stage.   I would only go back if my seats were Center sections.

I've been here for concerts and shows but never ate at the restaurant. My boyfriend and I decided to try it out after watching The Lion King. We were pretty disappointed with the small menu and prices. Like many restaurants in Las Vegas, they charge you an additional tax for live entertainment. It's really difficult to carry on any kind of conversation with music blaring.  The service was great but the food was definitely not worth the price.  With entrees being approximately $20, I expected fairly good to large sized proportions. Not great food selections and the taste was alright. I feel like I would have been more satisfied from McDonald's.  I won't ever come back for the food.

House of Blues gets some of the best punk rock and indy bands out there. They seemed to pick up where the Huntridge left off.  Nothing in Vegas touches the Huntridge but HOB makes a good effort. The General admission  floor is the way a  a music venue should be.  The figging monster pillars are a pain in the ass for a music venue. The sound is amazing.  They need to get rid of the no studded belts, camera or chain wallets. You have a ton of punk rock bands playing there yet you ban the items they wear?? wake up! Joint, Pearl all allow cameras! How about no flash photography? No photos is just stupid.  You have  a great concept, you would get 5 stars if you would change some policies and chain saw those pillars out and put new hidden supports in! keep up the great music and tweek the policies. Otherwise and great venue.  Ticket prices are perfect! The restraunt I have eaten a few times and its solid but not amazing. Worth it to get something before or after the show but nothing amazing to go eat in my opinion.

This place is the coolest!!  I LOVED the d√©cor, the food, the vibe and every single thing in the adjoining gift shop, too...I could have spent hours up in there....  Came here for breakfast with my husband during our recent anniversary trip in Vegas.  What actually prompted us to eat in the restaurant was my stop in to buy one of their kick-ass t-shirts in the gift shop the day before.  When the girl gave me my receipt she said that if we brought it back the next day we could get 2-for-1 breakfast.  AWESOME!!  : )  So we came back the next morning and sat in their little bar seating area to have breakfast.  I ordered the Traditional French Toast and the hubby ordered a Breakfast Burrito that had eggs, chorizo, chiles, onions and cheese in it.  Both were SOOO FREAKIN' GOOD!!   Nothing particularly special in the preparation....just simply some tasty ass food!    The whole time we were there we kept checking out the cool paintings on the walls and all the Day of the Dead style skull d√©cor...love that stuff.  We took a bunch of pictures, too.    I would love to come back again and try the Southern/Cajun style food they have for lunch and dinner....YUM....maybe check out a show there too!  ; )
Wrong advertisement of concert start time. 1 hour late. Please be considerate of others esp if you are in standing section.

Came here for lunch, it was southern comfort! Full with Mac and Cheese, Pull Pork Sandwich, Fried Butter Milk Battered Chicken and Grilled Marinated Chicken Breast. None had any complaints, just full stomachs!

I was here on 1/15/17 to see and meet three bands -- Falling in Reverse, Issues, and Motionless in White. I got a picture with all three of them and they are very friendly people. :) They blew the roof off this venue. I was at the very front row, REALLY close to the stage and this lady comes up to us and hands us a free water bottle. I have to say, this was a smart idea as I was in the same spot for about four hours. I'm definitely coming back for more concerts in the future.

Entertainmently, this place is the bomb in Cleveland. You get to see your favorite bands up close and it's not very expensive. Food and drinks are a little expensive...expect to pay $4.00 for bottled water.  Corporately House of Blues is very strict when it comes to professional videotaping concerts. Only certain things can be taped for a certain time, if you are lucky. Professional photography seems to be the easiest way to get in with House of Blues if you're in broadcasting. Back stage passes aren't too hard as long as you can contact band managers. I've been offered upper floor seats with free food and drinks before for having press passes.  If you're looking to have a fun day in Cleveland, eat at the House of Blues restaurant, get front stage passes, then see Flogging Molly this February.

I was contacted by management a few times, a lot of small talk and placation, no real substantive effort to address my concerns in any way.  Worthless place, do not go here.  And if you do, take your chances

Love this venue so much I take a road trip from Pennsylvania to attend concerts. They are one stop entertainment you can have dinner, drinks and see a show at the House of Blues Cleveland. They have good food and drinks in addition to a versatile line up. Love that they cover all genres of music with affordable tickets and some of the tickets are on Groupon for additional savings. I've had dinner and the jalapeno cornbread is outstanding. The Hurricane is good and you can buy shot glasses in the souvenir shop. They have an entrance from the restaurant to the concert venue. So it makes it very convenient to go enjoy the music. I have been to standing room and sat in the balcony for concerts. They are all great experiences so you can't go wrong. You can buy tickets online and use your smartphone or print them for concert entry. This is a great time so check it out then hit E 4th Street for additional drinks and good times.

The food at House of Blues is good, but nothing to write home about. I especially like the cajun dishes though. We went during happy hour so the drinks were by far the cheapest of our weekend in Vegas. After the meal we went to the venue to see Megadeth. THIS is where HOB really shines. So much better than the Joint in Hard Rock where we saw Muse the night before. Cheaper too. If you buy balcony seats there's a cocktail waitress that comes buy to take drink orders. Emphasis on seats! You can stand if you like but it is awfully nice to sit during a long show, especially during the lull of a set change. Plus, (and I know I'm a wimp for saying so) balcony seating keeps you out of involuntarily being dragged into the pit, which is really helpful when seeing a band like Megadeth. Best priced tickets you'll find in this area.

**VENUE REVIEW ONLY***  As a concert venue, HOB in Mandalay is pretty decent.  It's set up exactly the same as other HOB's, with the pit on the bottom floor surrounded by bar space, and seating upstairs.  I personally like the upstairs seating, because there is nothing worse than being a short person in a pit setting.  I've been here for a Nas show and to see Common and N.E.R.D. and both were outstanding - the artists really had the crowd dancing in the aisles and on the chairs.  Price wise, both concerts were reasonable too.  My only complaints for HOB : 1. It is a non-smoking venue (WHAT??!?!?!  This is freakin Vegas, everywhere should be smoking allowed) and there is no where to duck off too in between sets to get in a drag (unless you go all the way out to the casino floor or are brazen enough to ignore or subvert security and risk getting the boot) 2. the drinks!  friggin ridonculous!  i paid 18 dollars for a 'rita, including tip.  and it was nasty! (how do you %$*& up a margarita is beyond me).  trust me, drink before you go or strap something to your leg (no i don't remember if i went through a metal detector to get in, so do the latter at your own risk) :)

5 starts for both food and as a concert venue.  We saw Santana here and then came back another day to have breakfast. (Just plain breakfast, not Sunday Gospel Brunch.)   As a concert venue, it feels intimate. There really isn't a bad seat, of course, they aren't many actually seats. You stand here or you paid a lot of money for one of the few tables. But by being mostly standing room only, it makes you more involved. You are moving. You are dancing. This is good.   The food is great. Eggs benedict here. And the chicken caesar salad I had right before the concert at the bar was much better than I expect from the bar food section.

I've seen three shows here and one gospel brunch. It's a great venue. Seems like there isn't a bad seat in the house. I like the balcony, short drink lines and restroom lines every time I've been there.  Gospel brunch was awful. Very loud, very Jesusy, and the food was terrible compared to the food in the restaurant. I couldn't get out of there fast enough. I only went because we had free tickets, but I think we still overpaid.

would not do again. Was sooooo disappointed in the food!!! I also expected a complementary mimosa or bloody Mary..but alas it was serve yourself at the bar OJ and tepid coffee. There was no table service..but they wanted you to tip...I don't get it.

After 10pm there are not many dining choices, so we went for a late dinner after a show.  There was a band playing, so it was extremely noisy (of course).  The food and service are just ok - typical bar food.  But, the people watching was quite entertaining!

Very cool venue for concerts.  We saw Billy Idol here and enjoyed every bit of the concert.  Billy can still rock, even at 60.  First time at the House of Blues and I honestly could say one of the coolest small venues for concerts.

My experience at the house of blues was less than great to say the least. It was a Saturday night so the hour wait wasn't a problem, what was a problem was that the host wanted either a drivers license or credit card for the table pager. I wasn't comfortable giving either of those items to host at a restaurant for a pager; when I declined both hosts working got rude stating I could wait if I like but if I wasn't there when they called I would lose my table which is understandable. After about 45 minutes we checked in to see if there was an update about our table again the host was rude telling me they had 15 minutes and the exact time that they had to get us a table. When our table was ready they sat us right in front of the live band, which was so loud we couldn't even order or communicate with our server. We asked our server if we could move back slightly which she accommodated with no problem. Our server was amazing and I would enjoy her serving me anytime.   Now lets talk about the food.... Lets start with the chicken I was served... First I'm not sure it was even chicken because the size of the leg and breast I got were so tiny.... When I cut into it and got passed the skin I'm pretty sure the chicken wasn't cooked... It may have been the poor lighting but the chicken just didn't look right.... My moms chicken wasn't much better than mine, but she was able to eat hers... The server offered to remake my chicken but I was already too turned off to try another attempt at it, so instead I ate a side of mashed potatoes. Everything else that came from the kitchen was ok and just ok.... Nothing stood out as amazing or spectacular...  Oh and if there is a band playing they also charge an entertainment fee... Which is a bit unreasonable since the band made it so you had to scream across the table.   So if your looking to be treated rudely,pay for overpriced cafeteria food, and not be able to communicate with your group then this is your place....
The Mac and cheese is GREAT. If you like M & C at all... just trust me and try it.

I was really impressed with this House of Blues location. Reservations on a Saturday night for a party of 6 were hassle free, and the live band was phenomenal. The atmosphere is lively, service is friendly, albeit very slow, and the menu is diverse enough to satisfy any palate.   The restaurant is loud and lively with the band, the random people dancing in between tables, and the merry diners getting sustenance to get them through a night in the casinos or clubs.   I like that the have an extensive selection of entrees on the menu. Everything from salad to pasta to tacos, burgers, sandwiches and even meat and potato dishes. We shared a spinach dip appetizer for the table and it was on point. The entrees were very typical of the quality of chain restaurants, and everything was edible. Not exceedingly delicious or memorable, but edible.  It's certainly one of the most fun, fairly priced and easy restaurants to eat at in Mandalay Bay.

FIVE STAR REVIEW ALL AROUND FOR CROSSROADS AT HOUSE OF BLUES!  We were at the Mandalay Bay - in Las Vegas for VIP treatment!  Hats off to Brian Kline, Director of Vendor Operations Manager for House of Blues, which Crossroads is part of! Brian made our weekend spectacular for a weekend of good food - and Santana!  WOW!  Went with my husband David, and son Brian ...and from Brian Kline to  the Supervisor, Melody Patron who made us feel we were royalty, and to our servers, Blade at Crossroads who was courteous, gave us great insight on the menu.  From the scrumptious Voodoo Shrimp and corn bread to the mouth-watering bourbon pudding....our taste buds were soaring!  And our wonderful and kind Chris Jones who was our server liaison at the House of Blues...terrific!  The music, the ambience, the food and the great Santana LIVE show...HEAVEN!!! We never want to leave! Thanks you Brian, Melody, Blade and Chris for giving us a weekend that WE SHALL NEVER FORGET! We will be back! Jeri, David and Brian! If we could have given this a 10 STAR ....we would have!
Great Louisiana style atmosphere! Breakfast was excellent! Would go back again to try their lunch/dinner menu! Service was excellent!

This was my first visit to HOB Vegas.  What a great venue for watching a concert.  Viewing options included standing directly in front of the stage, lower floor seating around the outer rim of the venue and upper level seating.  I opted for the standing section.  WOW, two feet from the stage and thumping sound all night long.  I was surprised by so many people lighting trees in the house.  Would I see another concert at a HOB, HELL YEAH!!!

From 10/23/15  We came to The House of Blues for Korn and Suicide Silence. The House of Blues is located at Mandalay Bay, and not hard to find once you are in the casino. We got our tickets the day of the show which resulted in us having to be in the nose-bleed section, totally our bad- haha!  Once we were upstairs, it wasn't too bad, as a matter of fact the view from the 3rd floor was pretty decent. Drinks are reasonably priced, and there is a server walking around taking food plus drink orders.  I had a good experience, and will be coming back for more concerts in the future

There is a lot to this place with music and brunches. This review is for a normal dining experience. I've been here three times over the past couple of years.  Breakfast: I liked breakfast here, but the service was slow. Take-out lunch: Walk up to the bar and ordered. The food took forever, but the bartenders were cool.  Dine-in Lunch: This knocks the place down from 3-4 stars to 2 stars. I had cajun shrimp salad that was almost unedible. Whatever they used for the dressing, they put it on too heavy. For some reason it was really spicy. I like spicy, but this dressing was basically medium spicy followed with a taste of nasty. I'm sure it would have been much better if it was only lightly coated. The service was again, very slow.  Overall, the food is nothing special. It would be a much better option to walk over to Border Grille, Citizens, Fleur or even Lupo.

Ate breakfast here on our way out of town. Chose it out of convenience at we were staying at THE Hotel. Was told wait was 15 minutes or immediate seating at the "high bar tables only". We opted for the bar, but at least half the restaurant was empty and the regular tables in the same section were completely empty (the high tables are very uncomfortable for me to sit at because of back problems and also for the husband who is very tall).  The server was very prompt and friendly and brought coffee right away. However, we did wait about 25 minutes for our food.  The food was tasty, but my omelet had a wrong ingredient in it and I was brought toast with no jelly or butter. My husband said the corned beef hash was better at Red, White and Blue (also in MB hotel), and his poached eggs were not really poached at all (not runny but solid).  We were on a time crunch so we didn't have my order corrected and I borrowed jelly from the table next to me.  For Vegas, the prices are pretty reasonable. I will probably try another place next time.

Saw a $5 off coupon for $25 spending. We  come for breakfast.  The breakfast sampler is a good portion. It has everything. Sausage, bacon, eggs, hash browns and two big pieces of pancake. All dbelicious.  The breakfast omelet is done great also. You can choose three items. We had smoke salmon, Italian sausage. Very good combination.  Services are prompt and nice.   Ps. The coupon can be easily found on some tourist information pamphlet

My boyfriend surprised me with a pair of tickets to a show that was playing in this venue. I've never been to a House of Blues before so this venue was pretty exciting, it was a restaurant on the front but around the venue there was a back door leading to some stairs and as you walk below you approach a hall. It was really nice, the stage was large and there was a second floor to go up and sit. This place had three bars and they served food as well, we had burger sliders and crocodile bites ( it does taste like chicken). To drink I had few beers and a "Adios"... will you believe me that everything else was all smiles, kisses and plenty of good times. :-D  The band was intense we had loads of fun and the people here were wild.. funny wild if you ask me I had such a great time looking forward to another show.

I've been to 3 shows here since moving to Las Vegas in August.  Falling in Reverse in January, Social Distortion in March, and Billy Currington in April.  This venue was perfect for each of them because it's big enough that a lot of people can fit and really enjoy the music but small enough that there's not a bad view anywhere and you can really vibe with the artist.  General admission standing room tickets are usually cheapest and for us they're usually just fine.  You don't really have to arrive that early (no more than an hour) to get a great spot.  For Falling in Reverse, we arrived at the same time the doors opened and stood in about the third row.  For Social Distortion, we arrived about an hour and a half early and stood in the very front. Security here is usually awesome and is able to stop any fights before the get out of hand.  The only problem that I have is that when the doors are supposed to open, people start going through the security line (pretty basic metal detector wave and quick purse check) only to stand in what appears to be another line for the actual doors to open.  This wouldn't at all be a problem except there's a large area but everyone stands in a single, respectful line.  Every time, security comes through and asks everyone to fill in the rest of the space.  This causes people from the back of the line to be able to move up in front of the people already waiting and someone always gets mad and picks a fight.  It doesn't make much sense considering everyone has to file through a relatively small entry way.  Just be prepared for this and move up as much as you can! On most occasions, we grab dinner at the restaurant after and it's always a fun, upbeat experience.  I'm not sure the exact schedule but I believe they have live music Friday and Saturday nights at least.

This review is for the restaurant only.  Easily the worst dining experience I've had in Vegas.  Came for lunch with four other friends.  Waited 30 minutes (yes we should have left), kept being told our table was being set up and then waited longer.  And they asked for a drivers license for some reason? (yes we should have left!)  Our waiter seemed frazzled and rushed the whole time, and it didn't really seem that busy.  We waited over 10 minuted for our drinks (four waters and a Diet Coke).  My cobb salad was actually good sized and tasty but the rest of my party wasn't so lucky.  The street tacos are a joke, a tiny tortilla with one piece of bland chicken.  The mac and cheese was actually tasty, but the sandwiches my friends' got were all meh.  Oh, and the water was gross for some reason?  We had to get lemons to be able to drink it.  The waiter was maybe the worst I've had; never checked on us, no refills and was even openly annoyed when I gave him a hundred dollar bill for my twenty-something dollar check.  Come for a show, but go ANYWHERE else for lunch.

This review is for the buffett at the Sunday Gospel Brunch.  It was awful!  Almost all of the dishes that were supposed to be hot were cold by the time I got back down to my seat.  The brisket was completely charred black on the outside and very dry on the inside.  Salad tasted wilted as did the fruit.  At a cost of over $60 each, I expected it to be a lot better!  Good thing the gospel singers were entertaining!
Great place to see ashow. I saw Santana here and both the concert and venue were amazing. I was in the standing room only section and it made me feel like i was part of the band. Amazing experience.

THIS REVIEW IS FOR THE CONCERT VENUE ONLY.  So far I have been to HOB twice this year. One was for Hoobastank and the other was for RZA, Wu Tang Clan founder.  First, let me get the negatives out of the way. That way you can end reading this on a more positve note.  NEGATIVES:  Security says you cant smoke and that you have to go back outside to do so. This is FALSE. The two times I was there people were smoking weed and regular cigarettes. Not once did I see ANY security or usher walking around telling people to put out their smokes. I for one don't smoke but I am not about to be a killjoy by ratting them out. I assumed even if I did, they probably wouldnt do a damn thing about it.   The main floor that's right in front of the stage can get a little messy. What I mean by that is you got people drinking and spilling their beer not just on the floor, but also on other people as well. You will also see pretty much the same people that drink just throw their garbage on to the floor. Talk about litter bugs! Again I for one dont drink but if I did, I would hang out by the bar area to enjoy my suds until I was done. Then I would make my way to the main floor. There should be a rule that you cant drink on the main floor.   The climate to this place fluctuates. Sometimes its rather warm and sometimes it can get pretty cold. Dont know how HOB has their system set up, but its definitely not consistent.  POSITIVES:  The stage has just the right amount of room and is elevated so you can see the performers pretty clear. Since its an intimate setting, you are pretty close to all those that are on stage. Most of my pictures I have taken looks like im pretty much right in front of them so when my friends see the pics, they get kinda jealous because it looks like im so very close to the stage.  The sound and lighting is awesome! When there are some deep bass lines in some songs, you can literally feel the bass pounding right through your body!    So overall, I would say I had an ok experience both times here. Its just that those negatives were still there and it didnt matter who was performing.

We came here for drinks. I ordered a Bloody Mary and my friend ordered Grey Goose and tonic. Drinks were STRONG. I really liked the interior and our bar tender was super friendly. Drinks were not expensive. I would come back and check out the food.
The music was nice, but the cost was ridiculous. Two pastas and a CUP of soup was $81!! We had a $20 entertainment fee attached to our bill on top of the 2 other taxes. I won't be back.

Our group accidentally went to the House of Blues during their 2 to 6 happy hour and it was a great, great deal with a couple hits and misses.  The carribean jerk chicken wings are a big hit! The wings themselves are huge since they are both wing and drumsticks. The seasoning on them is delicious and hits that great balance of spicy, savory, and sweet. I got the beef street tacos and those were a major miss. They were tiny, dry and lacking any flavor. The pulled pork sliders were somewhere between the other dishes as they were a bit dry and not as flavorful but were still satisfying.  The best thing about the whole thing was that the total came out to $25 for 4 dishes. A great value in my opinion that filled us up and was good.  It is also good to note that the menu at the Las Vegas location is an abbreviated version of their other locations.

Had the best time here before a show. Food was delicious and came out crazy fast. Club and burger were both great, hot tasty food. Drinks were quick and our waitress was friendly and accommodating by moving us to be closer to the show. Having dinner here is worth pass the line to get easier access to shows as well! Easy to make a reservation, and they consider dietary restrictions when reserving and confirming!

I give the bar/happy hour a 4. The bartenders are super friendly, dranks are cheap ($3 beers) and the food menu is good. The margherita pizza is delicious. Next door, they have a little club. It wasn't very busy that night (I highly doubt it's a happening place), but it's a great place to go if all you want to do is get your dance on.  The restaurant on the other hand is a hot ass mess. 1 star. Me and the fam went for lunch and we were pretty excited because the menu was created by Aaron Sanchez (foodnetwork chef). My mom ordered the fish of the day, my dad got the rib eye, cousin got te lobster Mac and cheese, bf got the Jamaican burger and I got the juicy lucy burger. First off, we waited forever for the food.. But I'll let that slide because there were 5 of us. Second, the food finally came out and my cousins lobster Mac and cheese was sans lobster. And lastly, my mom found a piece of plastic wrapper in her veggies. We called the manager over and told him about the lobster and the plastic. All he said was that  the kitchen was learning a new menu and that he'd send some new veggies and take care of it. Then the waiter gave us the wrong check and my mom never got her side of veggies. But at the end of the day, we got 50% off our bill.   The rib eye was super tender and yummy. The juicy Lucy burger was tasty and a fattie and the bf love his burger. The fish of the day was swordfish, but it was a tiny ass serving, the size of a toddler's palm. The lobster Mac and cheese is also yummy, but make sure they don't forget the lobster.   All in all, I definitely won't be returning to the crossroads restaurant. The food is ok/good but the service is THE WORST. The part that bothers me the most is that no one was apologetic about anything. But I'll probably go to the bar for a cheap beer.

Food was good. Kudos to the kitchen. Service on the other hand- absolutely terrible. We had a large group of 20, and all we got was a rude lady who said she was just helping out, messed up orders, and empty drinks. You would think with the reservation, they would have their stuff together. Will not be coming back. Too bad cause I like HOB.

Great venue for a show. Can get somewhat claustrophobic if it's a sold out. Toward the end of the show, I headed to the 2nd level to get some space. The video monitors could definitely be updated and larger.

We came to the world famous Gospel lunch for Mother's Day. It was very ok. The table seating was a bit squished. The food deserves a 2. It was tasteless and there was no attention to detail. They forgot to put our cream cheese for the lox and cream cheese bagels, for example. They had no gravy by the carvery station and the meat was dry. The fruit/ pastry station was very under-catered.  The mac and cheese, which was next to the scrambled eggs and no where near the omelette station, were cold.   The show itself was ok too. You couldn't really hear the singers all that well. I thought it would be more fun.
Like the size of this place. Been to a ton of shows here. Always good time. Used to go for service night on Sundays. All around a cool place for locals
Well... came for a late lunch here after a trade show... probably not the best time to experience the place. While the food was not bad, it was far from memorable.

I booked a last minute trip to Vegas when I found a cheap plane ticket and realized my (second) favorite band, Steel Panther, was playing that weekend. As much as I love Steel Panther and not much can ruin one of their kick ass shows...I kinda hated this venue.   The night started off rough when I was forced to remove my belt and check it for $3 (or I had the option to "bring it back to my car"...because...yeah right. Everyone cabs in Vegas, and my hotel was a mile and a half away). My belt was studded but the studs were flat and definitely weren't going to hurt anywhere. And yet security didn't confiscate my bracelet with huge spikes, which, according to the sign I saw upon arriving, was prohibited. Dumb.   The actual space inside has a lot of character, but if you like to be in the front row like me, the stage is awkwardly high, (a foot or so above eye level, and I'm 6'0"), which makes for an uncomfortable viewing experience. Drinks are also outrageously expensive -- even for Vegas. If you want to be tipsy for a show, don't bother trying to do it here. $11 for a shot of their cheapest rail whiskey (and it was an extra small shot glass, too) was just ridiculous. I get that it's a concert venue in Vegas so it's gonna be pricey...but I was shocked.   Of course, Steel Panther always kicks ass. They have so much energy and are so freaking funny. It was my fifth time seeing them (I'd seen them in 3 other states and 4 other venues previously), and I was really sad to see their set cut short. They changed up their set and played all the songs I'd never heard live before, which was super cool, but then they cut their set short! I don't know if that was a House of Blues policy or something, but the show ended pretty early (around 12:30)...and there was no encore! First time I've seen them that they didn't return to do an encore and play Community Property and Party All Day. I was pretty bummed. I could've watched them play for hours more. Also Steel Panther shows always get wild and inappropriate and a little nude, but the House of Blues apparently has stricter limits on what they'll allow compared to other venues.   If a band I love is playing in Vegas and they're only playing here, I suppose I'd return. But it's definitely not my first choice for a venue.
Had a very good experience had a waiter named Anthony was right on top of things great server.. And great food will be back
Went here for breakfast. Food was great. Service was great. Price was great. I've heard this place is very lively at night as well. Would definitely recommend.

Not a fan of this venue.  The Standing Room Only concept, and when there is empty tables, doesn't make a lot of sense.  Also, in between the bands, the guests had to wait toooooo long. One of the bands took 40 minutes to setup.

We saw Santana on November 4, 2017 at the House of Blues in Las Vegas. It was hands-down the best concert we've ever been to in our lives! He was amazing, the crowd was excited and well behaved. We were probably 40 feet from him at our VIP seating, well worth the price. The food was great and our service was excellent. His special guest, Quinn Sullivan, is an extraordinarily talented young man. I don't generally like seeing the same person frequently, but I would definitely go back very soon to the House of Blues in Las Vegas to see Santana live in concert.

The first time I was here I had a male server that gave us the poorest service I had ever got in my life! By far the worst server I've seen! I'm a server my self and the things he was doing was absolutely ridiculous! Took him longer than 10 mins to greet us ! Starving and having a short time frame to eat and get to a game we decided what we wanted to order before he had stopped to greet us.. Taking the drink order we had told him that we were actually ready to order food as well. Shortly after taking 3 out of 6 of our orders he tells my aunt " Hold on one second" , than walks away and grabs utensils for another one of his tables and drops it off a couple tables down. After doing that he returns and continues on taking our order. Who does that? Right in the middle of taking our order? Something that should NOT ever be done. My girlfriend and I weren't too hungry so we ordered a salad and asked for it to come out with everyone else's food. Around 7 mins later he comes and drops off the salad to us without everyone else's food of course. Knowing we were sharing he did not give us another plate or any silverware at all! Just simply dropped off the salad and walked away without saying a word. He wouldn't stop by to check on us at all still we had to stop him to ask for silverware..  The rest of the food took a long time to come out after the salad as well. After the food came out he drops it off and never seen again. With empty cups wanting refills again we had to stop him. Not remembering that I had a mango ice tea he poured regular tea in my cup and I told him it was mango. He leaves and returns with a little cup of syrup in his hand and just pours it into my iced tea. Yes I do know that the flavored iced teas are regular tea mixed with flavored syrup but is it professional for your server to just fill your flavored iced tea with a pitcher of regular than just pour syrup on top in front of you? I would never do that and I don't think any server would ever think of doing so. This is the worst service ever.     My gf loves the buffalo crispy chicken salud they got here so we have it another shot and damn... Service is just not that great at all... Let alone being rude, and not friendly in anyway. The first time was a busy but now I really don't want to spend a dollar here with people that are flat out rude. How can you be a server and be rude?

This review is strictly on the entertainment, Santana.  We were really looking forward to seeing and hearing this legend of music.  He was the reason we came Vegas for a long weekend.  Here's a warning if you are thinking of doing the same... Bring your earplugs!  Although it will change the music a little bit, at least you will save your hearing.  The music was much too loud for this smaller venue.  The House of Blues holds under 2,000 people.  This is something the sound engineers need to keep in mind.  This is not a large arena of 20,000+ like where Santana used to perform.  When the first song started, we looked at each other and said it will be fine.  By the fourth song we were holding our ears and had to run out of there because it hurt.  We didn't even say anything to the older gentleman on the elevator about why we were leaving and he said if you think that's loud, you should hear the band downstairs.  So we have to wonder, why so loud?  It's not enjoyable for anyone.

My husband and our friends wanted to eat someplace where we could sit down and relax after a long day, and long walks, so we decided to check out the blues. It was nice. I was expecting a performance, but there wasn't anything going on when we came in, but oh well, their food was still good. The service was great. This is a nice place to come for dinner to relax, chat and sober up. We wouldn't mind coming back here again. I gave it a 4 because it was a little dark in there... I get it, its the theme, but still... I'd like a little more light.

Went to House Blues twice in 2 days. The service is pretty bad.  Dinner on 6/7 we were a party of 12. They acted like they were doing us a favor! Service was terrible! We waited 1 hour for dinner. When I inquired about our food, I was rudely told about the number of people was difficult to accommodate. Give me a break. Any professional restaurant and staff will easily handle double the size of our small party. They had the nerve to add the tip, however referred to it as a service charge. music was unbearably loud.   We returned next morning with bounce back coupons. Manager was a jackass. The servers and hostesses told us he was a control freak, and would not accept more than one coupon per table, never mind we spent $370.00 the night before. We split up our party so we can buy one get one free. Our server took both coupons at our table. He got a big tip!  I spend a lot of time in Vegas, at Mandalay Bay where this Restaurant is located . I won't be going back.   I do not recommend this Restaraunt

I've been here before, but never for their happy hour.  Came here prior to a night of clubbing at Vanity.  The happy hour wasn't huge or anything , but what I did order was super tasty!  Ordered:  Spinach & Artichoke Dip-  Man this was a huge order of chips and dip.  Red chips and white chips ...oh my !!   I love this stuff... one of the best I have tasted.  Buffalo Wings-  $5.00 for a pound of wings... Score !!!  Don't forget the ranch, napkins, extra napkins, and a wedge of lemon to help cleanse your hands of the buffalo scent.  The power of citrus ...amazing !!  Blue Skittles Shot-  This was not on the happy hour, but it was recommended by my server.  It really did taste like a Skittle!  I wonder if there are other shots that taste like the rest of the rainbow?   He let me keep the shot glass too!  Heck yeah !!  I recommend this place for cheap Happy Hour on the strip.  Great value!  Free shot glass, good recommendation from the server, cheap happy hour, awesome Spinaach Dip and Wings... how can I not give them a 5?

Every HOB is the same, right?  Not true.  Instead of the standing room everywhere downstairs deal that I'm used to, these guys have added a few "VIP" areas where one could sit down and/or get bottle service.  Man, this VIP/bottle game has gotten toooo ubiquitous here in the City of Sin.    So we were here to see Steel Panther on a Fri night.  Not too bad a line and I coughed up for the first round of drinks while the others found us a place from which to watch the show.  Just below us are totally unoccupied comfy couches guarded by a helpful gentleman who said that for $300 we could sit and get a bottle of hooch and mixers.  Nay say I, besides, we're drinking beer.  Roll up the sleeves, here come the negotiations...  Long story short (too late) we got down to $150 and it comes with a $100 bar tab.  Still we walked on the deal--two of our members were not drinking by that point.  Anyhow, decent show (though long on the banter and mucho sampled backgrounds) and a decent sound in the venue, but I have one more complaint.  While I was...um...making room for another beer I noticed that Fridays were $6 24oz Bud Lights.  Since I had been paying $11 for 24oz Coors Lt I decided to switch.  Ordered up 3 and was told that it would be $33.  I reminded the tarbender of the ad in the bathroom and he said that was the 12oz cans.  Aw, fuggetaboutit.

I've always walked by and finally decided to try it out. First things first, the drink selection is not that great. I ordered the strawberry smash and my friend got a vodka soda with grapefruit and lemon. They brought us out two identical looking drinks, both with strawberries and one with lemons. I am 99% sure they put the lemons in the wrong one and have her my drink. We had to switch. The food selection was average, not too many "lunch" meals if you weren't looking to spend over $20.  We all got the street tacos with house salad. The salad was amazing, but the tacos were bland. Not in any rush to go eat here again.  But hey they gave us free show tickets and the presentation was nice.

What can I say about the HOB. It's alright. It's across from a parking garage, which is convenient, if you can't find street parking. It's got a lot of cool art work scattered about. Dark lighting that sets the mood. Drinks are crazy expensive. I usually pregame or make bae buy my drinks. I don't like that they have ladies in the bathroom handing you paper towels when you are done washing your hands (if you wash your hands) I always tip, but it gets expensive because I am always peeing. If you don't tip they get sassy with you. When it comes to bands playing, the sound usually sounds good. Light show isn't gonna  put you in a seizure.  When they over sell a show it sucks to move around. I just saw Against Me there for the hundred time and it had the perfect crowd. Not too over crowded. Usually when I see Flogging Molly here you can barley move, and it ruins the show.  If you're reading this and going to the house of blue, one word of advice PREGAME! Booze is expensive as hell.

Saw Hanson on October 25, 2017. Definitely go with a VIP table! The table cost $75 a person. Goes and a group of two or a group of four. So it will range from $150-$300 depending on how many people are in your party. That is not bad to have a spot at a very packed concert. Not only do you get a table but the best part is if you are a couple of two you paid $150 but you get a food and drink credit of $150 and if you are a group of four he paid $300 and you get a food and drink credit of $300. Definitely would recommend it because the price of the drinks and if you want to eat would equal that. Go VIP all the way!
Good food and good music is a winner any night. They bring in some great bands and keep the resturant on top par with most strip favs
Aaron and Kenny are great at the bar and our server Leah was fantastic. Would recommend anyone that comes to Cleveland to visit.

Hit up House of Blues for Lunch, while in Vegas...Ambeince  great, service was good, restaurant was actually fairly busy for a Monday afternoon.  Food was just ok, not great.  We got the Shrimp Po Boy, Gumbo, Blue Burger, Blackened chicken Sandwich and Kids Mac. Decent portions, just not a lot of flavor... but lets face it theres better eats in vegas and your not stoping here for the culinary excellence, its the music, drinks and location!  Have fun play hard its vegas baby!!

So Apparently, we never got the memo about the kick ass Harry Potter theme that we underdressed for, as we casually rolled in for what we thought was going to be a typical Vegas strip lunch experience... But my girlfriend and I were blown away by the energy and vibe that HOB was putting out that day!! As a previous service industry major, with a minor in crazy OCD anal retentiveness employee myself, I usually am often let down by the servers and bartenders I encounter in this transient town.... but, on this day, the clouds parted, the universe aligned,  and my friend and I were introduced to Daaaaavid!!! He was fantastic from the time we sat down until we finally had to leave! Charismatic, witty, helpful, funny and most importantly HAPPY to be there!!! He was all decked out in Harry Potter attire, but didn't over do it by trying to BE Harry Potter... our food was perfect, the atmosphere was fun and inviting, we had great conversation with meaning, depth, laughter and positivity! I'd just like to say to the management, that this guy needs a promotion! Definitely recognition for being a model server- he's an asset to any place he goes... my friends totally in love with him I think LOL! I'm glad we decided to have lunch there, although, we had much more than something to eat... we had a kick ass experience!! Definitely will be back!

Went here to see Norm MacDonald - funny bastard, degenerate gambler extraordinaire and hopeless alcoholic - not to mention a FUNNY BASTARD.  Drinks were overpriced, but what do you expect.  Best part of the night was when the ghetto fabulous mafia appeared late for the show with their cheap dial-a-dates...even the housewife next to me in the balcony started laughing when they appeared in their plastic Payless pumps and non-flame retardant ensembles.  I guess the old saying, what happens in Vegas stays in Vegas, doesn't apply to chlamydia - and that's not the name of a stripper at the Spearmint Rhino.
Only reviewing the drinks here- expensive and the margarita tasted like there wasn't any tequila in it. Will definitely not be back.

I'm giving only one star because I am extremely disappointed with the service. I arrived with a party of nine and waited an hour and ten minutes JUST for the appetizers. In fact, our appetizers arrived with our dinner orders. Also I ordered a salad and added a meat but my salad arrived without the meat. By the time my grilled salmon arrived, my salad was gone. And the Salmon was salty. The food choices looked delicious but if you're hungry and in a group, you'd be better off going to McDonalds.

Went there for dinner with some friends.  I was not impressed at all.  The shrimp appetizer was OK.  The jambalaya was spicy hot (good) but mostly because it was swamped with black pepper (bad).  All I tasted was black pepper.  Service was slow and I never got a refill on my drink or even my water.
Be sure to ask how big the portions are! My wife and I could have split one order and still left food on the plate. Great value for breakfast.

All of my worst concert experiences lie here, except the most recent being manageably okay at the Tyler, The Creator concert. However, after slithering out of the pit and resigning to the side, my group and I settled for the view despite having done pass the line. The reason for the two stars is that nearly ALL my photos were ruined by the huge head of the guard. So disappointing. I understand the reason for him - for safety and whatnot, but you'd think they wouldn't put the biggest guard in the way of at least 20 people's view. Don't bother paying for pass the line unless it's the most mellow show ever, because the GA in this place is like a pit of doom. Don't expect to SEE a good show past the extreme moshing and huge guard heads. Despite the signs they don't pull people out for pushing or smoking weed. If the artist is going somewhere different, AVOID the House of Blues. I know I will make an effort to.

Ate at the restaurant at this hob location for the first time. I work at the house of blues San Diego so it was interesting to get out of my zone and visit another venue. Jessica was our waiter and she was great! She was very sweet and attentive. She gave us everything we needed and more. Drinks were always filled and she was always around if we needed anything. She also let us know that they had pretty good breakfast which we are going to take advantage of tomorrow morning. Thanks Again Jessica!
Great food and great service from Ahna. Came in for breakfast last Saturday. Breakfast was fast and I was happy for affordable breakfast
Awesome food. Awesome service. Susie Q was the best!  I had the rosemary chicken and potatoes.  Top notch

I love seeing concerts at the house of blues.  The acoustics are less than perfect but the small venue size and close proximity to the stage makes up for that.  This last visit was for the Pennywise concert on March 16.  Checking in thru security was swift and they were all quite pleasant.  Once inside it was packed which is to be expected with a band like this with such a huge following for the past 25 years.  It was a great time!  The bartenders were efficient despite being slammed.  The one I dealt with took the time to greet me AND thank me after serving me and taking payment.  I know that's trivial but in atmospheres like this those types of qualities general get forgotten about.  One other thing I enjoy about HOB is the security (while ever present especially at this type of concert) are not over-bearing.  They realize that at this type of show it's going to get rowdy, there's going to be a mosh pit, there will be crowd surfing and people will be getting knocked down.  Goes with the territory and that's what I enjoy for this type of show.  Don't worry all of you more timid concert goers...there's plenty of seating upstairs or standing areas around the floor that are out of the mix.  This past experience receives 5 stars from me given the fact that I know going into it that the following will occur:  I will have beer spilled/sprayed on me, my shoes will get trashed, I will be sweaty and I will encounter a few dicks with attitudes...All goes with the territory.  If you want a peaceful experience, go see Celine Dion or something.  Otherwise come to HOB and get rowdy and support bands like this!  Danzig, April 17...see you then!
Best shrimp and grits I've ever had and I had a ginger mint mango drink that blew my mind!!!

While in the Mandalay Hotel, my associate and I were in the mood for a burger. The House of Blues was our choice; a chain restaurant which has live music halls and are in major markets throughout the United States. The burger was great and so were the fries.

I saw Coheed and Cambria here.  This place lost a star for a miscommunication about their front of the line pass.  They have a $20 pass you can buy to enter the music venue first.  You buy one per person and you go. This pass is good for the store or the back bar.  This seemed like a great idea to my mom and I, as we were planning on drinking first anyway.  We went to the bar and got each of our $20 worth of drinks... and then they say that you can only use one $20 front of line credit per party.  So... what is the point of getting them?  Our bartender went to the ticket booth to make sure that we even needed to buy two of them... turns out we did need to buy one each, but we can't use them?  It all worked out in the end but ugh it was a fiasco.  Absolute fiasco.  The reason that I still gave them the 4 stars is because we did have an amazing bartender, and the venue wasn't overcrowded.  I go to shows and concerts in Los Angeles.  I've seen Coheed and Cambria many times in LA and lets face it, I'm not a spring chicken.  So its getting harder and harder to enjoy the music with all the violence.  In Vegas it wasn't overcrowded and security was on it.  The music was amazing, the show was long, and it was air conditioned!  As for our bartender, after the show we went back for more drinks.  She asked what I wanted and I told her I wanted something fruity but refreshing.  She asked one more question, and that was "do you like ginger?" I say yes, and she makes me the most delicious peach/ginger drink i've ever had.  AND she wrote down the recipe so I can have it made again in the future.  Overall, we left happy.
Went for. Real fast. It was cheaper than most spots but it was not very good. The service was really good and the only reason this place got any stars.

House of Blues gave us our dream wedding!   Jen, Mel, Terri, and the rest of the team were total rock stars from start to finish. All along, we knew we wanted to have our wedding in a unique venue downtown. The House of Blues is just that. The Cambridge room is ornately decorated and has a super cool vibe. Jen was so easy to work with. She guided us through the whole process and made sure everything was perfect for our vision. Mel & Terri were invaluable on the day of the wedding. They made sure everyone/everything was taken care of and the bridal party was where they needed to be. They anticipated any and all of our needs and kept this anxiety prone bride completely stress-free.   We loved being able to use the Foundation room before and after the ceremony. It was great to have some time to breathe and celebrate with our bridal party. The food and drinks were just divine! We went with the adobo fried chicken and bbq pulled pork. Our signature drink was a "Married" Moscow Mule.   On top of all this, we felt that House of Blues was a great value for our money. It was one of the more reasonably priced venues downtown but absolutely no detail was spared. Overall, I'd recommend the House of Blues to any couple looking for an impeccably unique and totally "Cleveland" wedding experience.

I went to the House of Blues for the Sunday Gospel Brunch "Kirk Franklin Presents" The food was absolutely outstanding with the unlimited mimosas and bloody mary's. The music was phenomenal. I only gave it 4 stars bc I believe the show was rather short. The choir only did a few songs. But other than that it was an awesome show. I would definitely consider going back next time im in Vegas

We actually went to because my niece wanted to get a t-shirt from a band that was playing there that night. I want to say Sting?  Anyway, we decided to stay for a few drinks before walking back the to the other end of the strip.  Turns out it was Karaoke night with a live band.  The House Band was great!  Most of the singers were pretty good.  It was just the drunk older women that didn't sound as good but they still had pretty high entertainment value.  LOL!  Would I return yes I would and I would recommend this place to friends.

I didn't order any food from the bar, this review is for the stage/lights. I like this place because its a small enough venue you can see everything on stage. We had GA tickets and were standing fairly close to the stage, to be honest even standing in the very back right in front of the bar is good enough. The bathrooms were clean and had an attendant handing out paper towels. I recommend the House of Blues for any concert- inexpensive tickets, will call made it easy to pick up tickets, small venue, and good sound system.

This review is for Carlos Santana Performance only.  House of Blues music venue is pretty small setup and  when you get seated  it appears you have a pretty good view of the stage.  We were in row 208 section C seats 4-9.  I was in seat 4 and could easily see the front of the stage.  The name of the concert is Santana for the world famous highly skilled musician Carlos Santana.  What we could see was his entire band and a salt and pepper male singing duo.  What we did not see was Carlos Santana, the person EVERYBODY came to see.  Yes he was there, yes he was playing, but he practically hid in the far left corner of the stage 99.9% of the show.  Hmmm, so maybe House of Blues should instruct Mr Santana that the crowd paying $125 per ticket and more(price of our seats) are there to SEE him, not just hear him.  If I just wanted to listen to him I would have watched Youtube.  There was a camera man shooting live for the television screens but even that didn't focus on Carlos.  What I am typing might sound like bitter grapes, but trust me nobody on the left side of the stage was happy, most people were just as bored as me, yawning and not even looking at the stage or televisions.  Well maybe if we had purchased different seats the concert would be better-wrong! We left early and I checked the view from the center and right viewing areas and Mr Santana was very difficult to see from those vantages as well.  Mr Santana was virtually hiding from his fans way in the back left corner of the stage.  Santana's sets were also way too long.  Interesting upbeat music quickly devolved into boring noise as single songs turned into ten minute long ordeals.  Dude mix it up and keep your audience attentive not imprisoned.  I have seen almost every show in Vegas and the only show worse than this was the Legends of Music Tribute show at the Stratosphere which cost $20 and came with a free buffet !  I would highly recommend NOT seeing Santana unless you are a die hard fan willing to pay a lot of money to only hear him play.

This place was horrible... I ordered the meat loaf and have never tasted anything like it. Could not get past the horrible texture of the meat. Our waitress looked and acted like she was spun out. My wife ordered the fried chicken and it tasted like the oil hadn't been changed in weeks. Will never return.
