Rockstar Karaoke is A FRICKIN JOKE!! The D.J. ONLY let's you sing if YOU PAY HIM!! We went with a group of 14 people. All of us ate and drank A LOT! All of us put in for songs. We were there for HOURS and NEVER GOT TO SING A SONG! We spoke to the D.J. and he said if we "took care of him" we could sing. We told him we spent a lot of money on food and drinks and shouldn't have to pay him. He  LITERALLY said "Too Fucking Bad!!"  He is a COMPLETE ASS who should be FIRED!!  We will NEVER, EVER GO BACK THERE AGAIN....EVER! DO NOT GO THERE!! There are so many other LEGIT places to go in Vegas, where you don't have to "take care of the ass" to sing a song after sitting there for hours and hours!!  SHAME ON YOU HOB for hiring such a SLEEZE!!

The food well spiced and tasty. The menu is diverse and the portions are generous...too generous! I must say Aune is the best server we have ever experienced in Vegas. Bright, happy, on her game and glad to be working with her clients...make sure you ask for her when you visit.   The biscuits and gravy rock!

Went to the House of Blues Kirk Franklin Sunday Brunch in celebration of my God-Sister Birthday. **Great Seating, Great Food and of course the Performers(singers) were awesome and a Blessing. We got so involved with participating in singing along and praising God. But only a little disappointed 1. We actually thought Kirk Franklin was going o be there to perform(he was only there video wise) 2. The Food was Great but after the performance it was time to leave, we were like "What" that's it!!!Performance is over & Brunch too, WOW!!! but We stood up, sang, & Praise we didn't really eat our food just nibble here and there. Suggestion: A. It should state on your ticket that Kirk Franklin will not be there personally just by pre-recorded Video. B. If Brunch starts @ 10:00 they should give people to enjoy the brunch till 11:00 from 11:00-12:30 performance, 12:30 continue your Brunch till 1:00= change the time frame of the Brunch,. so those that are thinking about going please be on time to enjoyed your Brunch, Unlike us we were enjoying the Praising and singing . It was all Good we left there not full of good food but Full of the Spirit God is Good.... When I visit Las Vegas I will re-visit the House of Blues Sunday Brunch :-)

Server was engaging and friendly but overall, we won't be back. It was somewhat busy when we arrived around 10:30 on a Saturday morning. 35 minutes to be seated. Ordered beverages and food within 10 minutes.  Almost an hour later, literally 50 minutes, we finally received our pancakes, watery eggs, overlooked bacon and undercooked hashbrowns. Not worth the price and definitely NOT worth the wait.
I had breakfast here and was surprised because food and service was great.  There Bloody Mary's are the best! I had to order 2.     Mia

Went here for a quick dinner before leaving for the airport.  I ordered the fish sandwich, which I thought was very tasty...i got sweet potato fries with my meal and I really enjoyed them. However, I do need to complain about the service.  It took so long for our food to come and also for us to get our bill...not sure why because it wasn't busy.

I gave this place 1 star because it's the lowest I could rate.  I wish I could give it a negative number.  The house of blues for music and entertainment is great.  No issues there, but the food and staff is another thing.  Single worst dining experience in my life.  Horrible food and just plain rude wait staff.  If you come for a show enjoy your night but look elsewhere for dinner.

We really enjoyed our visit to the House of Blues. Everything from the food to the ambience was perfect! We ordered a variety of menu items so we could dine family-style between 6 people. I'm not an expert in cajun-style cuisine but everything I tried, I really loved.   We had: voodoo shrimp, gumbo, jambalaya, blackened jumbo shrimp with fettucini alfredo, and baby back ribs! OH EM GEE, the ribs were spectacular! Tender, moist, and oh so delicious! I was completely addicted to the shrimp fettucini dish. It was served over a bed of alfredo and spicy tomato sauce. YUM! I also got to sample some desserts as well. My faves were the bread pudding and the apple tart. And by the way, the portions are HUGE so be sure to be hungry!  Service is great here...the servers are friendly, efficient, and very good at what they do. The atmosphere was upbeat and fun, with a live band 30 feet away from our table. Can't wait to return to the House of Blues!

The atmosphere was nice yet comfortable. The beer, local IPA, was delicious and the  Jambalaya was delicious. But what made all the difference, was our server Joseph. He was friendly, knowledgeable and came back around at the right time and in the right amount of time. Music was fun.

Great location, great music.  Watched blackberry smoke perform on 3.19.15 and the sound and venue was great. Security was good at checking for weapons coming in which I liked and they were good at not messing with people who were recording the show with cell phones or just having a good time. Crowd was respectful,  staff was nice and enjoyed the vibe, will come back to watch more music here

Our server Michael was very helpful on helping us make our selection.. Myself and my hubby shared the appetizer voodoo shrimp so good! Also for entree we shared Cajun blackened chicken pasta to die for delicious and side Caesar salad.. everything here was really good been here many times and have never ate here absolutely recommend!

Horrible food. The French Dip was cold & they forgot the onions, which was probably for the best. Fries were luke warm & by the time I got to eat them, they were also cold. The house of blues salad was good & the horseradish sauce.  Service was tolerable, no personality & a bit pushy.  This was on a game night, so the place being packed & noisy, loud is understandable, but the terrible food & bland service is not. The food is not worth the price at all.  We also tried to use 10% off thru yelp check in & the server had no clue what to do...training session.  I will definitely not be back. I'd rather pack a brown bag lunch then eat this tripe.  The name sells this place, nothing else.

Awesome venue..clean bathrooms..but I do hate feeling obligated to tip every time I need to use the restroom. The bar was very accessible and had quick service. There was plenty of space even though there was a large crowd. In between sets we were able to head over to a connecting Bar/Restaurant " Crossroads" which had a local singer performing who was really good. Wish we had a House of Blues here in Rochester.

I just love going to the House of Blues. I'm from California and used to go to all sorts of concerts in different locations but this one is by far my new favorite location. This was my first time getting to see Walk off The Earth, and wasn't expecting to be blown away by their showmanship. having seen some / if not all or their videos on YouTube . I knew they were good but wasn't expecting the show to be amazing. Seriously I had so much fun it was the best show I seen in a long while.  Picking my tickets up at will call around 6:15 pm it was super quick and easy, there was literally no line  and  security was just as fast.  When I actually got into the venue I was shocked to see that the house was practically full.  Doors opened at 6 pm and the opening act ( the Darenots)   started at 7 pm.  They Played several songs including a reggae song. Being from Toronto Canada they expressed how excited they were to be on tour and in Las Vegas. In between their performance and Walk Off The Earth I decided to buy a drink at the bar. Sitting almost in front of the bar it wasn't that hard to make my way there and considering it was between sets the bar wasn't completely slammed. So getting my drink was quick. I got a Pabst beer on tap with a few orange slices for $10 the price was fair and the beer was cold just the way I like it.   At 8 pm When Walk Off The Earth took the stage I was genuinely excited & taken back by how the crowd erupted with cheers. Having found a place to sit I was sitting off to the right of the stage i had an amazing birds eye view. In short this concert was the best one I been to in a long time. Walk Off The Earth has a way of getting the crowd hyped and keep the energy going. They have a unique way of using unorthodox objects to create beats. I found their take on major hits such as Ed Sheeran Shape of You  to be amazing, and almost laughable on how they pulled off the beats. I can't express how much fun this concert was and the best part this band decided to donate 10% of the proceeds they make on their souvenir table would go to opportunity village. Simply amazing I didn't buy anything but I dropped twenty in box for charity.

It was bitter cold out - -1 with a windchill and I forgot my mittens, so we were just glad to be inside.    Once in, we came to a realization that we must've been the only non-Pittsburgh fan that were dining at the House of Blues (HoB) tonight.  The place was quite lively - more than what I expected of downtown Cleveland on a weeknight.    The service was decent and prices reasonable.  The food was a typical chain-restaurant type food (think breaded fish and chips, baby back ribs, burgers, nachos, and the likes).  The overall feel? Just another chain restaurant.

I wouldn't go here to eat, but I ate here anyway to get the Front of the Line Pass you can get to enter the music venue earlier than everybody else. At other House of Blues locations, you can buy merchandise to get the pass, but here you have to order at least one entree. My meal was so forgettable, but the service was great all around.  The venue seems bigger to me than other HOBs because they've got a balcony with at least four or five rows of theater style chairs. The floor area is about as big as other HOBs. What made my experience at this HOB better than any of the other HOB locations was the staff there. They were so helpful with asking any questions and the security staff was the nicest I've ever encountered. Really cool security dude helped me get the lead singer's guitar pick. :) I'd give this five stars if they dropped the no-cameras policy.

Made me sick...Literally.  So my husband and I were in Vegas for his birthday and just wanted to catch lunch. So we headed into HOB inside Mandalay Bay because we saw they had Happy Hour from like 2-6.   About 30 minutes after I ate (I had the fried chicken and only ate 2 small pieces because of how drenched in oil it was) my stomach was in knots. I was sick for 2 days!!! Which basically ruined our trip. Never again!!
Not impressed with the menu or food - pricey for what you get ... starting out artist playing music was ok - will not return here

Oh, the House of Blues. This is one of those places you want to love really bad but it just doesn't hit the mark. I'm not going to lie, it has a lot going for it initially - the decor is fantastic, it's a more intimate setting so you can get up nice and close to the band, and it's relatively easy to get to. Plus, who can deny that you feel something special when you tell people that you are going to see a concert at the House of Blues. It's a false nostalgia that, while completely unfounded for most of us, resonates of the great music scenes of days past.  I recently went to see Tenacious D here and despite my overwhelming excitement for the show, the venue had some major flaws (although the band was fabulous!).   The biggest flaw is the layout of the venue. It seems to be set up as a bar first and a concert venue second - which may be ideal for people who go here only to drink (no one) and not quite as ideal for everyone else. The general admission area is surprisingly small, and not in a good way. I usually love the small, up-close venues, but this feels more cramped than intimate. In fact, unless you arrive at least an hour early (which I was), expect to be all the way at the back, where the bar stools, balcony pillars, and everything else is in the way. And if you are lucky enough to be at the front like I was, expect to be violently shoved and dry-humped the entire show (even in acoustic jam sessions like Tenacious D was). I was tossed around less at Slipknot and GWAR concerts in other small venues than I was here.   The most unsuccessful part of the layout is that the floor doesn't slope at all (as better general admission venues often do) so if you are under 6 feet tall you will possibly be staring at a big dude's back-rolls the entire show regardless of how early you got there. If I were a short female, I wouldn't ever attempt to attend a show here unless you snagged balcony seats right against the rail because you won't see anything. I'm not a girl and I'm not short, yet I was able to get a clear shot of about 15% of the show and had to stand in sumo wrestling pose the entire time to avoid being pushed onto my face by dill-weeds who were trying to get a better view by shoving.  I'd say it's pretty obvious that the House of Blues didn't give much thought to finding a location that served a concert-goer's needs. There are a ton of great shows that play here and I guess it still beats a stadium concert but I sure wish they had thought about setting this place up better for actually watching a concert.
The shrimp and grits was DELICIOUS. It was amazing. I will definitely order this dish whenever I get to HOB again. I ordered take-out so I can't evaluate the service.

after about an hour of arguing what to eat, my friend and i reluctantly decided on h.o.b.  much to our surprise it was pretty good. got the blackened chicken sangwich with sweet potato fries.   hit the spot big time. now where is my straw.......

Hey!!  I'm waving my at you!  Yes, I'm up on the stage at the House of Blues Gospel Brunch, and I've got my big blue hat in my hand, and my Sunday print dress on, and I'm waving at my pals to come on up and join me!!! Which they eventually do, after slurping down the last of their Bloody Mary's.  The music just enters your brain and gets your spirit hopping, and before you know it you're up on your feet on stage, even if it isn't your birthday or anniversary, it can be one of the best times of your life. The buffet is a generous and overwhelming helping of Southern food, so there are a lot of Southern favorites like ham, peel and eat shrimp, corn bread, and even grits, as well as coconut cake and all the regular breakfast staples.  The meal is served at long tables, like a dining hall, then the band comes on and renders their soulful ballads in the best of gospel style.  There is an invitation for interaction with the band, the servers constantly bring drinks around, and if you are able to recover from tehenight before, go on up stage and sing halleluliah like you mean it!

It was meh. Over priced and very small portions. Said live music and we went on s Friday night and it was very quiet. The food was ok in flavor nothing spectacular. I think this is one of the tourist trap places.

Pretty Impressive Dining Experience!  Besides a gorgeous ambiance; aslo the food quality was GREAT.  When I was walking in Mandalay Bay, "House of Blues" caught my attention with a unique design and decoration. I wanted to try this restaurant but the reviews made me doubt; after a little bit hesitation, we walked-in and I am glad that we did it.  As we seated, we ordered some refreshing drinks, I ordered white sangria which was sweet and yummy. From the main course, I ordered a veggie dish "Grilled Vegetable Bouquet" and requested to add shrimps. All the vegetables grilled perfectly and spiced just right, and shrimps grilled really good. The combination of all was great. My friends also liked their foods a lot. Unexpectedly foods and drinks were impressive.  Our server had a little attitude in the beginning; but when we started complimenting about our foods, she became friendly and nice.  Overall, we had a nice dining experience in this unique design restaurant.

I love the food here! I think it really depends on what you order, but I enjoyed my shrimp and grits a lot, and so did my coworker who ordered the exactly same thing! Most of the menu was a bit on the meaty side, and if you feel like seafood or vegetarian, it might not be the right place for your meal. However, their shrimp and grits were pretty flavorful with plump, big shrimps that would certainly satisfy your hunger, just a bit on the salty side though but we got water.  I heard their meatloaf and burgers were delicious too, but I haven't tried it so far.  Service was friendly and prompt. The atmosphere was pretty nice with all the wall decor. It's also very easy to find, almost in the center of the casino, which can hardly be missed.  Overall, a great place to have dinner, especially for big groups, because there should be something for everyone's taste.

The food was great, but this review is about excellent service. It started with our server, Ashley R.  She had us laughing the entire time, while providing perfect service. Her recommendations were on point. She invited us back for breakfast and gave us some coupons to sweeten the deal. That's where the second part of my story begins. I put the coupons in my wallet but forgot my credit card. Didn't realize it was gone until after midnight when we were leaving the casino. The restaurant was closed but Melody, the manager, checked everywhere, texted Ashley, and together they figured out where it was. Above and beyond!

I recently had the pleasure of attending a concert here last week (K Michelle) and it was amazing! I have been to plenty concerts here before but never did the whole VIP experience kind of thing. As I've gotten older I'm really no longer a fan of "standing only" concerts at these kind of venues! Now that I have the kinda coins to splurge and sit up top at a table I opt for that! Nothing like great bottle service while you are watching your favorite artist right? The sound is great throughout the venue, and I have no complaints on anything else. I can't believe I haven't reviewed this earlier on! The food options of course are priced higher than usual but that's a given! Once you get a few drinks in you and rock out to whatever you're listening to that price tag no longer becomes of any importance!
The dessert was delicious - the bourbon bread pudding and the coconut cream pie - but Phil's music changed our life.

Jessica is Awesome!!!! Best service I've ever had at any restaurant IN MY LIFE! She gave us honest opinions on which dishes to try, perfect descriptions and checked on us frequently. Definitely made me want to visit every House of Blues around the world to see what they're like.

Came here for food and drink. the drinks were potent (especially the sangria) and tasty. I had a shrimp spinach salad and it was VERY good. My sis had the quesadilla and wedge salad, and gave her thumbs up. I'd come back.

Just left the Gospel Brunch. Wonderful! My wife and I loved it. Great fun show and all the food on the large buffet was delicious. That was a surprise. Chicken and Waffles, biscuits and gravy, catfish, bread pudding. All of it. A nice meal and show for the money.

Really enjoyed this venue. The staff was wonderful and the drinks downstairs in the concert venue were amazing. The only negative I found was that the sound isn't that great unless you're in the audience in front of the stage. If you want to stand by the bar, behind the sound board, or along the fenced/railing area, the show will not sound it's best. If you can - get down into the crowd and prepare to have a fabulous evening!

Girls loved the fish tacos and club.  I had the po boy and it was super greasy and tasted more like oil than shrimp.  Really disappointed in the service as well, waitress came by once to get our order.  I've always loved the food and service here so I will be back.  Just disappointed w this visit!

We have been to this venue three times for concerts and it continues to be a great venue.  This time we treated ourselves to a VIP table and it was AWESOME!  Service was great, the fact we didn't have to stand for the entire concert and had a dedicated view was wonderful. And the office staff that worked with us to make sure our nite was a success and we're so happy with this experience! Would definitely recommend the concerts at the House of Blues!

This place is huge and sits off to the side in the Manadalay Bay casino.  It has that fake rustic look and lots of tables everywhere with a stage for their acts.   HOB is about the merchandise and not the food.    I have never seen a show here. I ate breakfast here once.  I ordered a $11 ity bity breakfast burrito that was the blandest thing ever!  Plus service was so-so for being so dead.    Their lunch/dinner menu looks good, but after the bad breakfast I probably wouldn't head back.
The venue is very nice. The decor is cute but the drinks were very expensive. I ordered a pbr and a gin and soda and it was about $18. This venue is fine but nothing spectacular!

Saw Billy Idol on the last night of his 2016 residency and he ROCKED! Billy gets 5 stars. This venue only gets 3. My opinion might be different if I had a seat. Unfortunately all reserved seats were sold out before I thought to look for tickets. So, it was standing GA for us. Friend was happy about that as he'd done that before & said it was great. This time around he said it seemed like they added more tables in the typically GA section, drastically reducing the available room. We arrived just before 8 and everything was packed. Sardine packed. We found a place on the side where I could breathe, but really couldn't move/dance much because it was a walkway to the bar. The show was a truly fun blast from the past. Billy still has it. But, HOB would not be a go-to venue for me unless the artist is one I'm dying to see.
Try the flat bread! Basil tomato! Yum
Really good and easy. Also reasonable continental breakfast.  Great bloody Mary too. Service great and courteous

This is just a concert venue review. The place is small and very quaint for a place that houses shows and it definitely let's you capture that personal feeling with the artist no matter where you wind up. I don't understand the two big pillars that block a ton of viewing (especially from the bar area). The whole stage center section around the sound boards is blocked off as well for a "VIP section" eliminating some pretty good viewing areas but yet no one was in it the whole night.   The balcony area seemed very cool but it was closed for our show even though the bottom floor was jam packed with people which stumped me about the place as well. Acoustics were pretty good and you get a good energy level from the small and close size of the place when the crowd gets into it. The attitude of the personal I dealt with was piss poor and to put a "camera" in coat check cost $3.00!? All and all I had a blast but wish the artists selected a better Vegas venue.

Great lunch experience here! The service was incredible... Very attentive and we were well taken care of. We ordered the cornbread, the voodoo shrimp, jumbalaya and lobster mac and cheese. Everything was delicious and extremely rich, which is good for the cold weather. I also ordered a hurricane, but was only able to finish half of it. It was delicious and not too sweet, but very strong (in a good way :)

I have eaten here several times before, usually for breakfast.  The menu has recently changed, however, I prefer the previous menu.  It was easier to order from.  The service is always good I feel.  They have a nice gift shop.  Eat one breakfast one morning, get 2 for 1 next day with your receipt!

A fun spot to visit for drinks or a happy hour, but there are much better options for a meal within Mandalay Bay. For a drink, I tried the blood orange, basil and lime margarita and it was fantastic. So good in fact, that I thought about it the next day. For lunch, I ordered the lobster mac and cheese, and left most of it in the little skillet it came in. It was very bland, not very cheesy, and covered in about a pound of breadcrumbs. My lobster pieces actually had gristle attached to them, and I had to spit two of them out. For $22, I wasn't impressed. So, if you are planning a trip to House of Blues, stick with the drinks and enjoy the live music.

Yea, yea.. I know it's a chain, but I've always loved our House of Blues in Cleveland.  I can't tell you how much I hate being a number in a huge arena full of people. It just disconnects you from the music. At the HOB in Cleveland, it's a big enough venue for great bands to play at, but small enough to feel uber intimate. Talk about the best of both worlds.   I've never been one to push my way through a sweaty, stinky crowd just to get close to the stage. I'm all about the sound, the connection, not the "star" factor of being close to the performer. What I love about HOB is that you can sit up on the balcony and still be super close to the show. It's a better view up there with better sound and I can sit down when I want. I mean, that's insanely better than being pressed up against some hot, sticky stranger who's probably going to start a mosh like a total jack-ass.   The balcony level also has bathrooms, two bars and a cocktail waitress for your excessive drinking pleasure. I mean, it's pretty much guaranteed that if you're boozing during a show you're going to have to get up to pee at least a few times. Lucky for you there's easy access to beers and the potty.  Speaking of the bathrooms, like other yelpers have mentioned I too have an issue with the attendants. I appreciate that it's always super clean in there. But,  if I'm not making eye-contact with you and reaching for my own paper towel, please don't come at me saying, "Here you go, ma'am... no, look here, I have a towel for you." It makes me feel uncomfortable that I have no cash on me to tip you with. I don't want you working for free and I'm more than capable of grabbing my own towel, thank you.   Also, be prepared for the on-slot of teenagers who fill the seats for shows. You cannot escape them or the parents they've dragged with them. Sometimes I just want to buy these folks a shot for having to suffer through a concert with 10 teens.   Other than that, go enjoy a show and grab some dinner before hand if you're running behind. There are lots of great restaurants up and down E4th to suit any palette.

Service here is always exceptional! Love the food and decor. I make sure to come here everything I stay at Mandalay Bay. A must try appetizer is the Jalape√±o Pepper Cornbread with maple butter. I ordered the Island Turkey a Burger, which was amazing!

House of Blues is one of my favorites, I have gone to many awesome shows but never been to the one in Vegas. The Flatbread is amazing and Tracy, our waitress is fantastic! My wife and I sat here hot over two hours and had the most amazing time, Tracy kept us hydrated and was a pleasure all the way. Tracy rocks!

I'll give this place 3 stars and only because of the good music and food. The server I had when I went there for a work party was horrible. My whole table asked for a round of waters. We each ordered our own drinks as well.  Got the alcoholic beverages but never received the waters until after the meal was done upon asking the whole time for them. My meal was made perfect however I can't speak for the rest of my coworkers meals. Everyone's food was made wrong and when asked to fix it took twice as long for the server to come back at all with anything at all. When asked for things our server seemed aggravated, Mind u we had to go up to the bartender to ask about our server n what was going on. We were his only table in this section and it wasn't that busy. I mean I would go there again for sure but request a different server. Don't know what his name was. But yea.

The Sunday morning Gospel Brunch is amazing!  All the workers are very friendly and helpful.  The food and beverages were fantastic.  And the singing group made it so much fun!  They are really good.  It was a very fun experience.

About 3 weeks ago my wife and I went to see a rock concert ,the band was Badflowe the singer is our friend son,I have a bad knee and we asked for a place to seat.One of the manager come to talk to us and told to what she can ,10 minutes later she come and took us in and gave us a place to seat, I'm sorry I forgot her name, Great manger great venue, thank you HOB.

So, apparently being ecstatic about Steel Panther isn't enough of a review for this place - so I have to actually rewrite it.   Steel Panther. That's all i have to say. What a great show. I've been here twice to see them, and both times the House of Blues was a great experience. The lines were quick to enter (this last time I went) and the first time during the VIP host, both the front host and our cocktail waitress were pleasant to work with. Great setup and started on time both times. It was a blast and enjoyed my visit here both times.  Thank you Steel Panther. We will see each other again soon! THank you HOB for a great setup!
The Shrimp and Grits were amazing!!  The mac & cheese was terrific!!  I loved everything except the lemonade.  I would definitely recommend it.

Don't show up to a Santana concert thirsty! My one complaint is the outrageous prices for water. As if my $350.00 wasn't enough for the two Santana tickets you feel the need to steal from concert goers  by charging 5.00 for one run of the mill bottle of water. This water did not taste like fresh gear drops from the cherubs in heaven but I feel that's what I paid for. I totally understand drought desert conditions but this is stepping over the line. You drain the canals in the Venetian and drain the water features in front of Treasure Island and the Mirage--that's when I will be willing to see water shortage sucks and we must pay more.   I will not stand for this aggression, house of blues administration.   I can understand the risks involved with serving booze to a crowd that's known for √ºber-indulging in the intoxicating substances, which is why I could assume you charge $11.00 for a small whiskey & 7. Everyone needs a drink of water, I don't fear the liability involved with this necessary business approach.   Oh yeah, the venue itself is awesome. Folky, quirky, bluesy--great seats are to be found just about anywhere. I would warn you that section 208 is quite steep and high above the actual stage in case you need a different perspective.  As for the quality and showmanship of Carlos Santana--his guitar delaying ability remains top notch. His ability to whoo a crowd is suspect. He doesn't move a whole lot around the stage and dont expect much singing from him. Did I feel like I was on the bargain end of seeing one of my guitar heros in person? Not really. Over $300.00 for a couple is a lot of dinero for this part time college student.

This is sad for me to be giving this place 2 stars but here we are. This is a place of memories as I recall coming to shows here in high school and the place being awesome.  However now, I'm simply annoyed at how outrageously cramped this place gets. I get it that it's a concert and should be packed but the venue should allow for some type of elbow room. This shouldn't be a place you pay money to feel like you're in a cattle car or a chicken coop.   Sidenote I experienced an very shitty bartender here. I had to have been standing at the bar top (at the counter) for about 10 minutes while the dude took orders to my left, right, like wtf man? So I finally say to the guy hey can I order a drink or what I've been standing here staring at you, waiting to take my order for quite a while. He has the audacity to tell me it's my job to tell HIM I'd like to order something. Like I'm standing at the bar staring at you for my health? Anybody who's BEEN to a bar before knows it's the other way around. Incredible moron, incredible!  So sadly, unless House of Blues expands their venue a little bit, or limits ticket sales to  a reasonable number, AND rids themselves of self righteous d-bag bartenders I think I'm good on coming back for a while.

I saw Thievery Corporation here during the Vegoose festival over Halloween weekend.  It's a pretty small venue which is nice because you have a close view of the stage from almost anywhere in the place (I always like to see what they're doing), but it also gets really crowded and is almost impossible to move around.  Overall, just okay.  Not bad acoustics.  I like the multi-level set-up.  I would recommend making it to the upper-level on the far side opposite the entrance.  From there you'll have a good view of the stage and crowd, be close to the bar, and have a little bit more breathing room.

we came here for a banquet. it was free. the cornbread was absolutely amazing. too bad there were 10 people sitting at each table and it was cut into 8 pieces. so by the tme the bread went around to the last 3 people, well, you know the rest. note that 10 people do not really fit around those tables, so the whole thing was uncomfortable, to say the least.  food was easily underwhelming. mostly due to a lack of logistical skills, which, like the bread, made the whole evening seem rather awkward. example: pasta was supposed to have some sort of topping. not sure what it was, since they served most of it to the first few tables and the rest of us got some wet noodles. hmmm...

I had the pulled pork sandwich with the sweet potatoe fries -YUM! The sandwich was off the hook. The pork was tasty and not over sauced on a soft bun. The sweet potatoe fries were sweet and crispy -just the way I like them.   Service was just OK...

Atmosphere is cool. Like any other HOB. The food was pretty good. I had the grilled Mahi sandwich. It was tasty and lightly buttery. It had a nice creole dusting of spices and a traditional tartar sauce. The sauce was not overbearing on flavor and was a delightful dish. The fries were cooked to perfection and lightly salted. I added salt of course because I needed my blood pressure to go up...lol. My friend had the calamari appetizer. It was fried nicely and had a good crunchy texture to it. Came with a nice dipping sauce that had non traditional flavors. All in all it was a great experience. Come on by to eat, chill and listen to some good music and you might even be lucky enough to catch a celebrity or two here. : )

I can't believe I am saying this....Especially since I am NOT a fan of national chains... But DANG!!!!  Party of 12 for a close friends birthday all met at HOB and smh...BEST NIGHT EVER!!!! From the service to the food to the entertainment, all was executed flawlessly!!! One hiccup that I will ding them on is billing...I got 3 receipts, one said 34 dollars and two said 51 dollars, so me being slightly buzzed was just gonna write the 51dollar and tip but the haze cleared and DID ask the waitress what the two different amounts meant. She said one was a mistake and retallied... Me being an old server from the day thinks a fast one was almost pulled... therefore a 1 star subtraction for the tomfoolery......
Went here before a concert for dinner the decor was super fun they had a live band playing that was good it was a little loud and hard to hear our conversation and the food was good

Bro, John the bartender is the motha fucking OG of east 4th. That ginger prince is nothing but a warrior. Asked for 4 shots of bacardi in a drink and that dude made me a hurricane. So blessed. Bless up for John at house of blues. Cute ass. Btdubs, A Aron also can bartend the fuck out of my drinks. He's an OG out here in the streets.

Went here last night  after  along drive from California and a few hours on the casino floor. The server and service was fabulous and fast. Our young girl server was super nice and kept up with everything. The atmosphere was also well designed and comfortable, not loud and quite pleasant. My GF and I shared the Grilled Sword Fish, The fish was cooked improperly. It was so Salt water fishy tasting and rubbery we couldn't  finish. The appetizers saved the night and were outstanding. "Or server recommended Shrimp over Corn Bread with a reduced sauce, this was to die for and would recommend. Then we ordered the Buffalo wings, these also were nothing to rave about. The sauce was not to tasty, I've had better wings from Costco out of a bag and cooked in an oven. My son had the Fish Taco's, he ate them so I'm assuming they were ok, he's not much for opinions. His GF had a Bacon wrapped meatloaf. She had all of us try her selection as she was cracking up on the taste. We all came to the same conclusion that the Meatloaf tasted like a "Slim Jim" Jerky. I'm guessing we are not going back soon and will try another restaurant for dinner.

We came to watch the live music and decided to eat while we were here. Not real impressed with the menu choices. I felt it was quite pricey but I guess it was worth it to sit down and listen to the music. I had the side order of mac and cheese for about 6 bucks. It came in a skillet and could have been a meal. Hubby had the jambayaya. He said it was quite tasty but not worth the almost $20 he paid for it, for sure. I was pretty shocked when our waiter, an asian guy who called himself 'kitti', brought three lemons on a toothpick and deposited them into the palm of my hand. What the hell am I supposed to do with a hand full of lemons??? Glad we went for the music experience but I wont rush back.
The service was painfully slow. Drinks were watered down and over priced. The food was OK at best. I was very disappointed

When I went to see Brandon Flowers here (my one and only, hopefully last visit to this HOB) the staff was horrible.  I know this will sound silly and like I'm exaggerating, but I truly felt like none of them had ever organized/worked a concert before.  It was absolute chaos.  I go to concerts all the time and this was by far the worst experience I've had with a venue and their ability to fairly and effectively manage the crowd.  Lots of people were waiting all day long before the show started and hours later, closer to showtime, the whole line was moved around about 8 or 9 times.  One guy would tell us we were all in the wrong place and needed to line up by the escalators, then someone else would lead us to a different spot in the casino, then back in front of the venue again, and it went on and on and on.  This whole time the line was getting messed up and people were running around like crazy trying to make sure they didn't get screwed out of their spot.  Once they finally decided where to put us, half the people were facing in one direction and half in the other direction.  The staff couldn't even decide where the front of the line was!  It was so ridiculous none of us could believe it.    They continued to be completely unorganized and when we were finally let into the venue, they destroyed the line again by holding back the right side & letting tons of people from the left go in...and then did the same to the other side.  Do these people not understand the point of lining up??  It's not just for fun, it's because we all spent many hours trying to ensure a great spot.  Telling us "every spot is a good spot" is irrelevant and makes it clear that you don't understand at ALL.    Oh I forgot to mention the best part.  To even get into this line that would be let in first, they force you to spend $20 in their store or restaurant to get a pass in.  So if you're a huge fan of whoever is playing, just know that the 'Pass The Line' people will be let in before you unless you shell out an additional $20.  Way to pray on the fans, make a quick buck, and then treat us like crap, HOB.  Not amused at all.  I hope Brandon never plays here again, because he's the only musician I'd go through this for again.  I almost gave them 2 stars because the bartender was nice when I asked for water, but they really don't deserve it.

Now that I have been to both the music venue as well as their restaurant and other conference/"back party room" (for the "May The 4th Be With You CMYE), I feel as if I have a pretty good grasp on this place... As least enough to write a solid review.  I have to commend this place. Most people associate more gimmicky restaurants like this with poor food and service. NOT HERE! You will be amazed with how on point both are. My guest and I were seated promptly, even though they were semi-busy. Our waitress was there with two glasses of water as she greeted us. I thought that was very smart, because as a former server, 99% of people are gonna want water anyway... Saves you an extra trip.  So she gave us plenty of time to look at the menu and decide what we wanted, and made sure the food came out quickly. She checked on us regularly and chatted for a little bit too. Pretty much the perfect server experience!  The night I was there (a Friday), they have karaoke with a live band. Oh. My. Lawd. It was so fun! I didn't sing, but I wanted to! It looked like a blast. Just watching the people get up and sing was fun. You know how most bars that host karaoke, you kinda zone out, it's not really that cool...... This was the complete opposite! Good times.  I ordered the Lobster Mac and Cheese, which was very, very good. Super creamy,not too cheesy, light, crispy bread crumbs, with sizable chunks of lobster, all served piping hot. I have a slight lactose/heartburn thing. It is fairly mild, but if I have too much dairy (specifically frozen yogurt. It's the worst) or too much oil, I can get all bubbly in the gullet area. I ate half of the meal then, and the rest later on. No problems at all! That's proof there was a good balance of ingredients. It was pretty expensive ($20), but with all the lobster they loaded it with, I wasn't too surprised.  Moving on to the music venue. I came here to see the band Meshuggah, with Animals As Leaders for the opening band. I have been to many a music venue in my heyday, and let me tell you... House of Blues' venue is one of the really good ones. It's pretty much close to perfection. The way that they built it is that no matter where you are located, you can see the band. It's intimate enough that you feel connected to the performance, but large enough to hold plenty of people. They have two smaller bars and one large one. The large bar is in the back, and had about 3 or 4 bartenders working it at the time, so you never had to wait for a drink. If you did, it was MAYBE two minutes, max. They even had cocktail waitresses, for those hardcore fans who don't want to miss anything by going to the bar!  The drinks are pricey, the they almost always are at these places. The cheapest place I have ever been to for venue drinks was Station 4 in Minneapolis, where you could get a PBR tall boy for around $4. That's as good as it gets. I think my beer at HOB was a full cup o' beer for $7 or $8. I firmly advocate a little pre-game action prior, then anticipate to buy a couple at the show. Everyone wins!! The few times I have ordered a mixed drink here, it has been a little weak, especially for the price you pay for it. I guess that would have to be my only "whine" moment about HOB.  This place has it all: good food, great venue, awesome service, and cool decor. It's pretty much a "must do" in Vegas if you are gonna be at Mandalay Bay.
Great venue once Inside.   Lines are absurd (hour or so at doors open time) Tonight's show was an hour. ... disappointing for the money spent

I was excited to try H.O.B. while on vacation, but my breakfast never came so I left and not to mention I waited 15 mins to sit (party of 1) and an hour plus before the waiter walked by and said "oh gosh idk what's going on" Booooo!!

The bf wanted to see Bad Brains in the worst way and much to his surprise they were playing at House of Blues last night. Hooray! According to him this was a rare treat (I guess they were only playing 3 dates in the US).   The tickets were cheap and because we were locals (with local ID) we got the service charge waived and some sort of VIP drink pass which gave us discounted well drinks, house wine and domestic beers. The box office staff were friendly and quite helpful.   On the day of the show there was no line to get in, the bouncers were pleasant (that's kinda rare in Vegas...maybe because I am a girl). There were a bunch of people standing to the side smoking (since I last came here they made everyone go out into the casino to smoke...kinda weird).  We roll up to the bar and they had big boy cans of beer. We wanted PBR but they were out so we opted for Miller Lite. With our cool discount band we got 2 for $12. That isn't horrible by Vegas standards Sam, the bartender, was awesome and sweet. Totally made us feel at home (well as best as he could considering the music was loud and the crowd was rowdy).  Overall we had a blast at the show and I didn't even feel old (I was probably the average). Plus...there were not too many skeezy guys trying to scam on girls...hooray! Will be back if there is another band that we want to see.

I got free tickets through Fillaseat to see the cover band called Saved by the 90s. Although the music this band plays is really not my thing, I had worked some very long hours over the holidays that I just wanted to get out for a little bit.  Husband and I went to the HOB on a Saturday night. My tickets says that the doors will open at 8 pm and that I must pick up my tickets between 7 and 7:30 pm.  Lucky, my husband works for MGM International, so parking at the Mandalay is free for us. Because of the tragedy that occurred in October, the Mandalay parking lot was empty. And because of this, there was a little sadness in my heart. At this point, I need a little something to cheer me up a bit.  My husband and I made our way to HOB. Now, I've been to this HOB for dining, but never to their concert venue. I thought the events team did a really good job with the outdoor setup.  We clearly understood where we needed to go to pick up our tickets. The lady helping us, it was clear that this is just a job for her :|    After picking up our tickets, my husband decided that we should go in right away since they were letting people in.  The "bouncer" asked for my ID, which shocked me, because I don't go to "clubs" and I'm old so I'm not used to being carded where as my husband wasn't carded and he looks way younger than I do.  We got to the event person that scanned our tickets and then made our way to security. We followed all the rules, take everything out of your pockets, we were quickly scanned, and my purse was checked.  Because we got there early enough, we got through the preliminary stuff rather quickly. And once again, the event people were professional.  Because this was our first time to the concert venue, when we got into the small lobby area, we didn't know where to go. Once we quickly observed our surroundings, we headed downstairs.   As one would expect, when we got into the club, it was dark with bright lights coming from the stage and dim lights around the bar. Because it's been such a long time that I've been to a venue like this, I thought it was small.  And more importantly, where's the seats!? :D And with the few pub tables available, why is it barricaded off!? I see, standing room "only" show unless you pay the upgrade. Upgrade was $50 person or $100 bar tab for a table. $100 bar tab for a table isn't bad when you have a bunch of people, but it was just my husband and I. Thanks, but no thanks, we'll stand.  I did go to the bathroom and found it clean. They even have a lady in there with a line of lipsticks, hair sprays, perfumes and paper towels. Classy.  It is a nightclub, so I did expect areas of sticky floors and a bit of sticky counters.  My husband ordered a Stella Artois. I believe the big bottle was $12. My husband also ordered fries, which was actually really good and not too bad at $5.  While waiting for our fries, a DJ and his hype man were on stage. Shortly thereafter, they moved their equipment so that the first band could play. The first band, Garage Band, was alright. In the middle of their set, we finished our fries and made our way down towards the front of the stage and found our place against the stairs.  Once the band was done, the DJ came back out along with his "MC" and we partied like it was 1990. And this DJ was a real DJ; he mixed, cut and scratched and played music from the late 80s and early 90s. My husband actually live streamed it on FB and his friends were getting a kick out of it. And to think, it was only 8:30 pm!   The cover band came out, we enjoyed the first 5 songs, the club was getting packed, just a sea of people dancing and having a good time.  My husband wanted to meet the DJ. Turns out the MC is from HI and his wife is the events manager at HOB, also from HI. So, of course, super cool people.  Good venue with big name acts like Santana and Marilyn Manson performing here. Great people. A little pricey, but all-in-all, a really good time.  Wait, you got people from HI working for you and a drink called "the 9th island"!? Bumping this up to 4-stars.

The food was great....the venue is AWFUL. Let me preface this by saying I love concerts. I love going to intimate shows but the House of Blues makes me crazy as a concert goer. I cringe when I see one of my favorite bands play there. Sometimes I wont even go because I hate this place so much  1) Sound: Awful. We were at Grace Potter last night. Stood on the left side of stage. The crowd noise was so loud it literally made her sound like background music. Switched to the right side and much better.   2) View: If you are short, you better pay for a seat. Fortunately I am not and I still couldnt see most of the time. Awful sight lines for a concert. The layout is completely terrible. So much wasted space in the middle. The place needs to bulldozed and rebuilt...or move it elsewhere where you can SEE the show  3) Prices: $5 for a Diet Coke!??????????????? Are you kidding me? What. A. Joke.  Go to Beachland Ballroom. Sound is great and you can actually see the show.

We had our customer appreciation party here for SEMA. It was a great venue for it. well  laid out with a dance floor and stage. We had the blues brothers tribute band played for the group they we off the hook! When they finished we gave all our dealers blues brother sun glasses and took pictures with them too. HOB put out some good food too from fresh sliced meats and mac n cheese to cold cuts, chips and salsa and pizza and we had an open bar!! it was a great time. They had to chase us out. we must have done something right

I didn't realize this was like a concert with food. I'm not sure if the music varies from one week to another. But the gospel band that played, did a lot of preaching. More than I've experienced in Glide Church (my favorite gospel venue in San Francisco.)   The band was fine, but the set was very short!! One of the singers seemed to spend an awful lot of time introducing his family, his friends, any married people in the audience, any birthday people in the audience, and basically jabbering instead of cranking out the good gospel music.  The food was plentiful, as any buffet is, but nothing stood out, and a few things just didn't taste good. The carving station had ham...or ham. The salad bar didn't have anything beyond standard salad stuff. The deserts were ok. The shrimp were fine. The biscuits and gravy were fine. The chicken was yummy. And everything else was utterly forgettable.  Also, maybe drink prices went up, but I got a diet Coke, a bloody mary and a club soda, and it was $12.50.   I love gospel music, but prefer mine without the preaching -- esp in a secular venue.  I wanted to go. I went. I wouldn't go back again.  It wasn't awful. But there wasn't anything great about it either.

House of Blues is like the Hot Topic of venues for catching a punk show. I've been to one in Orlando for a Bad Brains reunion W/ HR singing. I've caught a couple of shows here in the Vegas location. The last one was Rancid. They make you check in spike belts and kick you out for dancing too hard (hence the nickname "house of rules") but I sit up in the balcony and act like I'm VIP those days of effin' up the dance floor are over for me. It doesn't faze me but I think it sucks for the kids coming up. Either way I guess you can go to any house of blues and know exactly what to expect and in some weird way I like that. It trips me out that they have the Sai Baba portrait above the stage.

Happy hour from 2-6 every day! Hello! They don't have anything on Draft, but the drink selection is not all that bad. I mean $3 bottles and $5 drinks. Not to shabby. Plus the food ranges from $3-6 during happy hour ( I believe) so it is not all bad. The jalapeno cornbread is yummy and served to you in a small cast iron skillet. The steak quesadillas were filled to capacity with yummy steak and cheese. I do think my favorite was the bbq pork sliders. Yummy and nicely priced. ( Plus cannot believe I had not written a review about them until now SMH!)
Inside Mandalay Bay; good food, nicely decorated venue, and great live music!
This is my new favorite hidden spot. Love music is so good. Ashley R. is awesome ask for her and she will make sure your time is well spent.

Decent food. Had a salad and my friend got the burger. Salad could have had more tomatoes since it was the only veggie in there but still ok. Considering its the strip, for $8 it was good. My friend seemed to enjoy her burger. It was ok but I think id go back to strip steak before I came here next time Im in Mandalay bay looking for some food.

What a terrible experience. Reservation process (via yelp) and the staff were ultra friendly. Great menu, great bar. The issue was the kitchen and more so the food.   First - took us an hour and a half to get our food. Not just us - but no one in the place was getting served.  No explanation - just "it's coming".  No apology.   Then - when the food did come - our apps were served at the same time as our meals. We weren't the only ones - I noticed quite a few tables complaining about the same issues.   A couple of our apps were forgotten completely (but of course were on the bill) and only half the dinners were served at once. The others came out sporadically - including mine that was a half hour after the first person was served.   Three of us ordered ribs. They are not fall off the bone. Don't get them or if you do - ask for a steak knife.   Worse - there was a "red fish special" for $29.00. It comes out on a huge plate with two pieces of fish the size of your thumb. I wish I was kidding. And it was the only thing on the plate (except the lemon slice which just added insult to injury).   I had the waiter come over and he actually laughed at it when he looked at it knowing that our concern was legit. He showed it to another waiter who too shook his head in disbelief that this came out of the kitchen.   They wanted to take it to the manager so he could see it himself. His response was "that's the way it is".  They did offer to replace the dish however we were already 2 hours in at this point.   This place is brutal. With so many awesome options within walking distance of this one - save yourself (and your stomach) the grief and go elsewhere.

I'm not a big concert person, but lately I've found myself attracted to shows at HOB.  The tickets are never too expensive, and I feel like it's a good purchase because of the venue size.  I'm not watching a screen, i'm watching the actual concert which makes me happy.   Just a tip for everyone.. If you buy your tickets at the box office instead of Ticketmaster you usually get half off the convenience fees (or at least all the shows I've seen have worked out that way.)

We visited this place last night for our date.   It did not live up to our expectations.  The band was terrible.  I expected the local acts to be multiple not just one group.   I ordered the shrimp and grits.  It was okay, it had too much liquid for it to be considered cusine.  My date asked for his steak to be medium rare, the order was all wrong.  We both agreed we will not return.  I will take my chances with the one in Chicago.

Santana at HOB.  ABSOLUTELY THE BEST.  I would recommend the floor "seats" they are much more fun that the theater level.  Didn't eat the food, but had cocktails in the souvenir glasses.  Expensive, but they don't short you on the alcohol - probably at least a double shot.  If you are even a casual Santana fan, this is a MUST SEE.

My friend and I saw Billy Idol at the House of Blues Theater on Saturday night and we wanted to grab some grub before the show. We had no problem getting into the bar area with no waiting. The beer was cold and the food was delicious! The only reason for not a fifth star was our server was slow and took awhile before she even came over. We were not in a hurry so not a big deal!
Great place! it was real live. i went to see Santogold... and she was great! After that I went to the restaurant and the food was excellent and the servers was nice. A great atmosphere overall.
The ribs are delicious and the gumbo soup! Also if you hold on to your receipt you can come back the next day for a buy one and get the second half off breakfast!

Oh House of Blues! This is one of my favorite concert venues in Cleveland. It is small and intimate, which I appreciate with live music. They also bring in a wide variety of acts which is nice. The restaurant is good, but pretty pricy. I have been there on quite a few different occasions. I kind of feel the same about it each time. Good but nothing spectacular. We have a bachelorette party there, it was nice but it ended up being an expensive night. We have also been there for karaoke on Friday nights, which is fun but I expected more.    Overall the experience is always consistent here, which I appreciate.   And the corn bread is amazing!

2 visits in the last few days as we are staying next door at the Delano. First visit was a late bite of a fabulous burger and sausage soup which was great. Service was fun and a bluegrass guitarist on the stage was fun.   If I could give 4 stars for one visit and 1 star for the second, I would.   Second visit was for the breakfast special that was NOT special. 3 eggs small in size dumped on a plate with 2 slices of tomatoes. (didn't want the hash browns). Cold coffee too. What a sorry looking bf. Ordered sausage which came out cold. The super fuel omelette was of micro sized again with some fruit which we paid extra for in lieu of potatoes.., no toast or bread of any kind. I'm not a lover of super-sized portions but this was truly not special in size, taste or presentation.   Our waiter Blade was great and had the cold breakfast taken off the tab. We tipped him well didn't whine and left for Starbucks.   Note to self; House of Blues is great for Blues but not for breakfast!
Went in a large group, 30+, We had a party room and pre ordered buffet. Great pulled pork, staff was very accommodating for some allergies in our party.

I wanted too say thank you too a wonderful hostesses name Claudia.She went above and beyond herself ,as a hostess she was explained that it's was my mother's birthday  she took that too heart and did everything from picking out a special table ,too letting our waiter know about my moms birthday.She came back too check in on her, WOW the small things restaurants forget sometimes but not Claudia!!!!!!! We had an awesome time that really made my night and my mothers night the band gave a shoutout too my mom sweet our server was great as well Chris thank you my friend NAMASTE

Our first time here ,it's been forever since I've been to Vegas  ,I hear the food's good ,our room is beautiful  and very Romantic  ,can't wait for a candle light dinner with my Man  ,no kids yah. ..We are grabbing a show after  ...soooo much to do...
I had an ok meal here when some friends of mine were playing.a gig here.  The food was ok.  The venue, the staff here are all first rate.  Thanks again.

The place is a dump. Recently we saw GNR at HRH. Awesome sound, excellent venue, everything the HOB is not. For one thing the HOB makes no effort to restrict the number of people trying to force their way into GA. I'll never buy those tickets again. It is not safe. I'm not sure what the regulators are waiting for, but somebody is going to die in there because of their asinine policies. In the event of an emergency there would not be enough body bags. At HRH the tickets for the GA area in front of the stage are tightly controlled. No one gets in front of the stage unless they have a ticket. At HOB it was anything goes. The sound system needs a rework. Also it would be much more pleasant for the patrons if on occasion the cleaning staff actually cleaned the floor. Wherever we walked we stuck. Ick!

Nice place to see a concert.  There are different areas for the general admission tickets to watch. The main floor, left or right side of the stage and in the rear of the venue. Three large bars wiTh specials on beers and well drinks is always a plus. Sound quality is excellent and the staff here is very friendly.

We came here recently for Social Media Day with a show put on by Steel Panther, and having attended other concerts before, I think its a cool place to go for a concert, but I prefer grabbing a table and enjoy a show while seated.  Being on the floor is cool, but standing room only? No thanks....plus the claustrophobic situation that follows?...Pass...Do yourself a favor and pay a little more for your own spacious seating area...ALOHA!!!  YELP 365 CHALLENGE-(315/365) "Sit Or Stand???"

AVOID THIS PLACE AT ALL COSTS! $12 for a Fireball Shot? Where are the Strippers? This place has gone downhill since it opened and is a joke amongst Vegas Locals. Drinks are 25% more than even the most expensive Strip Clubs. It would be different if the shows were free.  Security Wanding & Pat Down before entering? Really TSA?  Avoid this place at all costs!

I would have given three stars but they charge you an "entertainment" tax of 18% when dining here.  They had two guys playing on stage and after we came in they sang TWO songs and were done for the night.  They were O.K. and actually I was glad when they were finished as they were a little too loud and I just wanted dinner.  And the service wasn't too great either.  For dinner we shared the Gator Pizza which was really quite good with just enough kick to it.  And we also shared the Paneed Chicken  which wasn't as good.  It had a strange flavor to it that I can't really describe.  We got a watermelon spritzer drink which was like a watermelon soda and that was really good.  Not sure if I will be back as I feel they should have informed me about the entertainment tax beforehand and the food is just O.K. nothing that I would want to pay an additional tax for!

I've gone to House of Blues twice - both times because it was a Sunday in the winter and my family and I were in Vegas, and my brothers (huge niner fans) wanted to go to a restaurant where we can watch the game.   House of blues has huge tv screens that play football games on Sundays.   Onwards to the food. Their food is Cajun styled and really tasty. Apparently there's a new chef at this location and he created a new menu 6 months ago.   MUST: get the voodoo shrimp. Omgosh. Jumbo shrimp on fried styled cornbread, soo good.   Another must: get the cornbread. It comes with maple butter. Believe me it's yummy!   Was too full for dessert this time but I remember it being good. Prices are also reasonable too!

Good venue size.  Saw Blues Traveller a couple weeks ago.  Great sound and not a bad seat.  Paid $26 for a Miller Lite tall boy and a Coots light tall boy (PBR tall boy is $11).  I'd definitely go back for the right band and will definitely pregame before going.

I came here on a work trip dinner after a long day of conferences. There were about 18 people so I completely understand of mistakes happen. The reason why they received a 3 stars instead of 4 or even 5 is because the same mistake kept happening. My co worker ordered her first round of drinks with no delay. When we all finished our first round and ordered seconds, her drink never came. Understanding that it was a big group, we just asked for it again. When everyone is done with their second drink to order the third she asked for her drink again twice. My third drink, which I asked for later than her third request, came out faster than hers. Yikes.  Plus note, their jambalaya was yummy but definitely order it with the shrimp. I thought the WHOLE scallion stalk on top was a bit extra since no one will eat that with the jambalaya......  Tip: New Yorkers: don't expect the buffalo wings to drip in buffalo sauce. Is more a dry rub type of wings.

decent venue. big. places like this are different shows every night, so it is a constantly changing thing. friendly staff. decent cocktails. beer selection wasnt super exciting, but was ok for the most.

We came here for breakfast the morning we left Mandalay Bay and Las Vegas. If only we'd known about it sooner. Great food (we got a custom-made omelet and the crab cake eggs benedict) for a decent price (in Las Vegas), fast service, fun atmosphere. Portions are good but not terribly excessive, and the coffee was kind of the best I've had in awhile.

House of Blues is a really great mid-sized venue. I've seen around a dozen shows here and have always had an enjoyable experience. Ticket prices are usually reasonable and if you're a designate driver, non-alcoholic drinks are free (at least the AFI show!) I've normally purchased alcoholic beverages (which are priced as one would expect for a chain venue) when visiting House of Blues, so I'm not sure I got an awesome bartender or if this is their normal generous policy.  I would have given HoB a five, but I just don't get bathroom attendants. I've been dispensing my own paper towels for myself since I was a kid. I just don't need a dude to try to be helpful by placing the paper towels he's offering to dry my clean hands on a wet, dirty countertop with his potentially dirty hands. And if I need cologne, I'll use mine at home. I typically attend metal and punk shows at HoB so a bathroom attendant is a little more "class" than I imagine the attendees at these shows expect. I know, I know - it's Vegas and this is fairly standard practice. I still feel it's obnoxious and superfluous.   Bathroom attendants aside, you should feel you're making a good choice if you choose to check out a show at Las Vegas' House of Blues!
Meh. Long time to get the food. No wait to be seated though. Jambalaya was so so. Mojito was weak. Overall meh !

The last experience there pushed me to 'Yelp' about it.    I've been to HoB many times since it opened.  At first i wasnt really a fan of their corporate feel, as I like the low-key Agora / Grog shop charm more.  However, now that im in my late 20s i REALLY appreciate the option to have nice, comfortable seating on the upper balcony area.  You get a great view, the acoustics are great, and there's 2 bars up there, very nice!    Ive only eaten there once before, and was unimpressed.  THIS time however our waitress Gina made my day.  I wanted the strawberry lemonade, but knowing it would be half ice i asked if the refills were free - NO "but for you they are  :)'  Win.  We also had a BOGO coupon - which she let us keep so 'we;d come back again' - very smart, because now I feel like i have to because she was so nice.    We got the fried artichokes and they were phenomenal.  Came with two delicious sauces, cooked perfectly with lemon wedges.  I got the pulled pork sammich for $10 which was a B, good size, good sauce, and the hot sauce tray they had on the table came in handy.    My GF got a burger which was average, nothing special but not bad for a chain.  I didnt like their shoe string style fries but she did, and the cole slaw wasnt bad either.    You get to sneak into the HoB concert when you leave from the restaurateur part which is a plus as well.    For the super thrifty  - she didnt ask to see our Entertainment card  /wink

Dinner at the restaurant was great. Service was on top of it, maybe too on top of it. The venue doesn't have the greatest sight-lines, can make you feel closterphobic if you're not into dark overly decorated walls and a full crowd, but the sound system isn't too bad. Chances are this is one of the 2 or 3 spots to see a good rock show in Las Vegas, so you take what you can get, eh?

I attended my first concert here at The House of Blues. Billy Idol was in the House tonight  and rocked this crowd. For a good 2 hours. He played hit after hit, classics  and some new material. He still has the voice  and commands the stage. He put in a powerful show and the band is fantastic. I would definitely attend another concert here. The concert hall is an intimate setting and the acoustics are great.
We enjoyed happy hour with Dave the bartender. He was very friendly and we had a great experience with him.

Saw WuTang last month and Lauryn Hill last night.  My fave part of HOB is that it's small.  Sucks to be downstairs like I was for Lauryn but, thankfully, it wasn't that crowded. Made it easier to walk in/thru. Watching WuTang from the top was great. We had seats, there was no one taller than me, and it wasn't crowded.

First I ordered a Philly Cheese Steak it was gross!  I should have taken a picture. I didn't want to make a scene, and start taking pictures of my food. The cheese was lumpy and disgusting.  So I sent  it back and ordered a grilled chicken sandwich. I received a burnt scrawny piece of chicken. So I took my phone out and took a picture. I took a few bites and that was it.  Everybody was finished eating,and waiting for me.  I ended up leaving Hungary paying for food I did not eat. I wanted to complain and lay in to the manager! At the very least get all that crap taken off my bill! I was with company. So I held back. I'm not the sort to hold back though! Especially, when it's costing me money.  In short ... SLOW SERVICE, BAD FOOD,  I felt bad, spending my money in this place! The waitress was extremely unprofessional! She made things awkward from the start with her horrible customer service skills. The place was empty yet could not manage her three tables. They can't cook  a chicken breast! "What a joke"   Good concert venue,  horrible restaurant!
Group of 12+ obnoxious drunk men here for drinks.. KC was the real MVP, even after closing.

I've had nothing but great experiences at this House of Blues. Good food, consistent service, and a friendly staff. I was there a few weeks ago for breakfast and Aune + the rest of the staff were really helpful and pleasant on a Sunday morning. Good way to start the day.

The food we did get was good and the manager has since contacted us personally to apologize and send us something to make up for it.  I'll recommend this place now because I'm pretty sure it was a bad one-off situation and they do care about their customer's experience.

Dude, it's the house of blues... what's not to like... well, like everything. great loud noises (LOL) and they have excellent prices on draft beer. oh, did I mention the killer bass that rattles your clothes - awesome!!!
Ashley R. Is the bomb!!  She truly rocks the restaurant and is one of the most personable waitress' in the biz!  The music is perfect. A MUST if you're in Vegas for a night. You're welcome.

As stated by other reviewers this place was just okay. The food was bar food, nothing to brag about. We weren't there for a show just grabbing some food and drinks.   The real win here was the service. This is the best service we have received while in Vegas. The waiter was attentive, polite, funny. He really made the experience.

We decided to get a little 'touristy' this past Christmas.  We came to Mandalay Bay to see the Shark reef and decided to eat here for Christmas lunch.  SO much better then what I was expecting, which was typical hotel on the strip food. I had the Christmas special which was Prime Rib, Sweet potatoes and mixed veggies and for dessert, chocolate cheesecake.  everything was delicious. not one item I ate was bad and I was so impressed.  on top of that, we had excellent service from both our waiter and at the busy times, the funny bartender, who at one point started pouring our drinks while wearing normal street clothes So at first we weren't sure if he was an employee or just a crazy customer who picked up a pitcher and started doing his good deed Christmas day.   will definitely be back again.  could not have asked for better customer service or food!
HAPPY HOUR!  Great spot for happy hour food and drinks. Try and the other bartenders are very professional and laid back.

I went with 8 friends. we were sat up front near the band. we could not enjoy a conversation because the rock music was so loud. When they weren't playing, they were talking. By the way, why was there a rock band at the House of Blues?? Our gumbo came out luke warm, we sent it back. it came out hot the next time, but our entire party was sick by the end of the night.

It's good place for breakfast or brunch after a late night out or even after a hangover. I like their coffee and their waffles are great with strawberries! So were their french toast. Will come back if we decide to stay at M/B again.

This is a great little music venue! Okay so don't come here and try to order food and expect great service...it's a music venue and if it's a good night it will be packed...eat after. The sound and light system in this place is great and the venue is small enough where you get a good view from almost any spot. I went on a night Santana was playing and it was amazing...fantastic experience. Sounded great, seats were great and I would come back for any touring artist if I lived closer.
Gospel brunch is a lot of fun, food pretty good and the choir is WAY more entertaining than Britney Spears!!!!!!

Well, we based our breakfast decision on the menu that we found online. I love eggs benedict. And one thing that will always capture my attention, is the claim of homemade hollandaise sauce.  Well, it wasn't. The eggs were over cooked and the chocolate milk was warm.....yuck! Outside of that, it was ok.    The waiter was good, service was quick, and the atmosphere was 2 thumbs up. I got a side of their sausage, very good!  Coffee was awesome too.   The waiter did suggest a way to consolidate my dad's order to get him a better deal.  That is knowing your job.  My dad is a fan of the pancake sandwich. A couple of eggs  between 2 cakes.  He was very happy with his.  I would eat here again, I would just order something different.

I going to squeeze 2 experience into 1 review for the House of Blues. I was on a business trip and staying at the Mandalay Bay hotel and the very first night I was there, the head of my region decided to treat everyone to a meal at the House of Blues. The waitresses and waiters successfully and quickly handled our entire group in a coordinated effort and made sure our glasses were always full and that all of the food was hot when it arrived at our table. No small feat considering we were a group of over 30.  I wasn't feeling too adventurous so i just ordered a burger, but the burger was cooked very well and the options of what you could add to the burgers were very extensive. My entire group was happy with the food, but if the waitresses says the dish is on the small side, please take her on her word. The Cobb salad was humungous and I will give a second-hand review of "delicious".  I had such a good experience the first night that when another, smaller group of co-workers asked me if I wanted to go, I immediately said yes. I went with a group of 4 and got their House of Blue salad and a side order of Sweet potatoes fries (because I just couldn't say no). I was just as pleased the second time around with the food and the service. The best part of the second night was the fact that they had several TV's and it was easy to see game 4 of the NBA Finals. Unfortunately the Miami Heat still won.

Gabriella was incredible and informative.  My drink never went empty!  She brought me cucumbers for my hendricks and tonic which i love.  We came in for a light lunch and she recommended the juicy Lucy because she said it was a must and it was featured on the food network.  Oh my Cheese!  Although not light It is a must because I must be in heaven!

Best concert venue in Cleveland. Great food, excellent service, wide variety of shows, beautiful surroundings (especially the Foundation Room). Our city is very lucky to have a HOB. I've never had a bad time there!
Lindsey rocked it as our waitress. Food and drinks as always are the best.  Love the House of Blues.

I got a pretty darn good fillet mignon here - tender, perfectly cooked, lightly but well seasoned - with a pretty good bottle of wine for a surprisingly good price considering it's in the Mandalay Bay in Vegas. The service was alright but the fake roadhouse ambiance didn't do much for me.

We had one of the best Las Vegas News Years Eve's ever! We started out at the restaurant and had a great dinner. Next we went to the show downstairs featuring the Roxy Gunn Project and the Graceland Ninjaz.  We came in with an affordable VIP package for four which covered the show and going up to the Foundation Room to watch the fireworks from the balcony on top of the Mandelay Bay.  I had a couple of guests with special needs and the management team was very accommodating and made this an awesome experience.  As for the non-rockers that have been here, suck it up! It's a music venue and not a library. Crank it up!

My wife and I always make it a point to come to House of Blues when we are in Vegas. We usually order the lobster mac and cheese and sweet potato fries. The atmosphere is fun and the live music is awesome (although it can get a bit loud) every time that we have gone we had received excellent service. Definitely one of our favorites.

We came here twice on our last stay at the Mandalay Bay this past week.  Once for dinner and once for breakfast the following morning to take advantage of their buy one get one free breakfast promo.  Both times were great.  Food and service was prompt an efficient, with the breakfast service especially good.  Our server was very friendly and pleasant to talk to.  I like the coffee, which in part may have been recovery from the previous night, but others in our party agreed too, so it couldn't have been all due to the late night!  We stopped by for bit after dinner for the music which was great, but it was pretty packed so we didn't stay long.  All in all, highly recommend for the food, service, atmosphere and music!    I also visited the Foundation Room on an different visit (business) and that was NICE!
Very fun atmosphere! Brianna the hostess was amazing. So bubbly and her makeup was on point! Lol. Will be coming back!
Saw a show at the house of blues tonight. Awesome venue... Sound was great. Staff was friendly . I would go back anytime.

The douchebags stage managers tried to stop the Matt & Kim set 30mins after they opened at 8pm this past Friday.  So they were going to go 5mins over their half hour time slot.  Big deal.  I paid a considerable amount of money to see this Cut Copy show, and if the opening band (who has a big following) is going to go 5mins over, I don't expect the House of Blues staff to go onstage and start motioning for the band to cut it off.  I expect that kind of bush league behavior at some pay-to-play shithole on the Sunset Strip, not at the house of blues.
