If a band is going to go five minutes over, keep your douchebag crew off the stage and let the fans see the show.

The music venue is clean, and well staffed. The sound system is quite good. We ate at the House Of Blues restaurant before the show. The food was pretty good. Not up to the hype expected from other people With whom I had spoken. The service was polite, but on the slow slide. For the food prices, we expected better. On the up side, if you spend more than $20 per person, you are admitted before the other ticket holders. Kind of a nice gesture for eating there.

The HoB is a fantastic place to see a show. An avid concert-goer, I've seen my fair share of shows here and have developed theories and strategies to maximize the fun.  Other than a sub-par performances or equipment malfunctions, a great concert can actually be within your own control. Here are some tips:  Timing - Opening bands generally go on about 45 minutes after 'doors open'.  They play for about 45 minutes as well. Then there's about 15-20 minutes between the opening act and the headliner. You may or may not have any desire to see the opening band, but getting there in time will give you an opportunity to get a great spot, either on the floor or along the peripheral rail surrounding the floor.   Position - position depends on how close you want to be to the band, versus how close you want to be to the bar and restrooms. For all the shows I've seen there, and the frequency with which I have to return to restock imbibing supplies, my favorite spot is along the rail to the right of the stage. You can tuck yourself into a spot along the rail and have relatively easy access to restrooms and the bar, while having a great, unobstructed view of the stage. The acoustics there are not as good as they are on the floor, or on the balcony though. If you wish to be closer to the band, it doesn't get much better than the floor, but it's a hassle to get to and from the floor.   Drink selection - the greater the volume, the better the value.  As I am a person with a larger frame and sausage fingers, I enjoy the PBR tallboys or the my-size 24oz Budweiser. Plus you'll want volume to save on trips to and from the bar, so you can enjoy more of the show.

Service was great, bartenders were awesome recommendations were spot on-food was fantastic steak tacos were the best I have had in a very long time the spicy tomatillo sauce was awesome.  They even gave us to go drinks!!!!!

I had the awkward situation of going to Vegas with my husband, my recently-divorced dad, and his new girlfriend.  His girlfriend likes to dance, with is fine with me, so we went here because this is the "discotheque" she liked last time they came to Vegas.    It's House of Blues.  You know... it's more of a concert venue than really a club, but whatever.  I was exhausted, but we still stood in line about 30 minutes to get in.  Right before we got in, the girls in front of us handed free passes to my dad and his girlfriend.  So they got to get in for free, dang it, and we had to pay $25.  I was kind of pissed about this, because I could have just easily danced to Montell Jordan outside the club as in, but after a few minutes, a band started to pay called the Spazmatics (spelling?)  The Spazmatics really made the night a lot better.  They were four guys pretending to be super nerdy.  Boris, the Czech-exchange student on the bass, wore exceedingly embarrassing tight little shorts with his white oxford/sweater vest/bowtie.  Others had slightly larger shorts, but had weird glasses or sweatbands instead.  So funny.  The were an 80s cover band, and the singer was surprisingly versatile, and the band had some really hilarious banter between songs stemming from the nerdy costumes and personas.  They never broke character, insisting we say "HECK YEAH" when we liked a song so we didn't "have to put a dollar in the swear jar."  I'm glad HOB booked these guys, because they saved my quickly-starting-to-suck-night!

Pros and cons. The event we attended was an all ages concert, so we expected it to have more kids and more concessions to kids. Fortunately, we decided to get seats because the floor was jammed with adults (standing only) and it would have been hard for kids to see at all. We were told all seats were "partially obstructed." That was an understatement. We could only see half of the stage and much of that was obstructed (not occasionally as we had been told) by people standing along the sides. I did not know the second floor standing area existed until the show began.   The Michael Jackson fan we brought was overwhelmed by the volume of the sound and ended up asking to go home at the first song. Then his parents moved him to an area above and behind us where more people were standing.  This cut the volume,  allowed him to dance, but limited his viewing to blurry, small TV screens. We took him home at intermission.  He was happy, so that's what mattered.  The staff was warm, friendly, and accommodating. One person led my husband to a place somewhere in the building to buy earplugs for our grandchild. All went well after that, but the four adults have no intention of ever returning. Too hard to see the stage and the tv screen for our area was over my head requiring leaning way back to see a blurry picture. I can watch a better TV at home.
Went there for breakfast, food was good price-wise good as well. A waitress that served the tables on a balcony was very nice and friendly

Decent food. Great artists.  Total bs for GA entry. Waited over 2 hours the line moves forward and they bunch everyone up opening line not from the front. So if you were first you might end up being 20th. Get some queues people.
Steel panther was a good show last night  However the 2 opening acts was an 1  1/2 hours of misery I will never get back  We almost walked out and did not come back

Went to the house of Blues for the 1:00 gospel brunch & it was amazing! The chicken & waffles with strawberries were so good. The bacon, scrabbled eggs with cheese, home fries & fruit salads were so yummy. The music was phenomenal! What a fantastic way to spend a Sunday afternoon praising the lord & enjoying all the dishes!

Went to the house of blues for dinner.  I had the juicy Lucy burger which was pretty tasty but was on the small side of a burger.  Additionally it didn't blow my mind and i also thought that for $13.99 for a burger and a medium sized cup of fries was not good value.   Bottom line is I feel this place is a bit overpriced especially for what's supposed to be a bar.

I have always gone to the House of Blues for music events but never for the food.  Just recently I was there attending the Press Club Awards Ceremony and had a blast.    There was open bar where they served some great drinks.  Also, the layout of how they had the tables truly fit with the atmosphere of the place.  I was truly impressed.  For dinner the wait service was great!  I forgot to let them know ahead of time that I would need a vegan plate.  So during the event, they went backed and made a speciality dish for me.  Which I was so grateful for!  The vegan option that I had, was so delicious!  I know the next time I attend a concert or another event, I will make sure I have time to grab some food from here!

House of Blues located in Mandalay Bay is the one place in Vegas I have to stop at any time I am in Las Vegas. They always have a nice beer selection at the bar, their customer service is always exceptional, plus they offer really good food at a decent price. When I stopped there tonight I got to meet Paul the bartender and Melody the manager, both great people who exude hospitality! Thank you !!!

This is probably my favorite venue for a concert.  Its seats a decent amount of people but it also feels intimate.  I was able to catch Teena Marie here a number of years back and was impressed by the show and her talent.  Everytime I go to LV I'm sure to check and see who's performing there because I like the place so much.  One day I will try the Gospel Brunch other's rave about.

What a gem this was to find in the Mandalay Bay. Live music. Great Cajun food. And the ambience is unlike anything we found in Vegas all week. If in the area and looking for some great live entertainment while eating some fantastic creole food, you've found the spot.

I came to watch jimmy eats world since I wanted a show while in Vegas but nothing overly expensive. We had gone to the red square before the concert ad drank alot of vodka and then  purchased a drink wristband  at HOB which my husband ended up taking full advantage of. This venue was small & intimate like others and no view was bad to enjoy the show. Unfortunately we were next to an obnoxious old drunk guy who kept bumping into me and causing me to spill my drink. Didn't realize how smashed my Hubby was either until I noticed he kept singing the same song over and over again lol. I followed him outside for a smoke break and when we tried to return inside he ran straight into the wall and security said he was done and kicked us out. I just couldn't believe after all the heavy metal and rap concerts we get kicked out of "jimmy eat world"! Hahaha I was pissed leaving before their set was over and it was only 9pm.

We went here for early evening drinks, so we are unable to see a show.  We opted to sit at the small bar in the back which fortunately had two bar stools just open up.  The feel of the restaurant is pretty cool.  They were able to make good use of beer bottle caps recreating stained glass mirrors and other religious themed constructions, in effect, creating a church dedicated to the blues.  That I enjoyed very much.  What I did not enjoy very much was some of the clientele.  For example, to the left of me there was a long engaging discussion about the "right" and "wrong" ways to hit a woman.  I think the consensus was that open handed strikes were okay -- ladies, you have been warned.  The female bartenders were tatty and gritty, but amazingly attentive.  With each round the drinks got stronger.  Wine pours pushed the brim of the glass and Cuba Libres became transparent from the very high rum to Coke ratio.  Making the arrangement even more generous, it was happy hour when we went.  So our several drinks came out to very little money when all was said and done.  Our bartender received a nice tip in accordance.    Overall, I am going to say this is a great place for drinks -- just be wary of the customers that may be hanging around when you go.  I think what I experienced was just a fluke.

I am not usually a chain restaurant fan but we wanted a simple dinner and a good place to watch the Steelers game.  This place fit the bill perfectly.  Our server showed up right away to take drink orders and was great about making suggestions.  Being a person that eats small plates, I was pleasantly surprised at the amount of choices I had to select from. I went with the pulled pork sliders and they were cooked perfectly!   The interior was pretty cool with a bayou tree filled with lanterns took up most of the first floor.  A HUGE screen television set up at the stage was the perfect place to watch the game (which my guys lost).  I will definitely be going back when we are in Vegas,

This was my first time eating at the HOB. I think it will be my last.  The first drink I got the was watermelon smash and it was delicious. However, I ordered a second one and when I took a drink, there was ibviou9something missing. So, I spoke to our server. The bartender then told her they ran out of mint. Well, the mint is what balanced everything. I find it a bit annoying that, I had to ask in the first place. So, we tried a few other drinks and none of them were up to par with the first smash I had. So, I settled on water and that was that.   I had the calamari for an appetizer and it was pretty good. A bit on the spicy side, but the dipping sauce calmed that down quickly.   For my meal, I ordered the shrimp and grits. I'm a huge shrimp and grits fan. These were not good at all. They made a patty out of the grits, grits were made with water. Then they put it on the grill and grilled it until crispy. The shrimp were big and plain. The sauce wasn't bad. There was just too much of it. Making the entire meal extremely watery. Too much sauce, not enough actual food for what I paid.   Prices were a bit steep. $108 for 2 people. I don't think we'll be returning. I wasn't impressed with the meal enough to give it a second try.
This place has awesome food. We have never been dissapointed ! Ok, and the Corn Bread is the best anywhere ! Great atmosphere also.

Great place for a burger and beer snack. Fried pickles are very good and the service is always friendly and efficient. Not a mind blowing experience, but you always know what you are going to get and it's decent food.

Incredibly disappointed with my experience here. The delicious food at this establishment was hampered by the HORRIBLE customer service. It took an hour and a half for them to bring out our food(party of 8) and they never came to check on us the entire time or full our drinks. Then when we asked for refills the waiter rolled his eyes. When the food finally did come my parents rigatoni was crazy hot! My dad loves spicy food but even he had a hard time with it, despite it saying nothing about it on the menu. My mom couldn't eat it. My burger(Juicy Lucy) was very very good but overall not worth the experience.

I have never seen a concert at HOB, so my rating is only for the restaurant.  I have eaten here twice for lunch both times I was not picking up the check, and both times I have been disappointed.  The lunch menu is large, but not really inspired and overpriced in my mind.  Our service was decent the first time and horrible this last time.  It took so long for our food to come out (over 45 minutes) that one of my co-workers had to get his boxed up to go.   I appreciate that we had a large group, but a 30-45 minute gap from beverages to the lunch being served is ridiculous.  Also one of the members of our team is a vegetarian, and she wanted a salad (she really had no other option), however the salad she wanted came with steak on it, so she asked for it to be removed and to not be charged for it.  The server said that just couldn't be possible, served her the steak and suggested that she share it with the group.  Weird, and rude in my opinion.    All in all after two bad showings, the House of Blues is off of my list of possible downtown destinations.

My 21st birthday was spent in Vegas, and in the duration of my trip I visited House the House of Blues twice! I couldn't ask for a better place to have gone for my birthday! I love the House of Blues.  This one isn't the first one I've been to, although, I do think that this is probably my favorite one so far. The food is really great here. I love their caesar dressing, and the chocolate cake is to die for.  The drinks are moderately priced, just like the food. HOB is just a great place to come and relax on a lazy Vegas night or to come and jam out with some of music's biggest names to date.  It is usually packed, so it is a good idea to have someone arrive about 30 minutes early to get your name on the list. I love the decor, the giant tree in the middle of the restaurant, especially. The Dia De Los Muertos theme is really great, too.  I shall return to you, House of Blues.

Came here for a quick breakfast before heading to the airport. Never thought house of blues served food, but this location does. To eat, I had the bacon avocado benedict, which was good. I also had their cajun bloody mary that came with a little shrimp. That was really good too. Overall, decent place for brunch.
Good venue for shows. Would be better if it didn't smell like stale popcorn, J√§ger, and body odor.

Place is joke. Dark, dirty and shitty customer service.   Not customer friendly by any means. Tried to walk around and check the venue out during the middle of the day and was told that it couldn't be viewed when I walked in. Was told to ask my server and was told no again.   Drink service was average and out door patio was average as well. Ordered drinks at 350pm and was told happy hour pricing didn't take effect until 4pm. If your on East 4th, pick it another place

We came to this location before going to a concert at the convention center in Mandalay Bay. They were fairly busy being as it was close to dinner time but we were seated quickly. The waitress we had was training somebody else. However she was attentive and paid close attention to what we needed. She overheard that I have a dairy allergy and she made sure that all of my food was dairy free without being asked. The restaurant and self is well-kept but noisy which is expected. The staff as a whole is very polite. I wouldn't think being in Vegas that the house of blues would be one of my spots that I would want to return to being as I live in California and we have one here. But I definitely want to return to this location. I am however upset but I don't remember my servers name because I would like to give her a shout out for doing her job and going above and beyond.

Went in for lunch.  No seating in the dining area so we got sat a a small bar table.  There was a mediocre cover band playing way too loud and they gave us five painful bursts of audio feed as a bonus.      Our food was okay not great.  The butternut squash soup was great.   Pouting was so so.  Both of us got the eggplant sandwich which was decent but gave us horrible stomach pains within two hours...or maybe it was the poutin which we both ate.  Waitress was friendly but slow and not frequent to check on us even though we were seated right next to the kitchen.  She even put the wrong appetizer in for us at first.  The manager apologized for the band issues and gave us 15% off but it didn't make up for it.   $50 for a truly disappointing lunch experience.

So this is the thing...most dining in Vegas has gotten pricey over the years. I might have cringed at paying $16.99 for a chicken sandwich at the beginning of the trip but after a couple of days here you realize that's probably not that bad of a price. Although that's why the buffets are popular because at the Mandalay Bay Hotel The Buffet is $17.99 and includes a beverage. So it wasn't the greatest chicken sandwich in the world but the service was good. Also I really like that they allow substitutions for the fries and I got a huge quantity of quality veggies. They weren't your standard carrots and peas, but rather red peppers, asparagus and crisp green beans.   I got my sandwich to go as I was on my way to the airport and just discovered that I had $24 on my MLife card that would expire within the year. Knowing I would unlikely be back to Vegas that soon, I tried to find a place I could use the credits. Turns out you can't use them in the convenience stores, but you can for any restaurants. So basically my lunch was free and you can't complain about that!

I was here for a corporate event with eBay/Paypal, and they had rented the whole place out. There was a Journey tribute band call "DSB" (Don't Stop Believing) who were very good.   The foods they served (buffet style) was awesome. It was somewhat standard... chicken fingers, pasta, shrimp. There was an open bar, and the drinks were all top shelf.   I had been here before a few times for dinner, and it was very good. The dishes are always large, and the prices (for a resort hotel) are pretty reasonable for what your get. And there is almost always a band... so live entertainment is always a good thing.

I hit up happy hour here one afternoon. It starts at like 2:00pm. Yes, you read correctly, 2pm. Get your half price chicken tenders and cold wine starting at 2pm. It was a deal I returned for twice, I think. I started taking those babies out to the pool with me. The lighting is moody and low. The decor is all house of blues. I mean sort of if you've seen one, you've seen 'em all. But I think there are subtle nuances from place to place. They're not exactly all the same. As it was happy hour (ahem, did I already say 2pm?) and I had to sneak my chicken tenders out to the pool, I did not stay for a show. But one of these ol' days, I will. I certainly will. 5/9/12

I have seen tons of shows here, they have some cool deals for locals like half off drinks and waived ticket fees. It is in Mandalay Bay and they always have great bands coming through here. I have seen Rancid, Motorhead, Bad Religion, Bad Brains, and a few other shows there this year.   Good times!

While I've been all over the country, and every House of Blues is pretty much the same, at least they're the same in that they're a great place to see a concert.  Good view of the stage from the entire venue and small enough to make it feel intimate (The Joint or The Pearl).  I especially like the great camera crew that shows the band on closed circuit TV's all over the club.  Three bars ensure you can always get a drink pretty quick, though at a major dent to your wallet.  It's a long walk from the parking garage, too, so be prepared for that!

This review is for the concert venue (I have never had any experience with the gift shop/restaurant*).   I have been to over ONE HUNDRED shows here, the first being Blue October in 2006 (hey, there was nothing else on a weekday night) and the last being one of the thirty Steel Panther sets I have seen here. Seems masochistic if I really believe this venue is two stars right? Well, one does not have a choice if a show is booked here or at another better venue.    This venue seems to be a magnet for douches. I cannot put it any other way. It's probably the location, because it is not particularly the shows; sets of Steel Panther at Ovation @ Green Valley Ranch go on without a hitch. A Joe Rogan/Deathsquad set goes on without a hitch at the now defunct Playboy Comedy Club at Palms, but here at House of Blues .... ahem ... crowd is comprised of 40% deebags. It could be argued that it is not the venue's fault, but perhaps it is.   I have never been hit with a cup full of beer at The Pearl; seems to be something that would only happen at HOB because of several factors: - security is not respected;  - security -- generally speaking, is not competent, hence why they are not respected; and - bartenders, some of them at least, are inherently rude pricks therefore agitating the poor cheap beer consumer and filling them with unpleasantness (and cheap nasty libation) which later would inspire them to throw a half-filled cup of the shit towards an innocent group of concert-goers due to the clear lowering of standards of decent etiquette.   Ten or more times I have walked up to the bar and asked for a cup of ice water. Ten or more times I have scored the HOB employee lottery and gotten a cool bartender that realizes it is exactly fifteen or so seconds of their time. They give me the cup and I give them a couple of Washingtons as compensation.   Why is it that the one time there is a EDM festival outside (at the beach or the arena or who knows [I did not attend], and the aftershow is in the HOB, a deebag bartender, who years earlier as a regular concert-goer probably was the perpetrator of a thrown beer or two at the same venue, announces to my girlfriend that he would not give her water that was from the Las Vegas Valley Water District. Uh, okay.   Truly nonsensical, especially considering they use that SAME water for drinks, but perhaps they were mandated with selling more over*priced bottles of water by supervisors/management because they were expecting a bunch of thirsty, candykids to be in there that night. Cool; eight dollars or whatever the hell it is for a bottle of Dasani water, which is just tap water from another city, and no tip for the dude behind the bar.  Those other reviews pointing to the gross oversell of the GENERAL ADMISSION/FLOOR areas of HOB-Vegas have it pretty dead on. I have been to, I don't know, ten-twelve different HOB venues and none oversells the GA sections of their concert halls like this HOB does. None have such an impressively poor climate control system either where it seems like it is 120 degrees F during some sets (Common during NBA All-Star Weekend comes to mind).      This venue will never be a Pearl, or a Book & Stage, but it could be as decently solid as HOBs in other states (Dallas, TX comes to mind, or even Chicago, IL [which is by no means perfect]). There are significant problems that are organic to this particular HOB venue and it is quite sad because a lot of decent shows are booked here. You've been warned. - E  *except one time when they were supposed to be the distributor for the LV Weekly advanced screening passes, and they were giving out passes at 11AM, we walked in at 11:01AM, and were informed they were "sold out" of passes. Bullshit, and indicative of how this place sometimes operates as a whole. They have some really cool employees, and yet at the same time unfortunately some of the most soured, rude, and outright criminaloids working there as well.

Shoutout to Diana the hostess for being one of the most pleasant people I ever encountered in Vegas. She was so sweet and helpful....you have a great employee!  This review is for the restaurant only.  The menu is New Orleans, with lots of traditional southern flavors.  I had the french toast, which I usually don't care for, but this one was outstanding.  Crispy outside and a fluffy interior made with cinnamon raisin bread.  my friends all enjoyed their meals as well. The bacon wrapped meatloaf had several people moaning and rolling their eyes back in their heads...maybe they were being poked by a voodoo doctor, or maybe it really was that good.  Service was a little slow, but it was authentically New Orleans slow, so maybe it was intentional.  They had Abita in the bottle and the cocktails were delicious.  Stop by!

Had dinner here with friends. It was pretty dead for a Saturday but then again, Carlos Santana was performing next door so there's that... My friend's enjoyed their dinner and mine was just eh. I ordered the Fried Chicken and mashed potatoes and the chicken was crazy bland. The crispy skin was super oily ( yes, I know it's fried...) but it was a bit much. Will I be back? Maybe for a Santana show...but not for their fried chicken.

We went to the VH1 Rock Honor Awards  after party  which I believe was in the VIP area - so not sure about the typical crowd or main area but it was a fun venue.  The bartenders and servers were incredibly friendly, the music was great, the food decent and unusual, fun, new drinks were served.   I'd definitely go back.
Our server Katie T. is the best server for Vegas!! Great personality and service. Also gives honest opinion to our questions. Made our trip memorable with her advice :)

Went in yesterday for the Sons of Apollo show. It was my second time there. I had tickets waiting at will call and the lady helping me couldn't have been nicer!! In fact all of the staff was very good. The decor, atmosphere and sound was awesome! I got up front and was feet away from the artists both times. Plus, I didn't go home with my ears ringing which usually happens at smaller venues. Awesome venue!!!

I drove from Buffalo to see The Airborne Toxic Event play on a Tuesday night in the C-Town, and the venue did not disappoint.  I got there early, grabbed a couple beers and met some lovely denizens of the fair CLE.    I could go on and on about how much I loved the show, but that would be a TATE review, not a HOB review.  I thought the sound was excellent (tho standing right at the stage Didn't SUCK) and the venue size and location were perfect.  Also, pretty damn easy to slip from the sides to grab beers from the bar.

We stopped in because we were starving and there was no wait. We should have gone for a better restaurant with a wait! The service was horrible and the food was even worse. The lobster mac-n-cheese made me sick and my 19yo said that the fried chicken made KFC seem gourmet. So gross. Our server acted like he hated his job and was very rude. Absolutely horrible experience and we won't be going back next time we stay at Mandalay Bay.

Like all House of booze's, I usually only come when a good band or artist is perfoming.    Sound is decently well, and you can for the most part have a good view of the stage anywhere you stand, unless it's packed like the night I went to see Social Distortion play.  This place gets negative points for having limited bartenders to a sold out Social D show, having to wait in a line to get a drink is no fun!!!!!  I would come here again though!

Went to the Yelp star wars event. I have to say Misti and Molly rock! These ladies always put together fun events. I hope one day to become an Elite so I can see what the privileged few get to attend but I have to say the regular events are way fun!

Absolutely loved the brunch experience I had here. We came here on Easter Sunday, and I am not religious type at all. There was a Gospel group that came in as the performance that afternoon. The total cost was about $40, which sounded expensive at first, but in the end it wasn't a bad deal at all for what I got.  The line itself was a bit of a long wait. Once we got in, the smell of pancakes and syrup filled the room. There was a nice waitress handing out mimosas to the guests, and then we basically just seated ourselves on the bottom level.  The room itself is wide, dark and has a traditional layout. It's a boxed style layout that is traditional with a balcony up stairs that surrounds the whole room. Then you have the main floor and then it drops below floor level. It's about medium sized that you'll get a good view anywhere.  Once we found our seats, we went hunting and gathering for food. There was a omelet line, which only produced 3 omelets at a time. It's about a 15-20 minute wait, but well worth it. The chef was very talkative and engaged with the patrons.  After that I picked up some HUGE perfectly cooked apple wood bacon. By the end of the performance, it was all gone. Also picked up freshly made mini waffles, and sausage.  I am fairly picky about my OJ that it can't be from concentrate. My friends made sure the waitress brought back fresh orange juice. I was very satisfied with it.  Service wise.. well they never came back to refill my drink. I'm assuming they stop service when the performance is on. There was a lady out there giving people new glasses of mimosas.  Performance of the gospel group? Absolutely amazing. High energy that got everyone off their feet, and participating with the audience was fun. Everyone was twirling around their cloth napkins in the air.

Great Ribs & Jambalaya! Nice atmosphere with great entertainment. Excellent friendly service located right outside the casino at Madalay Bay so you can gamble once you finish eating & drinking. Overall the place is really cool the food is awesome & the drinks are great no skimping on liquor at all!!!

LOVE THIS VENUE!  This is a review for the venue not the restaurant.  This is one of my favorite concert venues in Las Vegas. I have seen too many shows to count starting from when I was in high school over 10 years ago. The thing I love about it here is you are able to see the stage from pretty much anywhere and most shows are general admission. It's a small venue which makes it easier to see bands up close. I used to get up in the crowd when I was younger. Ok, I'm not that old now but I enjoy hanging out near one of the side bars drinking a tall boy and watching my favorite bands at the same level.   The beers are overpriced but really not that bad. They have a wide selection of tall boys and even offer a $5 dollar shot of anything when you purchase one of the tall boys. Mich Ult with shot of Jameson. Yes please! Recently they started serving snack like food in the venue which is nice if you plan on staying a while and drinking. I actually haven't tried any of it since I love going to the Burger Bar before or after shows.   Whenever I hear that one of the many bands I enjoy is playing at HOB, I get really super excited. The only gripe is that the tickets are managed by Ticketmaster which charges ridiculous fees but that's just something we all have to deal with.

For the type of food, it's expensive. I get that these places have to pay rent. However, you can go many places down the e4 alley to eat. We just had a burger. For the price and quality, there are better places. Also their beer is stupidly expensive and worse in the concert. 9.50 for a 24 ounce Miller light it's sports venue prices. Definitely get liquored up elsewhere and get premium drinks. Why get crap beer at craft beer price? Won't be back for a while. Our last concert was on 2015. Next show we'll drink at some other spot and eat at our fave joint in the alley

In Cleveland for a work conference. Hanging with five of my co-workers. Two of us wanted to sit outside and people watch, but the majority one.  The atmosphere on the inside is very fun. They have a variety of art all over the walls. Jessica was our server and she did a super job!   I have never been here before, so I thought I would experiment with a drink that I had never had before. I ordered a Mango Ginger Press which has fresh mint, ginger, mango, and a splash of lemon-lime soda. This drink is so tasty I might try to make replicate it at home.   I ordered a cheeseburger because I had a craving for one. It's been a while. I did the "build your own" with provolone cheese, crispy onion strings, extra pickles and a little mustard. The burger did not disappoint! It was cooked to perfection! They make homemade pickles, and they tasted a little interesting, but other than that, the meal was fantastic!
The breakfast specials are really good and reasonably priced for Las Vegas. The waitstaff was friendly and fast. Latte was better than Starbucks. We walked over several times from the Luxor to eat.

Much smaller than the L.A. one, but they still have that amazing cornbread, and it appears on the Happy Hour menu...which makes me so happy, I could almost air guitar about it.   Oh, and the bartender was all Rosie-the-Riveter and dealt very kindly with drunk and unreasonable people. Happy to report, I was not one of them.

The menu is very pricy, and since Aaron Sanchez created the new menu, many of my favorites have been removed. I ordered the pulled pork sandwich, and I am pleased to say it was really good. The pork is extremely tender. My main complaints are with my server. I asked for a kids water, and he asked me if I wanted the cup that lit up. I said yes, but had no idea, I was going to be charged $5 for that cup. Also, he took a really long time to bring the check, and an even longer time to bring me the change. With a great server, I would have given a higher rating.

Great service, excellent food & drinks! Purchased a VIP table for DSB Concert 6/2 through Ryan, he was a great host! Gianna served us, she was prompt and attentive. Very happy with the service. Definitely be back on our next trip

Way down at the bottom of the barrel of House of Blues venues you will find this mistake. This venue made me want to avoid attending any concert ever again, anywhere. Getting in and out of the place is an absolute nightmare. I couldn't imagine there being many survivors in the case of an emergency. The human giving wrist bands needed an attitude adjustment, as did the ticket scanner, "hand stamper", and both bartenders that I interacted with. I approached an empty bar only to be ignored by 3 bartenders for several minutes. 2 of them then disappeared into the back while the other proceeded to clean. No thanks.

We came during the day when there were no performances, so this review is strictly about the food, which wasn't good. The section we were seated in was pretty empty. I ordered the jalape√±o cornbread as an appetizer and the blackened salmon with a cucumber salad as my entree. The cornbread was dry and overcooked, but luckily there was butter on the side. It did have a nice flavor that wasn't at all spicy like the name would suggest. The blackened salmon was overcooked and tasted bland. Bland bland bland. The saving grace of that lunch was the strawberry mango lemonade. I could have filled up on that alone. Also, our server was very nice and attentive; however I see no reason to return to House of Blues.

Came here feb 13 to hear the pj Barth trio (who was awesome) and also decided to eat here.  We ordered whisky and cokes which came out very quickly and decided to order the full rack of st Louis ribs. Let me say-best ribs I've had in Vegas. The meat fell off the bone, and had some tasty brands and excellent coleslaw to go with it. We also had the banana bread with a whisky glaze that was to die for.   Besides all the great food our waitress, Nicole, was top notch. She was nice and chatty and very attentive. She suggested the banana bread dessert to us. Even if the food was horrible (which it wasn't) I would come back here for drinks just because of her good service. We probably will come back tonight!

Place is great. We came in for a quick dinner and Jessica recommended the popcorn shrimp (A), fried chicken skewers with sticky maple sauce (solid B) and carnitas sliders(B) - a little dry.  The watermelon margarita was killer. Great atmosphere.  Good came out quickly and hot!

Here to see a concert. Great atmosphere and vibe. Ordered drinks in the concert venue. A double shot of Jack was $24! I ordered a bud light thinking i would get a bottle like everywhere else and the bartender puts down a 25 ounce can of beer. I ask if they have bottles and she says no and before I can say I will take something else she opens it. No way can I drink all this! Oh and did I mention the beer and two bottles of water cost $34!!!! No prices listed at the bar either. If you go to a concert here DO NOT ORDER DRINKS IN THE BAR!!!!!! Plus the bartender was kinda rude.

I'm a lazy person of habit.  So it should not be surprising that during my last stay at Mandalay Bay, I ate breakfast at the House of Blues every morning.  However, its convenient location and familiarity are not the only things that kept me comeing back.  Quite simply, their breakfast food is AWESOME.  They serve the best bacon I have ever tasted.  And that's not hyperbole....... it was so good that just thinking about it makes me salivate.  They also make a damn good waffle.  And my boyfriend was impressed that they serve 4-egg, rather than 3-egg, omelets.    Their prices are reasonable for Vegas standards (our tab was usually around $26, except for the morning when I ordered four servings of bacon).  And the service is good.  I don't know if I'd make a trip down here if I were staying further down the strip, but if you're in the area, it's a good bet.

The worst food ever that I  had in my 83 years of life. Smoked chicken. Was served cold both chicken and bean "mush". Chicken was dry, little chunks was sawdust  taste. Colslaw drenched in white liquid no flavor, no taste no character. Pricy and worthless.

Ehhh, I think 3 starts is about accurate for this place. I've been to several House of Blues restaurants at different locations and loved it every time, except for this place. I ordered my burger medium and got it almost rare and my sweet potato fries, which tasted great, came out cold, maybe room temp. To be fair, I did not tell the staff so they did not have a chance to make it right. I tasted my mom's Cajun pasta and it was average at best. The chicken in it tasted freezer burnt. Wasn't terrible but definitely wasn't great. Service was really good, though- so I tacked on an extra star for that!

Tonight forever locked in Hotel California with no possible escape. I believe we are referencing Vegas here. After making it through security here which moved fairly rapidly. Time to go into the venue. The warm up band was the Forgotten Door, believe it or not they are actually good. Usually the opening band is audience practice, but the rhythm of the band and the lead singer were awesome.  This band kept the band engaged and dancing. The lead singer of this band was a female and she had a perfect voice that carried a tune too.  Time for the main event the Eagles cover band. This is close enough to the real thing for me. I was not old enough or alive when they started. The Eagles were a main music staple in my household growing up, so to hear this cover band I'll say does the band justice. They played a lot of the Eagles hits and a few that were not so popular. The Eagles frontman Glen Fry would be very impressed with the wonderful tribute to such an iconic band.

The venue had a large open space for standing room, and had 2 bars.  You weren't allowed to leave once you were admitted entrance, but you could go in to a roped area for a cigarette if you needed.  The only way in to the venue was through the Mandalay Bay hotel/casino so you couldn't go out and get "fresh air."  But the sound system was great, the lighting was great, and like I said before, they had 2 bars.  Oh and the bathrooms were well maintained.

Ate breakfast here. The food was pretty good but our server was not. However we saw the other server being very attentive and refilling coffee and mimosas. Initially we thought we might go for the unlimited mimosas but in the end we were glad we didn't because we never would have gotten a refill and wouldn't have felt like we got our money's worth.

The wife and I purchased tickets to see R.Kelly and Lil Kim.  The doors were opening at 8PM.  We arrived about 7:45 to find a line forming near one end of the Mandalay Casino by the restrooms.  There was one person checking ID's and giving out wrist bands and moving the line to a second person.  This person was advancing the line as security was checking bags and persons before packing everyone against the wall of the casino.  By this point folks were annoyed as everyone could see how unorganized this process was.  Finally at 8:30 we were moved into the venue like cattle and people didnt know where to go at this point.  There was an elevator that went up, or you could walk downstairs only to take some back stairs back up.  It was confusing because I asked an employee and she gave major attitude as if we should have known the layout of this place.  Also, the elevator only could take about 10 ppl at a time.  Anyway, found my seat and thought this may get better.  The DJ (J-Nice) playing was great, but his set was way to long for a concert to begin.  Lil Kim finally came out and she was good.  Then it was another wait probably a hours or more before R. Kelly came out.  R. Kelly performance was good also.  One of the major problems with this venue is the view of the stage.  The stage is positioned to far back and if you dont get center seats you're screwed.  Overall the chances of me returning to this HOB location are slim to none...

My taste for music is as moody as I can be sometimes and last week I was feeling hard rock. Luckily, I found out that one of my favorite bands, Volbeat, was performing that night along side Hellyea, at the House of Blues. My husband bought the tickets and we headed over on a Thursday evening.  The venue is not huge but I didn't feel like it was too crowded, just what you can expect from a rock concert. We had seats on the balcony and it was actually very nice to watch the band and the crazy pit from up there - made me be thankful for my upstairs seats. There was one bar upstairs, which also wasn't overly crowded and very easy to access. Security staff was very friendly and helped us find our seats.

Second time eating here without planning it this time was dinner everything was delicious 3 people at our table had the strip steak with the smashed potatoes cooked to Perfection and tasted perfect also enjoyed the app calamari the shrimp and the garlic fries all exceptional as well a couple other people at the table had the fried chicken no one complained about anything plates were left clean for dessert key lime pie while but my all-time favorite was the coconut cream pie Tower High not too sweet tasted perfect still dreaming about it

When I lived in Las Vegas, I would walk by this location often and always wanted to try their food. Finally got the chance to when I was asked to go on a date dinner here.   When we got here, there was a wait as the place was packed, but was told it would only be 10-15 minutes. We were seated promptly within our wait time, but was too far away from the stage to see who was playing that night. I'm not familiar with the type of music they play here, so I didn't recognize any of the songs, but did enjoy listening to it while we ate.  Our waiter came shortly after we were seated to take our drink order before heading to other tables to check up on them. Since it was a busy night, it took quite awhile for our drinks to come out and for our waiter to come back and take our dinner order. I ordered the House of Blues salad with a side of garlic mashed potatoes. The salad was made of fresh greens, red and yellow tomatoes, spicy pecans and feta cheese and topped with a balsamic vinaigrette. The salad tasted fresh and had a good flavor to it. They did add way too much vinaigrette for my liking to my salad. Next time I'll ask for it to be put on the side. The pecans and feta was a pleasant addition to the salad which I normally wouldn't have added. This cost $10. The mashed potatoes were delicious!! Potatoes were of a perfect consistency and had just the right amount of butter, garlic and salt and pepper. Cost $5.  My date got the Pulled Pork sandwich, which came with house made coleslaw and he added a side of fries as well. The Sandwich was full of flavor. There was just the perfect amount of BBQ sauce on the pulled pork. The meat was also done well without it being dry. Cost $14. My date isn't a fan of coleslaw, so he didn't end up eating it. The fries were crispy, but plain. They needed to add more salt and possibly some pepper as well. He ate them, but said he has had better at a fast food place. Cost $5.  Our waiter came by only once while we were eating our dinner. Did try and catch his attention on several occasions, but he was on a constant go between all the tables he was attending to. Finally got our check and it was another 10-15 before he came back with our card.   Would suggest maybe hiring more help during weekends, holidays and busy times of the year. The food and music was great, but service was slow.

We came here for dinner and loved the live music! The ambiance was pretty fun too being there was a huge fake tree on the inside with lanterns and a fun, cool decor.  Unfortunately the food wasn't the best. We got the spinach dip which was good! Then our burgers came and well.. Not the best. My husband had the heat seeker, cooked medium. It came out well done and a few of the jalape√±os were unbearably hot, and he loves spicy food. The sweet potato fries were cold and some actually tasted raw so I'm sure they were frozen fries that didn't cook all the way.  I got the BBQ burger and again, came out well done and dry. We were looking for good juicy burgers but it just didn't happen.  Our server was nice! I think we will pass on house of blues next time for food. I would go back for a drink and entertainment!

This is by far the worst venue in Cleveland.  They have very strict rules. People get kicked out all the time, so be careful not to have any fun. Also the drink prices are outrageous.  A tall beer there is $10 plus tip... Unreal. Then you go in the bathroom and they have people in there bothering you for money, just because they handed you a paper towel.  Walking around the venue, you can just hear person after person complaining.  It sucks that some excellent bands play here because I want to support the musicians but not HOB. Any other venue in Cleveland, I will guarantee a better time.

Great happy hour beer prices!  I have not seen a show here, but I have eaten here three times.  I came here twice for dinner and once for breakfast.  QUICK TIP:  Eat here for dinner and you get a buy 1 get one free coupon for breakfast the next day!  I'm a fan!

Visiting for RCPM concert. We have been here several times for that band, as well as Santana. This is a great venue for small concerts. Beer is ice ice cold, but extremely expensive. During this visit we dropped $300 on alcohol and bottled water, not sure how much our friends spent but probably close to the same. We're not even big drinkers. We were here 3 1/2 hours.  Sound & lights good, service quick. Will continue to attend events here as we always have a great time.

I had high hopes for a place called "The House of Blues" especially since it was located inside such a lavish casino, but I was pretty let down.  The acoustics were terrible. I could barely hear what the opening artists were saying. Gary Allan was a meh concert, but would have been great at a better venue. Plus they had people packed in this tiny bar like sardines. No spot was guaranteed. We nearly got into a huge fight with some very rude people so we left.  Conclusion: I highly doubt I would come back! Oh also I tried to get a drink at the bar I showed my ID to the bartender. He wouldn't serve me because I didn't have a wrist band. I didn't catch the memo, but the people next to me said they didn't even have to show their ID and they got a wristband. HMMMM!!!

The restaurant is awesome and The food is very good!!! Love eating at house of blues.  But concerts are not handled very good! Mostly the security is all Over the place with rules the lines are a mess after standing a long line for how ever long. (Don't bring back packs u can bring in a really big purse) after u are check u go into another cluster and lose your spot in line and not told what or where to go. if u don't mind that then the rest of the night u can handle. If u are handicapped u are in troubled for Concerts no real room For u and if u do find something u are no where close to anything with no real views also if it's up in the seating area bring a coat b/c it really cold up there b/c you are by the a/c blowers.  Other then that the music Sounds great! bartenders are great!  Cocktail waitress are wonderful!!!  the coast of Drink are out of this world $12 for a 6oz. Cup! With half of a shot of liquor in it Please!!!  And vip seating cost is Dumb!!! For the size of the stage and venue.  I'll Think again before seeing a show here again!

Recently a friend and I were visiting Cleveland and stopped in to check the place out.    George and Kate were great! Gorge was kind enough to take us on a personal tour of the place, it's absolutely amazing!  Kate was very friendly and happy to not only pour us some delicious cocktails, but also told us of some other beautiful places we should check out before we left town.  The food and service were on point! I couldn't have asked for a better experience!   Can hardly wait to go back!

First off, let me qualify that I've never eaten here, just gone to the shows.  If I have any real issue with this concert venue it is that I am a little bored of it.  Seems that about half or more of the bands I want to see in Vegas are playing here.  The VIP areas are a little annoying, but this is Vegas.  Maybe I've just lived here too long to be outraged by this, but they really aren't in the way of anyone of average height.  The VIP boxes are lower than the bar area so those of us in the back still get a nice view from any of the three bars.  The floor area is of decent size but can be a bit too crowded for some of the more popular shows.  All in all unless you plan yourself behind a pillar the view is good from just about anywhere.  Sound is no better or worse that most places I've been, though I can remember a show some years back where a band blew at least one of the venue speakers mid-set which was obnoxious.
Always enjoy House of Blues and the shrimp po boy was excellent. Service was a little on the slow side but still friendly. Window seat was great to people watch.

Came here twice for our recent Vegas trip: once for a quick snack/drinks and second time for brunch.    Love the decor of this place, very detailed to create that gothic rock vibe.  Service here is EXCELLENT.  The staff is extremely friendly, relaxed and very attentive.  For the snack, we ordered fried catfish bites with sweet potato fries.  It was delicious!  The catfish didn't have any muddy taste and the aioli tarter sauce they served complemented the catfish well.  Presentation was creative too.  Also, my midori margarita wasn't mixed with enough liquor, but our server offered to mix us another drink or gladly remixed it for us.  For the brunch, it was alright.  I ordered a corned beef hash skillet, but I guess to show they used quality corned beef and potatoes, they didn't chop them up to little pieces but served big chunks of beef and potatoes.  I guess it's just different preferences.  My bf and friend ordered make your own omelette, but I didn't see them rave about it.  However, presentation was good and food was a lot and the our server was friendly and attentive (kept making sure my cup of coffee was filled).  We also ordered some garlic fries which were pretty good.  Overall I would be back for either lunch or dinner, maybe even try to catch a performance here too.

This review is for the Restaurant not the Venue. CAN YOU SAY RIP OFF!  No where on the menu or stated by our server that they automatically ding you for Gratuity and Entertainment tax.  Our bill was $156 and by the time they added on there extras our bill was $209.  Now wait a minute we had a table of 3 not 8 and the band playing was a local blues band not a big production name.  When I asked our waiter why we had to pay an extra $53 dollars he said I don't know but we have to give tip money to the bar and cook.  THE BAR DID A CRAPPY JOB OF MAKING ANY DRINK!  Charged me $11 for a vodka fruit punch that was water down and taste like grapfruit...which I did not ask for.  The one star was for the waiter who was on our table like an ant to food.  He was attentive and friendly.  Needless to say we gave our waiter a little extra but not much since we were forced to pay gratuity in our bill.  My hubby and I are so angry that we will never return to the HOB for food or drinks; next time we eat and drink up before we go and order waters.

Hubby and I ordered shrimp for an appetizer. It came promptly and there were 5 nice size shrimp. It was delish. I had the taco for dinner and they were very good. Cabbage inside was a nice touch in place of lettuce. Hubby had a ceasar salad. But the best part was we were there to see a show and if you spend 20$ a piece you get early admission to the show. So worth it. We saw Chevelle and the place was sold out. We got a great spot on the rail. I felt bad for some who didn't have such great places as it was packed right. The band was awesome.
Gospel Brunch was a great time with good food and great service. Choir was amazing.  Whole family enjoyed it.

If you are looking for Lobster Mac and Cheese they have the best!! They have a large menu and some great appetizers as well as some great cocktails.  I really love the atmosphere there and the service has always been great!! We saw a concert there a few months ago and it was great! The sound system, lighting and venue all were great, but the next time I will opt for a table or assigned seating since I am short it was kind of hard to see, otherwise it was a fun night!!

Why on EARTH would Chef Aaron Sanchez put his name on any of the food at this restaurant?! Horrible! Tasteless! Don't waste your time on dinner. Perhaps as a music venue it is OK, but the food was disgusting. I ordered an appetizer of chicken wings. Sure the crunch was spot on but it was under salted and spiced. The chicken itself tasted like worn out shoe leather. I followed this by one of Chef Sanchez's signature dishes - a half rack of ribs. One bite into it and I was sorely disappointed. The ribs must have been steamed or boiled. It too was flavorless. To cover this up, it was slathered with a sauce that tasted like ketchup with hints of cayenne. This is not at all what I expected from an Adobo sauce. It was just straight up YUCK! I had it all packaged up to take back to my hotel and was SO angry I tossed it in the garbage as I walked back to my room. Shame on you Aaron Sanchez. Either take your good name off such horse-menure food or fire your executive chef and get someone who knows how to make it the way you intended it.

Since we were staying at Mandalay Bay, HoB was a convienient place to have breakfast.   The options for breakfast were good, and go with the atmosphere of the restaurant and music venue. As a group we ordered blueberry pancakes, omelettes and hash browns. Overall, everything was OK, but lacked any real flavor. The chorizo was more like ground hamburger, and lacked any kind of spice. The blueberry pancake was good, but the maple butter it came with didn't taste like maple at all.  I know its cheesy, but I really did expect a menu from Aaron Sanchez to be more flavorful.   The service and atmosphere were great, and made up for just so-so food.   I also liked the gift shop at the entrance. The cashier was really friendly and helpful, and let us know what kind of live music was scheduled for the next few days.

This is a review of the concert venue.  Not of the restaurant.  I have seen some amazing concerts here.  I have won tickets to the shows.  I have purchased tickets.  Most times the ticket prices are good.  It is crowded.  They pack a lot of people into this small space.  So it gets kind of stuffy.  It is too loud sometimes too.  I know I am making myself older than I really am.  But a venue inside that is so small does not really need to have to sound turned up to 11.  It gets to a point where you can't really even hear the music clearly.  And though it is supposed to be a non-smoking venue, there is a lot of smoking that goes on.  At least at some of the shows I've been to.  I am not speaking of tobacco smoke either.  The pot smoke has been so heavy that I had to leave a couple of shows early.  I don't like to feel trapped with that kind of smoke.  It is a comfort thing.  So while I like this venue for the most part, it is not my favorite.
Came here a few times over the years to see the Reverend Horton Heat. Entrance is easy, VIP balcony is unnecessary, standing-room only venue with good sound and ambience. Always a good time.

I went here for a private party and had a good time.  Really dug the ambiance and enjoyed checking out all the cool stuff on the walls and ceilings.  The music level was just right with a great variety.  We were being served appetizers by staff that kept the rotating.  The bacon wrapped cheese wiener thing was *awesome* but it didn't come around as much.  The rolls were pretty good but a little too prevalent.  The chicken satay skewer though must have been invented to sell more beer.  Overall I did enjoy my time here and I'd definitely return to dine there.

One to two stars, got the Jambalaya:  Marinated chicken, white rice, andouille sausage, sweet peppers and roasted green onions in a spicy traditional jambalaya sauce  Wasn't: Spicy Evenly Heated  Had: Delicious sauce A lot of Rice  *Even BJs has a better Jambalaya with more stuff.  Waiter was nice, split all the checks for us, she asked. (A party of 12)
David was AMAZING! He recommended the best appetizer on the menu, best wine to pair it with & made sure we would enjoy our evening by recommending a club near by!
The house salad is yummy. I had the veggie flatbread option. Well grilled and the basil arugula topping was good. Hope to get Brittney again when I am here next
The bacon Chipotle Mac and cheese is amazing.  Correna provided great service, and the HOB atmosphere from the venue lends itself to a great dining experience.

HoB Vegas has some pretty awesome ambiance with a high-ceiling dining room that feels like a court yard, complete with a huge tree.  Service was great throughout our lunch visit but their beer menu could have used some updating. Two bottles brews listed were missing.  The food, starting with the veggie-cheese dip, was good - my Cast Iron Cluck chicken sandwich was as filling as it was delicious! Most definitely upgrade to the sweet potato fries - it's too bad the portion for these was so small; they were incredible!  I wouldn't hesitate to go back.

Not sure I understand some of the poor reviews on this one. I've been attending concerts here since high school, and I've always had a great experience. One of my favorite things about this venue is the fact that it can accommodate a lot of people but still feel intimate if you are sitting in the right place.   My days of standing in GA are behind me, but I often purchase reserved seats. Grabbing a seat in Row A of the balcony can be quite spacious and low stress. You can stretch your legs out and still feel close enough to the stage to enjoy the band and see everything clearly.  No music venue is perfect, but I like when my favorite bands play House of Blues. To me, HOB is way more personal than a sprawling arena but still buzzing enough. This location goes through ebbs and flows with programming, but so goes the competitive nature of Cleveland's venues. This House of Blues also has a great Foundation room and rooftop patio, but I'll save that review for another day!

Dined here for Brunch Saturday morning 3/18/17. The wait to be seated took a while, but the photo booth to the right of the restaurant distracted us. Otherwise, once we were seated our server Pablo was very attentive and provided great service. We were seated at 11:14am and I decided to do the unlimited mimosa's for $20, but it ended at 12pm. So he made sure my glass was never empty! I can't believe it but I was able to fit in 7 mimosa's in a 45 minute period. I am that girl in Vegas, yolo! Otherwise, the egg benedict was delicious, but a bit too spicy for me to order again. However, I think I will make this a go to spot every time I am in Vegas.

We're local, and this was the worst $50 meal we've ever had - by far!! Tough inedible steak, charred black burger (asked for medium), tasteless frozen french fries, watered down ranch dressing. And how do you fuck up a salad??!!??

We had a great night eating at this restaurant prior to seeing mastodon. The server was a very nice gal. Even though my order came out wrong he immediately fixed it. The food was delicious!!! We had the jambalaya, house of blues salad & veggie flat bread. Again, service was great & food was excellent! The only thing I was displeased with was that I feel that they should offer more vegetarian options. They have maybe 2 & 1 of them is a salad. Other than that the atmosphere is nice & food quality was as expected for the price.

While my heart is with the more indie-centric Grog Shop and Beachland Ballroom, this is actually a great place to see a show. Fantastic sound, great sight lines, and (for me, at least) consistently nice and attentive servers/bartenders/bartendresses. The bathrooms are also the bar-none finest you will ever have the pleasure to pee in during a rock show.
Favorite place!!!! Edgar and Auggie are the best. Raspberry sours are the best and the gator bites !!!!!! Really the best place for a casual drink and quick bite to eat!!
Awesome happy hour specials, although I think it ends too early... 5pm Great service, friendly bar tenders.

This is a great place to visit. They have live band playing while you eat and drink. The songs they sang are awesome, a lot of classic rock. They also sing very well. The restaurant is very well decorated. The restaurant has a lot of style. Children are also welcomed.   What I did not like was when I explained to my waitress that it was my mom's birthday and that I wanted to suprise her with a birthday sundae. She didn't deliver. My guest has left already. I am bit disappointed.

We had a below average experience here - our waiter although friendly was simply overwhelmed and couldn't serve us in a timely manner.  Drinks took a long time to come out.  We asked for a dipping sauce for the wings and we couldn't wait any longer and ate them without it.  Our main course was brought out while our dishes from the appetizers were still on the table and we didn't even get silverware having to take them from other tables because we wanted to eat.  We were also put at a table right in front of the band and when I asked to for another table I was told that they didn't come on for another hour so we should be OK.  Well, they started playing  20 minutes later and we couldn't even have a conversation.    They need more staff and no one should be put at a table right in front of the stage if they're there for dinner - it was just uncomfortable.

Observations of my first visit to Cleveland House of Blues, Mar 13, 2018 for the Eric Johnson show. I was with a fellow musician friend from my rock group.   We arrived at 630 PM and decided to have a drink in the lower bar. The drinks tasted good and came to 12 dollars, no big deal. I handed the server 22 dollars for the two drinks. He casually said "keep the two fives ?" I thought that is a quite excessive tip request, for a two drink order. I took my change back but did tip accordingly.  The show did start at 8 PM, which I felt was professional. Before I proceed, I want to be clear that the talent all evening was very good but the sound system needed adjustment. I noticed during a brief pre-show announcement - portions of the mid-range really needed tamed. It had a noticeable effect on intelligibility of vocals. In the area of 315 to 1K or so...  The FOH rig is an 8 box line array each side. We were seated in the center, near the front, of the balcony. The top two array enclosures were certainly sufficient coverage for that seating area. The mid-range 'honk' was observable in all areas, balcony and floor.   Considering what I was able to hear, there is enough horsepower driving the arrays and subs. And I imagine the drive(s) are quality pieces, and was likely dialed in with the proper testing equipment, but does need the (qualified) human ear touch on the FOH overall EQ. I imagine the drive(s) are password lockout. Separate main EQs, for "touch up" may be in place at the console position ?   Dismissing the EQ situation, what I heard is:  Drums - decent channel(s) EQ settings. Rack and floor toms a bit low in level. There were two overheads, which is good, but the audience missed a lot of the excellent technique on the ride and high hats. The drummer was top notch.  Bassist - the tone in FOH was very dull. I grasp the featured instrument was Eric's guitars, but the sound was like the bass guitar tone was turned completely down on the instrument. Perhaps that is what was desired (?) I wish I could have heard more differentiation between the notes. Bassist was an excellent performer.  Guitar - it sounded pretty good in FOH, and the mids issue is not as noticeable on a guitar, as it was on vocals. Eric is an amazing musician as we all expected to see.  The interior of the facility is quite interesting overall. I have read other comments on the sound system, and I think it would be of benefit to tweak the FOH EQ settings. If people could hear an A/B comparison of the before and after adjustments - they would appreciate the improvement. The installed equipment is undoubtedly able to sound awesome after adjustment.

Saw Social D here last year and it was the best show I've seen!! Great venue. Got crazy packed in there and the drinks are a little pricey but it's Vegas!! What do you expect? Standing towards the front was awesome!! Then, I realized I had to use the bathroom. Bad idea to drink that redbull and vodka so fast. So, my hubby and I pushed our way through the crowd only for me to wait in a line..boo! Bathroom was decent. Would love to come back to see a different show!!

My five star experience was seeing Jurassic 5 here!  I can't speak for the food, the bar, or anything else.  Just the fact that this is a fantastic place to see live music.  Small, intimate venue with great acoustics.  Keep in mind that shows start right on time when it's all ages, which is why we missed a large part of the show (which was a huge bummer, but my own fault).   The sadness of missing most of the show was quickly washed away when my two friends and I were invited backstage and got to chat up Akil, Soup, and Chali 2Na of J5!  I swear, they must be the most grounded, friendly hip hop artists on the planet!  What an amazing night!  Thanks, House of Blues, for hosting J5 this week!  They are some of the best performers I have ever seen....totally exceeded my already high expectations!
This place is pretty amazing it's small compares to the other buffet places. The Gospel Brunch is expensive $60 bucks for one but it's worth it. Live Gospel band is amazing also. Give it a try.

I had been here once or twice before.  On those trips I didn't have a negative experience, but it wasn't a good one either.  The first thing you should know about my most recent trip (and what will be my last) is that someone got stabbed in the crowd.  This is the fault of the venue.  Security is a joke.  When entering I watched multiple go inside after the metal detector wand had beeped.  The overcrowding in the General Admission area certainly didn't help the matter.  Due to the stabbing, security (and later police) roped off an area of about 15 square feet due to it being a crime scene.  This of course didn't help any of the crowding concerns.  The blood puddle was left untouched which is important for the crime scene, and we should be able to continue the show right?  Nope, after 2 or 3 more songs the concert was ended early.  The ticket prices are ridiculous at this venue ($60 after fees for general admission).  It's even worse knowing that the concert still had at least 30 more minutes.  Not only did I feel unsafe because of this venue, but they also essentially stole $20-$30 from me.  EDIT: One employee has contacted me through yelp regarding this review and apologized for my bad experience.  I appreciate it.  I have also sent some letters to some managers and directors as well.  I will try to update further if anything happens.  All that said, the review will remain at 1 star as that was my experience of the venue.  It would take a lot to get me to return and re-evaluate my rating.  I would not re-evaluate without actually returning.  EDIT2: House of Blues has responded to my letter and has sent me a gift card to compensate for my bad experience.  I'm very happy that they responded to my complaints.  Hopefully soon I'll have an updated review and a much better experience to share.

My mom and I came here for a late night snack during our recent trip to Vegas and we were not impressed. Basically, both the food and drinks were pretty awful. My mom ordered a Mai Tai and I ordered the BBQ Pineapple Mojito. First off, I love mojitos and I especially love pineapple. Unfortunately, my drink was so bad that I couldn't drink it and had to send it back. It was watered down, didn't taste like pineapple, didn't taste like any sort of mojito I've ever had (mint floating in it but didn't taste like mint), and had a funky flavor that was unappealing. The waitress was very nice, apologized, and offered to get me a different drink. I politely declined, since I had tasted the Mai Tai and it was just okay. I had a feeling the rest of the cocktails weren't going to hit the spot. The only good thing was that my mom liked her drink because it was very strong.   Additionally, my mom was hungry, so she decided to order the Grilled Vegetable flatbread - this had basil pesto, goat cheese, mozzarella cheese, roasted artichoke hearts, broccolini, roasted red onion and micro basil leaves. There was something wrong with this. I took a bite and could not take another. It had an off flavor and I couldn't tell what it was. Maybe the bread? Maybe the pesto? One of the veggies? It was bitter and sour and ... possibly fermented? Not sure. However, since we already sent my drink back, my mom didn't want to send the food back and she continued to eat it but without any gusto or enthusiasm.   Overall, the place was extremely crowded, the waitstaff was understaffed, the food/drinks were awful, and I don't think I'll be back. If you are in the area, try another place.

Great venue to see big name and not so big name acts from around the world.   The staff is great and always ready to help any way they can. Coming in for a concert we were running a bit late, missing dinner, and it showed. The doorman told us not to worry as we could grab a bite in the hall. Traditional pub fare it none the less. It was all we needed.

This venue may have been so awesome to me because I flew in from NYC and I'm used to douchebag security. I went here recently for a Green Day show and I can honestly say the venue is set up perfectly. The size is perfect and you have options of how you want to view the show. The whole venue is GA -- There's the "moshing" area which is right in front of the stage, and then there's a small gate behind the moshing area and on the right side for those who don't want to deal with that nonsense. Both of those sections are elevated so you can see overhead and also include stools and tables to drink, eat, whatever. You can pretty much see wherever you stand in this place. Upstairs seemed to be mainly reserved/VIP seating. There's a girl that comes around taking drink orders. When I was leaving, one of the security guys offered to walk my girlfriend and I back to our hotel (not in a creepy way at all, just being a gentleman for no reason). Overall great experience.

We stopped here for a quick breakfast before a flight and the service was outstanding. Aune swooped in took our order, got it perfectly, and was on top of coffee refills all in time to catch our flight.   We ate at some expensive restaurants and this was by far the best service we had - next time in Vegas we will be heading there for their breakfast.

This review is only for the restaurant itself and not the music venue.   I've been to this restaurant twice now for our usual holiday meeting. We take up the bigger conference room in the back of the restaurant since there are quite a few of us. And both times, my coworkers and I have had an amazing experience.   Their service is on point here. Our waiters have been super patient with serving a big group like ours. Some of my coworkers are a bit demanding, but the staff was always there to get whatever they asked for. The food always came out within a reasonable time. The portions of food are ridiculous, a bit pricey, but worth it.   The food here is good. I don't remember what I ordered the first time we were here, but this time I ordered the meatball sliders. The meatball was rich in flavor and the marinara sauce wasn't too tart. The bread still had some crunch from toasting it, which I like. I also ordered the House of Blues salad which I thought was just blah. The lettuce was a little wilted and could have used more dressing. I know my coworkers enjoyed their food since everyone was raving about how good everything was. I did eat a few sweet potato fries from someone's plate. It could have been cooked a little, as they were soft when I but into them.   I enjoyed coming here for our meeting. It definitely beats having our meetings in one of our stock rooms. We will definitely be back for our next one.

Came from Pittsburgh for a concert. Great venue for a metal show! Staff was friendly and helpful. Great setup for a concert, we found a good spot and didn't move but it seemed like there was lots of good places to stand to get a good view of the stage. Acoustics were great, even after a loud metal show my ears weren't ringing at all like happens in some venues. Beer prices actually weren't horrific for a concert venue and we always got quick service, friendly service at the bar.  Restrooms were clean and I was pleasantly surprised by the shelf in the ladies room stalls, a place to sit my beer and phone! Genius! It's little things that make me happy.  Would 100% make the drive again for a band not stopping in Pittsburgh.

Great venue to see Billy Idol last night. Only reason why not five stars are a couple of issues; the ticket price was a bit high at about 200 bucks each in the 200 section. Sat directly under an air conditioner vent that was freezing. The bar was the slowest I've seen in years. I gave up after 10 min but luckily a server came by and I ordered from her. The location is impossible to see the entire stage. Especially when people in front stood up. I would suggest to get the seats directly facing the stage but it will cost you! They are going for 300 bucks!! The severs were great but do not wait in line for the bars! Amateur bar tenders and really slow!!!

After watching the concert of breaking benjamins we decided to give this place a shot,  we ordered the pulled pork sliders as an app, the shrimp jambalaya and the lobster mac and cheese .  I have to say the food wa excellent and our server was good too

Only sat in the bar area for happy hour however we were very pleased with our service. Hosts were all friendly, bartenders were extremely quick to serve and made excellent recommendations and had no wait at all between apps and drinks. We most definitely Wil come here again!

I came here for the first time a couple of weeks back for the Blue October show. I'm a big fan!   First off - this House of Blues is a little different. It's built into the Mandalay Bay casino, so it can be a little disconcerting. Even more odd - the House of Blues preserves the House of Blues theme - in the middle of the gaudy casino floor. So it looks a little off.  All that changes when you get inside. Inside it's your typical House of Blues. Restaurant out front and concert theater in the back.   We were fortunate enough to be in the "secret" James Brown private room that overlooks the stage at the back. We had our own cocktail waitress who brought us drinks all night and we also sampled the menu.   Of the food that we had I remember the Chipotle Chicken w/ Hominy - Delicious! I recommend ordering this highly. It was so good that you'll want to lick the plate - seriously!   After the show we rode the elevator all the way to the very top of the casino to go to the afterparty in the Foundation Room. Bottle service was had - very prompt and attentive service indeed. The Foundation room is split into two parts - public and private. The public area has an outdoors area where you can actually go out and look at the strip.  My only complaint is that the middle aged white dudes in there couldn't dance worth a crap and made some very questionable decisions. Additionally, one of them thought it would be a good idea to "dance up" on a gogo dancer and got removed from the premises.  The show was fantastic, the service was fantastic, and the food was delicious. I recommend catching a show here!

Came in from L.A. for Billy Idol show..... Dined here with my wife ....... Food was on point....... My steak was perfect! Exactly how I ordered it ! Staff was very attentive! I felt very taken care of ! Chris was our server......

First off - this review is only for the concert going experience. I don't think I've every actually eaten here, and don't really plan to.  I've been here quite a few times since I've lived here for concerts. I've actually been to this venue more than any other in town for concerts.
