The last concert I was here for was just this past Friday (Keane with Ingrid Michealson and FRAN HEALY from TRAVIS). The most recent time before this weekend was in October, so I can't really rate on that experience. I've never actually gone to a concert for the almost sole purpose of seeing an opening act (if you couldn't tell, I was there for Fran from Travis). The tickets for this venue usually cheaper than other places on the strip (these were $28 for GA...however, I paid over $15.00 in taxes and fees for each ticket). I've never encountered a completely sold out show, and the will call window is super easy and doesn't typically require an additional fee. The box office staff at HOB are great. Very friendly and very helpful, this was no exception. The ticket and front security are also efficient and pleasant. They don't seem to get too upset when you are waiting to get into a show.  The only staff that aren't always good is the inside security. Often times they get a bit assertive about phones and cameras when their really is no need. However, I can see this as a good thing when people really are out of control...which I've seen a couple of times. As for a concert venue, I really think its odd that they have bathroom attendants. I am at a  standing room only concert where I paid $30 for a ticket...I don't really need a bathroom attendant...I guess its charm. The drinks are priced pretty typically for the strip. I had a 24oz Miller Light for around $8.  Usually the sound and lights are good. This past concert was not good. The first two acts everything seemed to go okay. But when Keane finally started (after what seemed an eternity) the sound was off, and it never really got clear into  the show. My biggest problems where that a) the staff didn't let us know there was technical issues, despite us being able to see they where having problems. b) they didn't get their stuff figured out  to make the sound better, leaving me (maybe I was the only one) with an incomplete feeling from the show. They finished their set, but I couldn't say I 100% enjoyed the show, despite being a fan.  If I could I'd give a 3.5 because I've seen some amazing shows here. However, its going to be a 3.0 until I can get back to see they still have their act together.

Went in for a drink before a show. I asked the bartender for an old-fashioned. I got some sort of red colored, sugary drink. I asked him why it was red, and he told me that it was supposed to look like that and it was probably just the lights. It tasted terrible and he didn't offer to remake it. I order old-fashions frequently and I have never got anything so weird, I thought it was a standard drink that bartenders knew.
For great food and some of the biggest names in Rock this is the place. Watch for performances with Rock N Roll Fantasy Camp. Some of the biggest names in Rock will be only feet away!

This was our first time here.  The bartender didn't seem like she wanted to be there.  We ordered food and I asked her how many sliders were in an order and she said 3..it was only 2.  She did not apologize or try to fix it, I had to ask two other waiters about the amount.  Once we got a table our waiter was great but his shift ended and it just went downhill even more.  Our new waitress only came to the table once and when we were ready to leave she overcharged us and didn't seemed to concerned with trying to figure out the bill.  We are locals and not sure if we will go back.
Everything 80's has meetups there - big fan of the music so I attend the venue.   No deals on drinks or food, much less standing room only, so be sure to discern which show is worth it.

Stopped in after reading poor reviews of neighboring restaurants and was pleasantly pleased with the choice!  Husband ordered the catch of the day - blacked tilapia with garlic mashed potatoes and snow peas, cooked to perfection!  I ordered the ahi tuna toastada appetizer as my entree and loved every bite of it!  We drank a few cocktails and ended up sharing the key lime pie which was not a disappointment!  Definitely an A+ for us and a recommended spot on 4th Street.

The food here was amazing! The waitress was really really attentive. The only downside was the band playing. We went there to see the band and eat dinner, but ended up leaving because the band was terrible.
I loved the intimate venue however the food was not very good. I had pancakes which how can you mess up and my husband had eggs benedict which were horrible. Go only for the entertainment.

Live music venue located on the casino floor in Mandalay Bay.  Tickets can be purchased online or at the box office.  Tip: it is worth it to get VIP. It is $150 and you will be seated at a table in the VIP section with your own waitstaff. The $150 is actually a tab so you order drinks up to $150 and anything over you pay out of pocket. Drinks are still expensive but not as bad as other strip venues.  We had a great time seeing Steel Panther and had a great view from the VIP area.

GREAT live music. But the wait for our food was ridiculous!! We ordered the lobster mac an cheese and it took 30 min to come. So irritating! It wasn't that great a lot of pasta with no cheese. Had to add Tons of hot sauce

Terrible customer service and they rape you on drink prices.  No specials.  There handicap accommodations put you in fire hazard areas and complain about putting you there or having to escort you to the restroom.  No restroom access.  Only reason I ever go to a show here is because I get free tickets, drink before and order 1 beer.  $20 tall cans WTF!?

Will I "out" myself as an old lady by saying this venue reminds me of the Odeon? (a long lost concert hall in the Flats - RIP)  Despite the fact that HOB has been in CLE for like forever now, I saw my first show there last night. Crowd surfing ain't my thang anymore so I stood upstairs behind the assigned seating to watch the show. The sound was good and there were video monitors in case someone 7 feet tall decided to stand up in front of you and block your view. (I'm talking about you, dude, in the ugly pullover)  Yes, drink prices are astronomical. But there are at least 10 other places within walking distance to get a cheaper drink. Pre-game before the show or sneak out during one of the opening bands' sets. That's what my friends did. (HOB gets bonus points for letting you leave the venue and come back!) I do think the pricey drinks keeps the jerkery to a minimum. Kudos to the attentive security staff who had no problem literally dragging out anyone who got out of line. Ain't nobody got time for that.  I'd definitely go back to see another show at the HOB. It's a nice, relatively intimate venue to see your favorite band or an up and coming one. Thumbs up!

The stage is too high to make this a truly intimate venue. If you happen to be up front you will constantly be having to back up because that is the route that the servers take to deliver food and drink. Would love to talk to the jackass who thought that was good idea. Also, they need a new sound guy or system, either way the sound is terrible. Other than that, how was the play Mrs Lincoln. There are better venues around town, Brooklyn Bowl (Plus the food is better) Hard Rock Live (Again the food is better) So unless it's a band that you must see go somewhere else. Live It Up You Are In Las Vegas For Cryin' Out Loud!

There for a concert medley of local Vegas bands.  The first thing we hear when we enter the room is a man screaming into the microphone,  "sit on my d#@k".  Not what we were expecting. The techno music between bands was popular music and well mixed. We stayed through most of the next band, but decided to leave because the music wasn't really what we had thought the evening was about. To be honest, we thought it was a comedy show.  I'll be there in the future, no doubt, for some other show not involving sitting on d#@ks.

Was there last night... upon entering and going down the stairs that were wet I fell. I was ok at first but then my knee started to hurt so I went to the bartender who saw me fall and and asked if there was somewhere I could sit. She and the guy working vip referred me to the ticket window to ask for ADA seating, explained to the girl at the window what happened and she didn't wanna help so I asked to speak to a manager. The manager was quite unempathetic about it. Basically did not want to help accommodate at first until I raised a stink about it. She stated she didn't know if she could accommodate myself and the three people I was with. Once she finally decided to it was ok to accommodate someone who fell in their establishment due to wet stairs, we get upstairs that was closed to everyone else, and there was only maybe 30 people there. Empty seats everywhere but only I was allowed to sit on a stool and my husband and friends had to stand behind me. Worst experience ever! First and last time I go. I should've just laid in the floor after I fell and had them call an ambulance and sued the crap out of them! The manager never once asked if I was ok or apologize for negligence of the wet stairs. The staff upstairs was also very rude and quite mean about it. This place deserves no stars! My knee is hurting pretty badly today, so if I end up at the doctor they will be hearing from my attorney!! Terrible customer service!!!!

This place is such a shame.  It's a great place to see a show but I have two huge gripes with this venue.  The first being they still charge you service fees at the box office for shows.  I'm okay with a dollar but I've been charged upwards of ten bucks per concert ticket.  My other gripe is they don't let you tape the shows.  There have been shows I chose to go to that I wasn't as stoked about over shows at the HOB simply because I didn't want to have to pay the exorbitant fees and have to pay for parking on top of that.  Oh yeah, the parking situation?  You are going to shell out at least five bucks and if there is a event downtown that night?  Expect at least 10.  Bands need to stop playing here and go back to playing the Agora.

One of my favorite music venues anywhere @hoblasvegas is small and lively with CHEAP ticket prices and BIG name talent.  The cafe is another story-OVERPRICED and just ok food.   The menu is pretty limited and mostly cajun/creole dishes and sandwiches.  I got a burger an order of sliders and 2 iced teas=$35!!! WTF!  NOTE: Burger Bar is upstairs
Well here with some coworkers to just chill really nice relaxing had a drink or two just real kick back servers are nice and on it

I went to the HOB for an event and they have two many venders set up! It was hard walking though trying to see everyone. They had 3 tiny bars, I can't imagine how busy the bar is when a sold out concert is going on. The wait line must be for a drink. The location is great near E. 4th and plenty of restaurants.

My husband and I stopped in for dinner last night after checking in. We were seated quickly but for whatever reason the hostess tried seating us in a far off corner where we could not see the stage and we had to ask for another table. The waitress arrives and takes our drink orders but looked and acted as if she was above doing her job . She had an obvious attitude as if we had made her life choices. I received a glass of water before my drink arrived and it tasted fine , like water but after my drink the waitress returned and refilled my water glass with SOMETHING from a pitcher that tasted totally funky. I was livid but it was loud as karaoke was going and I really didn't feel like going through it , I simply asked for my check and intended to have my drinks on the casino floor. After about 10 minutes the waitress returns with the check which I quickly review and hand her my card . After a few minutes she returns with my card and hands it to my husband. What! I had had it with this nut at this point and left her a tip that reflected her level of professionalism. The whole experience was very bizarre and I will never return. I spent most of my evening wondering what this psycho had put in my water and why. I will never return.

Just one of many identical, cookie cutter HOBs in the U.S. The sound is really horrible and the drinks are pretty expensive, which is par for the course. They carry tall boys though, and that makes me happy. Also, if you are just a wee bit surly to the surly door guys (not all of them are, by the way) they might just smile & be nice to you. At least the club is conveniently located in Public Square.

We went for the Blues night (Mon & Wed nights) - awesome music, great vibe. Had the sweet potato fries ($4) with a side of the Jim Beam BBQ sauce - GET IT! That was one tasteee snackalicious snack. Friend got the chick tenders w/fries - spiced in a way that made her sneeze, cough, lick her lips and go back for more. Be aware -you can't have just one of those fries. Think we're going back for acoustic night tonight!! BooYa! Its fun to live in Vegas!

I came here with a friend for a drink and an appetizer. The margaritas were reasonably priced for the strip (only $6!), but they were REALLY inconsistent. Our first round was pretty good, but our second round tasted TOTALLY different. It was almost like completely different drinks.   I had the blackened chicken taco appetizer. I'm not convinced they actually gave me chicken -- I couldn't tell what kind of meat it was! That's a problem. Seeing as I was hungry, I ate it anyways. The flavor was okay, but I've had better tacos.   I would have given this place two stars, but I gave an extra one because the live music is always fun.

The service is so very slow.  It took far too long just to get our drink orders in.  Then another millenium went by waiting for them.  Then the food came out so much later.  Our server was friendly, but it could not make up for the tremendously slow service.  No, it was not that busy either.  The food is just ok at best.  I ordered an omlette and it was edible, but not much better than that.  Just no flavor.  I knew better, but I let friends make the choice.  Never again.

VENUE REVIEW - not the restaurant   Here's the dealio with HOB: For a long time they genuinely were a venue that did absolutely nothing to cater to locals. They jacked up prices and made concert goers pay outrageous random fees. Which, by the way, you will STILL have to pay if you purchase any tickets for this venue on Ticketmaster. A ticket that starts at a base of $25 will end up costing you $37 by the time you finally purchase (no joke here).  So, as a local, I do have the ability to purchase tickets directly at the box office and if YOU are a local, I suggest you do the same. I recently went to see Jimmy Eat World here and purchased my ticket on site. SHOW THEM YOUR LOCAL ID before they punch in the purchase! They will waive the fees AND you will receive a pass that gets you a percentage off of drinks in the venue on the night of the show. YAY!   The night I went to see JEW, it was an all ages crowd, which is always a little annoying, but I digress. I do think HOB is a nice venue and it is versatile. I have seen many shows here: Ghostland Observatory, Less Thank Jake, Reel Big Fish, and also, Adam Carolla doing stand up.   The JEW show I think was over-sold. There was just WAY too many people crammed in the venue. HOB has a special vibe, it has a good bar staff and an intimate feel - and you should not have to be crammed up against someone like you're at freaking Warped Tour when you go there.  I really think they should streamline their process of getting in as well. Do I REALLY need to be asked 3 times to show my ticket? Especially when I already get in the venue and have two paper bracelets on my arm? Digging my ticket out of my purse once I've walked down the stairs is just a hassle, and is unnecessary.  Anyway, every concert venue in Vegas over-prices their tickets in my opinion. They know they can get away with it because so many people from out of town come to see shows here, but at least HOB is now offering the locals discount.

Great place to stop for a causal Friday night! Their patio/outside section is the perfect spot to simply sit back, relax, and enjoy some people watching (especially the parade of Indian fans chanting through East 4th St after a big win);  while inside features high energy karaoke and live bands. The menu has a good spread of food options and drink selection- though the price tag on their cocktails being $12-16 a piece is too steep for my taste- leading to my selection of a Mango Ginger Press "refresher" which was fannnntastic- the blend of Ginger Beer with Mango was reminiscent of the SBx Peach Green Tea Lemonade that I love so much. The BBQ flatbread was solid, but nothing amazing.  The staff was friendly and kept thing moving- though they did have to have a manger come out to verify the Yelp 10% discount.  The atmosphere/location is what really saves this place. The food is pretty good- just a little pricier than the quality.

House of Blues Gospel Brunch @Mandalay Bay: thank you for ruining both my appetite and my Mothers Day.  My husband purchased tickets for us to attend the first seating of the Gospel Brunch on May 11. We arrived on time at 9:00 only to stand in line for 20 minutes just to get in the door. We were not seated until 9:30, at which point the venue was clearly overcrowded and overbooked with lines of people, tables that were too close together and wait staff that were nowhere to be found.  I decided to sit down to try and wait for the food lines to die down with no avail.  I was one of the last people in line in the traditional food area. Imagine my disgust as  I and a number of people in line discovered that the plates stacked on the table to self serve ourselves buffet-style were actually a stack of used filthy disgusting dishes with old food on them. Every other plate had stuck on food, wet slime and garbage on it. Not sure how such a gross error can be made with a huge catering event...I have been on many cruise ships with 20 times the amount of people served and have never experienced anything like this in a dining establishment in my life.   I proceeded to take some pictures of the filthy dishes and went to find a manager.  As they looked for the person in charge a couple of bartenders were actually laughing when I told them what happened. I'm not sure what part of a potential outbreak of foodbourne illness is funny. I'm sure the Nevada Department of Health will agree  with me when I call them first thing Monday morning.  One of the busboys was very kind and actually came up stairs to the ticket office and appeared to be genuinely sorry about the whole thing. The on site manager was nice enough but didn't seem too concerned that many other people eating from that buffet line were eating off of dirty plates. What was supposed to be a lovely Mothers Day turned into a nauseating experience. Our money is slated to be refunded  to our credit card but honestly I was so sick to my stomach that I couldn't eat till much later in the day and didn't care about the money at that point.  Please people, be aware of where you eat. Scroll down to another Yelper who posted a similar review of the exact same brunch only 3 weeks ago.

I have been here 3 times to see my favorite band of all time HIM. The first time was back in 2005 I believe. My friends & had GA tickets. We wanted to be up close on the rail so we ate @ the place to get early admission. I remember the food being good & that's about it. We were just amped to get into the venue & get a good spot.  2nd time we had balcony seats. This is when we started to wise up, felt old, & no longer wished to be crushed against the railing. Seats were great up in the balcony. Sound was awesome, bar & bathroom upstairs, what more can you ask for.   3rd time involved GA tickets again. This time we just chilled by the bar for the entire show. Bartenders are super attentive & friendly. Even spilled 1 drink on the bar cuz I got distracted & the dude just poured another without giving me any attitude.    I will gladly travel to HOB Vegas to see a show anytime. On the plus side, Vegas crowds aren't pretentious like LA crowds. They actually get into the bands playing & aren't on their cell phones the entire show.

I usually go to HOB in LA and Anaheim but I like the Vegas location best.  Saw Phil Vasser because the pharmaceutical company sponsored the evening and rented the whole place out for our convention group.  The seating is great and the service is good. Small venue with good sound!

Please don't come to this place! We did not get to try our meal and we walked out of it! Rude hostesses, very bad attitude. Said we had to wait for a table when the place was empty.  Then one of them walked us to our table which was a very small two-top.  We asked to ne moved to one of many empty (and some of them dirty) four-tops next to ours and she rudely declined saying that there was a waiting list for those tables when clearly there was none!! Really?? Bottom line terrible hostesses!!!

Happy hour in Vegas on a weekend...Say what?? My friend & I ventured in to good music playing, cheap stiff drinks and food specials. Great way to unwind after walking the strip!  Plus service was great & entertaining.
Good food. Good Service. Great live music--gratuity paid for live music.

Great place for concerts. Acoustics and sight lines are great except for the two big pillars. Have yet to have a disappointing time there due to the venue but the band thats another story. Its slow going when you try to get out like the Pearl going up those stairs.  Edit: Whats up with the stupid VIP section? it takes up the entire middle level between the bars behind the sound board? So the rest of us who don't want to be in the mosh pit have a bad view on the side lines!!!
Service was poor, ribs were dry. Kept having to ask them to refill my water. Table was cleaned and we waited forever for check. Waitress just kept walking past saying I'll be right with you.

I recently held my bachlorette party at House of Blues and had a good time!!!   This House of Blues is located inside the Mandalay Bay Hotel and has live entertainment at night (which keep in mind... they charge a 10% entertainment fee to your bill if you happen to be eating dinner while the music starts.)   We got a great table in one of their back rooms that sat my 20 girl bachlorette party. The service was fast and attentive. The atmosphere was relaxed and decor was cool. The only thing that disappointed me was the food... it was overpriced and was not really tasty.   All in all it was a good experience, mainly because of the company at my table.   I probably won't be back because nothing really struck me as awesome.

Went here to see Billy Idol this weekend, while Billy Idol himself was great, the acoustics in this venue are terrible! I've seen Billy Idol before and he his voice has only gotten better with age, but at House of Blues most of what we heard was the background music. Perhaps his mic was turned too low? Even when he addressed the crowd and spoke directly into the mic (with no music on), the sound was muffled and I couldn't understand what he was saying. Very disappointed in the poor sound in this venue.   We had standing tickets and that was great and we had a great view of the stage, but I don't think I'd return to this venue unless I really wanted to see the artist, as was the case with Billy Idol.

Great atmosphere with music rocking round the clock. Took the kids and my sitter there for lunch. I enjoyed a shrimp ceaser salad and their signature corn bread with maple butter, yum yum! My kids both had Chef salads and their portions were very large and great for little fingers. The service was great, no complaints there. They got us a quite corner with view of the restaurant the casino so lots to look at while enjoying some good food.

This is a review of HOB Vegas as a concert venue. The food, I've had before and no offense but I'd seriously pass on it...  We saw AFI here this last January. AFI is one of my favorite bands, but more like a 90's version of them and not like the current circa 2000's December underground version.   As for the venue, this place kinda rocks. It is stadium seating so no problem getting a good view. I feel like it was general admission (pretty sure) but we had no problem getting really good seats. No problem getting in and out of the venue. Even with a long line it moved pretty fast. Good sound overall for the one show we experienced here. Their bar service was really fast with no waits upstairs.  I prefer this HOB over Anaheim any day. Plus the "disneyland" you deal with in Vegas is a lot cooler than the real one. And you don't have to deal with soccer mom's trying to run you over with their strollers...

Good casual place with great ambience. Located at The Mandalay Bay and nice casual place for dinner before catching a show at Blue Man Group at the Luxor. Grilled Mahi Mahi tacos are good; however, corn tortillas tasted a bit dry and stale. Not worth the calories do ate the filling and the beans. Oh yum! The beans were soooo good!

You know you're in Vegas when you shell out $25 for a hamburger and coke.   I tried this place a couple of times as we were staying in the Mandalay Bay and there are limited options. Food was OK, nothing really write home about. Service was good, no complaints. Pricing is pretty high, but then again, you are in a Las Vegas casino..  Not bad but far from great.

This by far was the worst restaurant we visited while in Vegas. Would recommend it to no one and will never return again. There were 4 adults and 1 teenager. After being seated we Had to wait for a glass of water. Once our order was finally taken we waited over 35 minutes for our dinner. Never once did our server come to our table to see if we needed anything or to tell us how much longer it would be before we receive our food. Instead, she stood in back of restaurant chit-chatting with other servers. Very poor service and food was not that great either.

This review is for customer service, or in this case lack there of. I went on a Tuesday evening around 5:30 with family visiting from out of town. Our waitress Britney was not rude but she also was not very attentive either. This place keep in mind at this time was NOT busy. After she took our orders she disappeared for what seemed forever, and that is how long we waited for our food. When she finally did appear she not once told us how much longer our wait for our good was, she just asked if we wanted refills on our drinks, which at this point after waiting for over half an hour for our food, of course we did. I then saw her standing over to the side after about another 15 minutes of waiting for our food, talking to three other workers, again, no apology for slow service, no mention of when our hood was coming. Finally, some guy who had the personality of a dish mop brought our food out. He was less then enthused to serve us. Food was decent, nothing to write home about. Will not be returning.

Had the opportunity to go to the Sunday Gospel Brunch on July 23 2017 with some family members....the singers were amazing and very entertaining. The host was very engaging with the audience which made it even more enjoyable.  The food was just ok nothing to rave about. The staff was very accommodating to some disability issues that we had and really attentive to out needs. I would strongly encourage everyone to not past up the chance to see it
Great food if you can survive the wait to receive it after you order. Over 50 minutes from the time of ordering to the time of receiving our food.

I'd come back again. Happy hour was legit and the bartender was sincere. To be honest everything tasted standard. Chips and dip tastes like chips and dip. Street tacos tasted like street tacos. Well seasoned and good spices. Would I eat here again? Yes. I'd have to order 2 meals though... one for me and one for the guy with the gun pointed to my head.  Jk

Attended with my partner last night, who had a stroke 3 weeks ago. Our first outing as he was learning to speak again. Spoke with concierge prior to show and informed her that we had 4 tickets. I invited the only people I trusted to be patient with him on his first social outing. Obviously he can't stand for 3 hours, so I inquired about seating and explained we will not be partying that night (obviously) and asked if we could bypass the VIP upgrade ($200) to get chairs since he can't stand.  Informed her that we are not jerks trying to "get something for nothing",  that whenever their house needs the floor filled that I, as Community School Ambassador to Clark County School District, distribute tickets to teachers. Rudeness of the "manager" was beyond anything I've experienced before. This was already a stressful situation as he was embarrassed not being able to advocate for himself and I was embarrassed in front of my friends who I assured would have a seat based on the info I was given. Finally, when the show was almost at intermission, I spoke with a girl by the VIP stand and asked, "How much do I have to pay for a chair? $20? $200?" There were EMPTY chairs all around. Finally we received a chair so my partner could practice communication and social norms again, instead of all of us standing behind him like bodyguards.You were insensitive, callous, and made a reasonable request seem like I was asking for a free round of drinks. All I asked for was a chair. Yea, your "rule" may be that you only sit the ADA customer and one companion, but do you have humanity and compassion? Do you only live in the world of black and white? There were empty chairs all around! I will never fill one of those chairs again. I will never distribute info regarding "free tickets to CCSD teachers" again. You embarrassed me, our guests who were to help with my partner's recovery, but most importantly my partner...who is a music lover and legendary blogger/distributor/fan.
Great venue - great staff - great acts - watch their concert listings - got see Deep Purple, Tesla, Shinedown, Slash and of course Steel Panther.

There's a lot not to hate here, but not enough for more than two stars. As a concert venue, it's decent and intimate (my old ass likes it up in the balcony). The booze and beer prices are pretty fair for a captive audience. Only real complaint: WTF with the bathroom attendants??  I've been to private events here, and the spaces I've experienced are not that great. As for food, it's maybe a notch above the McCasual level of a sit-down chain. Mediocre is about the highest praise I can muster.

We had just checked into the Mandalay Bay and decided to get some breakfast. We stopped by the House of Blues. It wasn't very crowded. We were sat right away. It took forever to get a drink order started. Our waiter was running around every which way but loose from table to table, but again it wasn't that crowded.   We finally ordered, I got the steak and eggs. I ordered the steak medium but received it a very much well done. It was super thin anyway and nothing special. We also got chicken and waffles which were ok, the pancakes and bacon were probably the best thing on the table. I had told the waiter we were celebrating my daughters birthday. When the meal was over he brought the check and said they didn't have any ice cream or anything else to bring out, but if we came back in a half an hour he'd take care of us. Seriously??   I wasn't impressed for the $100 plus we spent on this breakfast. Nothing really special here with average food. Go to the cafe at Mandalay Bay for breakfast, it's much better.

Solid offering for lunch and easy to find in the Mandalay where we had a convention. I had a  Naw'leans meal by starting with gumbo and then jambalaya for the entre. It was good though I expected it to be spicier. I have never been to any other H of Bs but I may try others.

Can't believe I have never dined at the House of Blues. Since there was one located at the Mandalay Bay & we were guests we decided to have something to eat.  I ordered an omelet & mimosa & hubby had a burger. Both items were good, nothing special & our waitress was nice but a little slow service for the restaurant not being that busy.  Would like to come back for their gospel brunch or live show since it does have a good vibe.
Great place to grab a beer and get out of the hustle and bustle of Vegas.  I think I am over the casinos and welcomed something a bit different.

I love House of Blues, I've been to many concerts here and I always have a great time and the music sounds great. I also wound up here on St Patrick's Day in Cleveland, don't really know how but it was really crowded and pretty fun then too. I don't really know why anyone would come here besides to go to a concert, but that's your own choice. I really like that the venue is relatively small but it's not so small that there's no room for anyone. Of course everyone tries to push their way up to the front but I like standing up a little farther aganist the railing.. no one is in your way and no one is really pushing you. Trust me, stand there if you go to a concert here.  Not much else to say, this is a good concert venue, that's about it.

best place in las vegas to see a concert. small venue, you can see everything on that stage. its especially really nice when the cute singers take their pants off and sing. its like you brought binoculars its so cozy.
Family of 4 and we all ordered different item and ending up with testing others breakfasts.  Breakfast special, pancakes, waffle were very nice.  Server was efficient and friendly.  Thank you Blade.
Bought tickets to see Santana and as a venue it was amazing. The show was fantastic. Will be back.

I've always enjoyed watching shows here. It's nice and small, so you're pretty close to the performers even if you're in the back. Of course, I'm talking about the general admission floor area. I'm not really sure why anyone would pay extra to sit up top.  Ticket prices don't seem to be as cheap as they used to be. I remember paying $20 to see Foo Fighters a decade ago. I also saw Redman and Method Man for about $20 and I bought Killers tickets for my brother for $20 a pop. Last week, I paid $45 to see Wu-Tang Clan. Still, I like the venue. It may be on the strip, but Mandalay's parking is easily accessible from the freeway.  On the restaurant side of things, I've eaten here a couple of times, but quite a long time ago. I remember having the Jambalaya and I still think that was one of the best I've ever had. I'm not an expert by any stretch. For some reason, whenever I see Jambalaya or Paella or Risotto on a menu, I have to try it. In fact, I saw a restaurant.com coupon for this place yesterday. I may need to return to try that Jambalaya again.

It's the H.O.B. and it's Vegas. Pretty meh for food, but that's what you get for going to a chain. Was staying in Mandalay so it was an easy open option during a conference that was full of people. Not sure I'd make a special trip to come back, but it was a decent dinner.

alright, so I came here for dinner 'cause it was fast (but not fast food), didn't require a reservation, and didn't require the spending of an arm and a leg for some famous chef's Vegas outpost that has never actually been visited by said chef.  (Besides, most of them are from SF, anyway, so it's not like I can't get it at home!)  Dinner was passable -- it's chain food, and it served its purpose.  The rosemary cornbread is yummy.  The ribs are pretty good (but I'm not a connoisseur), and the fried chicken was crisp on the outside, tender on the inside.  Beers are only available by the bottle, oddly enough.  Dinner for the two of us cost about the same that it would have to go to a buffet, and at least the food was freshly made for us, so you can't beat that.

So we went for Fat Tuesday all you can eat crawfish, shrimp and beignets.  I was so disappointed.  It took long for everything to come out as if they weren't prepared for the crowd and the turn out wasn't that bad maybe 50 ppl.  The crawfish was dry and not well seasoned.  Idk if it's the first time that they did this but I've never had any issues eating at HOB and it won't stop me from coming back.  I actually enjoy their menu.  So even though i want to give 2 stars for this particular event I can't give it for my overall experience at HOB!   Paul was my bartender he was pretty good.  We didn't have mixed drinks just some beers but he made sure we never went dry.    The bathrooms were clean.

We visited here a couple of times on our trip, once for breakfast and once for lunch.  My husband seemed to like it here on his last trip.  The food was good.  I would say that breakfast was better than the lunch, but then I'm a breakfast person.  There was plenty of food for each meal also.  The staff was helpful, and when we had a mistake on our bill, they fixed it right up.  Typical d√©cor for a House of Blues, and it may be fun to try one of their evening concerts sometime.
We always have the BEST breakfast at House of Blues!!! Our server today "ANGEL" was amazing and a absolute delight!!! Thanks for the great attitude and service Angel :)  keep Rockin!

Life and yelping it can be amusing. For example, take my experience with House of Blues (abbreviated HOB). Up to August 2016, I never set foot in one. That changed a couple of weeks past when I saw the Go-Gos in the Boston HOB. So, naturally I reviewed it. Then Yelper Debbie. N has free tix for anybody that wants to see Bee Gees Gold. Because I am a Bee Gees fan, I was like, "Oh hell yeah!" Thanks to Debbie. N, a few days later I would be in the Las Vegas HOB. The most amusing thing is that for the first time ever, I would be writing back to back reviews on a chain.     HOB is a chain of music venues. It was established at Cambridge, Massachusetts in 1992. Two years later, this one opened in February, 1994. This was the Las Vegas version of the music venue in Boston. Both HOBs have the similar setup with the general admission standing only floor, three bars along the U-shaped perimeter, and two balconies. Regardless there were also differences between the two that they weren't cookie cutter.     Although life can be amusing, waiting in line at a HOB doesn't fall into this category. There is a need for a sign pointing to the line. We had to ask the restaurant hostess where it is. Then there is another line that seems to be for hotel guests. It seemed that they were nearer the door to get in first. Our line got through the security checkpoint first. Then there is another delay by the door. Then the security dude says that there is no line and everyone goes downstairs. Fortunately aggression was nonexistent.      The tix stated the doors open at 7. What time does the show start? Apparently 2 hours later. There was a warm up band that played for around a half hour and the rest was time anticipating the show.      The 2 hours wait, in my opinion is a money maker for the HOB to maximize $. The same for using standing room only that gives the perception of overselling tickets.      HOB was alive! Music fans of all ages from the Millennial couple to the silver haired grandma's were dancing & clapping away. HOB is upbeat and as far as mood goes it is the anti-blues.     On the general admission level, we hung out in the back corner. With the exception of a bench and small restaurant it was standing only. Normally every viewpoint would be intimate if it weren't for the 4 columns. One of them created a blind spot. The venue was packed creating my spot to be the prime real estate with elbow room. My HOB attitude is to enjoy the scene instead of fighting for the ultimate viewpoint.      The sound and lighting effects were spot on. The noise level was perfect. The sound was crisp giving the fans a detailed soundscape of the Bee Gees Gold harmonies. The strobe lights complimented the moods that the band tried to convey.      The HOB experience ends after the show with the sight of the pit littered with beer cups. Speaking of beer, there is the concern of people throwing beer off the balconies.      I never say never about returning to HOB. If that happens I will look into the means to get a table in the small restaurant overlooking the stage. The extra money on dinner and maybe a few cocktails would be worth it to sit down and enjoy live music in an intimate venue.

Was in the Foundation Room for a private party. An interesting, cozy space--not to say that it's small, but it has a nearly like-home feel with its fireplace and intimate seating. Balcony boasts a lovely view, though it was rather crowded and not quite so enjoyable when I was there. Looked like they had several smaller rooms as well, perhaps for intimate dinners and such. Drinks were fine, hors d'oeuvres and sweets were tasty, and service was absolutely excellent, generous and friendly.

I've eaten here twice in the last week. Breakfast is fine, but overpriced. If you get a 2 for 1 coupon from Mandalay Bay, it's worth eating there.  I also ate here during happy hour and it was better than expected. They had some special kind of rum on special so I had two mojitos and my boyfriend had 2 rum and cokes. With that we had an order of hot wings and a spicy shrimp dish w/ cornbread. Wings were SPICY and our drinks were perfect- our bill came to $21!! No complaints there!
What can I say it's The House of Blues, if you've seen one you've seen them all. mostly standing room unless you pay for bottle service or the balcony is open. Good sound I have no complaints.

We just went to see Santana live at the HoB and it was fantastic! The venue is excellent for music and it's small enough to to make the concert intimate! We had a reserve table with a perfect view! The service was friendly and prompt! I would highly recommend this to anyone who enjoys great music in wonderful setting! Thanks for an fun evening!

It's about as good as you would expect for a touristy chain but not even close o the caliber and quality of restaurants in the hotel. This is a bargain hunters spot and perfect if you're looking for a less than swanky spot to grab some grub.  The prices are actually normal here and the service is pretty good. I had the wing appetizer with a side of fries and they weren't bad.

Don't go to the House of Blues expecting a culinary experience to write home about.  Go there to have fun!  They are really are better at the whole rock and roll, get down, get funky thing.  I've had dinner here with hubby, we've seen Third Eye Blind play here (and we remember some of that experience) and we've gone to the Gospel Sunday Brunch.  One thing is for sure, we've had fun every time!  The Gospel Sunday Brunch was even more fun than we expected.  Stop by and let loose with whatever musical experience you choose to have while you're there.   Check out House of Blues at: http://www.hob.com/venues/clubvenues/lasvegas/

So I really like coming here and have been here at least a hand-full of times.  I enjoy the live music nightly, the food, and the service has always been great; however every time I go it seems like the food takes forever to get out but that's not a major issue for a place like this though. House of Blues is a place to relax and not be in a rush so it doesn't bother me.  I am IN LOVE with their Portobello mushroom burger and I highly recommend it because it is delicious.  House of Blues is a good spot, especially on the strip for some tasty food and music vibes.

I went here to give it another shot, since my last experience was very lack-luster, and I must they this place reallllllllllllllllllllllllllllllllly redeemed themselves!! So much so, that if I get the spot I had last night, I'd for sure drive the 3-4 hours to see more bands!! The staff were helpful and polite. I reallly had a great and amazing second time!! Thank you guys so much!!

I visited the house of blues for a quick bite to eat and a drink with some friends. I ordered pig skin fries and pulled pork sliders. The food was awful. I thought I would get sick if I finished the food. The bartender was extremely rude. To top it off they charged my card 4 times. Horrible way to start my Las Vegas weekend. Never again. I would rate negative stars if I could.
Harrison at the bar is the #1 House Of Blues employee... Yes!!! While dinning we just watched him work Non Stop!!

So my boyfriend really likes this place. I was rather so-so on it. Side note: we were just hanging out, not there to see a show.  It was a super nice weekend weather-wise and when it's like that, I'd honestly rather be outside. HOB was a little dark inside for my taste, considering the super bright day outside, but I digress. We did hit this place before a show (we were in town for MGMT) and got some food. My boyfriend ordered the steak salad, which was PHENOMENAL, and I had shrimp street tacos, which were SPICY AS F*CK - but rather delicious.  The bartenders were really the ones who made/saved the whole experience. We ended up back at HOB after the MGMT show and it was the same two ladies. They shared some really funny stories about things that have happened at HOB and, for one of them, stories of days as a roadie.

Came here for some special event for UNLV. It was some kind of contest setup for bartending. I guess it was sponsored by Sailor Jerry rum. There were a whole bunch of cutie rockabilly girls there showing off all their ink. The hubby was sad to have missed that! So I was to drink the 4 types of drinks they were pouring and pick my favorite. We could go up and get as many as we wanted which was nice. Its always fun to have an excuse to drink..it was a contest after all. They even had a nice foodie table set up with fruits/meats/cheese. So people had something in the ol' tummy before drinking themselves silly. For a free event it sure was fun!

House of Blues:  (This review is for the restaurant only).   Where else do you go in a party of 14, on a Saturday night dinner with no reservations in the East 4th Area ?! House of Blues restaurant.  I admit, I had low expectations for this place, but the food was surprisingly ok . Overall, our server Kristie was really great and accomodating since some of our party arrived after we sat down and some of us changed seats at our table. The food was all right, in fact. The menu was generic, American Southern-Themed, but it was reasonably priced [$10-20 for entrees].  The Cornbread comes with Maple Butter (yum!) and was large enough to share it as a side for 2-3 people. The BBQ pork sandwich and sweet potato fries were all right. Cornbread + BBQ Pork sandwich + 20% tip for $18, not a bad way at all to start the night downtown.  Of course, if you haven't been to a House of Blues, don't expect it to have the 'blues' - the music was 90s [oasis and radiohead] and the only Blues things I saw/heard was a ceiling of 9*12inch busts with a brief bio.   The HOB restaurant was a pleasant surprise and a more casual place than the rest of East 4th, come on down.

We went here to see the Dan Band. As Vegas locals, we scored free tickets so that was awesome.  The place was really hot at first, almost as if the air condition wasn't on. Eventually it got a little cooler. We were in the standing room section so it was a little uncomfortable & crowded, but I guess that's expected. We ordered our drinks directly from the bar. They were well made drinks but very expensive!

I do love the three sections of this place.  The restaurant (has the usual HOB food), the bar area/stage and the main concert hall.    A while back, they had "Rock and Roll Karoeke" where a house band would play live, while singers got up and sang their selected tunes.  It was excellent!    Have gone to a couple of concerts in the main concert hall and had a fantastic time.

Table of three ordered 3 crafts. Wanting to have a drink or two before ordering food. Was kicked out of our table for "reservations" on a Tuesday night due to the fact of not ordering food right away. Used to come here weekly. Will never be back. Go to greenhouse tavern, sawyer is awesome and will treat you great!

The best experience!! Great food, thx u Chef Aaron Sanchez for a new menu!! Great service Suzie Q!!! Excellent personality! She'd be a great manager! We will try House of Blues in Anaheim next!! Super excited!!

I just can't do enough shows here. Soon I'll be throwing bows at a Sunday Gospel Brunch, I swear. Saturday 08.01.08 was CAVALERA CONSPIRACY, basically Sepultura's core (Max and Igor) with a virtuoso lead guitarist and prog-mad bassist. Early on, security was a lot more active than I've ever seen them here, getting people in lock and dragging them out of the venue or giving them stern talking downs. Friends THROWDOWN, INCITE, DILLINGER ESCAPE PLAN, and BURY YOUR DEAD filled the rest of the evening with soothing discordance and calming carnage.   I came down with two friends (who, incidentally, were both hxc chixxx) and was proudly grinning like a Cheshire Cat when I saw how feral and aggro they were with the fools in the pit; kicking, shoving, head-butting and elbowing right up there with the best of em. The set was very Sepultura-heavy, and literally left me shell-shocked at the end. Stage lights already were up. Inventory: cheekbone, jaw and neck already knotting from The Hits. Pockets beat up from the overpriced (albeit strong) drinks. Gotta be careful and stealthy when popping idiots. As previous reviewers have mentioned, security is on point here and you will get kicked. Dazed and contused. Fun!

I've seen multiple concerts here and I do have to say this is not a bad small venue to see a show. My only complaint is that quite a few shows have not had the greatest sound. It seems hard to hear the vocals clearly at times. They do have some killer drinks at the bar, definitely try the Mardi Gras punch.

Waiting in line then employee yells there is no line....free for all ensues and people behind rush to front! Then have thumb 3 sets of stairs and then go down a flight! With a bad knee this is NOT GOOD!!! I WILL NEVER COME BACK TO THIS VENUE!!!!

My family came here to see Carlos Santana the other night and what a show it was!  After security, don't try to bring your mase or anything with you, you head past the souvenirs and on to snap a pic in front of the billboard, then head inside. You have to go down stairs, to go back up if you're sitting in section 200 or 300. General admission and VIP were both downstairs, but let me tell you, the venue is so intimate, there is not a bad seat in the house. We were in section 204, last row and we could see everything perfectly. I didn't have to squint or guess who was where. The acoustics in there are awesome! I literally felt like I was on stage with them. There were bars on each side of the sections, as well as downstairs if you gotta get your cocktail on.   The decor of the place is pretty awesome as well. With many older artists pictures hanging on the wall, you definitely get a blues feel.   If you have not seen Santana, I encourage you to go. The venue is the right spot for his show. Like I said, there is not a bad seat in the house!

I saw Joe Satriani here and the sound was decent but the venue needs to be updated badly. It's just too beaten up compared to The Joint. They seem to have an identity crisis, hosting a lot of crappy hip hop shows and trying to appeal to the wrong crowds. Steel Panther is a fucking joke yet they have a residency here on a regular basis. There are too many good local bands for this venue to support the garbage it's promoting as "good music" That being said, when a real band is actually booked here, the production values i.e. lights and sound are usually top notch.

We went for Sunday night dinner. It wasn't packed which was great.  There was a live band playing good music.  I ad the catch of the day which happened to be swordfish.  It was very good- well seasoned & moist.  It came with bacon mashed potatoes & sauted veggies.  The place was clean & sercice was good.

The short: Started with a concert and ended with dinner  The long: Went and watched a concert in the venue. One thing that was great and I would advise anyone to do is see if there is the option to pay extra and skip the line especially if you want to get up close. Not only do you get that bonus, but you can then take that money and have it applied to your tab in the restaurant. The venue was almost perfect for the show. The only thing I wish they would have done was have an option for seating in every show. I had a knee surgery and had to stand on the floor in the crowd on that stitched up post surgical knee. I even showed them my giant full leg knee brace and asked if there was a way I could pay extra for a seat and was told no. So needless to say I was in a lot of pain through the show. Once out of the concert we jumped into the restaurant which was pretty full but luckily I thought to make reservations ahead of time. We were seated and waited a good amount of time before I finally flagged down a server for ordering. Apparently the server who was working my area had gone home for the night and they had mistakenly put me in a "closed" section. There was a live cover band finishing up in stage who had their volume WAY too loud. Even ordering required screaming at the top of my lungs. Food took a long time to get out and when it finally did it was lukewarm at best. The flavors were all there it just look bad and the temp issue. All in all I wouldn't go back for food (maybe use my skip the line on booze) but would for a concert.  What works: Awesome venue for concerts and not a single bad seat in the house  What to improve: Service and improving food standards

http://www.hob.com/venues/clubvenues/lasvegas/dining.asp Not only has blues concerts at night but the cajun creole food is  great.  Ribs , steak, chicken, jambalaya, gumbo and fried catfish.  I loved the sides like mashed sweet potatoes and rosemary cornbread.  Pricey.  The inside is dark with voodoo and bayou vibe to it.

Ok so I've been to a few concerts here....One thing I don't like. Grey Goose Rocks....12 dollars. Yea....plastic ware and Vodka...eh....Just put me in the backyard of Jorge Lugo's house - have his mom make tamales, and kool aid in the plastic container. Yea that is just not classy. One thing that sucks...it's downstairs. So if you don't take the elevator. People are bottlenecked and herded in. 2nd sucky thing. Kids are smelly....Boys especially. So going to a rock concert. gross...smelly....sweaty...boys...who think they're hard core and they like to mosh. One thing about me....I'm a tank. Myke Smash. Yea I rock out. But I would rather you not smash your face onto my fist. It's just weird. Overall - it's ok - I've been here when it was great. But I've been to some hot smelly crappy concerts here too. I gotta knock it for drink prices and presentation. I also knock it for having cheap concerts that attract hooligans and hoodrats with their shenanigans....Whoa...that's the whitest I've sounded all day....

Come here ONLY FOR THE HAPPY HOUR!!   The food is reminiscent of high school cafeteria food but the HAPPY HOUR IS SUCH A good deal, it's worth it.... but only for happy hour!!  I think like 4 of us had drinks and food for like 35 dolla!!  Remember, this isn't mortons, and only order appetizers and beers and mixed drinks during happy hour and let the vegas dream live on beootches!

Came by the lounge late night for a private party only to see that most of the party already left... There was no cover and the view from the top is amazing!  ...other than that, the place was dead...super dead.

Great concert venue. Was there to see otherwise last night and the sound and lighting and special effects are wonderful. The drinks are just so fucking expensive! UGH and the women's restroom is always a line! Annoying. Also the bathroom people freak me out.

I'm docking a star only because my group of 18 had to use a limited group menu with our dining reservation and couldn't order off of the full menu. Not all restaurants in Mandalay Bay & Luxor had that restriction, but in a time crunch on our group's first night, and looking for convenience as well as a fun experience, we decided to try HOB anyway. The available options were good, but several of my people complained that they had wanted something from the full menu. I also fielded complaints that our table was too close to the stage & therefore chatting while dining was impossible. I guess you can't please everyone.  Apparently we were able to order anything from the bar, although I chose the Hound Dog Mule from the drink menu. At $17, I expected a larger than typical beverage; however, after I received my small cocktail & re-read the menu, I realized that my drink came in copper HOB cup that I could keep. As a graphic designer, I felt misled by the asterisk & it's 8pt italicized disclaimer; it seemed like HOB was trying to hide that the cocktail alone was $12. This is truly a shame, because how many Vegas souvenirs can you get for $5?! Why isn't House of Blues making a bigger deal about this fun extra? I think they're missing out on big upsells, while I still feel misled by the cocktail menu. And, yeah, this also contributed to my less-than-5-star rating.  Our server was outstanding, and the kitchen was on the ball this night. My steak was perfect, and I heard of zero food  complaints from any of my team. Our appetizers were amazing as well. House of Blues served a great dinner to our group, and I will most likely include them in my meal considerations for our 2020 convention.

HOB located right smack dab in the middle of Mandalay Bay had a great atmosphere and the food was pretty good. We ate breakfast there and we left pretty full and happy. Our server was very sweet.  My friends and I had a really good time shopping in the little gift shop-really cool items!
The food is overpriced but I love everything else about this place. The bartender Molly remembers my drink and is fast and very friendly. Great place to catch happy hour.

I really like the venue. Drinks are super expensive, which is probably consistent with everywhere else I suppose. I've been here for a few special events (like year end parties for work). The food is great and service/security is top notch.

This venue is horrible. They cram way too many people in. We were finally approached since we were standing in the stairs and asked if we would like to go upstairs and sit. For what is supposed to be a bar setup the drink process are extremely high.

Do not be fooled by "Happy  hour". I ordered the chicken strips for $6 and it consisted of 3 small, bland strips and a small portion of fries. I then ordered the quesadillas which were very shabby and flat...

This review is for the Steel Panther concert. They were amazing and deserve 7 stars! The venue was nice but after a long day of travel being able to take a seat would have been nice. There were supposed to be two bands before Steel Panther but one must have bailed or canceled because there was an hour long gap of nothing between the opener band and Steel Panther. Since we weren't drinking and were standing next to a couple guys with boundary issues (get out of my bubble dude!) it was a long two hours before Steel Panther came on. They were awesome, great entertainers and there was even an awesome chick fight between a couple of the girls they brought on stage, they literally pulled each others clothes off and threw slugs, pure entertainment! I would have given this place 5 stars if there had been access to any chairs that weren't VIP.

So disappointed in House of Blues!  Traveled to Vegas from Houston on 23 May for the express purpose of seeing Carlos Santana.  This was a "bucket list" experience for us so we went all out, spending $222 each for seats advertised as "VIP," with the "...second best view" in the entire venue.  We were not given specific seats at the time of purchase; rather, the seats were to be assigned to us by the box office.  Unfortunately, when we were taken to our seats, we found that the view was obstructed and we could not see Santana and three of his band members for much of the concert. I feel that if a venue is going to provide obstructed view seats, they should be advertised as such so consumers can make an informed decision. We sent House of Blues a letter and also provided feedback on their website, but have received no response. Won't be going there again.

(I'm reviewing the Sunday gospel brunch at the House of Blues, not the performance venue.) When my sister in law first suggested having brunch here I was skeptical. I didn't think a performance venue would have particularly good food, but I was wrong. The Sunday brunch serves all southern style food-- biscuits and gravy, jambalaya, corn bread-- everything yummy and deliciously fattening. I love how you eat at long picnic style tables. By the time the gospel show started I was too stuff to sit there and enjoy, but the crowd really got going and participated in all of the "Amen!" and "Feel the Lord!" It was fun and a different way to enjoy brunch in Vegas.

The atmosphere is great but on this trip to Vegas and two meals at THOB I must say I was very disappointed in the food. It was one notch above terrible for me. The BBQ wings were small, hard and the sauce tasted like ketchup. I needed tabasco sauce to give them flavor.  I came back the next day for Gospel Brunch with Kirk Franklin. It was a buffet style breakfast with live music. I thought having brunch and getting to see Kirk Franklin would be worth the 107.00 we paid for tickets. Well I was wrong. The food for the most part was again terrible. Maybe it was ok for a food cart vendor but for THOB it was extremely underwhelming.  I had the blackened catfish that was so salty you could not eat it. It was so bad that the food that contacted it became inedible. Well at least we were going to get to see Kirk Franklin. Wrong again. We got to see a movie clip of him and he didn't even sing!! WTF?! 107.00 dollars for bad food and a movie. I felt robbed. Huge disappointment.    The little gospel quire that I thought was opening was good.

Went here for the Drake concert and it was packed. I wished they opened the doors earlier for the concert but the concert started on time. The prices for the Drake concert was overpriced though but I guess the venue sets the price based on popularity of the the performer as well as the costs for security and all of that. Overall, great concert experience (also Lebron James was on stage but if I factored that in, I would give this place a five star as well as the concert).

I had the Juicy Lucy and my wife and kid had the "build your own" (don't remember what they got on it) but did rave about it.  The ambiance was a little Pink Taco'ish but none the less very cool.  Maybe half the tables were full so they weren't that busy but our service sucked and we actually had to go to the bar to get refills on our waters and soda.  I sarcastically, on the second trip mentioned to the bar tender that it was nice of them to let the customers fend for themselves.  Will be back but sit at the bar since that's where you get the best service apparently.

Worst experience ever! They overbooked a show and did not open the upstairs balcony and herded everyone downstairs my wife slipped down the wet stairs and hurt her knee they didn't want to accommodate her until we made a fuss. Just the worst. Too bad because the venue itself is great their staff just sucks. Herd people in like cattle. Will NEVER go to another show here again. Pissed I wasted my money.

Very disappointed in the sound system the first night of Billy Idol on his May residency.. MAY 4th.  It cut out at least a dozen times during the performance,  and made for a disconcerting concert.  If I were Billy Idol I'd be hopping mad!   I can't believe no one from the venue tried to fix it

Not much to say just stopped in for some drinks. A little disappointed in the selection of Scotch and Bourbons.   Surprised that there was no "Blues" music being played over the in house stereo. What is the name of this place? I know were were not here during a show, but really to listed to "pop" music at the hose of Blues.

We tried out the new menu at House of Blues on Friday night. We had the street tacos. They were good but nothing special for $11.   Also tried the jalape√±o turkey burger and the mushroom manchego burger. The best part of the burger was actually the bun!!  Fococcia I do believe.   Be warned that there is a live entertainment tax added to your bill automatically!!  We talked to our server and got it removed because we never heard a live note played :)  All in all, pretty good. We just eat there because it's close to where we are going for the evening!

The concert venue is an amazing place to see any type of performance, but the restaurant is the opposite. The food is totally sub par and very over priced, as are the drinks at the bar. Oh and if you happen to be there on happy hour, you can only get those prices of you are seated at the bar. They used to allow a pass the line for shows if you eat or drink and spend $20 total, not so anymore. It's $20 a person to not stand outside in the Cleveland weather. For that price I'd rather go down the street and pay for better food, drinks, and service. I feel that this place knows its floundering so they jack the prices to its restaurant but do not give the customers what they pay for.

So so fun! There was a stage in the middle of the restaurant with a live band! It was so awesome!  The service was super great too - food came out so quickly, I didn't have time to change my mind.  Change my mind, you say? Yes. I'm on this health kick and being in Vegas has been tough, but I'm doing it. So I decided to splurge a bit and get the shrimp with grits - thank god I checked the recipe online! I entered it in myfitnesspal and found out 1 serving was over 1,500 calories!!! Absolute freak out! So I ended up tasting the grids and only eating the shrimp - still got the taste of the delicious sauce, but left 90% of the cream and grits on my plate.  Let me tell you it was absolutely amazingly delicious!  My hubby got the buffalo chicken salad which was very good as well.  This was such a fun night!! Absolutely loved it. Gave me a little taste of New Orleans, which I miss greatly.

The ambiance is pretty chill. I went for a Yo Gotti show and was a little disappointed in the size of the venue. There were at least three people I did not know touching me at all times. The good thing about that was, I got passed a blunt by a stranger. The venue was extremely crowded, the tickets don't cost that much, and I had a really good time.
We had Jennifer as our server (4/11/17) Mandalay location, she was top-notch. We ate dinner and are coming back for breakfast tomorrow. She made the experience for my family.

I have only been to house of blues for concerts, not to eat here (no vegan options!).    The venue is OK, I think it's decent for concerts, it's small, has a General admission and seating section.  Full Bar down stairs and decent bathrooms.  The staff has always been decent when I have been there.    The drink prices are about as good as you would expect, especially for vegas.  Not sure what else people expect to find.  My suggestion is to hit up the bar across from HOB and get a huge freezy drink for $9 with an extra shot.  It will save you money (unless you want water).  I would come back here again, and I love Mandalay Bay too!

We decided that since we were hitting a concert at HOB, we might as well eat there. We were pleasantly surprised. Our food was quite good and the service was stellar. (Our server, Tyler, was exceptional.) We highly recommend HOB's meatloaf...

The House of Blues is my favorite music venue in Cleveland! The entire venue is filled with all kinds of African influenced art that gives it such a cool vibe. The staff is extremely professional and very helpful. I've seen some of the best shows of my life here, and can't wait to go back soon!

I was a bit disappointed by the presentation especially with it resting in the Mandalay Bay. To me it looked just like Friday's and I've never been to a house of Blues before but I'm sure it's not supposed to make you feel like you're eating at TGI Friday's. They have the strangest decor I've ever seen; painted crosses covered with bottle caps and paintings of disfigured people on the walls.  They had s decent happy hour going, $5 well drinks and $3 beers. We ordered 3 appetizers that came with the happy hour deal, nachos and cheese, hot wings and chicken tenders while we sat ate the bar drinking our beers. I grabbed me a Blue Moon to go and stuffed it in my purse.

Didn't try the food - so this review is really of the bar and happy hour specials.    Came by about 30 minutes before the end of happy hour after a couple of hours gambling in the casino - happy I did as it's much cheaper to spend $3 on beers than lose $100 for a "free" one out in the casino ;)   There is a great selection of beers in bottles and the bartender is VERY generous with the pours of liquor.    The bar was filled with "cougars" who kept hitting on my friend - very funny.  Clientele seemed to be a bit older than I usually see in bars I frequent, around 40-60 years old was the average age.

VEGETARIAN REVIEW:   Happy to find a somewhat affordable place in Mandalay Bay.  We really didn't want to spend $30+pp on a gut busting meal after a long day of travel and being a little before 10pm and wanting a decent veggie option it was tough to find something that fit the bill.  The breakdown: *Ambiance: cool decor, good music: 4 stars *Staff: pleasant, helpful: 4 stars *Food:    ---Fianc√© got Fried Chicken with potatoes and veggies, said it was flavorful/tender but greasy $17.99: 3 stars,       ---I'm a vegetarian so I got the child's mac and cheese plus a side of veggies, that mac was yummy! $6.99+$3.99 (not bad for a Mandalay restaurant and just the right amount): 4 stars  All in all, we were happy to have found it and if we find ourselves in a similar predicament again we may go- otherwise we'll hop across the strip to the In-n-Out.
Great Atmosphere staff, and food were excellent!!! I would definitely have friends and family come at and enjoy!!! awesome sound and talent!!!!

I came here for dinner on memorial weekend. I knew it would be busy but the service was so slow in the bar. We snagged a dirty table and sat there for 10 mins before someone came to clean it. Another 5 before our waitress came over and asked us what we'd like to drink.They have a good beer selection. I really like Abita Purple Haze. We ordered BBQ wings to start. They were really good. For entrees we ordered fried chicken which was delicious! I should of swapped the cole slaw for Mac and cheese. We also ordered ribs. Don't order the ribs. They aren't soft they were rough. We only ate one rib. Wasted money. We asked for our check and the waitress was in a rush cleared our plates I guess didn't even notice the ribs weren't touched. You would think she'd ask about it and offer something else but we had been sitting there so long we paid and left.

First time at HOB and really liked this place. I came with my boyfriend for a concert and really like the venue. I would definitely come back for other events as it is a great spot from anywhere you are. Prices for tall boys were reasonable.

Waaaaay overpriced, pay a few more bucks and go to a top notch restaurant in MB. Or go cheap elsewhere.  The salmon special was incredible but the pasta were bland noodles in catsup. The service was amazing however (thanks Lisa) and saved the day. She had them make the sauce into a rose for me.   Overall a fun place like all HOB's but really steep for the budget traveler.

This is one of my favorite places to see a concert, so long as I get orchestra level seats.  I'm not much of a fan of standing around in the packed general admission area getting shoved around and stepped on.  HOB is pretty small though, so even if you get a GA ticket, its not that bad.  Their drink prices are reasonable too considering it is a concert venue on the strip.  There is a private bar on the orchestra level and the stage can be scene from any position so it's not a huge hassle to get a refill while the show is going on.  I really like the fact that the security are so strict about people sneaking up to the second level if they don't have tickets for seat up there.  That way it never gets that crowded, even for a sold out show.   Another thing worth noting is the volume level never seems to be too loud or too soft, but just right.  Unlike shows I've scene elsewhere, I have never left a show here feeling like I'd lost 90% of my hearing for a week or so after.  Some of the shows I have attended at HOB include; Citizen Cope, Charlie Murphy, Everclear, Third Eye Blind, Dierks Bentley, She Wants Revenge, The Bravery.  They have all been great!

whoa! i saw a "people like me on yelp" sticker on the door and i had to write a review!  i've gone to HOB just twice because i intentionally avoid it. the first show was one my favorite bands. the second show we got free tickets or else i wouldn't have gone.  ticket price is never just a ticket price. learned that the hard way when i went to the box office to avoid fees. NOPE. even a fee at the box office. so, it is literally *impossible* to not pay fees unless you have some type of buddy at the venue i guess.  ridiculous policies - like, someone had offered my boyfriend and i their reserved seat tickets. the attendant wouldn't allow me to go get the tickets (while he watched) from the people. they had to bring them to me. unfortunately, i didn't have their cell #s and they didn't magically know they had to bring them up. so, that was a pain and something you don't see at non-corporate venues.  HOB is a corporate chump and there are only a handful of bands i'd see if they played there. larger indie bands should play at the masonic temple. everyone else, there is the grog, beachland, etc! please no HOB!

The hostess Claudia was awesome she explained everything to us on how it works how to use our coupons and where the different seating arrangements were we decided to sit in the happy hour section where they have the Booths we had an awesome bartender and the manager on duty was very thorough and informative on how to use are my Vegas comps. the food was great

We have seen so many shows here. Steel Panther and The Dan Band just last week. We love the venue. We have mostly had standing seats (which are first come first serve). We have sat upstairs several times. We recently bought a table. Any spot in here is great. The staff at Will Call is awesome and hostess and waitresses rock. Always a clean venue. Restrooms always have an attendant. Drink prices are a bit pricey but not to bad for the strip. I always feel very safe inside. The security is top notch! The d√©cor throughout is crazy cool. I love it. Highly recommend and will definitely come back again and again.

1 star only because the host and waitress were nice. Other than that do not eat here. We ordered buffalo wings that had a burnt bacon taste to it. My boyfriend got a philly cheese steak that was nothing great. Same with my turkey burger that had me throwing up all night and sick to my stomach for 2 days. Never again!
Medium food, high prices, staff keeps the change.

Now, I have been to many a show at House of Blues. This venue is amazing for intimate shows and always good for a dance party. Recently, they have been advertising local specials on drinks. I am guessing this is to attract more local traffic as I am sure it has decreased with the opening of the Cosmo and they're great line-up of shows. We went to see Panic! at the Disco, whom we are all fans of. The show was great, but when we asked about the local drink specials, we were told by the bartender that he had no idea what we were talking about. Meanwhile on a television screen behind him, the advertisements were playing, We pointed this out to him and were told, "Everyone pays the same price". Hey House of Blues, if you want us to pay $10 for a tall boy of PBR, we will. Just don't tell us it'll be cheaper. BOOOOOOOOOO!

Outstanding.  Just very much fun.  There was _loads_ of great food throughout a southern-style buffet, carving station, salad and dessert bars, and a couple other areas I can't put a specific description on but that were just as stuffed with edible goodness.  There's free orange juice and water, and bloody mary's and mimosas as $4.25 [and the latter are excellent].  From the time the doors open, you get 30-45 minutes to eat and talk before the band and singers come on.  You can still eat during the performance, but it is hard to pull away -- the musicians are energized, full of life, and really get the crowd going.  I think I'd give this a 4.5 if I could.  But pretty much only because I like gospel _choirs_ even better than small gospel groups -- I just wanted to hear the place rock without the speakers blaring.  (Not that the sound was bad at all -- I'm just greedy!)  I'll definitely be back!

The service was slow and I was shocked that they didn't serve any fish. The fish of the day was shirmp and spinich. Now how can they claim to be cajun and not serve any fried fish or have any crystals hot sauce?
One of the best venues to see a rock show! Drinks are expensive, but there's not a bad seat in the house.

We love the House of Blues whether in NOLA, Orlando or LV. Just got back from out four day Super Bowl stay at Mandalay Bay and we ate at HOB three times. The breakfast is plentiful and delicious and the burgers are the best. The atmosphere is fantastic and cannot wait until out next trip.

I am biased; I witnessed one of the funniest scenes of my life here.  HOB was pleasantly surprising. I would never have thought they'd have such attentive servers and really delicious food. My dad's friends made the reservation, so I didn't have a say in any of the matter. The atmosphere is a bit chain-y, but it's pretty, and the bathroom is really big! Anyway, everybody liked their entree, and our server was so nice, dealing with our rowdy group. The band was a 90s rock group specializing in girl power songs like No Doubt and Alanis, and I loved it. The sound is great, too. After too many drinks, some poor girl decided to dance-attack my dad on the dance floor. She seemed lost from her friends. She wasn't wearing underwear....and I can't quite explain the scene when she tried doing back bends in her mini skirt, on my DAD. My mom watched in pure shock as the whole group completely lost it. Not sure if I've ever laughed that hard in my life. What happens in Vegas, goes on Yelp. The staff handled it very well. They were nice to the girl, but needless to say, she had to go auf wiedersehen. They escorted her out and we got a story to tell for years.

FRAUDULENT ADVERTISING! We purchased tickets for the Eli Young Band and were really looking forward to it. The ticket and website said "Doors open at 8:00. Show starts at 9:00"  This was a mid week show.  (we had to be at work as usual 7am the next morning).  We arrived about quarter to 9, purchased a small plastic cup of wine and can of beer overpriced at $22.00, and waited for the show. The opener was finishing. 9:00 came and went. At almost 20 minutes after 9:00 a band came out. NOT the Eli Young Band. When we asked they told us they wouldn't be starting until 11:00 or after!  This is completely misleading.
