After some argument, the Box Office refunded us. We would never have purchased tickets had they been truthful about the showtime. We have lost faith in the integrity of the House Of Blues and will never purchase tickets there again.

I came here as a guest of my program director. It wasn't bad. The jambalaya was tasty, but rather salty -- though that is sort of to be expected. The lobster mac and cheese was quite good! I enjoyed the ginger mango drink, but it was a little too sweet. I let the ice melt to water it down a little. The ambiance is very dark, so if you like that sort of thing, there's that. The service was excellent. We came for lunch, so there was no concert.

Went there to see a band, the staff was rude, told us we would have to buy 2 drinks per hour each, we don't drink, we saw no soda on the menu. We left without seeing the band.  It's just a very overpriced hole in the wall. Will never go there again for any reason

I've been to HoB dozens of times, but nothing recently until a concert the other night.  The venue is small enough to make you feel close to all the action, but big enough to where it isn't overly crowded.  It is probably my most favorite place to listen to live music in town truthfully.  Most other places are much much larger, and you don't have the same effect being there.  The security here are actually decent people, not too harsh and stern like they were a few years ago.  Seems like they lessened up a bit.  Prices are usually reasonable too, but that obviously depends on who's playing.
I love coming to see shows at the House of Blues.  The security guards do their jobs without being jerks, and I never have a problem obtaining my photo passes when I'm working for bands.

This is for the Foundation Room which is on top of the Mandalay Bay.   The views are incredible, but not much to be seen if you're seated indoors.   The food is top notch! They seem to have a full kitchen on the same floor in order to produce this quality.   The service was a perfect mix of fun and approachable while still very professional.  The only complaint I have is the general air of exclusivity it has. I guess maybe in Vegas you need to be 'selective' in who you allow in, but they asked my friend to leave his camera behind. Meanwhile, the table next to us took video with their smart phones (loudly).
Food is really quite bad, and drinks too--got a margarita with little more than sour mix... Disappointing, luckily didn't break the bank

Not too long ago I had my first experience at this particular House of Blues, and it was definitely a great one! I went on a Tuesday night which happens to be when their  "Swingin Tuesdays" occurs. If you are a fan of swing, you should check it out! There are many talented swing dancers that turn up, and the live band is pretty good too!  On to the food! I decided to order their Lobster Mac & Cheese. If you are looking for pure ooey-gooey cheesy lobster BLISS, order this! The mac and cheese comes served hot and topped with crunchy panko breadcrumbs. If you have never tried panko breadcrumbs before, you are missing out. The light, crunchy texture provides a perfect coating for any dish. The cheese was very creamy and tasted great with the large, plentiful pieces of lobster they provided in the meal. If you can't tell by now, I was very satisfied.   For dessert, I ordered the triple chocolate cheesecake. In case you didn't read it right the first time, let me say it again.. TRIPLE. CHOCOLATE. CHEESECAKE. Anything with triple the amount of chocolate is amazing in my book. The cheesecake is served with raspberries and other seasonal berries to compliment the chocolatey goodness. The whipped cream was the added cherry on top to this perfect dessert. Definitely 10/10, would eat again.

Great venue, but usher has almost ruined our night.  I was not going to write a review but after thinking about it and seeing how another venue went above and beyond to a help my handicapped mother I decided I had to write this.  This past Saturday night my and I attended the Santana concert.  My mom had been using an electric scooter all of our trip be decided not to bring it as we had to take a can in the venue.  She walls with a cane and it is very clear that she has mobility issues. We are on the second level and took the elevator up.   We were greeted by an usher, he looked at our tickets and pointed the section out to is and said you are 2nd row.  We started the down the stairs and once we get to the to the 2nd row I see there are no empty seats.  I get my mom to stand on the stairs and hold on the railing while I go up to get assistance from the user.     The user has dancing when I asked for his help he said I told you 2nd row from the top, not the bottom.  In other words he saw that me and my handicapped mom were having problems and he decided just to dance.  We got to our seats, with out any assistance I shall add.  At the end of the concert we stand in lane to what we thought was the elevator, it was I fact the stairs.  Same usher standing right there says nothing.  One if the other guest tells is that's the line to stairs if we go straight and turn right we can get to the elevator. Your ushers may need a refresher in guest relations.  The next night we went to the Mirage to see Boys to Men.  Their ushers went above and beyond to help out my mother and we never asked for a thing from them.

*This review is for the will call ticket area and not for the restaurant*. On Saturday 5/6/17, my fianc√© and I headed to the HOB for the Billy Idol concert (which was amazing).  I purchased the tickets from home 2 days prior to the concert and the only option I was given was will call. That's when I encountered the representative at the ticket window named Jason. I told him that I was there to retrieve my Billy Idol tickets. He asked for ID and then walked over with my tickets. I then went on to ask about the packages for the concerts. He looked at me with a bewildered look and said "what do you mean?  What packages". That really was aggravating. He works at the HOB and I'm pretty sure he hears the term packages quite often. He seemed to be playing dumb but knew exactly what I was talking about. I went on to tell him "the Billy Idol packages. When I bought the tickets, I wasn't given the option of adding a meet and greet or dinner package when I was checking out. I read the HOB website that states packages could be added on the day of the event". Then Jason says "oh those packages."  He went on to say that people attending the Billy Idol concerts usually don't buy the packages so they aren't usually offered. He stated "now for Santana, the packages are offered because people want them". I said, well I'm only asking because the website said I could add it at checkout and I wasn't given the option. I get it.  If packages aren't offered or no longer available, not a problem. It's the way the message was delivered. His customer service skills were sub par and condescending. Customer service means everything in this day and age. If I'm going to dish out money, which I have no problem doing, I expect to be treated with courteous and friendly service. So overall, I don't really care to return to this venue. The concert was a 5 star show, but as I mentioned, this review was for the overall experience at the will call window.

We've been here many many many times and have always enjoyed it.  We came here last night with a group of friends to see the Dirty Hooks (local Vegas band) open for the Stone Temple Pilots.  The venue is awesome and we had a great time.    They off a lot of bars and plenty of area to watch the shows.  Great sound system and great bartenders.

Went here on a Friday night with a group of 5. We were seated very quickly, however I could tell by the faces of the other guests they were not pleased with the service. Many of them looked as if they were waiting quite a while. The table next to us actually waived their bill in the air to be picked up by the waiter.   Once seated I decided to head to the bar for a drink based on the looks around us I wanted to get my drink quickly. The waiter was at the table when I came back and looked flustered that I ordered from the bar rather than him. We quickly ordered our food, we ordered the following.   Heat Seeker Burger- my friend said this was a pretty good burger. No complaints. Came with sweet potato fries and I tried those, pretty yummy!   Chicken sandwich- my other friend has this, yet another with no complaint. Came with sweet potato fries as well.   Buffalo Chicken sandwich- I had a few bites...the chicken was cold. I found this strange. Nothing to rave about just a regular salad with buffalo chicken on top.   Chicken tacos- pretty flavorful, small but I think they were street tacos so not bad.   Everything was just ok. Little bit of a wait to order and get drinks and the cold buffalo chicken was a bust. Definitely would go somewhere else when you're in Vegas.

Where do I start? My wife and I saw Billy Idol on the 18th of March. First off, don't waste your money on the loge seating unless you have seats directly facing the stage. The sound system sucks for lack of a better description. If you have seats near the stage In the loge seating the speakers are so loud to try and cover the damaged sound that you can't hear anything.  All you hear is the crackling speaker.  We had seats in loge 8 and our view was covered by a safety bar. Also anyone seated in the rows behind you will walk up to take video with their phone and security does nothing to stop them.  We ended up walking out before the show was over. I wouldn't even give the experience 1 star, but I was unable to leave a review.

We went to see Boogie nights as a guest of as close friend. Doors open at 8 but band did not start till 930. No seating available unless you want to pay 200 for a table with a 1 bottle minimum. Boogie nights is not exactly a chart topping band here. So my complaints with my not so young back. I enjoyed about 30 minutes of the show because my back hurt so bad I had to go to casino to sit down. While I was waiting for band to start I paid 13 dollars for a lukewarm 40oz Bud Light. Will not go here again. Maybe I am too old. However the lack of seating and drink prices were the only complaint I heard this night.

This place is such a treat. With so many pretentious places in Las Vegas, this place was such a breath of fresh air. I absolutely loved the comfort food and the comfortable vibes there. The music was dope also! I just can't say enough about how good of a whole experience this was. Good music, great food, good vibes.

Great experience. I was invited to listen to my very  talented friend perform that night. This is a very special place! It has an ambiance second to none. The food is outstanding and very unique, later that night a friend of my friend that has already preformed invited us to a private room in the back area to see Aretha Franklin standing room only! It was a magical night....very unforgetable.
I would like Thank Taylor and her Manager for the comp ticket last Friday the Biz Markie show

Took my 90 year old mother this year for Mother's Day because last year when husband took me it was fairly decent. This most recent visit to the gospel brunch was not as enjoyable. The chicken fingers were dry.  They ran out of turkey at the carving station.  A lady dropped a serving spoon on the floor and than put it back on the saucer they had to put during serving. Food was lukewarm. The seating is horrible. When booking do not get a table to the right or left of the sound booth.  The tables and chairs sit low and you can't see over/around the booth. There is a railing that if you're sitting in seats 1 and 2 you can't see.   Railing is right at eye level.  You would have to stand and than the folks behind you wouldn't be able to see the show.  The seating chart looks like everything is the same level and of course they don't tell you when you buy the tickets.  I bought mine in person and both times I ended up by the damn sound booth. My bad. All the seating is close. Not much elbow room. Banquet table seating and you're not facing the stage. Need to turn your chair around to see stage.  Get there early to eat so you can turn your chair around to see show or eat with plate in your lap. After all this place is meant for standup concerts. The saving grace was that both times there was a two person high top table that our server allowed us to sit in.  That puts you up high enough to see over the sound booth. Fortunately my mom is a nimble 90 year old so I was able to get her up in the barstool.   Our server was very attentive removing plates and getting drink orders. Also this is "new gospel" so don't expect the "old school" back in the day or choir type show.  It also depends on the group. This recent trip was a more modern group.  Lead female singer was more traditional and very animated.  2015 visit was a different group with a lead male singer and a bit more traditional.   There is a lot of "fluff" during the show.  Meet and greet.  Birthday, anniversary, wedding and special occasion interaction.  They really only sing tops 8 songs.

From someone who grew up going to concerts, at a variety of venues, Cleveland us lucky to have a place like the House of Blues. Hosting eclectic artists, you can step outside of your comfort zone and go listen to someone new or the artist you have plastered all over your wall and look at each day. Just kidding, maybe you are not that intense, but either way, the House of Blues probably has an artist right up your alley.  From Galactic to the hometown boy, MGK, this venue hosts both an upper and lower deck area. You can typically see from every point, unless you are hanging out by one of the back bars, then you might be in for some bobbing and weaving to see the stage.  The sound system is pretty great for a smaller indoor venue. I highly suggest grabbing a bite to eat on East 4th or keep it close to home and go to the House of Blue's own restaurant. Typically, if you spend more than $20, you do not have to wait outside in line for your concert and will let you enter from the inside. Not to be a baby, but knowing Cleveland's weather, eating at the restaurant is your best bet during 9 of the 12 months.  Take a look at their artist lineup on the outside board of the venue or online. Typically you can find relatively decently prices tickets through Groupon or other accounts such as those.

First off I should really review this place as a concert venue first. Loved the show I went too and the sound was incredible. The bar service was good and speedy. But it is definitely a Vegas place. I really don't like to spend $14 dollars on a PBR tall boy? But that is what I had to do. In the end I would definitely come back here. But plan on not drinking while there.
This place just didn't do it for me. We ate at the restaurant...forgettable and went to a music venue. The venue was just small...most clubs are bigger than this.

This place is packed from the bottom to the top! The air conditioner should be turned to high for every concert.  I thought I was gonna pass out from all the body heat.  The drinks were good.  The 3 floor hike to the upstairs seating was just awful.   I heard every person complaining with each step..going up or down!

***food review only***  i don't understand this place, i don't understand the menu, i don't understand the service, i don't understand why there isn't a daily special on sundays.  i always had the idea before i ever frequented it that the house of blues would be on par with hard rock cafe.  so naive.  it's not that the hard rock cafe is awful, it's that hob is a culinary trainwreck.  gordon ramsey would have a fit.  i think hob food can best be described as "down home southern cookin'" or something to that effect.  mac 'n cheese, jambalaya, rice and beans are all on the menu.  the menu is really extensive, and hob dabbles in a bit of everything apparently, but nothing on the menu looked good to me while i was here, and believe me that is saying something because i was STARVING and everything looks good to me when i'm starving.  i finally settled on the mixed field greens and a side of fries.  "unremarkable" is my verdict!  i had a few bites of my friend's mac 'n cheese...FAIL.  but that was to be expected, since emmy's spaghetti shack in san francisco has spoiled me for good in the mac 'n cheese department.
Paul Charles band was AWESOME!!  We didn't want to leave!  The food was good- service better than ok (had a trainee).

I do not like this business entity. Holy cow, they rape you on the prices! A 12 oz can of beer is $5.75. 16 oz, $6.75. Tallboy, $9.50. I checked in and received a check in offer for 10% off my bill - which isn't valid on anything other than food. Who the hell eats at a venue? Shady if you ask me. We have Dan Aykroyd to blame for this, right?

***THIS IS STRICTLY FOR THE LATIN NIGHT VENUE OF HOB***  House of Blues Latin nights, Thursdays @Mandalay Bay, no goood :( ENOUGH SAID. lol.  All I can really say is that me and my girlfriend were really hyped to check out this night since there are not a whole lot of Latin nights in Las Vegas, and it sounded even better that it was at Mandalay Bay. I thought it was funny that on this particular night, as me and my girl were on our way over to HOB, we listened to the Dj say on the radio say "This place is poppin tonight!! Whoop whoop!" YET when we arrived around at 12:30am,10 minutes before we heard the Dj's announcement, there was a total of 8 people on the dance floor :/ I would say the DJ over exaggerated a bit.   This was a very disappointing Latin night and what sucks is that this place has SO MUCH POTENTIAL TO BE GREAT. Great location, plenty of room to sit, a decent sized dance floor, music is perfect, BUT for some reason- NO CROWD!! I dont get it.
went there for breakfast with a group of 6.  i ordered the joe's scramble and really liked it.  had a side of hashbrowns.  would come back!

Came for the Social Distortion concert. Place was jam packed so had a good vibe going until the band started playing. The sound was awful. There was a short and the sound engineer couldn't figure it out. If it wasn't for everyone in attendance singing along with the band, you wouldn't have known what was being sung. The instrumental sounded good but the vocal was the bad. Bad mic or bad sound check. Disappointed.  Now the after-party with Punk Rock Karaoke was freaking awesome. Good good time. It was enough for the HOB to redeem themselves and salvage the night. Still though, had the sound system issue been resolved, I would have left a 5 star review.
Went yesterday 1 pm. Venue was nice. Foof excellent including beef brisket and bresd pudding with caramel sauce over the top. Music was outstanding with hreat harmonies. Would definitely come again.
Came to see Santana. Great venue. I had some special circumstances and they took care of me with no problem. Jason was a great help.

Great ambience and decor. The layout is perfect. I even got hooked into buying some of their merchandise. I love the designs on their t-shirts. I wore one of their shirts for years until my wife threw it away. The food is great here. Your typical high end appetizers and drinks. Their live music acts rock! The acoustics are great. Not once do you ever hear muffled versions of your favorite songs. I am a fan of this franchise.

What's one of the best things about living in Las Vegas, you ask? Living in a city where top notch bands regularly make pit-stops to perform, of course! I probably go to House of Blues to see a concert at least once every other month. Just this month I've seen headliners In Flames and Cannibal Corpse at HoB.   PRICE: One benefit of being a metalhead is that shows are relatively cheap compared to mainstream performers. The average concert ticket ranges from $20 - $60. In Flames, for instance, was $33 per person.  PRO TIP: If you buy your tickets at the HoB Box Office at least one day before the concert (and you're a local), you get a discount! The discounted prices are ALWAYS cheaper than buying online through sites like Ticketmaster.com  THE VENUE: Overall visibility isn't the greatest. Four stupid beams/support structures get in the way of your view of the stage. Finding a good spot to watch the concert can be difficult, especially for people like me who tend to hangout towards the back of the crowds. Besides the impaired view, HoB has the BEST lighting/stage effects for a concert venue. Acoustics are awesome too. Room wise, I think HoB is the perfect size. I'm always on the General or Standing floor, and that's fine by me. There's 3 (maybe 4) floors. Alls I know is you can't see squat from the highest/top floor. I was forced to watch a Marilyn Manson concert from the top floor once. I could've used some binoculars!    RULES OF ENGAGEMENT: Mosh pits are tolerated, crowd surfing less so. Vaping is allowed indoors, smoking is not (it depends on if you get caught, though). The standing area immediately in front of the stage gets packed and messy. When pits break out, drinks go flying everywhere. Some a** holes in the VIP area or 2nd floor may throw their drinks out in the crowd.   PROS: Clean bathrooms, cool stage effects, good acoustics, locals discount. CONS: Limited visibility and sky high drink prices  RETURN VISIT? As long as the metal concerts keep coming, I'll pay to see them!!  YELP 100 CHALLENGE 2015: #28

I've been here quite a few times for various types of concerts. Park nearby in one of the garages for $10 or if you get lucky, snag a street spot. Make sure to double check the times on the signs! None of them are the same. If you have a band here you want to see, don't hesitate, because many of them sell out quickly. It isn't a very large venue, but that just makes for a more intimate concert experience. Concerts I've seen here:  Chevelle Excision Madeon  The sound has always been well done. I wear eareplugs with filters to the concerts because I'm usually in a bit of pain after a long night. The speakers certainly won't disappoint. Excision had absurdly crazy bass and there didn't seem to be any problem meeting those demands. I think that the bathroom attendants are unnecessary but mostly because it's just awkward that I didn't tip you for handing me a paper towel... There is a medium sized area right in front of the stage for standing, and various areas around the main floor for staying out of the big crowd. The balcony can be nice if you want a good view.   I've never bought the food, so I can't comment on that.   Drinks are expensive, as in $10 for a pounder/tallboy. It's probably for the best; it keeps the crowd from getting too drunk. I'll be coming back here for many reasons, but mostly because the House of Blues is one of the few concert venues in Northeast Ohio that actually brings bigger name bands in.

Seen quite a number of performers here. I'm fond of the layout of the music venue. Slash played here NYE and that was horrible (insert sarcasm font please) Slash is always phenomenal!  Then went and saw Billy Idol, seen him numerous times over the decades. Billy Idol is doing a residency at HoB, better catch his show when he returns in August! Now, he's 60 and still has that voice and note he still looks great! If only I had that jacket with the studded skull :( will post a video...

Tracy was fantastic! She deserves a raise  if you get her as your server you are in for a treat! She walked my friend to the place where her Uber was picking her up. Great vibe overall and the live music was fantastic, lots of 90s throwbacks. Food is classic House of Blues fare, but atmosphere is above average which makes sense in Vegas!

Things I liked:  -Reasonable priced casual lunch food at Mandalay Bay. Which says a lot for Vegas.  -Less than 10 minute wait time to seat our party of 10 ppl.  -Available seating soon after the Rock and Roll 1/2 marathon, which says a LOT, considering the race wrapped up just outside MB. We assumed this place could be jammed up.  -Burgers were good, but after 13 miles, anything would have tasted good!   Things I did not like:  -They were out of sweet potato fries. We were so excited to have some. Huge bummer.  -For not being jam packed with patrons, the service was rather slow. We had to ask a few ppl to find a server to bring water and take our orders.  -Many of our orders were not prepared as requested. Onions were included when they should not have been. Salad was delivered after the entree. Some entrees were served 5-8 minutes before the rest of the party. Stuff like that.   So, it was just OK. Not in a huge hurry to return.

Yasssssss. Love this place. Service was nice and food was bomb.com the atmosphere is cool and they even have us our drinks to go without us asking. How thoughtful! Coming from someone who is in the service industry I can honestly say this place is stellar.

Took about 30mnts to get our food. I ordered a juicy Lucy burger. It was missing the juicy! No cheese in the middle or whatever cheese it had just evaporated. Our waitress Sierra was nice and polite. She did a great job. But all our food was just way below average for the price. I would not recommend.

We came here to eat prior to a show at the House of Blues. Our waitress, Gentille, was very friendly and helpful. She has a great personality! She recommended the voodoo shrimp as an appetizer and the jumbalaya as an entree. We got the voodoo shrimp and they were cooked perfectly and the sauce, which had a little kick, was very tasty. I highly recommend the voodoo shrimp. My boyfriend had the jumbalaya and said it was packed full of meat and very tasty. I had a burger with cheese and bacon. It was cooked to my liking, rare, but I just wish it was seasoned a little more. This is a very cool place to eat and relax pre show. I am drinking the Bluesmobile, and it's so good that I will continue with this drink throughout the night. If you are seeing a show, stop in and ask for Gentille. You won't be disappointed.
Box office was awesome! I had a problem and they took the time to solve it so thank you for that! Saw The Cult and they killed it!

The main band started almost an hour late but put on a full 90 minute show plus one encore. Several technical issues with the microphones but the band played through it and put on a really energized show.  Amazing guitar work well worth seeing if you ever have the opportunity. This was my second time and they really mix it up. Nothing the same in either show except closing with Stairway to Heaven.   House of Blues, it would be nice if you got a little air moving in there to cool things off a bit and that you soup open the upstairs a little sooner.

We had the Sunday Gospel Brunch.  It really felt like you were in church.  Wonderful live stage performance.  Not a bad seat in the house.  Take the stairs down to the basement where the buffet and the show was held.  All you can eat buffet.  My faves were the waffles and the jambalaya.  Skip the fried chicken.  It was chicken tenders and very dry. I saw the shrimp but bypassed it.  Went back later and it was an empty platter.  It was not replenished.  There's a mimosa and bloody mary station.  Pay extra for that.  Dessert was a cobbler and a bread pudding.  Average.  4.0 stars for the performance. 3.0 stars for the food.

Very cool venue!  I saw a show here a few weeks ago.  My only complaint is that for "standing room only", there really isn't much room.  You have to be tall or really persistent to be able to see anything.  But, that being said, I look forward to coming back and trying the restaurant part of this place sometime...

We went to see Billy Idol here. Billy was amazing and so much fun. I give him 5 stars! I like how small the venue is so you can see from anywhere. However we spent extra money to get a table and it wasn't good. First of all we had to sit on tiny round stools with no back. So it was very uncomfortable. Then the table was tiny. They crammed four of us in a small 2 person round table. Eventually we moved the stools and just stood. That was way more comfortable. Then the tables in front of us had taller stools ( with backs). Why do you put people in shorter stools behind people in taller stools? I don't get that. The waitress was awesome and nice. The place is great just don't buy the cheapest table seats. Worth is to upgrade to the better tables, the more expensive package. Only 3 stars for them due to the table and stool issue. And we had dinner there before hand and it was OK. Nothing special.

My friends and I ate breakfast here yesterday while staying in Vegas. 2 of my friends used their cards. One for merchandise and the tip and the other for the bill. The friend who bought the merchandise realized today that her card was billed for both her purchase as well as the entire bill. When we called the restaurant to resolve the issue the manager on duty,Marissa, was very nonchalant and told us that they charged both cards to see which one would go through (the other transaction had already gone through though). She said she would call back but was too busy at the moment. We went to the restaurant to discus in person as over and hour went by with no call back. When we got there she again told us she was busy and didn't have time to look into it. She never once told us she was sorry for the inconvenience or the error. After a while of arguing back and forth she finally went to the back to check and came back with a card of someone else we could call. She handed us the card said see if the charge falls off in 2-5 days and turned around and walked away with a flip of her pony tail. She was unprofessional  and rude. She acted as if we were an inconvenience to her. Because of this customer service none of us will ever return to this or any other House of Blues.
Here with a party of 20.  Christmas party with good friends.  Our server did a great job! Sadly I didn't ask his name. Young man in his thirties.

Swing dancing on Tuesday nights at the House of Blues is soooo much fun. Tons of awesome dancers who are friendly and  amazing to watch.  The bands change weekly so there are all types of good music to dance to.  Everyone should check it out. Come in your fancy duds and dance shoes! This week was a band from L.A.  The California Feet Warmers.  So much fun.

We came here for Sunday brunch. We wanted to do the gospel brunch, but didn't realize it was only at certain times; so we just came here since it was next door.  The food was good. I had a well made omelet. The hash browns are Denny's style (grated - hard on top, soft on bottom) but tasty. No complaints about that at all.  I will complain about the service. Our server must have had a long night before or is just dumb. She brought us our drinks and I asked for a straw. We were seated next to the bar where I could see straws. She continued to check on all her other tables and go in the back. A few minutes passed and I was thirsty, so I went to the bar and got my straw. (Sorry but I will not drink from the glass at restaurants. None clean their glasses by hand and there's usually left over lip balm on the sides. Gross.) I realized I didn't have a knife and asked her for one before my food came out since I knew it would take her a while. She looked at the empty tables around us for one. None of the tables had silverware on them, our hostess put them down when we were seated. It was strange. We asked for boxes and she returned with them. Usually when guests ask for boxes, that means they are done so that's the server's cue to leave the check. Nope, we had to wait for her to make her rounds and go in the back again for her to come back and ask us if we had any coupons. Then she left again and brought us the check. It was truly annoying and because of her, I probably won't go back.

Skip this restaurant.   It will give you the blues!   Went to HOB for dinner as I was craving their new Citrus Steak Salad - which I've had twice before.  It usually on point, delicious and unforgettable.  However I was very very disappointed tonight.  The salad did not have the same flavor as it used to - it was missing the hint of ginger and heat of jalapenos.  It tasted like a plain old forgettable chopped salad with a tasteless vinegarette dressing.  I mentioned it to the waiter - who didn't really seem to care - but offered to have them redo it and add some seasoning to it - I told him what flavors were missing....He brought it out after they remade it - it tasted the same....bland.....A manager came over and I told him that  I came specifically for this salad as I've had it twice before....and he explained that they took out the ginger and jalapenos because customers were complaining.....totally did not make sense to me as it is on the menu (which was created by chef Aaron Sanchez) He offered to bring me some chopped ginger ...and he thought they may still have some jalapenos in the back - and expected me to fix it myself......I said no thank you....He said they probably had a different chef this time.   Well...my thoughts were that that chef should follow the damn recipe that was created!!!!  Service was disappointing  - they just didn't really seem to care.  Once I complained....they stopped bringing refills.  They had a live band on stage - music was way too loud in the restaurant - not the place to go if you want to have any sort of conversation.  There is also a 10% entertainment tax that is now charged in many Las Vegas venues - so be aware!!  I will NOT be going back  - Thank you to the 2 employees of HOB for ruining my previous high praises.

Throughout the years my friends and I have been coming to the House of Blues for concerts. A few of us recently came here last Friday for the Scissor Sisters show. We came in late and the only spots left were near the side bar. With the large pillar cutting off our direct view, I was bummed. If the artist is energetic and works the stage well, it is no problem. Luckily, SS did just that. Jake Shears and Anna Matronic moved strutted their stuff all over the place. As the show continued, people moved off and we got a better view. HoB does have TV screens to alleviate the obstructed view, but it doesn't help because they recorded it from a far distance.   A major complaint I have about most concert venues is the parking situation. While other places tend to be a free for all after a show and locks down the ramps, it was not difficult to get out of the Mandalay Bay. I was amazed since there were two concerts going on that night.
After a long drive, we stop by at this great restaurant Bruno was incredible ..great service and the food was delicious,a perfect dinner to start our trip in Vegas

One of the best reasons to attend  a concert at the HOB is for the intimate, up close and personal feel of the venue. The prices for shows are usually pretty reasonable. But once you get inside, plan on paying good money for drinks. The place can get jam packed during popular shows. We've noticed the sound quality of some shows can be sub par. And don't expect to get a seat to a show, unless your willing to pay for a table with bottle service. I really don't know why they don't open up the seats upstairs like the good old days for us lazy folk.
I love this spot. Everytime we come to Vegas I have to get something from here. Hint hint bloody Mary's are awesome.

Our first time here, watching Led Zepagain for the first time since hearing them on Spotify. The band was EXCELLENT!  Understandably the greatest collection of LZ emulators in the world.  But I looked online and found that they let the venue run the sound and lights, and that explains how badly the sound was mixed.  The lighting was fine, but the sound mixer clearly had not been trained on this kind of music... Zep is known for screaming vocals, awesome guitar, dynamic drums, and a serious baseline.  The mixer seemed to think this was a blues band, needing to boost the vocals massively while muting the base.  Or they had the channels swapped, which is what it felt like - the bass should have been amped up and the vocals should have been relaxed a bit...  When he screamed, which he had to do all the time (duh), it actually hurt my ears!  No, not like the normal live band thing, it really hurt!  In the awesome encore Stairway to Heaven, I watched the bass playing the critical parts which I literally could not hear!  Not quite what I think the songwriters had in mind... All in all, a great concert by a seriously talented band, heavily tainted by a very badly mixed sound.  I don't think I want to try another House of Blues concert, but I would see Led Zepagain anywhere.

Wait was long for food and service was suuuuper slow. My brothers ordered the baby back ribs and although I didn't try them myself they said it was horrible and you couldn't but into the rib as it was full of cartilage everywhere. (I think that's what it's called) won't be back.

Wasn't impressed with the food and the service was even worst. Had too flagged down the waitress 5 times just to get a refill drink. The waitress got mad because I didn't want the salad that was given to me. Gave me a straight attitude. Will not be returning

I think this makes me old because I like this place cause my feet don't hurt from standing during the entire concert.  Even if you're not the first people in the standing room or have a seat reserved upstairs, you still have an okay view.  I tend to stand in the back, closest to the bars and bathrooms and not be involved in any crowd surfing or mosh pits.    Unless you're planning on needing someone to get your paper towel for you or borrowing a tampon, don't bring your purse into the bathroom.  You'll feel less like an asshole that way.    Have always had good service at the bars here, which is important.    Even though its a 'big box' concert venue, I think I prefer it over most other ones that remain in CLE.  Plus, you couldn't ask for a better location.    Somehow ended up in the Foundation Room one night where everything is gold leafed and covered in velvet with long drapes of sexy fabric separating areas.  I feel like if the show "Blind Date" came to CLE, this would be a good place to film in.  Cozy and awkward, but fun.    3 Stars because of the restaurant.  They keep advertising their crazy ridiculous happy hour which $1 domestics from 4-7.  I got 2 miller lights here at 6:45 (after waiting a solid 8-10 minutes at the bar) and it was $9.  UM WTF.  Bartender never even came back for me to argue this.  I mean, maybe it was already 7 bar time, but that's just ridiculous.  I'm going to go back at 3:45 and get me a dollar domestic.

Boyfriend and I came here for breakfast while in Vegas. We were drawn here because they have an $8.99 breakfast deal during the week (eggs, bacon, and hash browns). The food was pretty good. We made the mistake of getting a side of biscuits and gravy to share; they were too pricey ($8) and weren't very good. The gravy tasted like it was made with pepperoni.  We also ordered mimosas which, again, were probably over priced (but it's Vegas, so whatever). Overall, the breakfast hit the spot and the service was good. Fine place to come for cheap breakfast during the week if you're looking for something simple!

This is one of my absolute favorite venues to see a concert! Small, intimate and easy access to both bathrooms and the bar. There really isn't a bad spot in the house especially with the bar located elevated from the floor. It makes it super easy to have a prime lookout spot over the fans watching on the floor.  Will call is right in front of the venue which makes it super convenient as well.   The only thing keeping this from being 5 stars is the exorbitant price of drinks when you are there. I know this is how they make their money and I fully expect Strip casinos to be charging more anyway. It just seems that it's even higher than the norm. With that being said, I will not be deterred from coming back. Just consider pregaming a bit if you don't want to break the piggy bank!

Love the ambiance of this concert venue.  Its intimate enough that there is no bad seat.  In all depends on what you are looking for when you go to a concert, but if you like to mosh, then head to the floor in front of the stage.  If you like dining and drinking while you watch the concert, then the first floor at the bar or the reserved tables surrounding the sound system is best.  If you prefer to sit like in a theater, then head to the balcony.  You can also upgrade and get private seating, for a price!  The sound is incredible, the stage is large, the lighting is superb, and its probably the best venue when seeing a concert!  I've seen many concerts here.   Bar drinks are a bit pricey, and its sometimes hard to get the bartender's attention.  You could go thirsty.  Overall, great venue.  You won't be disappointed.
Had a beautiful Cobb salad at a lively dinner with friends. Service was very good. Once music started it was hard to talk but that may be ok. Music was great!

Okay, service was fine, courteous, and fast...95 dollars for greasy chicken wings, small cob salad, and a tasteless jambalaya...Come on people just say no. This was about as bad a meal I've had in LV...for 20 dollars (return) with Uber get out of the casinos.

I like this place.   Here's why: *their attentive *it's moderately priced *they have a lot of options on the menu--salads, meals, fish, pizza, etc *from time to time they have live entertainment *they have a Gospel Brunch on Sundays *Shrimp 'n grits are really good [sauce on the side] *it's good for groups *it's super casual *Steak salad is on the spicy side so I'd advise you to get the jalapenos on the side *it's quick

We recently got married here inside Mandalay Bay at the House of Blues (at the Crossroads Restaurant). It was a unique venue that allowed us to personalize our wedding and add extra details that made it unique and special to us and our guests. There is a stage on one end of the space and a bar on the other. We performed a few songs on the stage and our guests enjoyed the open bar, southern-style food and groovy atmosphere. The wedding coordinator for the HOB, Amber, was a dream to work with. She and she staff were very professional and they helped make our Big Day stress-free. Our guests said it was one of the most unforgettable weddings that they have ever been to and we have Amber and the HOB staff to thank for that.

My first time going to the HOB Gospel Brunch, and I actually thought this experience was really great.  My advice: get there when the doors open, rush to your table, and go straight for the buffet.  Dump your plate of food on the table and get your dessert from the dessert station.  I say that because (1) the buffet line gets looooong, and (2) I noticed the dessert table right away and thought I would get something later after I ate... but they never refilled the Key Lime Pie and some of the other goodies that were there.  The food:  Lots of cajun classics, from jambalaya to biscuits and grits. There was also a carving station with a mound of chilled peel-and-eat shrimp.  As a vegetarian, I was thrilled to see they had a vegetarian pasta... and it was delicious.  It had a bunch of veggies in it (like brocolli, califlower, tomatoes), and pesto, with melted cheese on top.  That's pretty much all I ate from the main buffet line, besides some breakfast potatoes. The french toast sticks were horrendous...obviously some food service garbage that was freezer-burned.  They also had beautiful fresh fruit, pastries, and mini bundt cakes.  The bundt cakes were chocolate, vanilla, or blueberry  (and I might have seen a lemon or pineapple one on the bottom) and I loved them.  The music:  I am not a particularly religious person and I knew absolutely nothing about gospel music. Going into it  I thought it was going to be more neutral... more inspirational than religous.  However, it was quite religious. There were tons Amens and Hallelujahs, and Jesus was thanked many times, which is fine - they were doing their thing and I respect that. They even did the classic hymn, "Amazing Grace," and it was beautiful.  The singers and band overall were outstanding, and they sang for at least an hour.    It was about $40/person which I think is an excellent deal for quality food and entertainment. I would definitely go to the Gospel Brunch again, perhaps at another House of Blues to see how they do it in another city.  F.Y.I. - the noise level was about a 9/10, you couldn't hear the person next to you over the music while you were eating.

Other reviewers are right-- the service wasn't great. It was borderline bad. But I did order some mixed drink thinking I would like it-- big surprise, I didn't-- and our server swapped it out for a bottle of Bass for me. It was a nice gesture and I appreciated it.  Although I'm from Orange County, I'd never eaten at HOB before, and since I was feeling like some cajun/Southern food, it sounded pretty good.  I had a big plate of jambalaya and it was great, but it was HUGE-- there was way too much to possibly eat in one sitting. One full sausage, two chicken legs, a half dozen shrimp, with more chunks of all of the above mixed in. I loved it, but my goodness!  For an appetizer, we also shared the catfish fritters which would have been nothing without the spicy dipping sauce that came with it! The sweet potato fries were the best I'd ever had-- finally a place that doesn't slather them with maple syrup and/or brown sugar. They were crispy and crunchy and delicious.  My boyfriend cleared his pulled pork sandwich off his plate.  We were there for his birthday but didn't really ask whether they did anything for that, so I'm not sure. Overall though, we enjoyed the meal and look forward to trying the HOB in Anaheim. Maybe their service is a little better.

Food is good. Service is average.   Open for breakfast & way cheaper than the other sit down breakfast places in Luxor or Mandalay Bay. Has a bounce back coupon, eat breakfast here one morning, get a coupon for the following day 2-4-1 breakfast entree.   Also has a rocking Happy Hour from 2 - 6 pm Monday - Friday $2.00 domestic pints, $3.00 import pints.

Mandalay Bay is a beautiful hotel, but aside from that.  I have to say that the House Of Blues is a great place to hang out and see bands.   I went to see Motorhead a couple years back and was blown away!   The venue was just the right size.  Not to big, not to small.   Never dined here, just had drinks, but the experience was great!

This review is for the food.  AMAZING.  We woke up rather late and were starving.  One of my friends said "I'm feeling a big fat juicy burger with mushrooms and avocado and sweet potato fries" and the next minute four drooling women were on a major mission.  We walked into The Caf√© in The Hotel and saw maybe two burgers on the menu, with overly fancy fixings for $18.  FAIL!    On our way to get a quick Starbucks, me and another gal checked the menu for House of Blues as we passed by and low and behold- burgers and sweet potato fries for about $12!!!    Our waiter, Angel, was super sweet and did an awesome job of taking care of us!    I'm adding this place to the short list for best sweet potato fries, ever!  Sweet, slightly salted, crispy, and delicious and Angel recommended the spicy tarter sauce to go with (SO GOOD).  I ordered the Mushroom Swiss Burger and it was heaven in my mouth; grilled onions and shrooms falling out all over the place, juice all over my hands.  Lawd.  I'm definitely coming back here next time I'm in Sin City!!!

Really enjoyed this place. Went to see Joe Walsh, who put on a great show. Liked the venue. Small enough for a more intimate show but didn't feel crowded. We only decided to go at the last minute, so all we were able to get were general admission seats. That meant standing for a good hour and a half before the show started, which was not fun, but the bar was nice enough and the drinks were good. We had dinner before the show in the restaurant, and had a pretty decent jambalaya. It was a little on the mild side for my taste, but otherwise OK. Our server was fantastic. She was attentive and made sure that everything went smoothly with our meal. I would definitely go back again to see a show.

Came here for a concert and it was packed on the first floor. They finally opened the upstairs after a little while and it was open seating, so we were able to sit while enjoying the show.  There was only one bar opened upstairs and the line was super long with only one bartender working. We got a total of five beers and it came out to $80.00 which in my opinion is way too expensive but we had waited in line for so long already that a beer was much needed.  Btw, the bathroom was clean with no line.

Have you ever had that moment when you were so excited to go somewhere and you have heard nothing but excellent things about it and then you get to experience it for yourself and you want to go back and backhand everyone that told you such amazing things about it? If so, welcome to the world of House of Blues.   Santana was back at the house of Blues and I have wanted to see him forever so as a Christmas gift I received 2 VIP ticket packages somewhere around $250 a piece tickets that had been advertised to include, Early access to the music hall with advanced seating, a bottle of champagne or wine, chocolate covered strawberries, and a few other things outside of the venue that dont matter here.   With doors opening at 7:30 we figured we would go to the venue around 7:15 and with the VIP badge we would walk right in. That was in fact the complete opposite. The General admission line to the left of us was simply pooring right into the music hall while we waited in a rope made coral. The hostess told us that they are short handed tonight so there will be a little wait to be seated.. I Can understand a place being short handed so guess that is no big deal right? If this was a 5 minute wait that would be no big deal but we then stood outside while all the others people walked right in for over 15 minutes, Once the lady opened up the rope she got on the radio and let them know table 26 was coming down and she let us know the usher would meet us at the bottom of the stairs and escort us to our table. At the bottom of the stairs we were greeted by a woman that said... Oh you are VIP? go ahead and wait right here and points into the middle of a group of people so we then waited there getting in and out of peoples way for the next 10 minutes. Until an usher finally came to get us to take us to the table.   Once we got to our table or maybe we should call it our position in the sardine box we waited forerver for the server to come take our order. We ordered the bottle of wine which she did end up bringing to the table pretty quick but said, " I need to go drop off this other bottle and then Ill be right back to open it up for you" 25 minutes later she returned to ask how we are doing and that is when I think she realized I was not happy and discovered we had just sat there with an unopened bottle of wine.  The show itself was amazing and Santana is a musical Monster but this establishment is not as Intimate as people say it is, unless you are talking about the fact that you sit so close to the guy next to you that you can smell his breath. My one recomendation would be not to pay for the crazy priced VIP packages, instead, choose to site in the balcony seating, it was comfy movie theater like seats and the view would have been amazing. I may give this place another try for a general admission rock concert or something but definitely not for a seated show like this one.

I'm pretty much reviewing this just based on the atmosphere....which is really REALLY cool in my opinion. The downstairs is really open, with a bar, a large dance floor, and stage for concerts. The band playing that night was pretty good, and it was fun to kick back on the balcony above it and bop around to the music. I was there for an event, so we had free wine and beer for a bit (although I was only able to take advantage of one free glass of wine, BOOO) and although I didn't personally try any of the food, the guys I was there with scarfed a bunch of spicy-smelling chicken wings and fries.  The crowd is pretty good, too. Even though it's in Mandalay Bay, right on the strip, it didn't seem to attract your typical bro-man Vegas crowd, at least not the night I was there (which was Saturday). I'd actually like to have a conversation with the any of the patrons at House of Blues. Four stars for that alone.

House of Blues has tons of shows.  Some of the bands that play here have been on the radio, some of them just have a large underground following.  There are 21+, and all ages shows.  From metal to gospel, there's almost always something worth seeing.   It can get very crowded here, and mosh pits are not unusual.  Avoid the HOB if you're claustrophobic.  Smoking has been banned inside the show room.  This is great for non-smokers, and not-so-great for smokers.  If you go upstairs for a cigarette during intermission, you're sure to lose your spot for the next band. Unfortunately the shows here aren't the cheapest.  Tickets can range from $15 to $100+ depending on who's playing, and you can count on paying about 25% more in ticketmaster, and "house" fees.   Security has been an issue in the past.  I've seen people get kicked out for things they absolutely weren't doing (and people NOT getting kicked out for being complete pigs).  I've had shows cancelled after I bought tickets, and have not had my money returned.  Also, I have no idea what determines if a show should be all-ages, or not, but whatever the formula is, it has appeared to be wrong on several occasions (imagine trying to enjoy LMFAO with about 200 "provocatively" dressed 13 year olds). I've seen dozens of my favorite bands here, so I can't complain TOO much.   House of Blues is a bit expensive, pretentious, and unpredictable, but it's still not a bad venue by Vegas standards.

Caught a lot of concerts here while Steel Panther was doing their Saturday-Midnight residency, and enjoyed them. We'd usually get there early and camp out on the rocks next to the gift shop entrance so as to have place to sit and wait instead of standing in the line (which would sometimes go all the way to the tattoo shop), because we'd have to stand once we got inside, as well. The concert venue is nice, though the beer is expensive... though beer is always expensive in Vegas, and at concert venues, so I suppose that comes with the territory. The bands we saw play always sounded great, and the security personnel were professional and friendly. They weren't there to hassle you, just there to make sure everyone started out and remained okay during their time there. I wore a kilt to several of the concerts and did get a few odd looks from the people running the metal-detector lines, but I'm used to it so that's not a big detractor. Overall, I'd gladly see more concerts here, though Santana has a capacity to run long from time to time so if he's nearing the end of a stint or going on tour in the near future (and thus abdicating his spot for a few weeks), be ready to wait longer in line as they get everyone out and the place cleaned up for the next act. Or, if you're there to see Santana, be prepared to order an extra drink when he runs long. It's all good.

Everything went as planned when I went to go see Mac Miller's concert! The service was impeccable & The staff is also friendly & helpful. I can't forget James, everytime I had a question or concern he was the first to jump up & help can't beat him!

Had the pleasure of eating breakfast and dinner here during my birthday vacation.  Breakfast was good nothing really special but filling. Now, dinner was another experience. It was a toss up between Jambalaya or Baby back ribs, I chose the Jambalaya.  Wished they had a combo plate, both would've been delicious. Jambalaya was tasty not overly spicy the portions could've been a bit larger or maybe I was hungry which is why the food disappeared so fast! The live music got started when dinner arrived.  The Blues goes well with Jambalaya and for dessert Bourbon Bread pudding topped with toffee sauce and bourbon butter was made to be savored with a cup of coffee.  Service was friendly & paced well.  I didn't feel rushed or neglected. I would've stayed all night but ... when in Vegas... the machines were calling my name.  Atmosphere =A. Food =B+

Great food, great prices on food and drink. We had a group of 9 and were taken care of by an awesome waiter. There is Rock Star karaoke with a live band. People signed up immediately and we spent the evening listening to some real talent. Very enjoyable night.

What a freakin rip off! Friends wanted to see Fortunate Son, a CCR tribute band. 16 bucks a ticket for a tribute, ok. Then you get there and they tell you, would you like to sit? MF'ers then charge 25 bucks to sit at a table. Dishonest thieves!
If your a foodie this may not be the place for you!!! Nothing spectacular or over the top. No lasting.memory of the food or experience here.

I can only comment on the House of Blues as a concert venue.  We've been here twice (both times to see Roger Clyne and The Peacemakers perform) and I will say that the venue itself is awesome!  Very cool vibe - open and spacious, although it still gives you the feeling of being small.  The decor and lighting makes you feel as though you are transported to a different city.  For us - we prefer standing room for concerts - so you can move in closer and the setting is more intimate. It almost seems as you are at a private concert with just you and the band.  The crowd really gets into it - and the bands feel the energy!  Although our friends have told us that HOB Las Vegas can get shoulder to shoulder crowded for events, both times we've been there it has been perfect.    The bar area is elevated, with stairs or a ramp leading you down to the floor area.  Even being 5 ft 2 I never felt like I had to struggle to see over the person in front of me.  The sound quality is also awesome!  The only complaint I have, with that of any concert venue, is the bar and beer selection.  Although it was super easy to get a beer (no lines) the prices were pretty ridiculous.  $26 for two Coronas (okay - so they WERE king cans of Corona) but still - a little insane.  But again that's expected when you're out to see a concert.  A definite plus is that being a Vegas venue - the band was able to play past midnight (almost 3 and a half hours), unlike a lot of places where they are cut off early!  House of Blues in Vegas is one of our favorite concert venues!

I have the biggest girl crush on the House of Blues.  Like, if it were a person, I would ask it on a date.  Maybe I'm totally sheltered? Because I think this is the best venue EVER to see a concert.  There isn't a bad seat in the house. If you aren't into getting punched in the face by random strangers, you can chill out upstairs and still have a good view.  If you aren't a marathon stander, you can (usually) get seats and have a great view.  Really, I think it's a perfect venue.  The sound is always great.    My favorites shows have been at the House of Blues - maybe I'm biased.  But I think given the prices of tickets and the quality of the sound and the size - you can't go wrong with the HOB.

We went to the Santana concert Sept 22.... and bought VIP seats on the lower level.  The information we received was a little sketchy...was told that the concert started at 7, it really started at 8pm.  Of course this completely interfered with our dinner reservations and we had to leave the concert early.   The seats were amazing...about 30-40 feet from the stage. I would highly recommend springing for the more expensive seats!!

I like corn bread. The HOB corn bread is the best I've had....ever. And the honey maple butter thing with it....sheeee get out man! Now why don't they have this by where I live? Think I'll search for it now.  On this particularly insomnified night, I'm thinking of all the places I've eaten & Yelpin' 'em all from memory....testing, testing.....

Most people either love HOB or hate it--- personally, I will only go there if somebody totally awesome is playing, and that is not frequent any more. Like some others have mentioned, things have changed in the past few years-- and yes, the ticket fees are ridiculous and annoying.   Aside from that, I really hate the whole "standing room only" thing, especially since there is always some huge goon that thinks his Daddy was a glassmaker up front.   I really want to like this place, as it reminds me in some ways of the old Cleveland Agora, but just does not measure it. Maybe it is just the "franchise" feel of it that turns me off...but I'd prefer almost any other venue in town to this one.
Great breakfast decent prices would recommend. Nice atmosphere polite staff.  Clean environment

This was my first time here, and it was a very positive experience!   Kenny and Kate were the bartenders, and were both excellent.  I got the Herb Crusted Salmon Salad.  It was the best salad I have had in a long time, and I eat a lot of salads.  The place has a great atmosphere, as well.  I would love to come here when they have live music in the main dining room, as it seems like the perfect layout for it.  I highly recommend you visit here!
It is called House of Blues because you get the blues after spending so much God damned money at this pit. The staff is grumpy too.

I've been here a few times now, all of them for metal concerts (Dimmu Borgir and Mastadon) and I can say full heartedly that I'm a fan of this place. The venue is easy to find from Mandalay Bay's parking garage. Just go into the casino, proceed past the Light Nightclub and enter the casino floor. Turn your head left and TA-DA! Huge lights saying "House of Blues." So let's get to the main part of the review.  Venue: The venue is actually quite small in terms of stages. It has an upper floor with seating for other shows besides for concerts, but I'm rating it strictly as a concert venue. The floor is surrounded by a bar area, so drinks are easily accessible at any time. As far as concerts go, I prefer smaller venues to bigger ones because they seem more intimate. Being able to feel "close" to the band as they perform no matter where you are is pretty neat. That means you won't miss a beat! (Haha, music joke) They put up guards at the front of the stage during concerts, as do most places and they actually make a really good place to lean on between sets if you are lucky enough to be in the front and don't plan on moving anytime soon. It is also nicely decorated. I love the chandelier that they have, in the middle of the place, the tinted glass windows and the whole vibe the place gives off. It makes a great rock band venue.   Service: The people that work here, from the times I've been there are nice and personable. I mean, come on, it's hard not to be when you get to see free shows, right? Right. In any case, booze is always easily accessible. The cool part is that during concerts, if you are one of those lucky people against the guard rail right in front of the stage, a waitress comes around between the guard rail and stage to take drink orders so you don't have to move. BONUS! I didn't get anything to drink though, because drink prices in venues scare me. To rich for my blood. The actual people in charge of watching the event let you have a little fun, but do the appropriate thing when bad stuff goes down. They also help crowd surfers.   This is a great place to go see a concert, especially if you are a rock fan. The mood, atmosphere and small venue make it easy to mosh, drink, and/or enjoy yourself. If you know somebody coming to Vegas and feel like going to the show, hopefully you get lucky and get the House of Blues. :)

We stopped in here for a quick bite one evening. The food was ok. The prices seem a bit high, but that is to be expected for Vegas I guess. But the highlight of our visit was our server! Our waiter was Kurt and he was so friendly and helpful. Ask to be seated in his section and you will have a great experience.

Accessibility (Parking / Wait Time)  1/1 Star: no wait   _____  Service (Waiter / Cleanness / Ambiance)  1/1 Star: normal service. Fun Ambiance with s lot of things to look at.   _____  Taste (0=Not Edible / 1=Edible / 2=Good (average) / 3=Must Try!)  2/3 Stars: steak was good. Pasta was good.   _____  Overall Experience  4/5 Stars   _____  Last Words I didn't really like the music but the food was good.

The review is for the bar area. The food was just ok. Service was also just ok. I Liked the decorations at the bar. We walked around and the whole place is really nice and has cool features. There is also a small retail store inside.

SOOO impressed!!!! After I posted my review I was immediately contacted by the house of blues staff(Sahsha,Brian Klein,and Tim J.)  I was so  impressed on how fast they responded to the situation at hand.  They were very apologetic,professional,accommodating and they went above and beyond to turn a bad situation into and AMAZING memory.  I have told numerous friends,family and clients about my incredible  experience and how the House of Blues rocks.  What could have been disaster, has now made me a bigger fan and I can't wait to go back. The Venue is AWESOME , very intimate,and the service was outstanding. I HIGHLY recommend House of Blues for an up close and personal music experience with service unmatched by any other.  THANKS HOUSE OF BLUES  MAUREES

The drinks here are good, pricey, but really? You threw out the coupons and discount store deals once you stepped on the Vegas strip. They didn't have a band when I went, just check to see when they do have bands playing on their site. The artichoke dip and the bread pudding were so good, I can't enjoy those things as much as pre-house of blues Jessica did. My standards were raised. I want to try the one here, closer to where I live, but this place was great (food-wise), the waiter I had was distracted by something and seated us (me and my dad) in the leper section apparently, everyone else in the entire restaurant were all seated about half a football field distance away from where we were told to sit. The bread pudding though, try it! I don't care about your diet, you eat that bread!
This was our first stop of the night. We had some drinks and the vibe was casual and relaxing. The noise level wasn't too loud so we were able to converse normally. I certainly enjoyed my time here!

This is my second favorite house of blues to go to. The staff here is incredible and the venue itself is nice. I've been here multiple times to see Steel Panther and have spent many birthdays on stage with them! This HOB has a lot of seating upstairs too!!! Love it and I'm sure you will too!

Steel Panther!!!  Steel Panther does a show here every Friday.  I highly reccomend that.  The drinks are overpriced, but the show is free so it's worth it.  No seats unless you pay VIP, which is REALLY expensive.  But there is plenty of room to stand around and rock out.

We were a bit worried that the food here would be mediocre or below because of the similarities to Hard Rock Cafe. We were happily surprised!! My wife had the meatloaf and loved every bite of it. I had the Cajun pasta and while not truly spicy the sauce on the table made up for that. -1 star for the constant self promotional commercials running on every TV. Including the big screen on the stage. Why couldn't they play videos or concert footage?

I stayed at the Mandalay Bay for a conference and we had a private event here one evening.  The food was pretty good.  Sliders were tasty (pulled pork and meatball were the best...angus was just "meh"), the shrimp and grits were delicious, as was the jambalaya.   Bartenders were great, drinks were good and the music selection had everyone dancing.  The place has a cool look and vibe.  So why only two stars?  This HOB suffers from the same issue as the one in Chicago.  The music is deafening!  I was standing beside someone trying to have a conversation (after all, this was a social event in connection with a conference) and as we were shouting at each other to be heard, they actually turned the music up!  We just looked at each other and laughed because even though we were three inches from each other, there's no way we could continue the conversation.  Thankfully, one of the big cheeses from the conference was able to get them to turn it down a notch about 10 minutes later but by the time I left, my ears were ringing and my voice was hoarse from shouting.    If there's a live band, I guess that's one thing but just cranking it up so loud that everyone has to stand there with no interaction because it's physically too loud to converse, that's not terribly fun in my book.  I guess this must be a corporate decision since the loud music seems to be consistent but I don't think I'd choose to go to another HOB in the future because I actually like to interact with the people I go out with.  Except maybe in Houston, because that location was okay.  Side note: If you search for the word "loud" in the reviews, you get 26 hits.  Most of them complain about it being too loud.

Drinks took 20 minutes. Food was decent, very generic. The service was horrible. They kids menu is photo copied. The crayons are clearly from the 99cent store. The spinach artichoke dip was only spinach dip. The sangria was HORRIBLE.

The House of Blue's is a great place to see a concert. The atmosphere is fun and the sound is spectacular. They have a good bar and a nice area to eat. I've seen a few concerts here and hope to see many more!

HOB as a concert venue:   Went for a concert. In the general admission standing room "only" area you can get great pics of the band and get pretty close to the stage. Good sound and cool venue. Expensive drinks ($14 for 2 cocktails or $9.50 for a tall beer)! No specialty drinks in the concert venue. In the standing room only area there are a few first come first serve stools along one side of the place with a little railing in front of them - side view. Some shows also sell tickets to the upstairs balcony. And for the 1st time I noticed there were "club seats (stools)" behind the standing area but right in front of the stage.   The walls are actually really full of cool art if you have the chance to look around.
Really awesome staff and very welcoming atmosphere. Would recommend to come in for a great breakfast.
We did the sunday brunch and the music was good and the food was good, but not great. It was enjoyable and would not mind going back again. Something spiritual for a Sunday morning. :-)

I came here for dinner but to my dismay as every other dining option in Mandalay Bay had ridiculous waits. The menu is a hodge podge of heart attack-inducing foods with random influences that you would expect for all their calories would taste good but instead are completely bland and gross. The service was poor and the food took forever to come out even on a night when the place was only half full. The noise level was obscene. For half of our meal they had a horrible crooner screaching into the mic that made it impossible to hear the person sitting next to you. The second band was half decent at least and made the end of our meal a bit more enjoyable and fun.

2.5 stars  The venue seemed nice, and we thought we had decent seats since we were in the 3rd row back (section 200 row C) however upon sitting down found that the incline and the safety bars obstructed our view to a degree that we almost never could see anything on stage without the bars in the way. Not sure why they dont have clear glass railings? Ticketmaster didnt mention obstructed view so you may want to see if there is a seat map showing if there are obstructions, definitely would have paid more $$$ for a seat that I could see!  Disappointing sound quality, speakers were not always clear.  Tall cans of beer were a whooping $14/each.  They had Heineken, Corona, Bud light and paps.  Billy Idol was great though!!! :)

My wife and I have been going to Thursday night dinner at House of Blues for many years, as we enjoy seeing some of our favorite local bands play during dinner. Last night was the first time we have been there in a couple months, and were severely disappointed.  To start the night off poorly, the hostess placed us, essentially, on the casino floor in the farthest table from the stage. We asked if we could have one of the empty tables closer to the stage, being told "no, there is no server for that section." Before our drink order was taken, there were people seated at those empty tables.  Then, looking at the menu, we were even more disappointed and aggravated. We expect to pay more than normal restaurant prices to eat at House of Blues. However, $3.99 for an ice cream scoop of luke warm/cold mashed potatoes and the same price for an equal amount of snap peas is asinine.   Their entire menu has drastically gone up in price and down in selection. None of the good items are available anymore.  The only reason two stars got marked, after talking to one of the floor managers, she apologized at the illogical reason we were not permitted to sit at quality tables, moved us to a better section and comp'd us some drinks and dessert. Our servers were also pretty on top of things.   After having that first, bad experience as we got to the restaurant, it tilted the night's mood.
Great breakfast! No trip would be complete without a stop here. Ask for Aune she is the best. Two days in a row and she remembered our preferences. Sweet!

I really have a love/hate relationship with the HOB.  This used to be THE spot for shows.  It is small, intimate and has a great vibe.  Since The Joint expanded, I am no longer a fan of HOB.  The Joint is still small enough and is never quite as crowded as this place gets.  I mean, they really JAM the people in.  Maybe because I am getting old, but I am just not down with fighting for space with a bazillion other people.  The last show I saw here was Social Distortion, and we ended up leaving early - crazy!  It was way too packed, it took forever to get in, and I didn't want to pay $10 for a PBR tall boy.  I HATE PBR.  I drank about 1/2 my beer and it made my tummy hurt (yes, I am a beer snob), and I just couldn't stand there with the guy next to me elbowing me all night.  Overall, shows are a decent price.  The location is cool - inside Mandalay Bay and near most of the bars/restaurants of Mandalay Place.
Great venue, food is standard, but overpriced.

Food is ok.  Service is very slow.  There were probably a total of 10 people in the restaurant and it was a very long wait for food.  The first time I came here I ordered the all twisted up skillet which is just a bunch of veggies mixed in with eggs and topped with cheese.  It was very good and flavorful--the first time.  The second time I was like meh.  It was just totally bland but edible the second time.  Husband got the biscuits and gravy the first time and some sort of chorizo and egg dish the second time with a pancake.  The pancake was as large as the plate but arrived at least 10-15 mins before the main dish came out.  Really?  Anyways...if you are looking for a quick breakfast look elsewhere.  That's my opinion.
Food was not that great! We had lunch here so not much going on. I'm sure the night life is much better!

I go to a LOT of shows. That means I go to a LOT of venues. I have never been all that blown away by House of Blues, except that they bring in great acts. I was here for a phenomenal Ingrid Michaelson show. It's the perfect-sized venue for a show like that. The pro is varied seating - high tops, floor standing, seats up in the balcony. The negatives are the huge amount of obstructed seats and the prices for mediocre food and beverages. The bathrooms are also GROSS. While I get that it's a concert venue, it's also a bar and restaurant so let's maybe clean it up a little bit?  Definitely a good spot to go for a show but be sure to get in early if you want an unobstructed view. Also, stay away from the bar area if you are a fan who wants to hear the act --- gets LOUD in there.  Definitely worth it to see an act you like in a fairly small venue but I wouldn't go just to go experience a House Of Blues. And I definitely wouldn't go just for dinner and drinks.
I liked my breakfast again.  They should relax their serving times.  10:45, hubby wanted a salad.  'you have to wait until 11.' OK.  Whatever.
Kayla who works in ticket sales at the House of Blues Box Office is a Rock Star! Super friendly and very helpful. Thank you Kayla!
Good atmosphere, great food and excellent service by our very friendly and accommodating server: Bretani. Thanks so much!

Breakfast is my favorite meal here.  I love the waffles, but had the eggs and corned beef hash.  In spite of the fast food nature of the kitchen this place has great food.  I do really like this restaurant, but advise that breakfast has the most consistently good food here.  Lunch, and dinner can sometimes be an adventure.
I'm a big fan of House of Blues, more so because of the live music.  The food isn't anything special, satisfying nonetheless.  The service was also satisfactory.  Fun ambiance though!
Was in Vegas for work, had dinner at House of Blues.  Reasonable prices for a casino and the food was tasty. Service was top notch... our server Jennifer was great!

I ate here twice while I was staying at Mandalay Bay.  In the evening I had a Juicy Lucy, I found two hairs on my plate.  The fries were soggy.  The food was bland.  Despite my bad experience I came here again the next morning and got an Eggs Florentine because we had free gift cards to eat here.  The English Muffins were stale and our waiter forgot to bring us silverware.  We also ordered two drinks that our waiter forgot to bring us even though they showed up on the bill.  If you are staying at Mandalay Bay, I recommend eating someplace else.

Tried to come in here for an early lunch at about 10:40 on the morning we checked out of Mandalay. They weren't serving lunch until 11 and didn't offer us the opportunity to just hang around so we ended up ordering breakfast. I got the gravy and biscuits (which the waitress immediately corrected to "biscuits and gravy" - strange) and the wife got a breakfast burrito that seemed pretty standard.  Overall we were in and out in less than 30 minutes. Service was ok, food was ok, kind of annoyed by the whole thing, hence the 3 stars.

On a recent trip to Ohio, I was in Cleveland for the Frozen Diamond Faceoff.  We decided to find a place to eat and grab some drinks before the game. We ended up at the House of Blues.  Upon entering, there was a small crowd; however, there were empty tables. We got taken through the main dining area into a small overflow type room on the side. When we went into the room, we were seated near a group of 30 people. They took up several tables and seemed to be having a good time.  It took a few minutes for the waitress to take our order. After that, this is where the trouble began.  After an hour of waiting for our food, we finally asked the manager what was going on. He said they were extremely busy and there was a back-up in the kitchen. I thought this might be related to the large crowd; however, they were finishing their food when we came in.
