He did end up buying us a round of drinks.  When our food did come out, my order came out wrong. I ordered sweet potato fries and ended up with regular fries. No big deal, they just brought me the correct fries.  My cousin and his brother-in-law ordered the same burger. The waitress told them the only way this burger was made was well done which was great for them. When their burgers came out and they cut into the burgers, blood started pouring out. My cousin dealt with his; however, his brother-in-laws was nearly raw inside. They clearly tried to rush the burgers on a hot grill and only managed to cook the outside.  We didn't have time to wait for a re-fire, so my cousin's brother-in-law just didn't get to eat. It took us nearly 2 hours to have lunch here and one person left without getting to eat anything.  We won't be going back!

Ahhh the good ol' HOB. Man..I remember when this was THE concert spot ..the ultimate place to see your favorite performer and also the ultime spot for a performer to play.  I can start my review off memories , some blurry because of the alcohol , contact high or simply because I was in a musical orgasm; However it would not be fair for the readers  The place is small. Lets face it. You will end up tasting the sweat of the person right next to you .I can tell you the night before going to a HOB concert I pray to the Gods that the people around me decided to take a shower before the event.  On the flip side..small means close..close means better vibe..better vibe means awesome show! So if you are ok with all that.. it is still a very cool venue specially if you choose to sit on the balcony where there are movie theater kinda seats .  Sound is outdated. Sadly to report they seem to not want to upgrade the speakers nor their (speakers)location. Usually they have to retune , or the sound is simply not that good. The place have a lot of wood which is great for sound..but when you have the same speakers that "the wonders" from "that thing you do" had..then you are pretty much done.  They are selling food now.Hot dogs pizza , etc. And the price is actually pretty damn good for being inside the venue that is inside a casino. It amazingly tastes pretty good as well(for concert food of course). Food tends to go fast and wait time might be a little long but I think its pretty awesome to have the availability .  Drinks are just ok. Sometimes you get that water downed vodka and cran, but they will NEVER forget to charge you more than 12 dollars for it. Seriously HOB? I mean you are selling 5 dollars pizza but a 12 dollars Barbie sized cocktail? On the flip side..they sell tall boys and that's what I stick with  This place is where its at right now due lack of investment and love from its owners . Music artists don't want to play where they know their concert is not gonna be up to par. People don't want to go to weak concerts and then the whole chain reaction starts.Trust me ;the concept is awesome and I love the feel of a private venue, without the crazy expensive ticket price and with a cool ambiance. Im sure if HOB decides to take care of their spot , all this could change.  Rock out with your YELP out !

First time here was looking to try something new decided on the Cajun chicken pasta. Very dry and plain. I don't recommend it. Also If they have performers  on stage they charge a 10% entertainment fee, which was not explained prior to sitting. We didn't even dine there for entertainment.

Megan, the manager, is a Superstar. We all know that servers can sometimes have a bad day. Megan did a great job fixing the mistakes and making it overall, a great experience. It's not really what goes wrong but how it's handled.

If I could give less than one star, I would. Terrible, terrible, terrible brunch. Possibly the worst food in Vegas (at least of the food I have tried in Vegas). The brunch is especially terrible if you are vegetarian or health conscious. Nothing healthy and no true vegetarian options. Everything that I tried was disgusting (e.g. omelet station, salads, country potatoes, mac and cheese). You will only enjoy the food if you also enjoy Denny's.  As for the entertainment, it was decent. Some might call it a fun experience. If you are willing to pay $50 to hear gospel church music, then this is your spot. The vocalists were decent singers and the experience was somewhat entertaining. Overall, I think it's a complete waste of money.

Terrible service. It took 25 minutes to get our drinks.  We told the staff that we were seeing the Cirque show in an hour. At the hotel. He said no worries. We had the bacon wrapped poppers.  Ick. Cheese burger and salad. The food came out 5 minutes before we had to leave.  It had been sitting on a warmer. Kinda pricey, food is ok, but the service is atrocious. Better choices in town.

I decided to check out House of blues for brunch. The food was okay. Probably the best place for brunch in Mandalay Bay. There aren't many great places to eat at Mandalay, especially for brunch. I had an egg sandwich, eggs over easy on a buttermilk biscuit along with a side of fresh fruit. My eggs were not over easy. In fact they were overcooked. How do you mess up eggs? I just don't understand how restaurants do this. The biscuit was rich and yummy..they did not mess that up. Overall the breakfast was just okay, but 10 times better than the Mandalay buffet and room service. Therefore if I stay at Mandalay again, I may eat here again out of pure convenience.

This review goes for the concert hall  For me, this place is as good as it gets for a show.  Its not too big, not too small.  I have seen In Flames, Shadows Fall, Trivium and just recently Steel Panther here.  I love this place!  Steel Panther apparently play most Saturdays here and I would highly recommend the show as they are very entertaining.

Server is James. He carries this place. Even without the solid meal, the service from James blew me away. This is a genuine, friendly, helpful, quick, knowledgeable guy who got me excited about my meal and feel inspired by the menu. He mentioned Aaron Sanchez (chef from Chopped!!) when describing the menu and the intended vibe of the restaurant. Chef Sanchez has several items that he personally crafted for the venue, like the beer burrito meal (beer in a brown paper bag and a breakfast burrito to cure a hangover), and the bacon avocado eggs Benedict.  Coffee came quickly. Freshly brewed. Really hit the spot.   The bacon avocado eggs Benedict came with the delicious Hollandaise sauce

Worst service ever !!!! Waited an hour for a table for three !!!' After traveling 10 hours wanting food and alcohol they told us the wait was only 30mins ... they were seating people that came after us before us .... also people were coming up saying they had reservations they were telling people to come closer to their time a guy came literally one minute before ... and had to wait longer because they weren't ready ... hostesses suck at their job so disappointed this Military family went over to a slice of vegas and had way better service !!!

I tried this place out and really liked it the food was great and you get a lot the price wasn't too bad and they have live music, I would recommend to have a reservation, because if not you will be waiting for awhile to get in. The service was good and the atmosphere was nice and comfortable. I would check out who is playing the night you go so you know who is going to performing. sometimes they have big bands, try them out you will not be disappointed.

Pleasantly surprised!  I was really expecting this to be like a hard rock cafe (and their food is horrible at best), but the food was great!  Price was good.  I had a Cesar salad and BBQ Chicken Flatbread.  Chicken on the flatbread was amazing.  It was real BBQ chicken...not diced frozen bits.  Hubs had an Island Turkey Burger with sweet potato fries and it was DELISH!  I made me wish I had ordered it as well!  Nicely seasoned.  My sister-in-law had the mac and cheese, also very very good! Nice and creamy, smooth, but lots of cheese taste without being too sharp.   I loved the decor.  I could have looked at the walls, floors, and ceiling all day.  Of course the music inside was good.  Service was great and our waiter even recommended a few things to do and see besides the obvious.  If you are in the area you should stop by, don't pass it up thinking it is going to be like those other franchise rock places.
Service was slow. Chicken and waffles had no flavor and the waffles were very thick and dry. My latte was the best part of my meal.

Will make this short and sweet ~ Went here One time, one time too many.  I think because of their name and where they are located they think they can get top dollar for everything on the menu. This place is very expensive. Don't get me wrong the food is good. It is just crazy to pay the prices here because your hungry. There are far more places to eat at in Vegas and close by you don't need to come here Service is slow and it takes forever to get your food. The place does get pretty busy.  So not worth going here and we will not go back.

We had breakfast here. We had a little wait to get in so our table could be set up. There was no live music but still the environment is fun. The food is average for breakfast, nothing out of my group made us want to come back. Had to constantly ask for refills on drinks. Waitress was sweet but seemed to be still waking up for her shift.

Good food and the service was great too. From the moment we got there the host were welcoming and friendly, and our server was awesome as well. It was nice to have the manager show up to our table and check on us. I will be back and I will be happy!

My friends and I came here for dinner while in Vegas, and actually had a decent time. I'm generally hesitant when headed to a corporate chain restaurant, in fear of an over-priced and mediocre meal.  I guess Aaron Sanchez is the chef here? Honestly, the food was pretty decent. Our meals ranged from mac n' cheese, to the chicken sandwich, ribs, and jumbalaya. All was thoroughly enjoyed and savored.   They didn't have live music playing when we were there, but they did have music playing in the background. The vibe is pretty modern, upbeat, and fun.   Not bad! I was pretty impressed.

I came her with my gf and we enjoyed their 8.99 egg meat and hash brown breakfast. Food was great with appropriate portion. Service was the highlight of our dinning experience. Zero pressure to order, no rush to leave. Walked away with a 20$ tab which is cheap for a meal on the strip in vegas.

Food: Delicious! Had the fried chicken here with mash potatoes and fries, just what I was in the mood for.   Price: Not bad, portions were pretty big and the food was good.  Service: Friendly. Our server was cool and very attentive.   Atmosphere: Pretty chill in here, different music videos were playing on the tvs around the restaurant. Dark setting.  Location: Located at Mandalay Bay near the tattoo place.

This review is for breakfast. I ordered the sampler and everything was luke warm. The yolks of my over easy eggs were solid. The portions were huge and the pancakes were tasty but everything was overpriced. With the price I paid please bring my food to me warm and cook my eggs right. Even my mimosa couldn't redeem my experience.

Went to see Steel   Got to the show just in time.  Large forum, easy to see where ever you stand.  We were able to walk right up to the stage during the show, even though the floor was a bit crowded.  Everyone was friendly and service was good.  We weren't here to eat so I didn't experience the food just the alcohol and show.

The selena kareoky by who..... Any ways what a JOKE... tottaly a fake venue even worst than lip singing is a fake band lol OMG .. But a good time with frinds and $18 dollars beers and $10 parking fees for locals
Decent food option in the Mandalay.  Southern style eats were OK, not fantastic, but OK.  Good coffee at breakfast!  And a pretty decent happy hour too.

Went here with a restaurant.com gift card and received $50 off the bill so that factors into my perception of value.  There were no hassles redeeming the certificate which isn't always the case. I took my young teenage daughter and her friends out for her birthday celebration and we enjoyed ourselves.  Outsider art covering the walls and downtown location made for cool experience. It was loud, which was odd because restaurant wasn't really crowded.  Server was great: professional, kind and she even sang a special birthday song Ronny daughter. Tater tot appetizer was good for sharing. Burgers and tacos looked good. I got shrimp and grits and it was just ok.  This place is well equipped to accommodate large groups: a girls hockey team came in and all 25+ were easily seated.

Twitter? Waste of time, right? Not always. I saw a chance to win tickets to see Brit Alternative ( well alternative in 1979 ) band Squeeze.   Did the RT and got a message from HOB, " you've won' . Cool. So Friday night and I'm freeloading at HOB in Mandalay Bay. What a cool venue, it's all standing, aside from a handful of VIP seats, and a great place to watch a real band.  There are a couple of bars and steps down to the floor, sound is great and you cannot fail to get a good view from anywhere. I ordered  a Heineken and a Chardonnay for wifee. The Heineken came in a can which was enormous , almost a keg and the wine came in a tiny plastic 'glass'. I was happy, wifee not so much!   Anyway the band were awesome, Glenn Tilbrook is now sporting a beard that would not be out of place in ZZ Top and Chris and the other players were tight.   Great place I will make more effort to see some shows there, the only downside was $21 for a beer and a splash of Chardonnay.

I loved the atmosphere, felt bluesy ;) But for real, I liked the simple menu- good food and something for everyone. Our waitress, Lisa, was on top of it and patient when we took awhile to look at the menu and decide what we wanted. The margherita flatbread, Mac and cheese and tacos were my favorite. All in all- Coming back again is in my future.

I would give this venue negative stars if I could.  This is just for the main concert venue, not the restaurant, by the way.  First off, the sight lines are absolutely awful.  If you're not on the (very small) main floor or in the balcony it's almost impossible to see the stage due to the very low ceilings.  I didn't spend $30+ on tickets to watch a show on the television, thank you very much, and I don't really want to be packed in like a sardine on the tiny floor.  And since the ceiling is so low, the sound gets extremely compressed.  It's terrible.  This is supposed to be one of the trademark music venues for Cleveland, and to have such basic flaws in the design of the venue is inexcusable.  It's simply a terrible setup for a music venue.  After that add on the worst security I've ever had to deal with at a venue.  I am a writer and often have press and photo passes.  At one particular show I was taking pictures in an area reserved for photographers with my photo pass.  A security guard grabbed me and yelled "Either you get out or I'm throwing you out."  He was extremely aggressive.  This is not uncommon.  I've been to over a hundred concert venues around the country and this House of Blues is probably consistently the worst with security being heavy handed for absolutely no reason.  After all of that, the drink prices are crazy, the attendants in the bathroom get mad if you don't tip them for handing you a paper towel (which I never asked you to get for me), there's no dedicated area for smokers (I'm not a smoker but I have friends that are, you have to leave the venue to smoke), and on and on and on.  I can't think of a single redeeming factor for this venue.  I wish that artists that cared about their fans would stop performing there and go to one of the other great venues in Cleveland.  Unless there's a show you're absolutely dying to see, stay away from this place.

Saw the M*F* Darkness here last month. INCREDIBLE SHOW.  The security was great, effective but not overbearing. I wish they would have opened up the second floor. Beers were priced well ($6 for a tall coors).   I also noticed the house of blues attracts the local crowd. It was nice to get away from the plastic surgery creatures and drunken bachelorette parties.

[pic added]  i've been to HOB a lot of times in LA but this is my first time in LV. we went here for the gospel brunch, which is an all-you-can eat buffet accompanied by live gospel music. lemme tell you: i love gospel music. i don't know why, exactly, but i love the energy and soulfulness!  their waffle and pancake station was great. the mini-waffles are my all-time favorite of the meal. mmm, pair it up with fried chicken and it's a match made in heaven. especially if the chicken is all you can eat AND positioned strategically between the cheesy grits and old bay boiled shrimp! those were the real stars of the brunch in regards to savory food. they also have meat carving stations (this time it was smoked turkey and marinated flank steak), a dessert station, build-your-own bloody marys, unlimited bellinis and mimosas/beer (sorry, didn't partake).  entertainment was fun and touching. st. paul's children choir performed and their voices carried strong. coupled with the energy and audience participation, this event turned out very well.

Dinner at the House of Blues nearly inspired me to sing the blues.   If I had a mic and harmonica I'd sing you a woeful tune about the ahi tuna appetizer. Tiny, bland and overpriced.  The St. Louis ribs that featured more inedible gristle than meat.  The redeeming factors that push the review from 1 to 3 stars would be the great service and music we enjoyed during our visit.  Next time I'll go back for drinks and a show, but I'll eat my food elsewhere.

Love the atmosphere and the staff. Everyone is very friendly and helpful. The live music is awesome! We got the spinach and artichoke dip as an appetizer. Very very good. A lot of restaurants fail at this dip but not the case here. I ordered the linguine primavera which was honestly a little bland but not horrible. My husband enjoyed his grilled chicken but his carrots were slightly undercooked. All in all great service, great atmosphere and we will return next time we visit Vegas.  As a bonus you receive 10% off in the gift shop area if you spent $30 or more in the restaurant. I don't know if this is always the case but that's a nice little perk. The shop has some pretty fun stuff!

This review is mostly for the restaurant.  We came here for dinner because we scored free tix to a Brazilian Party at the concert venue, and we had a $25 restaurant.com certificate for the restaurant.  I'd love to be able to give the restaurant 3 1/2 stars, but the service and management was so exceptional that I'm bumping it up to 4.    We were two couples, and it turned out that we all decided to order the same thing, the Turkey Burger.  One of our friends is allergic to tomatoes, and told the waitress that they absolutely had to be left off.  We waited quite a while for our food to be delivered, and even though we'd gotten to the restaurant with time to spare before the concert, we were getting nervous.  When the food was delivered, you guessed it, the tomatoes were sitting on his burger, and it needed to be sent back.  The waitress was completely apologetic and stated that she absolutely told that to the kitchen.  We believed her, and it didn't take too much time for his food to come back, this time prepared correctly.  We all agreed that it was the best turkey burger any of us had ever eaten; no gamy taste whatsoever, and it had stuff mixed into the meat.  It was a little bit spicy - a good thing!  It kicked up the blandness of the usual turkey burger, without the kitchen having to oversalt it to give it some taste.  The fries that came with it were crisp and delicious, and there was a little dish of sweet and spicy pickles, something I'd never tasted before, and really loved.  What happened next was totally unexpected:  the manager came over, unbidden, and apologized for the mix-up.  He invited us to come back after the performance and enjoy dessert on the house.  And then the charge for the Mistake Burger was removed from the bill!  And that's in addition to the discount from the certificate we had.  The performance was a whole 'nother matter.  After being searched and branded, er, banded, we went upstairs where we were ushered to comfortable seats.  No standing room for us, with our free tickets!  A DJ on the stage was playing some Trance-type music.  I normally like this stuff, but I was waiting for "Brazilian" to start.  8:30, 9:00, 9:30, nothing except that DJ and a lot of heavy bass.  Nobody downstairs seemed to be moving to it, and I, who normally can't sit still when rhythm is happening, was getting completely bored.  The girl next to me said the show was going to start at 10, even though our tickets said 8:30.  When 10 pm came and went, and nothing changed on the stage, we all decided that dessert would be much more interesting.  We returned to the restaurant, where our same waitress cheerfully served us delicious Key Lime pie, coffee and tea, and no bill save for the tip we left her, and we left sated and happy.

My husband and I ordered the St. Louis Rib and the Southern Fried Chicken and they were both okay.   The chicken was 'semi boneless' which meant only a small bone in one of the two pieces. Crispy crust and moist on the inside.   The crushed potatoes were good. Not quite mashed, kind of a baked potato texture.   The wait wasn't that long and the food came out right away. The atmosphere was lively and buzzing with people for a Wednesday night. The live band was a surprise bonus.   Staff was friendly and attentive.
Suzie Q is amazing,  u have a valuable asset.  What an amazing bartender....  I will be back for sure.....

Breakfast here was decent - too much onion in the gravy over biscuits, and a pancake that was a bit mealy inside. Service was admirable and the place is iconic. I would venture here again for lunch or dinner because I love their cornbread, but breakfast may find me somewhere else...
Our Server Jasmine was great! Our latest trip here was a little dicey but this trip was amazing. Thank you for a great meal and great experience.

Came here for a dinner with my in-laws. House of Blues is conveniently located inside of the Mandalay Bay Casino floor, the exterior or HOB is very beautiful, decorated with a musical theme since they do have a concert area, aside from a restaurant and some designs made out of bottle caps. Very nicely done.  You need to be seated by their hostesses, when you walk into HOB you will enter their gift shop section first before being introduced to they restaurant area. Which had a nice dark and interesting atmosphere,  with a huge false tree structure covered with lamps. There were glass colored windows and a bar inside. Their bathroom was also filled with art paintings, the women's stall made out of an old classic truck bed metal (reminds me of my childhood in Hawaii) it was very creative.  For appetizers we started off with steak tacos, it was very tasty and at the same time healthy. For our main course I ordered Shrimp and Grit which was perfect, the grit melted in my mouth, it came with jumbo shrimp and the sauce that came with it was very delicious and went along with the grit perfectly. My husband had Mac and cheese with lobster which was good also, we were expecting a whole lobster, but this dish came with the lobster pieces that came inside the macaroni in cheese, it was still delicious. The kids had chicken tenders with fries, the grandparents said the "this is really good chicken!" So, I'll believe that. Our server was cute and informative, and so were every employee there, everyone looked young and good looking, must be, a must to work here. I have brothers and a step dad that bartend/ed and served here. Hehe  We didn't have room for desert as to we were all surprisingly full, the portions looked little but don't let it fool you. I'm 8 months pregnant and was very full, my husband told me I waddle, well after this dinner, I waddled more.  This place is great for dates, family dinners and date with friends; Especially if you're a local, if you want to hit the town, if you kind of want to go into the strip, but not really? Mandalay Bay is the first Hotel/Casino you hit, when entering the strip, South of Las Vegas Blvd.

On another solo work trip the House of Blues affords something to listen and look at while eating slightly above average Southern food. Lineup never fails to entertain and space at the bar is almost always available though sightlines to stage can be a challenge.
We loved the place, the food and the service.  Great ambiance.  We Will recommend and we will come back!

Went on 1/18/18 for Stick Figure show. For being a corporate place it wasn't too bad, somewhat cheesy. There was a lot of room and plenty of bar space to get drinks fairly easily. Prices on drinks were basically what you would expect for a place like this, I think I paid 8 bucks for jack. Maybe that price is a bit high but I guess  for corporate greed it could be worse. Security was quick to get through and the ones I saw and dealt with were professional and didn't go out of their way to make getting in miserable. The only reason for the two stars is that the sound was absolutely terrible and the sight lines pretty much suck too. There was this constant rattle and crackle coming from the right side of what I'm pretty sure were the house speakers. It was so noticeable that it completely ruined the show for me and many of the people around me who were talking about the same thing. I was standing in the balcony and also had friends who were standing downstairs and another group of friends who were stage front and they all said the same thing. I've seen this particular band at the beachland a few years ago and the sound was absolutely perfect. You would think they could use some of that drink money on some new sound equipment or a new sound tech, not really sure what the problem was but it was bad. I drove over 2 hours to this venue but next time a band that I really want to see comes through this venue I'm going to skip it. Hopefully I can see whoever it is in my hometown but if not I'd road trip somewhere else besides the HOB.

First time at House of Blues, Vegas edition.  Was brought here for a Steel Panther show by a Steel Panther lover.  I'll focus on the venue and not get distracted by the major girl fight that occurred... which was quickly ushered off the stage (go bouncers, go!).  PS - the bouncer right in front is huge.  Don't you dare think of climbing on stage.    The main floor appeared mostly packed, so we chose a spot right behind the railing by the upper bar.  View was good - a bit confused by the VIP (maybe?) area behind the sound booth where a few people were hanging out.  Sound quality was a bit muffled, but maybe I just had a hard time understanding the lyrics and the banter onstage.  Still, it wasn't the most superb.  I spotted two bars, one close behind where I stood... there was plenty of room for purchasers at the bar and the crowd watching the show from the higher level; the second bar was on the left side of the room.  Both bars were extremely overpriced considering the liquor prices in Vegas, so I opted out.    *Shows:  The upcoming band lineup looked great.  I'd definitely consider  a late night concert in Vegas easily.    *Location :  Easy to find in Mandalay Bay  *Parking:  A cinch.  Vegas is good for parking.  Free self-parking all over the place!    *Price:  Seemed reasonable (~$20).  If you were local to LV, you could get into the Steel Panther show I saw at HOB for free.  And who said there's no such thing as a free show?  It exists here.

Took an hour to get our food and did not even have silverware until after we got our food. It was not busy.   Two stars because the manager compensated us greatly for the inconvenience. Food was good one we got it and the manager hooked us up afterwards.

I come to the House of Blues for concerts all the time! This time, I tried out the restaurant and it was awesome. I can't believe I've yet to eat there. I actually just had the tacos, and they were actually one of the best tacos I've ever had for an American bar. I got the fish tacos and the steak tacos. I highly recommend it! The service was great too! The food came out in good timing too! Make sure you stop by for some food before the concert!

Wow! I was reminded why I like this place so much. Angel was my server today and he was always smiling and kept my coffee tipped off.  I am only rarely in Las Vegas, but when I am, here is where I will eat breakfast.  Wink

HOB is one of my favorite concert venues in Cleveland.  They host some great cover bands as well as some shockingly bigger name bands.  It's great because you can get right up to the stage and rock out with your favorite music.  Their beer is a bit over priced, but better than your average concert venue.  And tallboy PBR??  What could be better??

We went here with a group of friends. The food was decent, nothing special. The service was very slow and it took over 30 minutes just to get our bill. Then the waitress disappeared again. We also got charged the entertainment tax. There was a singer there but we were seated in a different room where we couldn't even see the entertainment. I think it's unfair to charge for the tax when we couldn't even enjoy the live music.

First of all, if there were halves, I'd give this place 4 1/2 stars. Staff was friendly (maybe it was because I was by myself and they felt sorry for me). I started off with a Coors light and a half (haha) when they brought out my steak salad. Steak pieces were perfect. I ordered it medium well, but they had it medium. Delicious. Salad was great! Except the avocados that came on it. It tasted like it was a day old avocado. A little too ripe with some browning (but then again, it was very dim in there- so who knows). Staff was nice and salad was good. Try it out.

Been here many times for concerts and also because friends throw fundraisers here. There a few distinct rooms which separate themselves by theme and d√©cor depending on what your business is there. Most of my HOB time is in the main hall for parties and concerts. Make sure you pre game the beers are a whopping $10 each. Bar lines are not horrendous, the place is small enough to good bands to play with a standing room below and seating above. Upstairs in the foundation room is a smaller bar/DJ place with a few meditarranean royalty style VIP rooms. There's also a restaurant downstairs but have never indulged. If you plan to buy tickets for a show here, recommend coming here to purchase tickets, you end up saving like 10-15 bucks on service fees when pay online or on phone.

I've been to several events here and never been treated so rude as i was yesterday.  My daughter and I arrived about 2:45 for the 12 Days of Giving event.  She was to perform 4:30- 5:30 but we wanted to see other friends perform.    When we arrived the lady asked if we would be dining and I said yes.  We also need a table for 4 as friends would be joining.  When we sat down the waitress came over and gave us menus.  I said we would be waiting for our friends to arrive before ordering.  About 15 minutes later our friends arrived.    The waitress asked if we were ready to order.  No not yet they literally just sat down.  A little bit later a woman who I presume was the manager came over and told us if we didn't order we had to move.  Ok first of all the rest of our table had just arrived a few minutes before.  I explained to her we were going to order but just not yet.  She was extremely rude and said again if you don't eat you have to move.  I explained AGAIN we are going to eat quit rushing us!  Wow!  We were mortified!  She said they needed it for reservations.  There was- at any given time 3-5 available tables.  At no time were they all full.  Busy but never full.    Any how we ordered food and it was subpar.  My friends gumbo looked more like dog food and was not even edible.  During that time our daughters were performing on stage.  They KNEW we had 2 other people at the table but moved together 2 tables for a party of 8 that was so close to ours my daughter could not even sit down after coming off stage.    Then a different waiter came over and said it was shift change and he had our check.  Well a) we specifically asked for separate checks and b) I still planned on ordering for my kid so was not ready to close out my bill!  He was very nice and I definitely do not blame him for the mixup.    Anyhow we were leaving soon and someone put a "reserved" tag on the table.  Again with the rushing!  Sad to say that unless my daughter has another event there I will not be back.  It's sad because I actually liked this venue but this was the rudest thing I've ever experienced.

* We used restaurant.com gift certificate for lunch.  * I had the steak salad and it was just ok.  * I wished we went to the Gospel brunch instead of just the regular restaurant area.  * I think this place is better for dinner than lunch fare. I think it will be more lively :).
